original: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i gnas @138b gzhan sna tshogs bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i gnas @138b gzhan sna tshogs bstan pa 'di ni zhes bya ba 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This teaching of various other bases for the engagement of conceptuality is connected to the teaching of the characteristic of the result.

original: gnas gzhan ni 'bras bur zhugs pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan ni 'bras bur zhugs pas rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'o //
translated: The other bases are the distinct stream-enterers and so forth who have entered the result.üîΩThe various teachings due to the engagement of conceptuality are the external things such as ugliness. Why are those ultimately non-existent?

original: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pas rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan pa phyi rol gyi mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag don dam par ci'i slad du ma mchis zhes pa dang / de'i phyir rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'jug pas rnam pa sna tshogs su bstan pa phyi rol gyi mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i dngos po de dag don dam par ci'i slad du ma mchis zhes pa dang / de'i phyir rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: And for that reason, the cause is stated:

original: 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / bsam gtan pa rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan du bya ba dang / bsam gtan pa rnam par dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the attainment of the result, for the meditative stabilization, and for the meditative stabilization, due to the isolation of the meditator.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i lam dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i lam dben pa'i phyir zhes bya ste /
translated: The path of that kind is said to be isolated.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral bas so //
translated: Because it is free from the aspect of duality.

original: ji ltar zhes pa dang / gsungs pa rang gi sems snang bar gtogs pas zhes te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes pa dang / gsungs pa rang gi sems snang bar gtogs pas zhes te /
translated: As for how? and what is said? it is said due to the inclusion of the appearances of one's own mind.

original: rang gi sems snang ba las lhag pa'i phyi rol gyi don med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba las lhag pa'i phyi rol gyi don med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that there is no external object that is superior to the appearance of one's own mind.

original: phyi rol gyi bsam gtan du bya ba med na yang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi bsam gtan du bya ba med na yang /
translated: Even though there is no external object of meditation,

original: bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan pa ji ltar na yod de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / bsam gtan pa ji ltar na yod de /
translated: how is there meditation and a meditator?

original: yang dag par rig pa tsam la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa tsam la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po med do //
translated: There is no object of knowledge and no knower apart from the mere knowledge.

original: gnyis su gyur cing zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la bzung ba'i skyon te /
analyzed: gnyis su gyur cing zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la bzung ba'i skyon te /
translated: The phrase in the duality refers to the error of apprehending an external object.

original: ji srid du phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa de srid du rmongs pa mi spong ste /
analyzed: ji srid du phyi rol gyi don du mngon par chags pa de srid du rmongs pa mi spong ste /
translated: As long as one is attached to an external object, one does not abandon delusion.

original: rgyu de nyid las srid pa kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa brtag go //
analyzed: rgyu de nyid las srid pa kun tu sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa brtag go //
translated: One should understand that from that cause, the fetter of existence is intended.

original: rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i rnam par shes rab kyis ldog par bya ste zhes pa ni phyi rol dang nang gi gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba rnam par dbye ba na khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i rnam par shes rab kyis ldog par bya ste zhes pa ni phyi rol dang nang gi gzugs sna tshogs su snang ba rnam par dbye ba na khang pa la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid de /
translated: One should turn away from the knowledge of the characteristics of the appearances of one's own mind with the wisdom that discriminates. When one discriminates the various appearances of external and internal forms, they are empty like a house, etc.

original: rnam pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du shes su tshor ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'o //üîΩrang gi sems snang ba'i rgyu las 'da' ba ni sems la yod pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa pa'i chud pa ma gtogs par 'gog par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa mtha' yas so zhes rnam pa de lta bu'i 'du shes su tshor ba tsam dgag pa'i phyir snyoms par 'jug pa'o // rang gi sems snang ba'i rgyu las 'da' ba ni sems la yod pa'i mtshan ma'i rnam pa pa'i chud pa ma gtogs par 'gog par mi rung ngo //
translated: One enters into meditative concentration in this way in order to stop the mere feeling of the idea, The aspects are infinite.üîΩ One should transcend the cause of the appearances of one's own mind. It is not possible to stop the mind except for the aspect of the sign that exists in the mind.

original: de zhes pa ni rang gi sems nyid kyi dmigs pa yod na ni de'i tshe 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang mi rung ste sems tsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni rang gi sems nyid kyi dmigs pa yod na ni de'i tshe 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yang mi rung ste sems tsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is an object of one's own mind, then it is not possible to enter into meditative concentration on cessation, because of the mere existence of mind.

original: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i mtshan ma yod pas dmigs pa la rnam pa sna tshogs tsam nyid mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa la snyoms par 'jug pa de'i mtshan ma yod pas dmigs pa la rnam pa sna tshogs tsam nyid mi rung ste /
translated: Since the sign of the meditative attainment of cessation exists, it is not suitable that it is merely the various aspects of the object.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the aspect of duality.

original: yang dag par rig pa'i sems tsam la ni /
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa'i sems tsam la ni /
translated: In the mere mind of correct knowledge,

original: mtshan ma yod pa ma yin pas na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam @139a * //
analyzed: mtshan ma yod pa ma yin pas na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam @139a * //
translated: since the sign does not exist, it is without thought and without appearance.

original: pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rig pa la mi rtag pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa thams cad dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bsam gtan thams cad kyang yod pa ma
analyzed: pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rig pa la mi rtag pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i gzugs su dmigs pa med pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis kyi bsam gtan la sogs pa thams cad dang 'bras bu'i mtshan ma 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i bsam gtan thams cad kyang yod pa ma
translated: Since the ultimate truth is not dual, it is not observed as a form that is impermanent, unpleasant, and so on. Therefore all meditative attainments such as meditative stabilization and all the signs of the result that are beyond the world, which have the aspect of duality, do not exist.

original: yin no // chos thams cad mtha' bzhi dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yin no // chos thams cad mtha' bzhi dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi'i rnam par rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are said to be free from the four extremes, which is to say, they are not conceptualized in four ways.

original: de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi dmigs so //
translated: Those are also not observed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chud pa mtha' dag mi gnyis pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud pa mtha' dag mi gnyis pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entire range of what is included is nondual.üîΩ‚Äú

original: blo gros chen po 'di zhes bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i blo ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'di zhes bya ba ni chos rnam par 'byed pa'i blo ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, this is the discernment of phenomena,

original: des gcig pa dang tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtog pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des gcig pa dang tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams rtog pa yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: by which one should completely abandon the conceptualization of phenomena as being the same or different.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad gzung ba med pa dang / brjod du med par thugs su chud pa de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i chos gang gis kyang de rnam par rtog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad gzung ba med pa dang / brjod du med par thugs su chud pa de bzhin du dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs pa'i chos gang gis kyang de rnam par rtog par mi bya'o //
translated: Just as the TathƒÅgata has realized all phenomena to be ungraspable and inexpressible, so one should not conceptualize them with any phenomena, such as existence or nonexistence.

original: gang dag sra ba dang / tsha ba dang / gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa de dag gi rtag pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag sra ba dang / tsha ba dang / gsher ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pa'i yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun rtog pa de dag gi rtag pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Those who are attached to the characteristics of conceptualizing the characteristics of solidity, heat, moisture, and so forth, have incorrect conceptualization. Their conceptualizations are conceptualizations.

original: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'byung ba rnams ni med do //
translated: The external elements do not exist.

original: ji ltar yi dam 'cha' ba dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / dpe la mngon par chags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar yi dam 'cha' ba dang / rgyu'i mtshan nyid dang / dpe la mngon par chags pa'i phyir te /
translated: because of the way in which one makes a vow, because of the characteristic of the cause, and because of attachment to the example.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyi blos rtog pa don gyi bya ba nus pa'i phyir byung ba rnams yod do //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi don du smra ba rnams kyi blos rtog pa don gyi bya ba nus pa'i phyir byung ba rnams yod do //
translated: Just as for the proponents of external objects, the cognitions that occur in the mind are capable of the activity of the object, and so they exist.

original: de dag med na ni tshig pa dang / gces pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag med na ni tshig pa dang / gces pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they did not exist, then the results of burning, cutting, and so on would not exist.

original: gang don gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni slu bas khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: gang don gyis stong pa'i rnam par shes pa de ni slu bas khyab pa yin te /
translated: The consciousness that is empty of an object is necessarily deceptive.

original: mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a mirage and so on.

original: de ste thams cad don gyis stong pa yin na ni slu bas khyab par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ste thams cad don gyis stong pa yin na ni slu bas khyab par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If everything were empty of an object, then it would not be the case that deception is necessarily deceptive.

original: de ltar ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi don grub po zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pas na phyi rol gyi don grub po zhes so //
translated: Since that is not the case, external objects are established.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa yang rmi lam gyi dus na smig rgyu dang mtsho la sogs par slu ba dang slu ba med pa'i 'bras bu yang dmigs pas na /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa yang rmi lam gyi dus na smig rgyu dang mtsho la sogs par slu ba dang slu ba med pa'i 'bras bu yang dmigs pas na /
translated: The intention of the Omniscient One is that at the time of a dream, the results of deception and nondeception are observed, such as a mirage and a lake and so on.

original: de'i phyir shes pa so sor snang ba las ma gtogs pa byung ba rnams yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa so sor snang ba las ma gtogs pa byung ba rnams yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, apart from the individual appearances of consciousness, there are no existing things.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la gang 'dzin pa yin @139b pas des gang mngon par chags pa des ni rab tu 'jog pa'i blo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid rnams la gang 'dzin pa yin @139b pas des gang mngon par chags pa des ni rab tu 'jog pa'i blo zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is attached to the characteristics of conceptualization is called the mind of placement.üîΩThe mind that is without appearance is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment is the mind of analysis.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.

original: snang ba med pa'i blo la rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir gang dpyod pa ste /üîΩsbom pa dang phra ba rnam par 'byed pa rjes su mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid khong du chud par byed cing /
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i blo la rnam par 'byed pa'i shes rab kyis 'jug par byed pa'i phyir gang dpyod pa ste / sbom pa dang phra ba rnam par 'byed pa rjes su mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid stong pa nyid khong du chud par byed cing /
translated: The mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.

original: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la nan tan byed pa'o //üîΩspyod pa'i sa bon thos pa dang sems pa ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la nan tan byed pa'o // spyod pa'i sa bon thos pa dang sems pa ste /
translated: The mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.

original: de la mkhas par gyur pa dang / sa dang po rab tu dga' ba rtogs pa mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la mkhas par gyur pa dang / sa dang po rab tu dga' ba rtogs pa mtshan nyid kyi sgom pa'i shes rab thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.üîΩThe mind of analysis is the mind that is engaged by the wisdom of discernment.

original: de la sa'i yon tan rgya cher gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la sa'i yon tan rgya cher gsungs pa /
translated: The qualities of the stages are extensively taught in that passage.

original: ting nge 'dzin brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin brgya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The passage beginning one hundred concentrations and so on.

original: thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: thog ma'i mtha' dang tha ma'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa ste /
translated: The initial limit and the final limit are the past and the future, respectively.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one enters the past and the future.

original: sa bcu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mthar thug pa thob par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyis thugs su chud pa'i sa thob nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'od zer gyis mdzes so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: sa bcu'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis mthar thug pa thob par gyur pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rang bzhin gyis thugs su chud pa'i sa thob nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'od zer gyis mdzes so zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Having attained the culmination of the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the ten stages, and having attained the stage of the TathƒÅgata's intrinsic realization, one shines with light rays in order to ripen sentient beings.

original: gang 'di 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa de ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
analyzed: gang 'di 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa de ni ming dang rnam par rtog pa tsam ste /
translated: That which is an element or derivative of an element is merely a name and a concept.

original: rgyu gsungs pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gsungs pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is stated: because one understands that it is merely one's own mind's appearance.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sngar phyi rol dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sngar phyi rol dngos po med par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: because external things have already been shown to be nonexistent.

original: mtha' bzhi'i tshul rnam par dag cing bral bar gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi'i tshul rnam par dag cing bral bar gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as it is said that the four extremes are pure and free.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas zhes pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa tsam mo //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi gnas zhes pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa tsam mo //
translated: The ‚Äúabode of intrinsic identity‚Äù is mere correct knowledge without duality.

original: tha dad pa'i byed pa dang byed pos so //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i byed pa dang byed pos so //
translated: It is different from the agent and action.

original: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of being free from arising, etc.

original: ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: ma skyes pa ste /
translated: is non-arising.

original: de lta bur yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing gser la sogs pa bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid grub po //
analyzed: de lta bur yod pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal zhing gser la sogs pa bzhin rang gi mtshan nyid grub po //
translated: Existing in this way, it is naturally luminous, and like gold, etc. , its intrinsic identity is established.

original: gsher ba snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni phyi nang du snang ba'i chu'i khams bskyed do //
analyzed: gsher ba snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni phyi nang du snang ba'i chu'i khams bskyed do //
translated: The concept of the appearance of wetness generates the water element that appears externally and internally.

original: tsha ba ni me'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: tsha ba ni me'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Heat is the concept of fire.

original: log pa la bden par chags pas ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la bden par sgro btags te chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa la bden par chags pas ni yang dag pa ma yin pa la bden par sgro btags te chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of attachment to the truth of the unreal, there is the superimposition of truth on the unreal, because of attachment.

original: rang gi rnam pa nyid la rab rib can la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du phyi nang gi don du sgro btags te /
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa nyid la rab rib can la gzugs la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du phyi nang gi don du sgro btags te /
translated: Like the appearance of forms and so on to those with eye disease, the imagination of what is unreal is superimposed as external and internal objects.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par nye bar rtog pa de las phung po lnga 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par nye bar rtog pa de las phung po lnga 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, the five aggregates arise.

original: @140a * // rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis tshig dang yul sna tshogs la gang mngon par chags pa sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de 'dod pas rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par shes pa 'gro ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar 'byung ngo
analyzed: @140a * // rnam par shes pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang gis tshig dang yul sna tshogs la gang mngon par chags pa sred pa'i mtshan nyid kyi de 'dod pas rgyun gyi mtshan nyid kyis rnam par shes pa 'gro ba gzhan du mtshams sbyor bar 'byung ngo
translated: Consciousness and so on means that by whatever attachment to various words and objects, craving arises. By the characteristic of desire, consciousness is produced, connecting to another life.

original: // mi 'bral ba na gang na gcig yod pa de na 'byung ba gzhan rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: // mi 'bral ba na gang na gcig yod pa de na 'byung ba gzhan rnams kyi ste /
translated: When they are not separated, wherever one element exists, the other elements also exist there.

original: des na sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba la gnas pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu 'byung ba chen po so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gsher ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu shes pa rnams yod kyi /
analyzed: des na sa la sogs pa'i 'byung ba la gnas pa'i 'byung ba las gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu 'byung ba chen po so sor snang ba'i mtshan nyid can gsher ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu shes pa rnams yod kyi /
translated: Therefore, the causes of the derivative form that is based on the primary elements such as earth are the consciousnesses that are the causes of the conceptualization of the characteristics of the individual great elements such as moisture.

original: mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa'i sa la sogs pa'i rdul rtag pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ni med do //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis kun brtags pa'i sa la sogs pa'i rdul rtag pa'i 'byung ba chen po rnams kyi ni med do //
translated: But the permanent great elements such as earth that are imagined by the tƒ´rthikas do not exist.

original: mu stegs can gyis kun tu brtags pa de dag kyang ji ltar na ma mchis zhes yongs su zhus pa /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis kun tu brtags pa de dag kyang ji ltar na ma mchis zhes yongs su zhus pa /
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúHow are those imagined by the tƒ´rthikas nonexistent?‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhes so //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes so //
translated: The question is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: dngos po ni tshig gi don gyi rang bzhin te /
analyzed: dngos po ni tshig gi don gyi rang bzhin te /
translated: A thing is the nature of the meaning of a word.

original: der mtshan ma ni mngon rtags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rigs dang / yon tan dang byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: der mtshan ma ni mngon rtags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rigs dang / yon tan dang byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: A mark is a sign. The sign of engagement is a class, a quality, an action, and so on.

original: 'dis mtshan mar byed pas na 'dis mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis mtshan mar byed pas na 'dis mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since it causes the marking of that, it is a mark of that.

original: des kyang rdzas la sogs pa gzung ba 'dzin to //
analyzed: des kyang rdzas la sogs pa gzung ba 'dzin to //
translated: It also apprehends the substance and so on that is grasped.

original: dbyibs ni sbom po dang phra mo dang / zlum po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs ni sbom po dang phra mo dang / zlum po la sogs pa'o //
translated: Shape is gross or subtle, round, etc.

original: bya ba ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bya ba ni 'degs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Action is the characteristic of lifting, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni 'brel pa'o //
translated: Conjunction is contact.

original: rdul phra mo rnams las yan lag can gyi rdzas bya ba dang 'brel te skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams las yan lag can gyi rdzas bya ba dang 'brel te skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The substance of the whole is produced from the atoms with action and contact.

original: rdul gnyis dang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rim ni thog mar bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul gnyis dang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rim ni thog mar bya ba dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order of the two atoms and three atoms, etc. is due to the priority of action and contact.

original: rdzas ni rdzas gzhan rtsom pa dang yon tan rnams kyang yon tan gzhan rtsom mo //
analyzed: rdzas ni rdzas gzhan rtsom pa dang yon tan rnams kyang yon tan gzhan rtsom mo //
translated: The substance produces another substance, and the qualities produce another quality.

original: de la khyad par can la sogs pas dngos po'i mtshan ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ni rva dang ldan pa dang / nog dang ldan pa dang / lkog shal dang ldan pa dang / mjug ma dang ldan pa ni ba lang gi mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: de la khyad par can la sogs pas dngos po'i mtshan ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du brtags pa ni rva dang ldan pa dang / nog dang ldan pa dang / lkog shal dang ldan pa dang / mjug ma dang ldan pa ni ba lang gi mtshan ma'o //
translated: In this regard, the specific, etc. are imagined to be the characteristics of the characteristics of entities, etc. The characteristics of the cow are: having horns, having a dewlap, having a hump, having a tail.

original: dngos po la rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po la rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of entities:

original: rdzas kyi dngos po dang / spyi'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dngos po dang / spyi'i dngos po'o //
translated: substantial entities and general entities.

original: de la ba lang kho na dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma dang 'brel pa ni rgyu rnams te /
analyzed: de la ba lang kho na dang / ba lang gi rdzas kyi yan lag gi mtshan nyid kyi mtshan ma dang 'brel pa ni rgyu rnams te /
translated: The cause is the connection of the cow itself with the characteristics of the parts of the substance of the cow.

original: des na dngos po'o //
analyzed: des na dngos po'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a thing.

original: rdzas kyi dbyibs dang yan lag rva la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: rdzas kyi dbyibs dang yan lag rva la sogs pa rnams kyi mtshan ma'i mtshan nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The shape of the substance and the characteristics of the parts, such as the horns, are apprehended.

original: rdul gnyis dang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rgyu spun rnams kyi rim par byed pa dang @140b ldan pas skye bo zhes gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs so //
analyzed: rdul gnyis dang rdul gsum la sogs pa'i rgyu spun rnams kyi rim par byed pa dang @140b ldan pas skye bo zhes gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i snga ma'i phyogs so //
translated: The order of the pairs of atoms and the groups of three atoms, etc., is the cause.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa ni phyi ma'i phyogs su gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa ni phyi ma'i phyogs su gnas pa'o //
translated: The eternal is not a thing, like the son of a barren woman, etc., because it is not produced.

original: mtshan ma dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa gang dag la tshad la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzung du med pa de dag la rdzas su rtsom pa med do zhes mu stegs kyi lugs so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mi ldan pa las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa gang dag la tshad la sogs pa'i mtshan ma gzung du med pa de dag la rdzas su rtsom pa med do zhes mu stegs kyi lugs so //
translated: Not from that which is without characteristics. This is the tƒ´rthika‚Äôs opinion that those formless [absorptions] which are not apprehended as having the characteristics of size, etc. are not composed of substances.

original: phan tshun du mi mthun zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun du mi mthun zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa ste /
translated: Mutually incompatible means having different characteristics of conceptualization.

original: sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni gang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa yod pa der grangs su 'byed pa'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: sra ba dang gsher ba la sogs pa'o // dngos po dang dngos po med pa rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni gang na dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa yod pa der grangs su 'byed pa'i tha snyad do //
translated: [They are] solidity, fluidity, etc.üîΩThe avoidance of entity and non-entity means that where there is the conceptualization of both entity and non-entity, there is the convention of classification.

original: de ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzings pa las 'das shing mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rtog pa dang rnam par rtog pa'i 'dzings pa las 'das shing mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is said to be beyond the entanglement of conceptualization and conceptual discrimination, and to be the correct understanding of non-duality.

original: gnas gzhan pa ma yin pa ni chud pa me long las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba phyi rol na med do //
analyzed: gnas gzhan pa ma yin pa ni chud pa me long las gzhan pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gzugs la sogs par snang ba phyi rol na med do //
translated: The non-otherness of the place is because the reflection is not other than the mirror. The various forms and so on that appear are not external.

original: 'phags pa'i ye shes rtogs pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i ye shes rtogs pa ni mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The realization of the wisdom of the noble ones is the correct understanding of non-duality.

original: shin tu rmongs pa ni phung por rnam par rtog pa bgegs dang 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu rmongs pa ni phung por rnam par rtog pa bgegs dang 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Great delusion is the obstacle and confusion of conceptualizing the aggregates.

original: rnam par ldog nas zhes bya ba ni bor nas so //
analyzed: rnam par ldog nas zhes bya ba ni bor nas so //
translated: Turning away means abandoning.

original: rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang gzung bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa zhes bya ba ni 'dzin pa dang gzung bar snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: Isolation means the ultimate truth of non-duality, which should be taught as the place free from the appearances of grasping and the grasped, free from the conceptualization of subject and object.

original: 'on te mo gsham gyi bu ltar yang dag pa kho nar ci yang med na bden no zhes chos gang la dben par bstan par bya zhes pa la /
analyzed: 'on te mo gsham gyi bu ltar yang dag pa kho nar ci yang med na bden no zhes chos gang la dben par bstan par bya zhes pa la /
translated: But if, like the son of a barren woman, it is absolutely nothing at all, then what phenomenon should be taught as isolated?

original: dben pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gsal bar bstan par na theg pa chen po gzhan rigs pa dang ldan par rtag tu ji ltar rung /
analyzed: dben pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis chos gsal bar bstan par na theg pa chen po gzhan rigs pa dang ldan par rtag tu ji ltar rung /
translated: How could the MahƒÅyƒÅna, which is reasonable, always be suitable as the clear teaching of the BhagavƒÅn?üîΩ‚Äú

original: dben pa ni ci yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni dben pa'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: dben pa ni ci yang ma yin zhes bya ba 'di ni dben pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äòsolitary‚Äô is not ‚Äònothing at all.‚Äô

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa bzhi ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: There are four kinds of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: dngos po ni rang bzhin med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can rnams kyis zhi ba dang / ro gcig pa'i rnal 'byor thob pa de'i tshe bdag dang bdag gi rnag bzhin gyis dngos po med par gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni rang bzhin med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni gang gi tshe na rnal 'byor can rnams kyis zhi ba dang / ro gcig pa'i rnal 'byor thob pa de'i tshe bdag dang bdag gi rnag bzhin gyis dngos po med par gyur ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the nonexistence of things is the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the nonexistence of things that are the natures of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù when yogins and yoginƒ´s attain the yoga of peace and one taste.

original: yod pa dang med par brjod du med kyang zhi ba rtag pa'o zhes bye brag go //
analyzed: yod pa dang med par brjod du med kyang zhi ba rtag pa'o zhes bye brag go //
translated: It is peace, but it is not said to exist or not exist, and it is permanent.

original: mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las @141a * //
analyzed: mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi dngos po med pa'i mya ngan las @141a * //
translated: The nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the nonexistence of various natures is the nirvƒÅ·πáa that is the nonexistence of the natures of the various things that are the bases of imputation.

original: 'das pa ni tshangs pa'i spyi'i rnal 'byor la mtshan ma rnams kyi sna tshogs su gsal ba'i rang bzhin med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rtog par byed de /
analyzed: 'das pa ni tshangs pa'i spyi'i rnal 'byor la mtshan ma rnams kyi sna tshogs su gsal ba'i rang bzhin med pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes rtog par byed de /
translated: The past is the diversity of signs in the universal yoga of Brahma. The nature of the absence of that is nirvana.

original: de bas na smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: tshangs pa'i 'di ni sgras sprul pa //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'di ni sgras sprul pa //
translated: This nirvana of Brahma is emanated by sound.

original: sgra yi mthur ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: sgra yi mthur ni rnam par gnas //
translated: It abides in the power of sound.

original: sgra tsam las ni byung ba yang //
analyzed: sgra tsam las ni byung ba yang //
translated: It arises from mere sound

original: de nyid du ni zhi bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de nyid du ni zhi bar 'gyur //
translated: and is pacified in reality.

original: zhes so // rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni rang bzhin skyes bus bzung ba la /
analyzed: zhes so // rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med par rtog pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa ni rang bzhin skyes bus bzung ba la /
translated: The nirvana that is the conception of the nonexistence of things that have their own characteristics is the nature of the person.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pas 'ba' zhig par shes pa'i phyir phyi nas rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni 'di gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan ni zhes te grangs can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po med pas 'ba' zhig par shes pa'i phyir phyi nas rang bzhin med par rtogs par 'gyur ba ni 'di gzhan la bdag kyang gzhan ni zhes te grangs can gyi mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Because it is known to be only the nonexistence of things that have their own characteristics, later one realizes that it is natureless. This is the nirvana of the Samkhyas, who say, ‚ÄúThe self is one thing and the other is different.‚Äù

original: bzhi pa ni mu stegs can gyi tha ma'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni mu stegs can gyi tha ma'i mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the nirvana of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: gang zag la bdag med par phung po rnams kyi rgyun 'chad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /üîΩphung po med na bde ba mchog //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par phung po rnams kyi rgyun 'chad pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste / phung po med na bde ba mchog //
translated: Nirvana is the termination of the continuum of the aggregates, which are devoid of selfhood in the individual.

original: ces par ro //
analyzed: ces par ro //
translated: For, as it is said, Without the aggregates, there is supreme bliss.

original: de dag ji ltar na /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar na /
translated: How is this so?

original: mu stegs can gyi tha ma yin //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi tha ma yin //
translated: They are the worst of the tirthikas.

original: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: nga yi gsung rab la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nga yi gsung rab la ni ma yin no //
translated: But not in my scriptures.

original: zhes te / don dam pa'i chos bshad pa na phyi rol gyi tshul du bstan pa ni dgongs so zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung las nges so //
analyzed: zhes te / don dam pa'i chos bshad pa na phyi rol gyi tshul du bstan pa ni dgongs so zhes thams cad mkhyen pa'i gsung las nges so //
translated: This is certain from the statements of the Omniscient One, for when the ultimate Dharma is taught, it is taught as an external mode.

original: chos la bdag med pa'i theg pa chen po la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa'i theg pa chen po la ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: In the Mahayana, which is the selflessness of phenomena, nirvana is characterized by the cessation of the conceptual mind consciousness.

original: de nyid rgyu dang dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun rnams zhes pa la /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu dang dmigs pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa bdun rnams zhes pa la /
translated: Because it is the cause and the object, it is said to be of the seven consciousnesses.

original: de zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Here, it refers to the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: de nyid gang dag gi rgyu dang dmigs pa yin zhes tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid gang dag gi rgyu dang dmigs pa yin zhes tshig sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat is the cause and object of those‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: yang na rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: yang na rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i rgyu ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Or, the cause of that conceptual mental consciousness is the store consciousness,

original: dmigs pa yang de nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang de nyid do //
translated: and that is also its object.

original: de dag gi rgyu dang dmigs par mtshungs kyang bdun gyi nang na rnam par rtog pa'i yid rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtha' shin tu rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu dang dmigs par mtshungs kyang bdun gyi nang na rnam par rtog pa'i yid rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i mtha' shin tu rgyas par byed do //
translated: Although they are similar in being the cause and object of those, among the seven, the conceptual mental consciousness greatly expands the store consciousness with the latent impressions of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa de bzlog pa na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de bzlog pa na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: When that conceptualization is stopped, there is nirvana.

original: der yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: der yang nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: And there, the conceptualization of the afflictions should be understood as stopped.

original: gzhan du mi rtog pa med pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal te chos bstan pa yang ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: gzhan du mi rtog pa med pas rang gi tshig dang 'gal te chos bstan pa yang ji ltar na rung /
translated: Otherwise, since there would be no nonconceptual consciousness, there would be a contradiction with your own words, and how could there be a teaching of the Dharma?

original: ji ltar @141b 'di'i 'og tu gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar @141b 'di'i 'og tu gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said later in the sutra:

original: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnam shes bzlog pa na //
translated: When conceptual consciousness is stopped,

original: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: nga ni mya ngan 'das pa'o //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: I am in nirvana.

original: de na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par mkhyen pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par skye bo mang po 'dus pas brtags pa'i don gsol ba'i lan du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgra dang /
analyzed: de na snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rnam par mkhyen pa ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med par skye bo mang po 'dus pas brtags pa'i don gsol ba'i lan du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sgra dang /
translated: The knowledge of the samadhis with appearance and without appearance is the various sounds that are the replies to the meaning of the many beings who gather without the concepts of affliction.üîΩ

original: don thams cad tha dad pa'i khyad par du chos ston to //
analyzed: don thams cad tha dad pa'i khyad par du chos ston to //
translated: The knowledge of the concentration of appearance and nonappearance is born without the conceptualization of afflictions, and in response to the requests of the many beings who gather, he teaches the Dharma in various ways, with various sounds, and with various different meanings.

original: yid dang lhan cig tu zhes pa ni thog ma nyid du rang dbang gis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pas yul thams cad du yongs su gcod pa'i rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yid dang lhan cig tu zhes pa ni thog ma nyid du rang dbang gis rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pas yul thams cad du yongs su gcod pa'i rnam par rtog pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'byung ba ma yin te /
translated: Together with the mental faculty means that at the beginning, the mental consciousness that conceptually differentiates all objects through the aspect of independent conception does not arise.

original: de yang 'byung ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags rnams rab tu gso bar byed do //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la bag chags rnams rab tu gso bar byed do //
translated: When it does arise, it refreshes the latent tendencies in the foundation consciousness.

original: kha cig tu la lar bdag dang bdag gi la mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa khyad par du 'byung ba na der nyon mongs pa'i yid dang lhan cig tu'o //
analyzed: kha cig tu la lar bdag dang bdag gi la mngon par chags pas rnam par rtog pa khyad par du 'byung ba na der nyon mongs pa'i yid dang lhan cig tu'o //
translated: In some places, when there is a special kind of conceptualization due to attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù it is together with the afflicted mind.

original: ji ltar na bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par mngon par chags she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin par mngon par chags she na /
translated: How is there attachment to ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine?‚Äù

original: ngar sems pa lta bur rjes su phyin nas 'jug ste /
analyzed: ngar sems pa lta bur rjes su phyin nas 'jug ste /
translated: It is like the thought of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and it is engaged in following after.

original: ji ltar nga dang 'di nga'i zhes par ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nga dang 'di nga'i zhes par ro //
translated: It is like ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúthis is mine.‚Äù

original: so sor nges pa'i yul nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i yid dang lhan cig tu cig car 'jug gi thams cad du 'jug pas ma yin no zhes de dag gi khyad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i yul nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i yid kyis rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa'i yid dang lhan cig tu cig car 'jug gi thams cad du 'jug pas ma yin no zhes de dag gi khyad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The conceptual mind that has a specific object is engaged simultaneously with the afflicted mind, but not in all cases. This is how their difference should be understood.

original: sems 'dus pa ji ltar 'byung zhes pa la /
analyzed: sems 'dus pa ji ltar 'byung zhes pa la /
translated: How does the mind arise in a group?

original: lus tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: It has the characteristic of not being a different body.

original: byed pa'i khyad par snga ma dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i khyad par snga ma dang yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The difference in action should be connected with the previous.

original: ji ltar na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar na yang tha dad pa ma yin pa zhe na ;
translated: How is it not different?

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par 'dus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ma gtogs par 'dus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no composite apart from the store-consciousness.

original: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas kyi rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams dang / de gnyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dmigs pa'i rnam par so sor snang ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang phyi rol gyi don med par gnyis rnam par so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam gyi dus na lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas kyi rgyur gyur pa kun gzhi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams dang / de gnyis gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dmigs pa'i rnam par so sor snang ba de bzhin du gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yang phyi rol gyi don med par gnyis rnam par so sor snang ngo //
translated: Just as at the time of dreaming, the store-consciousness, which is the cause of the body, enjoyments and abode, appears in the form of the eye-consciousness, etc., and the two of them appear separately as the objective supports of form, etc., just so at the time of the waking state, although there are no external meanings, the two appear separately.

original: gcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags sogs pa dang / yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro //üîΩdngos @142a * //
analyzed: gcig gi rgyur gcig gyur pa zhes bya ba ni bag chags sogs pa dang / yongs su smin pa'i rgyu'i phyir ro // dngos @142a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone is the cause of the other‚Äù refers to the cause of the accumulation of the latent impressions and the cause of their full maturation.

original: por mya ngan mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: por mya ngan mi 'da' zhes bya ba ni mi gnyis pa'i don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdoes not really pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa‚Äù means that it does not pass into final nirvƒÅ·πáa through the ultimate reality that is the meaning of nonduality.

original: rdo rje'i sku'i sku gdung ye shes kyi rdo rje'i bya bas sems can gyi don du zhib mor phye ba'o //
analyzed: rdo rje'i sku'i sku gdung ye shes kyi rdo rje'i bya bas sems can gyi don du zhib mor phye ba'o //
translated: The relics of the vajra body are minutely divided for the sake of sentient beings by the activity of the vajra of gnosis.

original: seng ge nyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang ma yin te ;
analyzed: seng ge nyal ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis kyang ma yin te ;
translated: Nor is it by the characteristics of lying down like a lion, and so on.

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩrnam rtog rnam par shes pa las //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / rnam rtog rnam par shes pa las //
translated: How is that?

original: bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
analyzed: bzlog pas mya ngan nga 'das so //
translated: It is said: Nirvana is the cessation of conceptual consciousness.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the abandonment of existence and nonexistence.

original: brjod pa ni sgra nyid do //
analyzed: brjod pa ni sgra nyid do //
translated: Speech is sound itself.

original: snyan pa la sogs pa'i dbyangs sna tshogs pa rnam par rtog pa ni brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: snyan pa la sogs pa'i dbyangs sna tshogs pa rnam par rtog pa ni brjod pa la rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The various concepts of pleasant and so on are the concepts of speech.

original: gang ci yang rung ba smra bar bya ba zhes pa ni spyi'i rnam par rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis par yang rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gang ci yang rung ba smra bar bya ba zhes pa ni spyi'i rnam par rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis par yang rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: Whatever is to be spoken is the general characteristic, and one also conceptualizes without a second specific characteristic.

original: de lta bu'i gang rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gang rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: Such is conceptualization.

original: gang chung zad mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin ri dvags skom pa lta bu'i smra bar bya ba de phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba rnam pa de lta bu la rang bzhinüîΩkhong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gang chung zad mya ngan gyi smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul ba'i rang bzhin ri dvags skom pa lta bu'i smra bar bya ba de phung po dang khams dang skye mched la sogs pa gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba rnam pa de lta bu la rang bzhin khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: That which is the object of expression, like the mirage of a little water, etc., which is the nature of the delusion of a thirsty deer, should be understood as the nature of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, etc., which appear in that way as a duality.

original: ji ltar na zhes pa de la de ltar gsal bar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes pa de la de ltar gsal bar brjod pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs la sogs pa'o //
translated: How? Therein, the characteristic of the various expressions is thus.

original: 'di ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di lta ste /
translated: This is like this.

original: 'di ni 'di bzhin pa nyid kyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni lhag mas bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di bzhin pa nyid kyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don ni lhag mas bshad do //
translated: This is just so, not otherwise. The meaning of this is explained by the rest.

original: gang zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: What? The establishment.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang / rkyen gyis te rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan mas yod pa dang med pa nges pas so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang / rkyen gyis te rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan mas yod pa dang med pa nges pas so //
translated: By what? By the cause and condition, by the ascertainment of existence and non-existence through the characteristic of the three natures.

original: gang na 'thad pa zhes bya bar klog pa la der rgyu'i mtshan nyid khyab par smra ba ni gang rnam pa de lta bu yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang na 'thad pa zhes bya bar klog pa la der rgyu'i mtshan nyid khyab par smra ba ni gang rnam pa de lta bu yin pa'am /
translated: In the reading where there is a reason, the reason is the characteristic of pervasion. The meaning is that it is of that kind, or it is reasonable.

original: 'thad do zhes rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma la de ltar gsung bar dgongs par rtog go //
analyzed: 'thad do zhes rang bzhin gsum gyi mtshan ma la de ltar gsung bar dgongs par rtog go //
translated: The meaning is that it is reasonable to speak of the three natures in that way.

original: rig pa la rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar gang dag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg pas na mthong ba dang reg pa don gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir bdag yod do zhes te /
analyzed: rig pa la rnam par rtog pa ni ji ltar gang dag gis mthong ba de nyid la reg pas na mthong ba dang reg pa don gcig tu 'dzin pa'i phyir bdag yod do zhes te /
translated: The idea is that I exist is a conceptual thought, because those who see and touch think that seeing and touching are the same thing.

original: rtsod pa'i rnam par gzud pa'i dus na bdag med do zhes bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rnam par gzud pa'i dus na bdag med do zhes bstan par bya ste /
translated: When one is introduced to the debate, one should teach that there is no self.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal du myong ba tha dad par dbye ba na chud pa ma gtogs par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal du myong ba tha dad par dbye ba na chud pa ma gtogs par dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one distinguishes the different experiences of pleasure and pain, apart from the one who experiences them, there is nothing to be observed.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i skye ba ni grangs can dang khyad par can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i skye ba ni grangs can dang khyad par can la sogs pa'o //
translated: The arising of the existent and the non-existent refers to the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, Vai≈õe·π£ika, and so on.

original: mi skye ba @142b la rnam par rtog pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dag gis yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi skye ba @142b la rnam par rtog pa ni sa dang chu dang me dang rlung dag gis yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The conception of non-arising is not real in terms of earth, water, fire, and wind.

original: ma byung ba sems can rkyen de dag rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma byung ba sems can rkyen de dag rnams las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Non-arisen sentient beings arise from those conditions.

original: rgyu med pa'i lus zhes pa ni ji ltar da ltar gyi dus na chud pa'i rgyu las chud pa gzhan skye ba de ltar sngon gyi rgyu med pa'i lus te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i lus zhes pa ni ji ltar da ltar gyi dus na chud pa'i rgyu las chud pa gzhan skye ba de ltar sngon gyi rgyu med pa'i lus te /
translated: The body without a cause means that just as a body is produced from a cause in the present time, so it is not produced from a previous cause.

original: chud pa'i rgyu las rig pa skye ba med do zhes so //
analyzed: chud pa'i rgyu las rig pa skye ba med do zhes so //
translated: The body is not produced from a cause.

original: gnyis po gang dang gang sbyor ba de ni 'brel ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis po gang dang gang sbyor ba de ni 'brel ba ste /
translated: Any connection between two things is a relation.

original: gser gyi skud par gang brgyus par snang bzhin te /üîΩsgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis phyi rol gyi don la yang rin po che la sogs par 'brel bar rtog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gser gyi skud par gang brgyus par snang bzhin te / sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis phyi rol gyi don la yang rin po che la sogs par 'brel bar rtog pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as a string is strung through a golden thread,üîΩso external objects are imagined to be related to jewels and so on by their illusory nature.

original: chud pa'i rgyun gyi rgyud la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag go //
analyzed: chud pa'i rgyun gyi rgyud la gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dag go //
translated: In the same way, the continuum of the stream of consciousness is related to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: bcings pa nyid kyang ma bcings pa yin te thabs shig gis 'grol bas na /
analyzed: bcings pa nyid kyang ma bcings pa yin te thabs shig gis 'grol bas na /
translated: Even bondage is not bondage, because it is liberated by a method.

original: bcings pa yang ma bcings pa'o //
analyzed: bcings pa yang ma bcings pa'o //
translated: And the bound are not bound.

original: dper na gsungs pa /
analyzed: dper na gsungs pa /
translated: For example, it is said:

original: ji ltar skyes bu zhes te thag pa mdud pa por bas bum pa la sogs pa'i don kha cig 'ching bas bcings pa mdud pa 'grol bas bkrol ba de bzhin du mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu zhes te thag pa mdud pa por bas bum pa la sogs pa'i don kha cig 'ching bas bcings pa mdud pa 'grol bas bkrol ba de bzhin du mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas bdag dang bdag gir chags pa dang /
translated: Just as a person, by tying a knot in a rope, binds some object such as a pot, and by unravelling the knot, unties it, so too, by the ignorance of non-equipoise, one is bound by attachment to self and mine, and by the noose of karma.

original: las kyi zhags pas bcings pa las bdag med pa gnyis rtogs na grol bar 'gyur ro //üîΩyod pa dang med pa zhes pa ni 'di ni yod do //
analyzed: las kyi zhags pas bcings pa las bdag med pa gnyis rtogs na grol bar 'gyur ro // yod pa dang med pa zhes pa ni 'di ni yod do //
translated: But if one realizes the two kinds of no-self, one is liberated.

original: 'di ni med do zhes par mtshan nyid rtog par byed de /üîΩrtag pa phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo'i rdzas kyis brtsams pa sa la sogs pa ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yod la /
analyzed: 'di ni med do zhes par mtshan nyid rtog par byed de / rtag pa phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo'i rdzas kyis brtsams pa sa la sogs pa ni gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na yod la /
translated: As for existence and non-existence, one imagines that this exists and that does not exist.

original: rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes so //
translated: One imagines that this is permanent and this is impermanent, this is external and this is internal, this is a subtle particle and this is a substance, this is earth and so on, this exists at the time of not falling asleep and this does not exist at the time of dreaming.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa de ltar gsal ba la brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bur mngon par chags par byed pa'i sgyu ma'i gnas sna tshogs mthong ba bzhin no zhes te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi rnam pa de ltar gsal ba la brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnam pa de lta bur mngon par chags par byed pa'i sgyu ma'i gnas sna tshogs mthong ba bzhin no zhes te /
translated: It is like seeing the various things of an illusion, which are the dependent nature, appearing in that way, and then superimposing the imagined nature onto them in that way.

original: sgyu ma'i gnas ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa du mar gang sna tshogs su phyi rol gyi mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'khrul pa rnams kyis mthong ba ste /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gnas ni rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa du mar gang sna tshogs su phyi rol gyi mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'khrul pa rnams kyis mthong ba ste /
translated: The various things of an illusion are seen by the many different aspects of conceptual thought, which are the various external appearances of beauty and ugliness and so on.

original: de lta bu sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang gzugs kyi rnam pa gsal ba'i gnas ni brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu sgyu ma'i bdag nyid kyi gzhan gyi dbang gzugs kyi rnam pa gsal ba'i gnas ni brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: The dependent nature, which is the nature of an illusion, is the appearance of the aspects of form, and that is the imagined nature.

original: sgyu ma gzhan du mthong ba'i blos zhes ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa'i blos gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa'i @143a * //
analyzed: sgyu ma gzhan du mthong ba'i blos zhes ba ni mthong ba dang reg pa'i blos gzugs dang reg pa la sogs pa'i @143a * //
translated: The line ‚ÄúThe mind that sees the illusion as something else‚Äù means that the mind that sees and touches sees and touches form and touch and so on.

original: yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas gzhan du phyi rol gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas nyid du 'dzin pa ni sgyu ma'i gzugs nyid du gang snang ba de la byis pa rnams kyis de ltar kun rtog go //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas gzhan du phyi rol gyi yan lag can gyi rdzas nyid du 'dzin pa ni sgyu ma'i gzugs nyid du gang snang ba de la byis pa rnams kyis de ltar kun rtog go //
translated: The apprehension of the other, the locus of various qualities, as a substance with external parts is the imagination of the childish in regard to the appearance of the form of an illusion.

original: sna tshogs dang sgyu ma ni gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang reg pa la sogs par snang ba ni 'dus pa'i yul gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: sna tshogs dang sgyu ma ni gcig pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes pa ni gzugs dang reg pa la sogs par snang ba ni 'dus pa'i yul gyi phyir ro //
translated: The variety and the illusion are neither the same nor different, because the appearance as form, touch, etc. is the object of the aggregation.

original: yon tan dang yon tan can gyi rkyen byis pas brtags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu la 'di ni gzugs dang ldan no //üîΩ'di ni reg pa dang ldan zhing rdzas gzhan yin no zhes gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i gzugs nyid la /
analyzed: yon tan dang yon tan can gyi rkyen byis pas brtags pa'i rnam pa de lta bu la 'di ni gzugs dang ldan no // 'di ni reg pa dang ldan zhing rdzas gzhan yin no zhes gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa'i gzugs nyid la /
translated: The childish imagine the conditions of the quality and the possessor of the quality in that way. In regard to the form of the aggregation of form, etc.,üîΩthey say, ‚ÄúThis possesses form,‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúThis possesses touch and is a different substance.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gzugs dang ldan pa'o 'di ni reg pa dang ldan pa'o zhes smos par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs dang ldan pa'o 'di ni reg pa dang ldan pa'o zhes smos par byed do //
translated: In regard to the form of the aggregation of form, etc.,

original: 'dus pa'i gzugs la gzugs sam gzugs la sogs pa yod do zhes tha dad par brtags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs par rdzas yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i gzugs la gzugs sam gzugs la sogs pa yod do zhes tha dad par brtags pa ni gzugs la sogs pa ma gtogs par rdzas yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The form, etc., of the composite is imagined to be different, as when one says, ‚ÄúThe form is in the composite,‚Äù but it does not exist as a substance apart from the form, etc.

original: ji ltar tshal gcig la skyed shing 'di rnams kyis tshal 'di skyed shing du ldan pa yin zhes skyed shing ni mang la tshal ni gcig pu 'di nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar tshal gcig la skyed shing 'di rnams kyis tshal 'di skyed shing du ldan pa yin zhes skyed shing ni mang la tshal ni gcig pu 'di nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: Just as a grove is imagined to be a grove of trees, since the trees are many and the grove is one, but the grove does not exist apart from the trees.

original: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa la snam bu la sogs pa ni gcig pu nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa mang po kho nar te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs la sogs pa 'dus pa la snam bu la sogs pa ni gcig pu nyid dang / gzugs la sogs pa mang po kho nar te /
translated: Just as a cloth, etc., is imagined to be one in the composite of form, etc., and the form, etc., are many,

original: de yang de dag ma gtogs par gcig pu nyid mi srid la /
analyzed: de yang de dag ma gtogs par gcig pu nyid mi srid la /
translated: but the one does not exist apart from them,

original: thams cad la yang gcig pu nyid du ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad la yang gcig pu nyid du ma yin te /
translated: and not all of them are one.

original: de ltar na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par tha snyad du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par tha snyad du bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the conventional usage of difference and non-difference.

original: des na sgyu ma dang sna tshogs gcig pa dang / tha dad par gang rtogs pa de ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: des na sgyu ma dang sna tshogs gcig pa dang / tha dad par gang rtogs pa de ni mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to understand the illusion and the variety as either the same or different.

original: gang gis tha dad par nges pa des gcig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang gis tha dad par nges pa des gcig par mi rung ngo //
translated: That by which one ascertains difference is not suitable for oneness.

original: 'dus pa'i gzugs la sgyu ma'i gzugs gcig tu nges pas na tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i gzugs la sgyu ma'i gzugs gcig tu nges pas na tha dad par dmigs su med pa'i phyir tha dad par yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the form of the magical creation is ascertained as one in the form of the composite, it is not observed as different, and therefore it is not suitable as different.

original: don dam par na gnyis ka yang med ces dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: don dam par na gnyis ka yang med ces dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that ultimately both are nonexistent.

original: 'jig rten chags pa ltar yod pa dang med pa ltar mi chags par bya'o zhes de'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten chags pa ltar yod pa dang med pa ltar mi chags par bya'o zhes de'i phyir gsungs pa'o //
translated: One should not be attached to existence as it appears in the world, nor to nonexistence as it appears. Therefore, it is said:

original: de ni snang ba tsam mo zhes dgongs pa'o //üîΩsems ni yul dang kun du 'brel //
analyzed: de ni snang ba tsam mo zhes dgongs pa'o // sems ni yul dang kun du 'brel //
translated: The thought is that it is mere appearance.üîΩThe mind is related to the object.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The mind is the consciousness of the ground of all.

original: lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang @143b ba'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang @143b ba'i gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: It is the other-dependent, which appears as the body, enjoyments, and the world.

original: rtog pa la ni rnam par 'jug //
analyzed: rtog pa la ni rnam par 'jug //
translated: It engages in conceptualization.

original: zhes pa ni brtags pa'i yul rtag pa dang / phyi rol dang rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rjes su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni brtags pa'i yul rtag pa dang / phyi rol dang rdzas dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs par rtog pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas rjes su rtog pa'o //
translated: The imagined is the mental consciousness that imagines the object of imagination, such as permanence, externality, substance, quality, action, etc.

original: snang ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The perfected is the nonappearance of the imagined.

original: mi gnyis pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la shes rab rnam pa gsum char yang 'jug go //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid la shes rab rnam pa gsum char yang 'jug go //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom enter into the nondual intrinsic reality.

original: 'ang gi sgra'i don ni snga ma'i phyogs la ltos te bye brag tu snang bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ang gi sgra'i don ni snga ma'i phyogs la ltos te bye brag tu snang bar byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù means that the perfected is distinguished from the former two.üîΩThe imagined nature exists, but the dependent does not exist.

original: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yod gzhan gyi dbang ni med pa ste zhes pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yid ches par byed pa yod la gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa med do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa mngon sum
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yod gzhan gyi dbang ni med pa ste zhes pa ni kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin yid ches par byed pa yod la gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i chud pa med do zhes rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa mngon sum
translated: The imagined nature is the object of faith, but the dependent is not the object of nonconceptual faith.üîΩThe opponent, who is a proponent of direct perception, has this doubt.

original: par smra ba pa rnams phyir rgol bar de ltar thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pa de'i lan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: par smra ba pa rnams phyir rgol bar de ltar thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pa de'i lan du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One, anticipating this, responds.

original: nor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
analyzed: nor ba dag gis brtags pa snang //
translated: The appearances of the errors are imputed.üîΩ

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal appears.

original: nor ba'i rnam par sgra'i don spyir 'dzin par byed de /
analyzed: nor ba'i rnam par sgra'i don spyir 'dzin par byed de /
translated: The imagination of what is unreal is the apprehension of the meaning of words in the aspect of an unreal image.

original: des na brtags pa'i rang bzhin nor bas 'dzin to //
analyzed: des na brtags pa'i rang bzhin nor bas 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, the imagination of what is unreal is the apprehension of an unreal image.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gsal bas na rnam par mi rtog go zhes khyod kyis bshad mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang kun brtags pa bzhin du rtog pa ste zhes de de snyam du gyur bar thugs dogs nas gzhan gyi dbang mi rtog go zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gsal bas na rnam par mi rtog go zhes khyod kyis bshad mod kyi / 'on kyang kun brtags pa bzhin du rtog pa ste zhes de de snyam du gyur bar thugs dogs nas gzhan gyi dbang mi rtog go zhes pa ste /
translated: You have said that the other-dependent is non-conceptual because it is clear.üîΩBut it is like the imagination of what is unreal, and so on.

original: rab rib la sogs pas skra la sogs pa gsal ba'i gzugs bdag nyid 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces 'dod kyang de'i dbang du gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rab rib la sogs pas skra la sogs pa gsal ba'i gzugs bdag nyid 'dod pa bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'byung bar ma gyur cig ces 'dod kyang de'i dbang du gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: The clear form of hair and so on that appears to one with an eye disease is just as one wishes, and it is not as one does not wish.

original: rtog pa ni de lta bur ma yin te bdag gi 'dod pa 'byung ba dang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni de lta bur ma yin te bdag gi 'dod pa 'byung ba dang ldog pa ste /
translated: But it is not like that for the imagination of what is unreal, because one wishes for the occurrence and non-occurrence of what one desires.

original: bdag nyid la bdag nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog ces so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la bdag nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog ces so //
translated: One does not have non-conceptual knowledge of oneself by oneself.

original: gang na brtags par klog pa der de yod pa nyid ni rta la rtog pa yang ba lang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: gang na brtags par klog pa der de yod pa nyid ni rta la rtog pa yang ba lang mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Where it is examined, the existence of that is like the swiftness of a horse, because of seeing a cow.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa tshigs su bcad pa spyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa tshigs su bcad pa spyir gsungs pa /
translated: The ultimate truth is stated in a general way in the verse.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rnams su khyad par du phye ba la sogs par 'brel bar yang snang bas na des na de'i phyir bshad pa tsam mo //üîΩsgyu ma yan lag dang yan lag can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dngos por brtags @144a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rnams su khyad par du phye ba la sogs par 'brel bar yang snang bas na des na de'i phyir bshad pa tsam mo // sgyu ma yan lag dang yan lag can rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dngos por brtags @144a * //
translated: Since it appears to be connected to the distinctions, etc., stated in the verses, therefore, for that reason, it is merely an explanation.

original: pa phyi rol gyi dngos po lta bur mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: pa phyi rol gyi dngos po lta bur mi 'grub ste /
translated: The illusory body, which is imagined to be a thing with various parts and members, is not established as an external thing.

original: de snang ba tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de snang ba tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is merely an appearance.

original: de bzhin du mtshan ma yang gang don sna tshogs su bya ba byed par gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bar kun rtog pa de lta bu de yang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na mi 'grub pa ni gzugs sems snang ba tsam gyi phyir
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan ma yang gang don sna tshogs su bya ba byed par gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi bar kun rtog pa de lta bu de yang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par dbye ba na mi 'grub pa ni gzugs sems snang ba tsam gyi phyir
translated: In the same way, the sign is also like that, which is imagined to be an external thing, such as form, that functions to create various meanings. That imagination is not established when divided into different directional parts, because form is merely an appearance of mind.

original: te de bzhin gyi sgra rung ngo //
analyzed: te de bzhin gyi sgra rung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is appropriate.

original: mtshan ma gnas ngan lan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan ma ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma gnas ngan lan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan ma ni gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan ma ste /
translated: The signs of the negative reflex are the signs of form, etc.

original: nang glongs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / rab rib dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
analyzed: nang glongs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / rab rib dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du snang ngo //
translated: They appear through the power of internal error, like the appearance of dizziness, floaters, fainting, etc.

original: de la gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang gtsang bar phyi'i dngos por phyin ci log gi 'khor ba'i 'ching bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la gnas ngan len gyi mtshan ma yang rtag pa dang / bdag dang bde ba dang gtsang bar phyi'i dngos por phyin ci log gi 'khor ba'i 'ching bar kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyun 'byung ngo //
translated: The signs of the negative reflex are the signs of permanence, self, pleasure, and purity, which are the errors of the external things. The stream of the store consciousness is the bondage of cyclic existence.

original: kun du brtags pa ni bdag dang / phyi rol dang rdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du kun du sgro btags mi shes pa blun pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs su snang ba la rtag pa dang / phyi rol dang / rdzas la sogs par rtog go //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa ni bdag dang / phyi rol dang rdzas la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du kun du sgro btags mi shes pa blun pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs su snang ba la rtag pa dang / phyi rol dang / rdzas la sogs par rtog go //
translated: The imagined is the superimposition of a self, an external, a substance, etc. on the dependent, which is the appearance of the form of the clear consciousness. The ignorant imagine it to be permanent, external, a substance, etc.

original: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong ma'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar mdzad pa sbom po yan lag can gyi gzugs ma skyes pa nyid yon tan dang / las dang spyi la sogs par 'brel ba'i rgyu sna tshogs su gzhan gyi dbang nyid skyes so zhes kun rtog go //
analyzed: gang 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gong ma'i tshigs su bcad pa'i don de nyid gsal bar mdzad pa sbom po yan lag can gyi gzugs ma skyes pa nyid yon tan dang / las dang spyi la sogs par 'brel ba'i rgyu sna tshogs su gzhan gyi dbang nyid skyes so zhes kun rtog go //
translated: The meaning of the above verse is clarified by the words ‚Äúthis‚Äù and so on. The coarse form, which is the possessor of the parts, is not produced, and the various causes of its relation to qualities, actions, universals, and so on are imagined to be produced as the dependent.

original: de ni le'u snga ma phyed phyi ma phyed kyis bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ni le'u snga ma phyed phyi ma phyed kyis bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained by the second half of the previous chapter.

original: sna tshogs snang ba ni zhes te rigs dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa'i gnas rnams kyis kun brtags pa nyid gzhan gyi dbang yin no zhes byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba ni zhes te rigs dang / yon tan dang / las la sogs pa'i gnas rnams kyis kun brtags pa nyid gzhan gyi dbang yin no zhes byis pa rnams kyis rnam par rtog go //
translated: The various appearances are imagined by the childish to be the dependent, in terms of the categories of type, quality, action, and so on.

original: phyin ci log ma yin pa mtshan nyid gsum po 'dis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zab mo rnams khyab pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log ma yin pa mtshan nyid gsum po 'dis theg pa chen po'i mdo sde zab mo rnams khyab pa ste /
translated: The three natures are the pervasiveness of the profound s≈´tras of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsung bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsung bar mdzad pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rtag pa yi ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: By the nature of permanence,
