original: thams cad chos ni ma skyes te //
analyzed: thams cad chos ni ma skyes te //
translated: all phenomena are unproduced.

original: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
analyzed: gzhan dbang la ni brten nas su //
translated: But in dependence on the relative,

original: mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye //üîΩgang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi //
analyzed: mi rnams kyi ni rnam rtog skye // gang tshe gzhan dbang rnam rtog gi //
translated: the conceptual thought of people arises.

original: rnam par spangs pa dag @144b pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par spangs pa dag @144b pa ni //
translated: When the relative is abandoned,üîΩthe conceptual thought of the wise does not arise.

original: grub pa de bzhin nyid par bstan //
analyzed: grub pa de bzhin nyid par bstan //
translated: The accomplishment of that is taught to be reality itself.

original: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do //
analyzed: mdo sde mdo sder ngas bshad do //
translated: The sutra says, I have explained the sutra in the sutra.

original: zhes pa'o // ji ltar na yang rtag pa ma skyes zhes pa dang / de bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // ji ltar na yang rtag pa ma skyes zhes pa dang / de bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: How is it that it is permanent and not produced? And to prove that, it says,

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste //üîΩzhes pa ste /üîΩgang na kun rdzob gzhan gyi dbang gzugs la sogs pa gsal bar gcod pa des de kho na nyid mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la sgrib par byed de /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste // zhes pa ste / gang na kun rdzob gzhan gyi dbang gzugs la sogs pa gsal bar gcod pa des de kho na nyid mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la sgrib par byed de /
translated: The conventional and the ultimate,üîΩwherever the conventional, the relative, the form, etc., is clearly defined, that obscures the knowledge of reality, nonduality.

original: rab rib can la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis yang dag par rig pa la sgrib pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rab rib can la sogs pa'i gzugs kyis yang dag par rig pa la sgrib pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the knowledge of the form of one with cataracts, etc., is obscured.

original: rgyu las skyes pa gsum pa med ces pa ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag gi rdzas la sogs par rnam par brtags pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: rgyu las skyes pa gsum pa med ces pa ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bu'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / rdul phra mo dang / yan lag gi rdzas la sogs par rnam par brtags pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: This is only imagined, like the son of a barren woman, as permanent, as a self, as a subtle particle, as a substance of parts, and so on.

original: de skyes pas na de ni brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de skyes pas na de ni brtags pa'o //
translated: Since it arises, it is imagined.

original: gang yang rang 'khrugs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
analyzed: gang yang rang 'khrugs pa'i rgyu las skyes pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang ste /
translated: That which arises from a cause of its own disturbance is dependent.

original: rab rib can gyi gzugs la sogs pa snang ba bzhin te rab rib can gyis gzugs de mthong bas so //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi gzugs la sogs pa snang ba bzhin te rab rib can gyis gzugs de mthong bas so //
translated: It is like the appearance of forms and so on to one with eye disease, because one with eye disease sees those forms.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi don byed pa bzhin du sim pa dang / gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba yang de na yod do //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi don byed pa bzhin du sim pa dang / gdung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba yang de na yod do //
translated: Like a dream, a magical display, and so on, it also has the function of the characteristics of satisfaction, frustration, and so on.

original: rgyu las ma skyes pa'i kun rdzob ni brtags pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyu las ma skyes pa'i kun rdzob ni brtags pa nyid de /
translated: The conventional that does not arise from causes is imagined.

original: mi shes pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi yan lag can gyi rdzas yan lag rnams las skyes so zhes smras pa'i don de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i mu stegs can rnams kyi yan lag can gyi rdzas yan lag rnams las skyes so zhes smras pa'i don de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The meaning of the statement by the non-Buddhist philosophers who do not know this, that the whole substance arises from the parts, is stated:

original: brtags pa dag ni kun rdzob bshad //
analyzed: brtags pa dag ni kun rdzob bshad //
translated: The imagined is said to be the superficial.

original: ces pa'o // de bcad ces pa ni ma skyes pa'i brtags pa de bcad pa'i phyir te /üîΩnyon mongs pa bsal bar gnyis kyi rnam par skyes pa'i kun rdzob gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin spangs nas 'phags pa'i spyod yul te /üîΩdon dam pa'i bden pa'i grub pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa'o // de bcad ces pa ni ma skyes pa'i brtags pa de bcad pa'i phyir te / nyon mongs pa bsal bar gnyis kyi rnam par skyes pa'i kun rdzob gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin spangs nas 'phags pa'i spyod yul te / don dam pa'i bden pa'i grub pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The cutting off of that is for the sake of the non-arising of the imagined.üîΩHaving abandoned the superficial nature of the relative, which arises in the aspect of duality, in order to remove the afflictions, the object of the noble ones is the establishment of the ultimate truth, which is the perfect knowledge of non-duality.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'i dngos po ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi snang ba med cing don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa'i dngos po ni rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: The object of the yogis, which is the non-dual ultimate truth, is the non-conceptual.

original: de'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams la sna tshogs ni dngos po gcig tu snang ngo //üîΩdon @145a * //
analyzed: de'i ting nge 'dzin las bzhengs te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa rnams la sna tshogs ni dngos po gcig tu snang ngo // don @145a * //
translated: The various appearances appear as a single entity.

original: dam pa de las kyang sna tshogs gud na med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rdzas las kun brtags pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid gud na med do //
analyzed: dam pa de las kyang sna tshogs gud na med pa de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rdzas las kun brtags pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid gud na med do //
translated: And just as the various appearances do not exist apart from that ultimate reality, in the same way, the imagined nature of entities does not exist apart from the dependent nature.

original: rgyu spun la sogs pa ma gtogs par snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu spun la sogs pa ma gtogs par snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas kyi tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from the causes such as the threads, there is no convention of a substance such as a cloth.üîΩHow is it that what is one is not various?

original: ji ltar na yang gang gcig yin pa sna tshogs ma yin pa zhes pa dang gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang gang gcig yin pa sna tshogs ma yin pa zhes pa dang gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: ji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
analyzed: ji ltar rab rib can dag gis //
translated: Just as those with eye diseaseüîΩPerceive various things, such as floating hairs,üîΩmoths,üîΩflies,üîΩand so on,üîΩand those with healthy eyes do not,üîΩin the same way,

original: zhes te / phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo mtho ba dang dma' ba la sogs pa'i rim par gzugs su snang ba'i shes pas sna tshogs su rtog gi /
analyzed: zhes te / phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo mtho ba dang dma' ba la sogs pa'i rim par gzugs su snang ba'i shes pas sna tshogs su rtog gi /
translated: the various appearances of form are perceived by the consciousness of those with the eye disease of ignorance,

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyi dmigs pa de ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: but those various appearances of form do not exist.

original: de med pa'i phyir sna tshogs su shes pa yang yang dag par na yul med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir sna tshogs su shes pa yang yang dag par na yul med pa nyid do //
translated: Because of that, the cognition of variety is, in reality, devoid of objects.

original: 'on kyang nang glongs pa'i mthu las 'khrul ba'i shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang nang glongs pa'i mthu las 'khrul ba'i shes pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par snang ngo //
translated: Nevertheless, the various appearances of mistaken cognition arise from the power of internal causes.

original: gang gi tshe na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rab rib kyi gzugs ni gzugs ma yin pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / snang ba tsam gyi phyir gzugs med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du mkhas pas yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin las rab rib can gyi gzugs lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang med par rab tu yid ches so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir rab rib kyi gzugs ni gzugs ma yin pa'i shes rab kyis mthong ba dang / snang ba tsam gyi phyir gzugs med pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du mkhas pas yongs su grub pa'i rang bzhin las rab rib can gyi gzugs lta bu'i gzhan gyi dbang med par rab tu yid ches so //
translated: Just as a person with eye disease sees a hair in the air but not a real hair, and just as a cognition of a mirage does not see water, in the same way, the wise should have complete confidence that the dependent nature, like the form seen by the person with eye disease, does not exist apart from the nature of the perfected.

original: ji ltar na yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma gtogs par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i yang dag par rig pa yod par brtags zhes de lta bur thugs dogs nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal
analyzed: ji ltar na yang gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma gtogs par dag pa gnyis su med pa'i yang dag par rig pa yod par brtags zhes de lta bur thugs dogs nas snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pas bka' stsal
translated: The Buddha, with his knowledge of all things, both with and without remainder,üîΩhas declared:

original: pa / ji ltar gser zhes te /
analyzed: pa / ji ltar gser zhes te /
translated: Just as gold is purified by fire,

original: dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dag pa'o //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba'i phyir dag pa'o //
translated: it is purified because it is free from stains.üîΩJust as water is purified by being filtered,

original: rnyog ma spangs te chu dag pa de bzhin du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ma gtogs par dag par rab tu brtags pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog ma spangs te chu dag pa de bzhin du brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin ma gtogs par dag par rab tu brtags pa ste /
translated: so too is the imagined nature purified, except for the imagined and relative natures.

original: rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúpurified‚Äù is ‚Äúestablished.‚Äù

original: brtags pa la ni dngos po med //
analyzed: brtags pa la ni dngos po med //
translated: There is no entity in the imagined.

original: ces bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: This is in terms of the mode of establishment.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni yod pa ste //
translated: The relative is existent.

original: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig yod kyi /
translated: This is because the two modes of the relative exist.

original: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa med do zhes de ltar rnam par rtog pa na legs pa'i lam las 'jig par 'gyur ba ni rnyag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i chud pa med do zhes de ltar rnam par rtog pa na legs pa'i lam las 'jig par 'gyur ba ni rnyag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When one thinks, ‚ÄúThe second person does not exist,‚Äù one falls from the good path, one falls into error.

original: de ste nor ba lam du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ste nor ba lam du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: One enters the wrong path.

original: gzhan gyi dbang @145b yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang / brtags pa dang grub pa med par skur ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang @145b yod par sgro 'dogs pa dang / brtags pa dang grub pa med par skur ba la /
translated: With regard to the superimposition that the dependent exists and the denial that the imagined and the real do not exist,

original: gal te brtags pa dngos med la //
analyzed: gal te brtags pa dngos med la //
translated: if the imagined is unreal,

original: bden par gzhan gyi dbang yod na //
analyzed: bden par gzhan gyi dbang yod na //
translated: and the dependent truly exists,

original: zhes pa ste /üîΩde ste brtags pa snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin par gyur la /
analyzed: zhes pa ste / de ste brtags pa snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzas dngos po'i bdag nyid du yod pa ma yin par gyur la /
translated: this is what is said.üîΩIf the imagined, such as cloth, does not exist as a substance, as a reality,

original: gzhan gyi rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rgyu don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin du bden na ni de'i tshe dngos po med par dngos po ste zhes par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rgyu don dam par dngos po'i rang bzhin du bden na ni de'i tshe dngos po med par dngos po ste zhes par rtog par byed do //
translated: and the dependent, the threads, etc., which are its causes, truly exist as a reality, as an ultimate, then at that time one would imagine that a nonentity is an entity.

original: rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyang yan lag tu rnam par phye bas stong pa'i phyir de bas na dngos po'i snam bu la sogs pa med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni dngos po med pa las yan lag can gyi rdzas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rgyu rnams kyang yan lag tu rnam par phye bas stong pa'i phyir de bas na dngos po'i snam bu la sogs pa med pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni dngos po med pa las yan lag can gyi rdzas 'byung ngo //
translated: The causes, such as the threads, are also empty of being parts. Therefore, the partless cloth and so on do not arise from nonexistent things. The substantial part-possessor arises from a nonexistent thing.

original: kun brtags pa ni rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rdzas la gnas te /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni rgyu spun la sogs pa'i rdzas la gnas te /
translated: The imputed exists in the substance of the causes, such as the threads.

original: gong ma'i rim pa zheng dang chur gyur te /
analyzed: gong ma'i rim pa zheng dang chur gyur te /
translated: The upper layers become the width and length.

original: rgyu spun gyi cha'i rdul 'dus pa las gsal bar snang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang snam bu la sogs pa sbom por nye bar dmigs so //
analyzed: rgyu spun gyi cha'i rdul 'dus pa las gsal bar snang ba'i gzhan gyi dbang snam bu la sogs pa sbom por nye bar dmigs so //
translated: The dependent cloth and so on appear as a coarse object from the aggregation of the particles of the causes, the threads.

original: ming dang mtshan ma 'brel pa las //
analyzed: ming dang mtshan ma 'brel pa las //
translated: From the connection of name and sign,

original: zhes pa ni gcig pu dang / sbom po dang / chen po dang / grangs dang / tshad la sogs pa la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gcig pu dang / sbom po dang / chen po dang / grangs dang / tshad la sogs pa la mtshan ma zhes bya'o //
translated: The sign is called the single, the coarse, the great, the number, the measure, and so on.

original: ming ni rgyu spun dang snam bu la sogs par brjod pa ste /
analyzed: ming ni rgyu spun dang snam bu la sogs par brjod pa ste /
translated: The name is the expression of the causes, such as the threads and the cloth.

original: de bas na ming dang mtshan mas 'brel ba las skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na ming dang mtshan mas 'brel ba las skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it arises from the connection with names and signs.

original: rdul 'dus pa gzhan gyi snang ba'i gzugs la mtshan mar gcig par sgro btags pas na kun brtags pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul 'dus pa gzhan gyi snang ba'i gzugs la mtshan mar gcig par sgro btags pas na kun brtags pa nyid do //
translated: Since the form that appears in the aggregation of particles is imputed as a single sign, it is imaginary.

original: brtags pa shin tu ma grub ste /
analyzed: brtags pa shin tu ma grub ste /
translated: The imaginary is not established at all.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang yan lag gi rdzas bum pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba ni ma yin no zhes pa gzhan gyi dbang yan lag gi rdzas bum pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The dependent is the substance of the parts, such as a vase, and so on.

original: gzhan las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises from another.

original: brtags pa ni rtag pa'i rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rgyu spun gyi rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: brtags pa ni rtag pa'i rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rgyu spun gyi rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: The imaginary does not arise from another cause, such as a pair of permanent particles.üîΩIt is not established at all.

original: shin tu ma grub pa ste zhes pa rgyu spun la sogs pa /
analyzed: shin tu ma grub pa ste zhes pa rgyu spun la sogs pa /
translated: The cause, such as a pair of particles,

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: form is destroyed by the analysis of particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The part of a particle is partless.

original: zhes pas stong ba'i phyir de'i tshe shes par bya ba med pas shes pa 'dzin par yang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: zhes pas stong ba'i phyir de'i tshe shes par bya ba med pas shes pa 'dzin par yang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it is empty, at that time, since there is no object of consciousness, consciousness also does not arise as a subject.

original: gang gi tshe ci yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gzung ba dang / 'dzin pas stong pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ci yang mi dmigs pa de'i tshe gzung ba dang / 'dzin pas stong pa ste /
translated: When one does not apprehend anything at all, then one abides in the ultimate reality, which is empty of the apprehended object and apprehending subject,

original: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i @146a * //üîΩdag pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i @146a * // dag pa gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: and which is the nature of the correct understanding of nonduality.üîΩThe imagined is of ten kinds.

original: kun brtags pa ni rnam pa bcu ste zhes pa klog pa ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i grangs kyis brtag pa bcu gnyis su klag par brtag go //
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni rnam pa bcu ste zhes pa klog pa ni brjod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i grangs kyis brtag pa bcu gnyis su klag par brtag go //
translated: The reading of the ten kinds of imagination as twelve is to be understood by the enumeration of the conceptual thoughts of expression, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa drug //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni rnam pa drug //
translated: The other-dependent is of six kinds.

original: ces pa ni rnam pa'i don du kun gzhi rnam rnam par shes pa lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba khams brgyad du brtag par brtag go //
analyzed: ces pa ni rnam pa'i don du kun gzhi rnam rnam par shes pa lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba khams brgyad du brtag par brtag go //
translated: The meaning of the six kinds of other-dependence is to be understood by the eight consciousnesses appearing as body, sense-objects, and sense-fields.

original: gzhan gyi dbang rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba de nyid de bzhin pa nyid du yang dag par rig pa tsam gyi phyir rnam pa gzhan du khyad par du 'byed pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rgyu dang rkyen las 'byung ba de nyid de bzhin pa nyid du yang dag par rig pa tsam gyi phyir rnam pa gzhan du khyad par du 'byed pa med do //
translated: The other-dependent is the arising from causes and conditions. It is just that, and nothing else. It is to be understood as just that, and not otherwise.

original: chos lnga gsungs pa ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: chos lnga gsungs pa ni ming dang / mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The five dharmas are name, sign, conceptualization, correct direct intuition, and suchness.

original: de dag nyid yang dag pa nyid de chos rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag nyid yang dag pa nyid de chos rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: They are reality, the nature of dharmas.

original: rang bzhin ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The nature is the imagined, the relative, and the perfect.

original: de bsgoms na zhes pa ni brang ba dang dor ba'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: de bsgoms na zhes pa ni brang ba dang dor ba'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúCultivating‚Äù means cultivating the special non-apprehension.

original: mi 'da'o zhes pa ni de bzhin pa nyid la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'da'o zhes pa ni de bzhin pa nyid la 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDoes not pass beyond‚Äù means entering into suchness.

original: mtshan ma ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa ste gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa ste gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúSign‚Äù is the relative, the consciousness appearing as blue, etc.

original: gang ming zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la 'brel ba'i sngon po dang / dkar po ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang ming zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la 'brel ba'i sngon po dang / dkar po ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúName‚Äù is the imagined, the blue, etc. connected with conceptualization.

original: der ni der brtags pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: der ni der brtags pa zhes bya'o //
translated: There, that is called the imagined.

original: mtshan ma ni rigs dang yon tan dang byed pa la sogs par gang de ltar gyur bar kun brtags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas las 'byung ngo //üîΩshes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs pa na gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gsal ba dang / brtags pa yang rjod pa dang / brjod pa spyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni rigs dang yon tan dang byed pa la sogs par gang de ltar gyur bar kun brtags pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi gnas las 'byung ngo // shes rab kyis rnam par gzhigs pa na gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gsal ba dang / brtags pa yang rjod pa dang / brjod pa spyir rnam par rtog pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The sign is that which is imagined to be of such a kind, as a class, a quality, an action, etc., and it arises from the dependent nature.üîΩWhen it is analyzed by wisdom, the dependent is the manifestation of the two, the imagined and the perfected. The imagined is the verbal expression of the two, the expression and the universal image.üîΩThe perfected is the non-existence of the duality of the imagined in the dependent, and the existence of the non-existence of that duality. When it is known that the perfected is the non-existence of the duality, the non-existence of the duality is not imagined by a mind that has the aspect of the duality, which is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: gnyis kyis stong zhing gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa las grub pa'i rang bzhin med na de ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i blos rnam par brtags pa yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pas spangs pa'o
analyzed: gnyis kyis stong zhing gnyis su med par yang dag par rig pa las grub pa'i rang bzhin med na de ji ltar gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i blos rnam par brtags pa yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pas spangs pa'o
translated: The perfected is the non-existence of the duality, the non-existence of the grasped and the grasper, and it is the existence of the non-existence of the duality. It is not imagined by a mind that has the aspect of the duality, which is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: // grub pa'i dngos po yod de phyogs gos kyi rang bzhin la dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par gnyis su brtags pa lta bu dang / spyod pa can rnams kyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brtags pa lta bu @146b yang ma yin te /
analyzed: // grub pa'i dngos po yod de phyogs gos kyi rang bzhin la dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par gnyis su brtags pa lta bu dang / spyod pa can rnams kyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par brtags pa lta bu @146b yang ma yin te /
translated: There is an existent thing that is accomplished, not like the investigation of a thing and a non-thing in the nature of a cloth that is not yet woven, nor like the investigation of the difference and non-difference of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i chud pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yongs su grub pa'i chud pa ste /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the perfected, which is without thought and without appearance.

original: der rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis brtags pa lta bur spyir rjod pa dang / brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: der rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis brtags pa lta bur spyir rjod pa dang / brjod pa'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: There is no general expression and no conceptualization of expression, as if investigated by the yogis.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ltar 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba yang med do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ltar 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa gsal bar snang ba yang med do //
translated: There is no appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender, as if dependent on the other-dependent.

original: des na mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i myong bar grub pa'i dngos po yod do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par rtog go //
analyzed: des na mi gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi dus na dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa spangs pa'i myong bar grub pa'i dngos po yod do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par rtog go //
translated: Therefore, the Omniscient One is thought to have intended that there is an existent thing that is accomplished, which is the abandonment of the conceptualization of thing and non-thing at the time of non-dual samƒÅdhi.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gsal bas na sgro btags pa rnam pa'i rim pas rnam par rtog nus so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam par gsal bas na sgro btags pa rnam pa'i rim pas rnam par rtog nus so //
translated: Since the two dependent natures are clearly manifest, the superimposition is able to be conceptualized in terms of the sequence of aspects.

original: ji ltar na rnal 'byor ba rnams la rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar snang bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnal 'byor ba rnams la rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rnam pa las bzlog pa sngon po la sogs pa gsal bar snang bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang snang bar 'gyur /
translated: How is it that for yogis, even while the appearance of blue and so on is clear, the dependent nature appears in the opposite way to that of the concordant and discordant aspects?

original: sna tshogs kyi phyir der rigs mthun pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi phyir der rigs mthun pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Because of the variety, the superimposition of the concordant aspect arises as a conceptualization.

original: des na de 'dra ba'i reg pa yod do zhes tha snyad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des na de 'dra ba'i reg pa yod do zhes tha snyad 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the convention ‚Äúsuch a contact exists‚Äù arises.

original: rnal 'byor ba lnga pa'i tshe na gang yang snang ba med cing bsam pa med pa'i chud pa rigs mthun pa'i rnam par reg pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar rjes su chud pa'i blos ji ltar na rnam par brtags pa gal te de kho na nyid mkhyen pas chos bshad pa'i dus su bstan du zin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba lnga pa'i tshe na gang yang snang ba med cing bsam pa med pa'i chud pa rigs mthun pa'i rnam par reg pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar rjes su chud pa'i blos ji ltar na rnam par brtags pa gal te de kho na nyid mkhyen pas chos bshad pa'i dus su bstan du zin te /
translated: At the time of the fifth yoga, when there is no appearance at all and no thought, how could the mind that is immersed in the concordant aspect, the apprehender of contact, and the apprehender of the object, conceptualize? If it were so, it would have been taught at the time of teaching the Dharma by the knower of thatness.

original: 'on kyang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa la sogs pa'i gcig par sgro btags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma ston to //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa la sogs pa'i gcig par sgro btags te 'jug pa'i mtshan ma ston to //
translated: But the sign of engagement is taught as the superimposition of oneness, such as the emptiness of duality, and so on.

original: gal te yang brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du shes nas grub pa'i chud pa med do zhes //
analyzed: gal te yang brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du shes nas grub pa'i chud pa med do zhes //
translated: If one understands the imagined and the dependent to be non-existent, then the perfected is not established.

original: slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas rnam par rtog na ni sgra bzhin par gyur bas blos ci zhig rnam par brtags zhes te /
analyzed: slob dpon bha bya la sogs pas rnam par rtog na ni sgra bzhin par gyur bas blos ci zhig rnam par brtags zhes te /
translated: If one imagines it like the master Bhavaviveka and so on, then it becomes just like a sound. What is imagined by the mind?

original: 'o na ci bdag la sogs pa dang mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog gam sgra dang rnam par mi rtog pa ni dngos po yod pa nyid la 'jug pa ma yin zhes kyang chog ste rgya cher ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci bdag la sogs pa dang mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rnam par mi rtog gam sgra dang rnam par mi rtog pa ni dngos po yod pa nyid la 'jug pa ma yin zhes kyang chog ste rgya cher ro //
translated: Well then, are self and so on, the son of a barren woman, the horn of a rabbit, and so on not imagined? It is sufficient to say that sound and non-imagination do not engage in existent things.

original: de bas na yongs su grub pa yod do //
analyzed: de bas na yongs su grub pa yod do //
translated: Therefore, the perfected exists.

original: ji ltar de dag min zhes pa ni dgag par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag min zhes pa ni dgag par gsungs pa ste /
translated: As for how are they not? it is said to be a negation.

original: dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa phan tshun du rang bzhin tha dad pa rang bzhin gcig par mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa phan tshun du rang bzhin tha dad pa rang bzhin gcig par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that things and non-things, which are mutually different in nature, should be the same in nature.

original: grang ba dang me @147a * //
analyzed: grang ba dang me @147a * //
translated: Like cold and fire.

original: bzhin no // de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par khas blang pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: bzhin no // de bas na dngos po dang dngos po med par khas blang pa mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to accept things and non-things.

original: gnyis ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin la //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gnyis ni brtags pa'i rang bzhin la // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The two are imputed natures.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The two are the conceptualizations of existence and non-existence.

original: rang bzhin dag ni mi gnas te //
analyzed: rang bzhin dag ni mi gnas te //
translated: Natures do not abide.

original: zhes pa ni phan tshun du ltos pa'i phyir rang dbang du rab tu mi gnas so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni phan tshun du ltos pa'i phyir rang dbang du rab tu mi gnas so //
translated: This means that they do not abide independently because they are mutually dependent.

original: shes rab kyis rnam par gzhag pa na dngos po med pa'i phyir med pa yang ji ltar na 'gyur zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyis rnam par gzhag pa na dngos po med pa'i phyir med pa yang ji ltar na 'gyur zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: When established by wisdom, how could non-existence occur because of the non-existence of things?

original: yang na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa chud pa ma gtogs par rang bzhin med pas na de dag rab tu mi gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa chud pa ma gtogs par rang bzhin med pas na de dag rab tu mi gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, because they lack intrinsic nature apart from the inclusion of the aspects of the grasper and the grasped, they are said to not abide.

original: brtags pa ni sbom po gcig pu'o //
analyzed: brtags pa ni sbom po gcig pu'o //
translated: The imputed is only gross.

original: sna tshogs snang ba ni phra ba dkar po la sogs pa'i rdul 'dus par snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs snang ba ni phra ba dkar po la sogs pa'i rdul 'dus par snang ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags yongs su smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: The appearance of various things is the appearance of the aggregation of subtle particles, such as white, etc. It arises from the maturation of the latent impressions of conceptualization.

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: kun brtags pa la gnas nas ni //
analyzed: kun brtags pa la gnas nas ni //
translated: Dwelling in the imagined,

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni dmigs par 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni dmigs par 'gyur //
translated: the dependent is objectified.

original: zhes de brlan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las chu la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mu stegs byed par brtags pa ma gtogs par gzhan du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes de brlan pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa las chu la sogs pa 'byung ngo zhes bya bar mu stegs byed par brtags pa ma gtogs par gzhan du bshad do //
translated: Thus, apart from the tƒ´rthikas‚Äô imagination that water, etc. arises from the conceptualization of moisture, etc., it is explained otherwise.

original: brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ni dag pa ste mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'phags pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa ni dag pa ste mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'phags pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: The pure, nondual, correct knowledge that is the domain of the noble ones is empty of the two aspects of the imagined and the dependent.

original: brtags pa ni sbom pa'i rdzas gcig la sogs par yon tan dang / las dang spyi la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i rnam pa rdul phra mo 'dus par snang ba la khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa ltar sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas su kun tu rtog go //
analyzed: brtags pa ni sbom pa'i rdzas gcig la sogs par yon tan dang / las dang spyi la sogs pas gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i rnam pa rdul phra mo 'dus par snang ba la khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa ltar sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas su kun tu rtog go //
translated: The investigation is the imputation of a coarse substance, such as a pot, as a single entity, etc., by means of qualities, actions, universals, etc., in regard to the appearance of the subtle atoms of the dependent nature, which are the cause of the manifestation of the coarse.

original: rnam pa gzhan du zhes pa ni gal te gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa phra ba gsal bar snang ba'ang lhan cig tu rgyu ba'i gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba med par gyur na ni de'i tshe mu stegs smra bar gnas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du zhes pa ni gal te gzugs dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg pa phra ba gsal bar snang ba'ang lhan cig tu rgyu ba'i gzhan gyi dbang zhes bya ba med par gyur na ni de'i tshe mu stegs smra bar gnas par 'gyur te /
translated: In another way, if the subtle forms, smells, tastes, and textures that appear clearly were not the dependent nature, which is the cause of the manifestation of the coarse, then the Tƒ´rthikas would be correct in their assertions.

original: sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs par smra bar ro //
analyzed: sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas la sogs par smra bar ro //
translated: They assert that coarse substances, such as pots, are single entities.

original: rtog pa ni spyir sgro 'dogs pas 'jug go //
analyzed: rtog pa ni spyir sgro 'dogs pas 'jug go //
translated: Imagination engages in superimposition in general.

original: des na de brtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: des na de brtags zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the investigation.

original: de yod pas na yang rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i phyir na rgyu las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de yod pas na yang rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba'i phyir na rgyu las 'byung ngo //
translated: Since it exists, it arises from causes because it sees its own characteristics.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa'i gnas kyi rnam par rtog pa dag las @147b grol ba ni stong pa grub pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pa'i gnas kyi rnam par rtog pa dag las @147b grol ba ni stong pa grub pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The realization of the ultimate truth, which is nondual, is the establishment of emptiness, which is free from the concepts of the subject and object aspects, free from thought, and free from appearances.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pas mi gnyis pa de yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni gnyis kyi rnam pas mi gnyis pa de yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same is the nondual, which is not in the form of duality.

original: rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so so re re la 'brel to //
analyzed: rtog pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni so so re re la 'brel to //
translated: The characteristic of imagination is to be connected with each one.

original: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma ni mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: The means of valid knowledge are direct perception and inference.

original: yid brtan pa bstan pa'i lung ngo //
analyzed: yid brtan pa bstan pa'i lung ngo //
translated: The reliable word is the teaching of the scriptures.

original: de yang gnas gsum po phan tshun du 'gal ba med pa'i don du yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: de yang gnas gsum po phan tshun du 'gal ba med pa'i don du yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: And that is to be understood as the meaning of non-contradiction among the three sources.

original: 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi lam du dbab pa'i phyir khyad par gyi ye shes ma skyes pa'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ni rnal 'byor gyi lam du dbab pa'i phyir khyad par gyi ye shes ma skyes pa'i dbang du mdzad de gsungs so //
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the non-arising of the special wisdom for the sake of entering the path of yoga.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni thams cad mngon sum nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni thams cad mngon sum nyid do //
translated: But for the omniscient one, everything is direct perception.

original: brtags pa thog mar byed pa rnams rigs pa dang / lung gis 'gal ba med par dpyad de //
analyzed: brtags pa thog mar byed pa rnams rigs pa dang / lung gis 'gal ba med par dpyad de //
translated: Those who are beginners in the investigation should analyze without contradiction by reason and scripture.

original: the tshom bsal nas rnam par rtog pa med pas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom bsal nas rnam par rtog pa med pas rab tu 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having cleared away doubt, they will enter without discursive thought.

original: so so rang gi blos blang ba dang / dor ba de kho na nyid gdon mi za bar yid ches par spyod do //
analyzed: so so rang gi blos blang ba dang / dor ba de kho na nyid gdon mi za bar yid ches par spyod do //
translated: They will practice with the certainty that the reality of what is to be taken up and what is to be put aside is not to be doubted.

original: lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas zhes ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa spangs nas so //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas zhes ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa spangs nas so //
translated: Having abandoned the discursive thought of views means having abandoned the aspects of the view of the transitory composite and so on.

original: gong nas gong du zhes pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa mchog gi rim pas 'bad do //
analyzed: gong nas gong du zhes pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa mchog gi rim pas 'bad do //
translated: Higher and higher means that they strive by the stages of the highest listening, reflection, and meditation.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba ni chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Discursive thought does not arise because one has understood the nonexistence of the self in phenomena, due to the thorough knowledge of the imagined and the dependent as they are in reality.

original: theg pa gcig pu mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa gcig pu mi gnyis pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will understand the stream of the single vehicle, which is not a second.

original: nyan thos dang mu stegs byed rnams kyi khong du chud la nga nyid kyis thugs su chud ces bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' khyad par du grags par mdzad pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bye brag tu brjod do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang mu stegs byed rnams kyi khong du chud la nga nyid kyis thugs su chud ces bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' khyad par du grags par mdzad pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pas bye brag tu brjod do //
translated: The statement I myself have understood what is understood by the Sravakas and the tirthikas is a special assertion of his own doctrine, and is stated by the Omniscient One in order to make it known.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ste /
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ste /
translated: The single vehicle of the Buddha is characterized by the understanding of the selflessness of the person and of the dharmas.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni de nyid kyi nang du gtogs so //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa ni de nyid kyi nang du gtogs so //
translated: The vehicles of the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas are included in it.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis ston pa med par sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das nyid kyis ston pa med par sngar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: And the Lord himself, without a teacher, previously became a perfect Buddha.

original: des na de ltar theg pa gcig par 'gal lo zhes thams cad @148a * //
analyzed: des na de ltar theg pa gcig par 'gal lo zhes thams cad @148a * //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to say that there is a single vehicle.

original: mkhyen pa la blo gros chen pos gsol ba ni de ste theg pa gcig pu nyid na ni ji ltar na theg pa gsum zhes 'khor gyi rnam par rtog pa blo gros chen pos mkhyen nas sgra'i khyad par las glengs par brtag go //
analyzed: mkhyen pa la blo gros chen pos gsol ba ni de ste theg pa gcig pu nyid na ni ji ltar na theg pa gsum zhes 'khor gyi rnam par rtog pa blo gros chen pos mkhyen nas sgra'i khyad par las glengs par brtag go //
translated: The request by MahƒÅmati is this: If there is only one vehicle, then how is it that there are three vehicles? MahƒÅmati, knowing the thought of the assembly, raises the question from the point of view of the difference in words.

original: bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can pas na zhes pa ni rang gi nyon mongs pa spong bar mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can pas na zhes pa ni rang gi nyon mongs pa spong bar mngon par mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not being one who passes into complete nirvƒÅ·πáa, means that because of not being one who abandons one's own afflictions, one is not a Buddha.

original: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa ste /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn, because of being omniscient, has abandoned the obscurations to omniscience.

original: nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyes pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of abandoning faults together with their imprints,

original: las kyi bag chags kyang spangs so //
analyzed: las kyi bag chags kyang spangs so //
translated: he has also abandoned the imprints of karma.

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas and noble ≈õrƒÅvakas have only abandoned the afflictive obscurations.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bdag med pa gnyis thugs su chud pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang gsum spangs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ni bdag med pa gnyis thugs su chud pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa dang gsum spangs so //
translated: The Lord has eliminated the three obscurations: karma, afflictions, and the knowable, because he has realized the two kinds of no-self.

original: de bas na de ltar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba yongs su mkhyen nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i snod kyi sems can rnams la chos ston pa 'byung bas na gzud pa'i rim pas tshul gsum ston to //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba yongs su mkhyen nas mos pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i snod kyi sems can rnams la chos ston pa 'byung bas na gzud pa'i rim pas tshul gsum ston to //
translated: Thus, having fully understood the thoughts and dispositions of all sentient beings, he teaches the Dharma to those sentient beings who are vessels in accordance with their aspirations. Therefore, the three modes are taught by way of the stages of the trainees.

original: chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pa dang / rgyu gsum med pa'i phyir de dag la bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ma rtogs pa dang / rgyu gsum med pa'i phyir de dag la bdag nyid kyis mngon par rdzogs pa'i byang chub med do //
translated: Because they have not realized the selflessness of phenomena and do not have the three causes, they do not have the perfect enlightenment of a buddha.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni chos la bdag med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mnga' ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa la ni chos la bdag med pa thugs su chud pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ba'i yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mnga' ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has the perfect enlightenment that is inconceivable because he has realized the selflessness of phenomena.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas thugs su chud pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas bsam mi nus so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas thugs su chud pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas bsam mi nus so //
translated: The Omniscient One has realized what the Sravakas and so on cannot even imagine.

original: gang na 'gag pa med pa der ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang na 'gag pa med pa der ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang 'brel to //
translated: Where there is no cessation, there is the connection with omniscience.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ba ma thob pas na nyan thos de dag la theg pa gcig pu nyid theg pa gsum du ngas bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ba ma thob pas na nyan thos de dag la theg pa gcig pu nyid theg pa gsum du ngas bstan to //
translated: Since they have not attained the inconceivable, I have taught the One Vehicle to those Sravakas as the Three Vehicles.

original: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mos pa med par gyur ba na de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes bya dang nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa'i bag chags kyi nyes pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi mos pa med par gyur ba na de dag thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: When they have eliminated the faults of the propensities of the obscurations of the knowable, of afflictions, and of karma, and when they have become free from the lack of interest in meditative concentration, then they will become omniscient.

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas slar sad par 'gyur bas na theg pa chen po la 'phags pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni mar me lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas slar sad par 'gyur bas na theg pa chen po la 'phags pa'i nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ni mar me lta bu ma yin no //
translated: Since they will awaken again from the uncontaminated realm, the Nirvana of the noble Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas in the Mahayana is not like a flame going out.

original: ji @148b lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji @148b lta zhe na /
translated: How is it?

original: las dang nyon mongs pas btab pa'i lus snang ba spangs te 'gog pa las mnyam par 'jog pa bzhin du sems pa med cing snang ba med pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings su 'khod do //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pas btab pa'i lus snang ba spangs te 'gog pa las mnyam par 'jog pa bzhin du sems pa med cing snang ba med pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings su 'khod do //
translated: Then, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mnga' dbang gis de nas phyis sad de snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas yang zhes bya bar ro //üîΩtshogs zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa mchog gis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bskang nas chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sku ste
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mnga' dbang gis de nas phyis sad de snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas yang zhes bya bar ro //üîΩtshogs zhes bya ba ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa mchog gis bdag dang gzhan gyi don 'byung ba'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bskang nas chos kyi sku bsam gyis mi khyab pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi sku ste
translated: Then, after that, he awakens by the power of omniscience, and again, as it were, he enters the uncontaminated realm, which is without mind and without appearance, impelled by the instinct of compassion.üîΩThen,

original: / de yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa rnam pa de lta bu'i dbang byed pa thob nas ma lus pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug pas na ji lta bur bshad pa de lta bur theg
analyzed: / de yang snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed pa rnam pa de lta bu'i dbang byed pa thob nas ma lus pa'i sems can la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir 'jug pas na ji lta bur bshad pa de lta bur theg
translated: And having attained such mastery over the concentration with and without appearances, he enters into it in order to benefit all sentient beings without exception.üîΩ

original: pa gcig pu nyid do //
analyzed: pa gcig pu nyid do //
translated: Moreover, having attained mastery over the samƒÅdhi of appearance and the samƒÅdhi of no appearance, he engages in the benefit of all sentient beings without exception. Therefore, as explained, there is only one vehicle.

original: de ste yang brtags pa tha dad pa'i phyir theg pa tha dad du 'dzin na ni theg pa gsum nyi tsher ma zad de lha la sogs pa'i theg par yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba tha dad pa rnams kyis thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro
analyzed: de ste yang brtags pa tha dad pa'i phyir theg pa tha dad du 'dzin na ni theg pa gsum nyi tsher ma zad de lha la sogs pa'i theg par yang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dge ba tha dad pa rnams kyis thug pa med par yang 'gyur ro
translated: If one were to hold that there are different vehicles because of the different conceptualizations, not only would there be three vehicles, but there would be an infinite number of vehicles, such as the vehicle of the gods, because of the different virtues, such as generosity.

original: // ji srid sems rnams 'jug pa'i bar //
analyzed: // ji srid sems rnams 'jug pa'i bar //
translated: As long as the mind engages,

original: zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni lus dang longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba la bya'o //
translated: The ƒÅlaya consciousness is the appearance of the body, enjoyments, and the environment.

original: de yang shin tu gyur ba na gnyis kyi rnam pas stong ste /
analyzed: de yang shin tu gyur ba na gnyis kyi rnam pas stong ste /
translated: Moreover, when it is transformed, it is empty of the aspect of duality.

original: theg pa dang 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: theg pa dang 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization of vehicles and beings.

original: des na gnyis su med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ngas bstan to //
analyzed: des na gnyis su med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gcig ngas bstan to //
translated: Therefore, I have taught the one vehicle of the non-dual Buddhas.

original: gzhan du ni ji tsam du snang bar 'byed pa de tsam du theg par 'byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ji tsam du snang bar 'byed pa de tsam du theg par 'byed cing /
translated: Otherwise, to the extent that there is differentiation of appearances, to that extent there is differentiation of vehicles.

original: lha la sogs pa 'grub pa'i las kyang theg pa ma yin pas na theg pa rnam par gzhag par yang rnam par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: lha la sogs pa 'grub pa'i las kyang theg pa ma yin pas na theg pa rnam par gzhag par yang rnam par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And since the actions that accomplish gods and so forth are not vehicles, there would be no establishment of vehicles.

original: de yang mtha' med pas na rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam par gzhag tu med do //
analyzed: de yang mtha' med pas na rnam par gzhag pa yang rnam par gzhag tu med do //
translated: Moreover, since they are infinite, there would be no establishment of them.

original: de ste gzhan du med na ci'i slad du theg pa gsum du bstan zhes pa la drang ba'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: de ste gzhan du med na ci'i slad du theg pa gsum du bstan zhes pa la drang ba'i phyir zhes te /
translated: If they do not exist elsewhere, why are they taught as three vehicles?

original: gsum po nyid kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su zad par byed nus kyi lha la sogs pa'i theg pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bskyil bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsum po nyid kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal yongs su zad par byed nus kyi lha la sogs pa'i theg pas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal bskyil bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The three are able to completely exhaust the suffering of cyclic existence, but the vehicles of gods and so forth do not eliminate the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: tha ma dang / bar ma dang / rab kyi shes rab kyi khyad par gyis theg pa gsum mo //üîΩde bzhin @149a * //
analyzed: tha ma dang / bar ma dang / rab kyi shes rab kyi khyad par gyis theg pa gsum mo // de bzhin @149a * //
translated: The three vehicles are due to the differences in the wisdom of the inferior, middling, and superior.

original: du rnam par grol ba gsum po nyon mongs pa zad pa'i mtshan nyid du drang pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du rnam par grol ba gsum po nyon mongs pa zad pa'i mtshan nyid du drang pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the three liberations are drawn out as having the characteristic of the exhaustion of afflictions.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rim pa bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la'o //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa rim pa bzhin du nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag pa'i sangs rgyas rnams la'o //
translated: The selflessness of persons and phenomena are respectively for the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas.

original: chos la bdag med pa ni theg pa gcig pu nyid do //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ni theg pa gcig pu nyid do //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the single vehicle.

original: der theg pa dang rnam par grol ba khyad par med do //
analyzed: der theg pa dang rnam par grol ba khyad par med do //
translated: There is no difference in vehicle and liberation there.

original: shes rab kyi dbang po shin tu mchog nyid la yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi dbang po shin tu mchog nyid la yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: It exists in the supreme power of wisdom.

original: chos nyid la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir gzhan du bshad pa med do //
analyzed: chos nyid la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir gzhan du bshad pa med do //
translated: Because there is no contradiction in reality, it is not explained otherwise.

original: chos la bdag med pa nyid theg pa chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa nyid theg pa chen po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is the characteristic of the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: rnam par grol ba rnam pa gsum po de dag ni de las 'byung bas na de nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba rnam pa gsum po de dag ni de las 'byung bas na de nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: Since those three types of liberation arise from it, they abide in it.

original: de nas ji ltar na yang 'byung zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa mnyam nyid ye shes zhes pa ste mi gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de nas ji ltar na yang 'byung zhes pa dang / de'i phyir gsungs pa mnyam nyid ye shes zhes pa ste mi gnyis pa'o //
translated: And the answer is: the wisdom of equality.

original: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i mi shes pa ste /
translated: The so-called afflictions are the ignorance of the afflictions.üîΩThe liberation from that is the liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de'i grol ba gang yin pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi grol ba de dag spangs so zhes dgongs pa'i don du chud pa'o zhes de 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i grol ba gang yin pa de nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi grol ba de dag spangs so zhes dgongs pa'i don du chud pa'o zhes de 'di skad ces smras pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the intended implication is that it is said that they are abandoned.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i grol ba des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa'i grol ba de dag spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba med pa'i mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i grol ba des nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi nyon mongs pa'i grol ba de dag spangs pa'o //
translated: The liberation by that wisdom of equality, which is free from the grasping of subject and object, and which abandons the obscurations of the knowable, abandons the liberation of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas from the afflictions.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba ni mi bskyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba ni mi bskyod pa ste /
translated: Distraction is Ak·π£hobhya.

original: de bzhin du pha rol gyi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang g-yo ba dang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa 'das te chos la bdag med par gnas pa mi thob pa'o zhes pa ni mi thob pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol gyi mtshan nyid sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang g-yo ba dang mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa 'das te chos la bdag med par gnas pa mi thob pa'o zhes pa ni mi thob pa dang /
translated: Likewise, having passed beyond the characteristics of the other, such as solidity, fluidity, heat, and mobility, impermanence, suffering, and ugliness, one does not attain the state of abiding in the selflessness of phenomena.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied:

original: nyon mongs bag chags rnams dang 'brel //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs bag chags rnams dang 'brel // zhes pa ste /
translated: They are connected with the latent afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa dang ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa dang ngo //
translated: This is the ignorance of the absence of afflictions.

original: kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas ldang ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas ldang ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas ldang ba'i rgyu bag chags kyi nyon mongs pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: The arising is the latent afflictions that are the cause of arising.

original: tha mar phyin pa de la med //
analyzed: tha mar phyin pa de la med //
translated: They do not exist for one who has gone to the end.

original: ces pa ni nyan thos sam zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi chud pa'i rgyun la bsnyems pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ni nyan thos sam zag pa med pa'i dbyings kyi chud pa'i rgyun la bsnyems pa ste /
translated: This refers to those who are conceited about the stream of the ≈õrƒÅvakas or the realm of the uncontaminated.

original: 'di tsam gyis mthar phyin to zhes gnas la chad pa med do //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis mthar phyin to zhes gnas la chad pa med do //
translated: They think, This is the end, and they stop short of abiding.

original: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu smra ba rnams //
translated: As the proponents of self say,

original: srid chags med pa'i bsam gtan pa //
analyzed: srid chags med pa'i bsam gtan pa //
translated: The meditators who are not attached to existence

original: srid pa'i rtse mor @149b phyin zin kyang //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor @149b phyin zin kyang //
translated: Even though they have reached the peak of existence,

original: nga rgyal lcags kyus drangs nas ni //
analyzed: nga rgyal lcags kyus drangs nas ni //
translated: they are drawn down by the hook of pride

original: sems can dmyal bar yang ltung ngo //
analyzed: sems can dmyal bar yang ltung ngo //
translated: and fall into the hells.

original: zhes par de dag kyang 'khor bar yang mi ltung ngo //
analyzed: zhes par de dag kyang 'khor bar yang mi ltung ngo //
translated: But they do not fall back into cyclic existence.

original: mu stegs ni bsam gtan gyis 'phangs te /
analyzed: mu stegs ni bsam gtan gyis 'phangs te /
translated: The heterodox fall from their meditative concentration,

original: ci tsam du gnas pa de nas shi 'phos te /
analyzed: ci tsam du gnas pa de nas shi 'phos te /
translated: and after living for a long time, they die and fall.

original: yang bdag dang bdag gir 'jig tshogs la lta ba las nyon mongs pa rnams byung nas sems can dmyal ba srid do //
analyzed: yang bdag dang bdag gir 'jig tshogs la lta ba las nyon mongs pa rnams byung nas sems can dmyal ba srid do //
translated: Then, from the view of the transitory aggregates, the afflictions arise, and they fall into the hells.

original: ji ltar skyes bu ra ro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas langs te snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas zhes pa snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu ra ro ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar zag pa med pa'i dbyings nas langs te snying rje'i bag chags kyis bskul nas zhes pa snga ma bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi sku thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Just as a drunkard falls down after rising up, so they fall from the uncontaminated realm, and after rising up through the power of the habitual tendencies of compassion, they attain the Dharma body of the Buddha, as before.

original: yod dang med pa gnyis ka yang //
analyzed: yod dang med pa gnyis ka yang //
translated: Existence and nonexistenceüîΩarise in the sense of being entities,

original: dngos po'i don du 'byung ba dang // gcig rtag du ma'i phyogs bshad pa //
analyzed: dngos po'i don du 'byung ba dang // gcig rtag du ma'i phyogs bshad pa //
translated: and the positions of oneness and permanence are explained.

original: skad cig pa dang 'gro mi mtshungs //
analyzed: skad cig pa dang 'gro mi mtshungs //
translated: The momentariness of the body is not the same as the momentariness of consciousness.

original: gnyis kyi char stong rnam shes tsam //üîΩlang kar gshegs pa'i mdo tshul dang ; / ye shes dpal bzang rig pa yis //
analyzed: gnyis kyi char stong rnam shes tsam // lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo tshul dang ; / ye shes dpal bzang rig pa yis //
translated: The body is empty of both, it is mere consciousness.

original: lus rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The body is of three kinds, and so on.

original: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sku gnyis te /
analyzed: btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams la sku gnyis te /
translated: The noble bodhisattvas have two bodies:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku khong du chud pa'i yid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi sku dang / chos kyi sku khong du chud pa'i yid kyi sku'o //
translated: the mental body of the bliss of meditative concentration, and the mental body of the realization of the Dharma Body.üîΩFrom the first stage onward, the bodhisattvas, having understood the characteristics of the stages, attain the mental body of the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: sa dang po nas gong nas gong du sa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes nas rnal 'byor can rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi
analyzed: sa dang po nas gong nas gong du sa'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes nas rnal 'byor can rnams kyis thob par 'gyur ba ni byang chub sems dpa'i sa dang por sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs nas don dam pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi
translated: Having completed the accumulation of the perfection of generosity on the first bodhisattva stage, the ultimate meditative concentration

original: bde ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dga' ba nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu dga' ba nye bar skye'o //
translated: gives rise to the characteristic of bliss, the Joyful.

original: de'i tshe 'khor ba las log par gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye bar gyur pa dang / de la 'tsho ba'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mang du thos pas nga dang 'dra ba 'jig rten du med na lhag pa lta ga la zhig snyam nas 'jigs pa med pas 'khor du spa gong ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'khor ba las log par gyur nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i rigs su skye bar gyur pa dang / de la 'tsho ba'i 'jigs pa med pa dang / mang du thos pas nga dang 'dra ba 'jig rten du med na lhag pa lta ga la zhig snyam nas 'jigs pa med pas 'khor du spa gong ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He has no fear of livelihood, and since he is learned, he thinks, ‚ÄúThere is no one in the world like me, much less anyone superior,‚Äù and so he is fearless and has no anxiety in the assembly.

original: sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / zhing brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / lus brgya ston par byed do //üîΩde de lta bur /
analyzed: sangs rgyas brgya mthong ba dang / zhing brgya g-yo bar byed pa dang / lus brgya ston par byed do // de de lta bur /
translated: He sees a hundred Buddhas and causes a hundred worlds to shake, and manifests a hundred of his own bodies.üîΩHe has mastery in aspiration,

original: tshe dang las dang yo byad mos //
analyzed: tshe dang las dang yo byad mos //
translated: Karma, and equipment,üîΩin prayer, in miracles, in birth,

original: smon lam rdzu 'phrul skye dbang dang // chos sems de bzhin @150a * //üîΩye shes mchog //
analyzed: smon lam rdzu 'phrul skye dbang dang // chos sems de bzhin @150a * // ye shes mchog //
translated: in minding the Dharma, and in intuition.

original: dpa' bo dbang bcu 'di dag thob //
analyzed: dpa' bo dbang bcu 'di dag thob //
translated: The hero attains these ten masteries.

original: chos dang sems dang ye shes chen po ni dang po dang gong ma'i sa khyad par du dbye ba ni 'phel lo //
analyzed: chos dang sems dang ye shes chen po ni dang po dang gong ma'i sa khyad par du dbye ba ni 'phel lo //
translated: The Dharma, the mind, and the great intuition are distinguished in the higher stages, and they increase.

original: tshe dang las dang yo byad la sogs pa'i dbang rnams kyis dang por 'khor ba'i skye bo las bye brag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe dang las dang yo byad la sogs pa'i dbang rnams kyis dang por 'khor ba'i skye bo las bye brag par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the powers of life, karma, and requisites, etc., one first becomes a person in cyclic existence.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'thob pas chos khong du chud pa ni thams cad du yod mod kyi rab tu dga' ba la sbyin pas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i phyir btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can dang 'dres par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bde ba 'thob pas chos khong du chud pa ni thams cad du yod mod kyi rab tu dga' ba la sbyin pas rab tu dga' bar gyur pa'i phyir btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can dang 'dres par thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par
translated: One who has understood reality by attaining the bliss of meditative concentration is everywhere, but the bodhisattva who is foremost in virtue is considered by the Omniscient One to be mixed with sentient beings on the stage of the joyous, because he is joyous through generosity.

original: brtag go // sa gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la sogs par chos khong du chud pa nyid de sems can dang 'dres pa med par brtag go //
analyzed: brtag go // sa gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la sogs par chos khong du chud pa nyid de sems can dang 'dres pa med par brtag go //
translated: One who has understood reality on the third, fourth, and fifth stages, etc., is considered not to be mixed with sentient beings.

original: sa gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la rang gi sems rnam pa mang po dben par spyod pas sems kyi rgya mtsho las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyi mtshan nyid bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med
analyzed: sa gsum dang bzhi dang lnga la rang gi sems rnam pa mang po dben par spyod pas sems kyi rgya mtsho las 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rlabs kyi mtshan nyid bde ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid kyi lus ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med
translated: On the third, fourth, and fifth levels, the bodhisattva practices with his mind in many ways, and so he attains the mental body that enters the ocean of minds, which is characterized by waves of engaging consciousnesses that are blissful.

original: pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
analyzed: pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis thob pa dang po dang gnyis pa la sogs pa yang yod mod kyi /
translated: This mental body is attained through the samadhi of the nonexistence of the personal and phenomenal selves.

original: der sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyis sems can sdud par byed pas na sems can gyi don gyi phyir btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' la rag par mnyam par 'jog pa med do //
analyzed: der sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyis sems can sdud par byed pas na sems can gyi don gyi phyir btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' la rag par mnyam par 'jog pa med do //
translated: However, on the first and second levels, the bodhisattva does not enter meditative equipoise, because he is gathering sentient beings through generosity and morality for the sake of sentient beings.

original: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang sa lngar yang sems can gyi don la 'grus pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal la mngon par shes pas rtog go //
analyzed: gsum pa dang / bzhi pa dang sa lngar yang sems can gyi don la 'grus pas sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang / bag la nyal la mngon par shes pas rtog go //
translated: On the third, fourth, and fifth levels, the bodhisattva is diligent in the welfare of sentient beings, and so he investigates the thoughts and latent propensities of sentient beings through his higher perceptions.

original: bdud 'tshe ba'i rigs can rnams la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs kyang kyal ka byed par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: bdud 'tshe ba'i rigs can rnams la sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyis phan 'dogs kyang kyal ka byed par 'gyur ro ;
translated: and to the demons who are the class of harm-doers, giving and benefiting through morality, but they will act perversely.

original: / gang gis 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: / gang gis 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: bdud 'tshe ba'i rigs can gyis thos te gtse bar yang mi byed pas na mngon par shes pa thob pas sems can gyi don byed pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bdud 'tshe ba'i rigs can gyis thos te gtse bar yang mi byed pas na mngon par shes pa thob pas sems can gyi don byed pa'o zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe demons who are the class of harm-doers do not hear of it, and so do not harm it. Having attained the superknowledges, it works for the welfare of living beings.‚Äù

original: de nas mngon par shes pa bskyed pas chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed nus so //
analyzed: de nas mngon par shes pa bskyed pas chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i thabs rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed nus so //
translated: Then, having generated the superknowledges, it is able to work for the welfare of others through the means of giving Dharma and material gifts and so forth.

original: de'i phyir sa gsum dang bzhi dang / lnga la sogs pa btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par shes pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sa gsum dang bzhi dang / lnga la sogs pa btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams mngon par shes pa skyed par byed de /
translated: Therefore, the bodhisattvas who are the chief of the third, fourth, fifth, and so forth, generate the superknowledges.

original: de ltar na de dag gis sems gzhan gyi don las 'pho ba @150b med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag gis sems gzhan gyi don las 'pho ba @150b med par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, they do not turn their minds away from the welfare of others.

original: chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po'i khyad par gyis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas skad cig mar 'jig pa yongs su shes par bya'i bye brag ni nyan thos dang thun mong ngo //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / bar ma dang / chen po'i khyad par gyis chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes nas skad cig mar 'jig pa yongs su shes par bya'i bye brag ni nyan thos dang thun mong ngo //
translated: The differences are small, medium, and great. The specific knowledge is shared with the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni sa drug tu mchog tu mi g-yo /üîΩbdun por na phyi rol gyi don /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa yongs su shes pa ni sa drug tu mchog tu mi g-yo / bdun por na phyi rol gyi don /
translated: The knowledge of the selflessness of phenomena is on the six stages.

original: med par yongs su shes pa yis //
analyzed: med par yongs su shes pa yis //
translated: On the seventh stage, the knowledge of the nonexistence of external objectsüîΩis fully known.

original: gnyis kyi tshul spros mi gnyis kyis //
analyzed: gnyis kyi tshul spros mi gnyis kyis //
translated: By the nonduality of the mode of the two,

original: yang dag rig par kun rig gyur //
analyzed: yang dag rig par kun rig gyur //
translated: one is fully aware of the correct knowledge.

original: mang du thos pas su la'ang med //
analyzed: mang du thos pas su la'ang med //
translated: There is no one with much learning.

original: thos kyang shes rab ldan pa med //
analyzed: thos kyang shes rab ldan pa med //
translated: Even if there is, there is no one with wisdom.

original: sems ni skyo ba zad pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sems ni skyo ba zad pa'i phyir //
translated: The mind is not discouraged.

original: des na 'khrug pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: des na 'khrug pa med par 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, there is no agitation.
