original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa slob dpon mang du thos pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gnyis par ni bstod pa zab mo dang / gnyis su med par gsol ba brgya dang de'i bka' lan brgya dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes pa dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa slob dpon mang du thos pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gnyis par ni bstod pa zab mo dang / gnyis su med par gsol ba brgya dang de'i bka' lan brgya dang / kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su shes pa dang /
translated: The second chapter of the master Abhaya's commentary on the noble Journey to Lanka explains the profound praise, the one hundred nondual prayers, and the one hundred replies to them, the thorough understanding of the foundation consciousness,

original: stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dpyad pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dpyad pa dang / sgra'i don brtags pa yongs su shes pa dang / rtsod pa'i gnas thor bu dpyad pa mang po dang / le'u phran dgu ste le'u gnyis pa yang rdzogs so /
analyzed: stong pa nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying po dpyad pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dpyad pa dang / sgra'i don brtags pa yongs su shes pa dang / rtsod pa'i gnas thor bu dpyad pa mang po dang / le'u phran dgu ste le'u gnyis pa yang rdzogs so /
translated: the presentation of emptiness, the analysis of the tathiigatagarbha, the analysis of cause and effect, the thorough understanding of the analysis of the meaning of words, the many analyses of the miscellaneous topics of debate, and the nine short chapters.

original: // / da ni le'u gsum par ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i yid kyi sku sgrub pa ste phyi rol gyi don med pas na snang ba'i rang bzhin du ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: // / da ni le'u gsum par ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i yid kyi sku sgrub pa ste phyi rol gyi don med pas na snang ba'i rang bzhin du ston par mdzad do //
translated: Now, in the third chapter, the mental body that arises from samadhi is taught to be the nature of appearances because external objects do not exist.

original: sbom po dang phra ba'i yul rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid yin pas yang dag par rig par snang ba'i chos nyid kyis de thams cad du yod do //
analyzed: sbom po dang phra ba'i yul rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid yin pas yang dag par rig par snang ba'i chos nyid kyis de thams cad du yod do //
translated: When the coarse and subtle objects are broken down, they are empty like a house, a village, a forest, and so on. Therefore, by the nature of the appearance of correct knowledge, all of that exists.

original: gang gi tshe na de lta bur yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na de lta bur yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it exists in that way,

original: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
analyzed: rdul gcig steng na rdul snyed zhing rnams te //
translated: as many realms as there are atoms in one atom,

original: zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams //
analyzed: zhing der bsam gyis mi khyab sangs rgyas rnams //
translated: in those realms, inconceivable buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus nas bzhugs pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas sras kyi dbus nas bzhugs pa la //
translated: in the midst of the sons of the buddhas,

original: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi //
analyzed: byang chub spyad pa spyod cing blta bar bgyi //
translated: while practicing the conduct of enlightenment, I will behold them.

original: zhes bya ba des 'di 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba des 'di 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is what arises from that.

original: de ltar phyogs rnams ma lus thams cad du //
analyzed: de ltar phyogs rnams ma lus thams cad du //
translated: In that way, in all the directions without exception,

original: skra tsam khyon la dus gsum tshad snyed kyi //
analyzed: skra tsam khyon la dus gsum tshad snyed kyi //
translated: in the space of a hair tip, for as many eons as there are in the three times,

original: sangs rgyas @151a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas @151a * //
translated: the ocean of buddhas,

original: rgya mtsho zhing rnams rgya mtsho dang / bskal pa rgya mtshor spyod cing rab tu 'jug //
analyzed: rgya mtsho zhing rnams rgya mtsho dang / bskal pa rgya mtshor spyod cing rab tu 'jug //
translated: the ocean of realms, and the ocean of kalpas, I will engage in conduct.

original: ces pa yid kyi sku rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du gar yang thogs pa med do //
analyzed: ces pa yid kyi sku rnams ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzhin du gar yang thogs pa med do //
translated: The mental bodies of the Buddhas are like the mental consciousness, for they are not impeded anywhere.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yid ltar myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis yid ltar myur ba'i ting nge 'dzin brnyes pa ste /
translated: The Buddhas, the Lords, and the principal Bodhisattvas have acquired the concentration which is as swift as thought.

original: de ltar na rdul gcig gi cha la yang thams cad du skad cig tu snang ba ni gzugs brnyan bzhin du dus gsum du snang ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na rdul gcig gi cha la yang thams cad du skad cig tu snang ba ni gzugs brnyan bzhin du dus gsum du snang ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: Thus, in a single atom, all things appear in an instant, like reflections, by the manner of the appearance of the three times.

original: ji ltar snod chung ngu'i chu'i nang du grong dang kun dga' ra ba dang / gzhal med khang dang / ri dang nam mkha'i steng gi skar ma'i tshogs mang po snang ba de ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar snod chung ngu'i chu'i nang du grong dang kun dga' ra ba dang / gzhal med khang dang / ri dang nam mkha'i steng gi skar ma'i tshogs mang po snang ba de ltar /
translated: Just as in a small vessel there appears the reflection of the city, the garden, the palace, the mountain, the sky, the multitude of stars,

original: nyag ma gcig khyon sangs rgyas mang po rnams //
analyzed: nyag ma gcig khyon sangs rgyas mang po rnams //
translated: so, in the space of a single atom, there appear the many Buddhas,

original: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed par //
analyzed: gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma ji snyed par //
translated: as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: zhing yang de snyed rgyal ba de dag gi / de dag tha dad mtshan nyid tha dad cha //
analyzed: zhing yang de snyed rgyal ba de dag gi / de dag tha dad mtshan nyid tha dad cha //
translated: each having his own Buddha-field, his own name, his own body, his own duration of life.

original: gzugs med pa'i chos rnams ni phyogs su mi gnas te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i chos rnams ni phyogs su mi gnas te /
translated: The formless dharmas do not abide in a direction.

original: chud pa de dag la phyogs su gnas par nges pa med do //
analyzed: chud pa de dag la phyogs su gnas par nges pa med do //
translated: There is no certainty that they abide in a direction, because they are included in that.

original: der snang ba yang de nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der snang ba yang de nyid kyi nang du gtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The appearance there is included in that itself.

original: chud pa'i chos nyid ni de lta bu'o //
analyzed: chud pa'i chos nyid ni de lta bu'o //
translated: The reality of the included dharmas is like that.

original: rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i rdzas la sogs pa'i gzugs can par gzhan gyis kun brtags pa ni rnam par dbye ba na stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rdul phra mo las brtsams pa'i rdzas la sogs pa'i gzugs can par gzhan gyis kun brtags pa ni rnam par dbye ba na stong pa nyid do //
translated: The substantial forms and so on imagined by others, beginning with the subtle particle, are empty when analyzed.

original: tshon gyis btsos pa dang ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tshon gyis btsos pa dang ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang / ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa'i rim pas phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a house, an army, a forest, and so on, when divided by the sequence of the cooked and uncooked, the shaken and unshaken, the covered and uncovered, and so on.

original: so sor gnas pa rnams kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: so sor gnas pa rnams kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
translated: The individual abiders are also empty like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: de de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi bsam gtan dang byung ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pas mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid du sgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de de ltar gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa'i 'du byed thams cad kyi bsam gtan dang byung ba rnams thams cad mkhyen pas mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid du sgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: Thus, the Omniscient One establishes all the meditative stabilities and occurrences of formations, which are empty of duality, in the nondual reality.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen po la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: Then, the Lord said to the bodhisattva mahƒÅsattva MahƒÅmati:

original: blo gros chen po yid kyi lus rtogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan gyi nyon cig / blo gros chen po yid kyi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par bsgom mo //
analyzed: blo gros chen po yid kyi lus rtogs pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid bstan gyi nyon cig / blo gros chen po yid kyi phyir byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun nyan thos dang thun mong ma yin par bsgom mo //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, listen! The characteristics of the distinctions of the realization of the mental body will be taught. MahƒÅmati, for the sake of the mental body, the bodhisattvas cultivate the uncommon thirty-seven factors of enlightenment.

original: sa de @151b dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang ye shes rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'jungs pa dang /
analyzed: sa de @151b dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgrib pa yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab dang / thabs dang / stobs dang / smon lam dang ye shes rnams kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'jungs pa dang /
translated: The obscurations that are the counteragents to those levels are the counteragents to generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, wisdom, skillful means, power, aspiration, and knowledge.

original: ngang tshul ngan pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa dang / thabs med pa dang / mi smon pa dang / mthu med pa dang / yongs su shes pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug par ro //
analyzed: ngang tshul ngan pa dang / mi bzod pa dang / le lo dang / g-yeng ba dang / ma rig pa dang / thabs med pa dang / mi smon pa dang / mthu med pa dang / yongs su shes pa med pa dang / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa nas thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi mthar thug par ro //
translated: They are stinginess, immorality, impatience, laziness, distraction, ignorance, lack of skillful means, lack of aspiration, lack of power, and lack of complete knowledge, from the perfection of generosity up to the knowledge of an omniscient one.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad du ni chos khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad du ni chos khong du chud pas zhes bya ba ni khyad par du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas on the eighth level are said to have mastered phenomena.

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The first seven levels are the mind.

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the absence of appearances.

original: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //
translated: The first two stages are the abode,

original: lhag ma sa ni nga nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: lhag ma sa ni nga nyid kyi'o //
translated: and the remaining stages are mine.

original: der btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sgyu ma lta bur te /
analyzed: der btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sgyu ma lta bur te /
translated: There, the bodhisattvas, the chief of the holy ones, understand dependent origination to be like an illusion,

original: skye ba med par ni sa brgyad du thugs su chud do //
analyzed: skye ba med par ni sa brgyad du thugs su chud do //
translated: and on the eighth stage they understand it to be unborn.

original: sa bdun gyi dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa yod par chags te 'jug pa ni ji ltar lang kar gshegs pa 'di nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: sa bdun gyi dbang po rnams ni rnam par shes pa yod par chags te 'jug pa ni ji ltar lang kar gshegs pa 'di nyid du thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: The faculties of the seven stages are engaged in the attachment to consciousness, as the Omniscient One has said in the Lankavatara:

original: phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po bsal nas su //
translated: Having eliminated external things,

original: shes pa tsam du 'jug pa ste //
analyzed: shes pa tsam du 'jug pa ste //
translated: one enters into consciousness only.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan du //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: taught by me and others.

original: dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin kyang /üîΩdngos po med dang dngos med min //
analyzed: dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin kyang / dngos po med dang dngos med min //
translated: The samadhi of the middle wayüîΩis neither existent nor nonexistent,

original: yod dang med pa mi dmigs pa //
analyzed: yod dang med pa mi dmigs pa //
translated: neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
analyzed: 'di ni dbu ma'i nan tan te //
translated: This is the practice of the middle way

original: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nga dang gzhan gyis bstan pa'o //
translated: taught by me and others.

original: zhes so // gang na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs pa rnams dang / sa bdun du phyin pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so // gang na nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs pa rnams dang / sa bdun du phyin pa rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the domain of the hearers, solitary buddhas, tƒ´rthikas, or those who have reached the seventh bh≈´mi.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba sgyu ma lta bur mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong pa dang / bar du rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong par mnyam par rtogs shing /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba sgyu ma lta bur mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid dang thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong pa dang / bar du rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong par mnyam par rtogs shing /
translated: It is realized to be the same in terms of the characteristic of non-arising, like an illusion, which is the emptiness of the extremes of beginning and end, and in terms of the middle, which is empty of the two types of nature.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du shes so //
translated: It is understood to be like a dream, an optical illusion, a reflection, and so on.

original: 'jig rten mthong yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ltar mi mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten mthong yang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ltar mi mthong ste /
translated: Although the world is seen, it is not seen in that way, in a manner of non-observation.

original: bsam pa med cing @152a * //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing @152a * //
translated: It is without thought,

original: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
translated: without appearance, the ultimate truth, free from the concepts of things and nonthings, and nondual.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi snying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de lta bu las sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir gleng ngo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi snying rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de lta bu las sems can gyi don byed pa'i phyir gleng ngo //
translated: The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, arouse the latent tendencies of compassion and, in order to benefit sentient beings, they emerge from that concentration which is free from thought and appearance.

original: des sad pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin sa brgyad du khong du chud pas snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ni yid kyi sku ste /
analyzed: des sad pa dang chos kyi rang bzhin sa brgyad du khong du chud pas snang ba dang bcas pa dag pa 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa ni yid kyi sku ste /
translated: When they awaken, they abide in the pure worldly concentration, which is endowed with appearance, by comprehending the eight stages of the dharmadhƒÅtu.

original: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang 'dra ba 'jig rten thams cad du khyab pa rdul gyi char yang snang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa dang 'dra ba 'jig rten thams cad du khyab pa rdul gyi char yang snang ngo //
translated: The mind-made body appears in all worlds like a reflection and so forth, and even as atoms it pervades the elements and the derivatives of the elements.

original: sbom po dang phra mo snang ba 'byed pas sems can rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par snod ji bzhin par khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo snang ba 'byed pas sems can rnams la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par snod ji bzhin par khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: It appears as coarse and subtle, and in order to make sentient beings understand impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness, it manifests in accordance with the vessel.

original: des chos ston to //
analyzed: des chos ston to //
translated: It teaches the Dharma.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir zhes pa ni chud pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nang du song bar snang bas na yid kyi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid rtogs par khong du chud pa'i phyir zhes pa ni chud pa'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid kyi nang du song bar snang bas na yid kyi zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is the realization of the essence of the Dharma. The essence of the Dharma that is realized appears to have entered into it, therefore it is called mental.

original: ris su lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du byed kyi lus zhes bya ba la lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba ni lhun gyis grub par rgyu ba dang gis ro gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ris su lhan cig skyes pa'i 'du byed kyi lus zhes bya ba la lhan cig tu skyes pa'i 'du byed ces bya ba ni lhun gyis grub par rgyu ba dang gis ro gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: The body of co-arisen formations in the realm means that the co-arisen formations become of one taste through spontaneous movement.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag par mnyam par 'jog ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rtag par mnyam par 'jog ces bya'o //
translated: For this reason, the Blessed Buddhas are said to always be in meditative equipoise.

original: ris ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: ris ni nges pa ste /
translated: The realm is definite.

original: gang gi phyir des thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyid kyi ma 'dres pa'i sku ni yid kyi sku'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des thams cad mkhyen pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams nyid kyi ma 'dres pa'i sku ni yid kyi sku'o //
translated: For this reason, the unshared body of the omniscient Blessed Buddhas themselves is the mental body.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis thams cad du khyab cing sems can thams cad kyi don du zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams kyis thams cad du khyab cing sems can thams cad kyi don du zhugs pa'o //
translated: The omniscient ones pervade everywhere and engage for the benefit of all sentient beings.

original: rnal 'byor thams cad kyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis 'jig rten mtha' dag gi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor thams cad kyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis 'jig rten mtha' dag gi bsam pa rangs par mdzad pa /
translated: The Lord of all yogis, by the magical display of various forms, satisfies the thoughts of all worlds.

original: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: He is utterly pure, free from desire.

original: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag rtsa ba rnams bton pa'i ye shes kyi me dang ldan pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i sgrib pa mtha' dag rtsa ba rnams bton pa'i ye shes kyi me dang ldan pa'i sku ste /
translated: He is the body endowed with the fire of wisdom that has uprooted all the afflictions along with their traces and obscurations.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis chud pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyis chud pa nyid de /
translated: That is the Tathagata himself,

original: 'dod chags la @152b sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la @152b sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has abandoned the afflictions such as desire.

original: ji ltar chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs su rnam par gnas par nges par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du yid kyi sku thams cad du song ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chud pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyogs su rnam par gnas par nges par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du yid kyi sku thams cad du song ba'o //
translated: Just as all that is poured is not certain to remain in the place of the all-knowing, in the same way, the mental body goes everywhere.

original: theg chen nga yi theg ma yin //
analyzed: theg chen nga yi theg ma yin //
translated: The Mahayana is not my vehicle.

original: yi ge med cing sgra yang med //
analyzed: yi ge med cing sgra yang med //
translated: It has no letters and no sound.

original: bden pa med cing rnam thar med //
analyzed: bden pa med cing rnam thar med //
translated: It has no truth and no liberation.

original: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul min //
analyzed: snang ba med pa'i spyod yul min //
translated: It is not the domain of the non-apparent.

original: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ste //
analyzed: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ste //
translated: But the Great Vehicle is the vehicle of the universal vehicle.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed cing //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed cing //
translated: It is the mastery of concentration,

original: yid kyi lus ni sna tshogs la //
analyzed: yid kyi lus ni sna tshogs la //
translated: the various bodies of mind,

original: dbang gi me tog dag gis brgyan //üîΩzhes te theg pa de ni phyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang gi me tog dag gis brgyan // zhes te theg pa de ni phyin par byed pa ste /
translated: adorned with the flowers of the powers.üîΩThe word yƒÅna means that by which one goes.

original: 'gro bar byed pas na theg pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pas na theg pa'o //
translated: It is a vehicle because it causes one to go.

original: chen po ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par ma dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: chen po ni byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel par ma dgongs pa'o //
translated: The word mahƒÅ means that the agent and the action are not conceived as different.

original: sgra ni chud par byed pa'i gdangs te /
analyzed: sgra ni chud par byed pa'i gdangs te /
translated: Sound is the resonance of the articulation.

original: de'i yan lag ni yi ge rnams te /
analyzed: de'i yan lag ni yi ge rnams te /
translated: Its parts are the letters.

original: tshig gi don gyi mtshan ma yin pas na de dag de lta bur so sor nges pa'i sgra dang / don gyi don med pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyis don dam pa brjod pa med do //
analyzed: tshig gi don gyi mtshan ma yin pas na de dag de lta bur so sor nges pa'i sgra dang / don gyi don med pa'i phyir sgra rnams kyis don dam pa brjod pa med do //
translated: Since they are the signs of the meaning of the words, the sounds are not applied to the ultimate, since they are not ascertained in that way, and since they have no meaning.

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ni spyir btags pa'i don la sgro btags te 'jug pa'i phyir bsam pa med cing /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs rnams ni spyir btags pa'i don la sgro btags te 'jug pa'i phyir bsam pa med cing /
translated: The collections of names, words, and letters are not intentional, because they are applied to the object of designation in general.

original: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par brjod du med pa de ni theg pa chen por dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par brjod du med pa de ni theg pa chen por dgongs pa'o //
translated: The non-appearance of the ultimate truth, which is inexpressible, is said to be the intention of the Great Vehicle.

original: 'phags pa nyan thos de rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yang phyi'i don du mngon par chags te 'jug pas na gnyis su med pa'i theg pa chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa nyan thos de rnams kyi sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa yang phyi'i don du mngon par chags te 'jug pas na gnyis su med pa'i theg pa chen po ma yin no //
translated: The noble ≈õrƒÅvakas are attached to external objects and engage with the truths of suffering, etc. Therefore, it is not the non-dual Great Vehicle.

original: rnam par thar pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi ste /
translated: Liberation is for the ≈õrƒÅvakas.

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pa rdul phra mo'i bar du skad cig pa tha dad par zhugs pa pha rol gyi don sbom po mi rtag pa'i dmigs pa de lta bu ni theg pa chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pa rdul phra mo'i bar du skad cig pa tha dad par zhugs pa pha rol gyi don sbom po mi rtag pa'i dmigs pa de lta bu ni theg pa chen po ma yin no //
translated: The characteristics of emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness, which are engaged in up to the level of subtle particles as momentary, are not the Great Vehicle, which has the observation of impermanence as a coarse object for the sake of others.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into particles.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Particles are without parts.

original: zhes pa theg pa chen po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhes pa theg pa chen po'i khyad par ro //
translated: This is the distinction of the Great Vehicle.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam par thar pa rnams ni /
translated: The doors to liberation, such as emptiness,

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: are not external things.

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: The mind appears in two aspects.

original: zhes te gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: zhes te gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When one examines with wisdom,

original: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩdes na / snang ba med pa'i spyod @153a * //
analyzed: shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo mi dmigs pa'o // des na / snang ba med pa'i spyod @153a * //
translated: the coarse and subtle objects of knowledge are not observed.

original: yul min // zhes te /
analyzed: yul min // zhes te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the domain of the non-apparent.

original: snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa don dam pa'i bden pa theg pa chen po la dmigs pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa don dam pa'i bden pa theg pa chen po la dmigs pa med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One intended that the non-apparent non-dual perfect wisdom, ultimate truth, does not focus on the Great Vehicle.

original: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ste //
analyzed: 'on kyang theg chen theg pa ste //
translated: However, the Great Vehicle is the vehicle

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed cing //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang byed cing //
translated: that controls meditative concentration,

original: yid kyi lus ni sna tshogs la //
analyzed: yid kyi lus ni sna tshogs la //
translated: and the various mental bodies

original: dbang gi me tog dag gis brgyan //
analyzed: dbang gi me tog dag gis brgyan //
translated: are adorned with the flowers of power.

original: zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa na yid kyi lus te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la zhugs te sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad pa na yid kyi lus te /
translated: When the Omniscient One enters meditative concentration with appearances and acts for the benefit of all sentient beings, it is the mental body.

original: des na theg pa chen po che bas yid mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhin du thams cad du 'gro bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na theg pa chen po che bas yid mgyogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin bzhin du thams cad du 'gro bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Great Vehicle is considered to be all-pervading, like the concentration called ‚Äúswift thought.‚Äù

original: dbang ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas sgrib pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas kho na nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ni sgrib pa thams cad spangs nas sgrib pa med pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas kho na nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'o //
translated: Power is the understanding of all things by the Buddha, the Omniscient One, who, having abandoned all obscurations, is free from obscurations, because he has abandoned the afflictions along with their traces.

original: de ni sgrib pa gsum spong ste //
analyzed: de ni sgrib pa gsum spong ste //
translated: He abandons the three obscurations.

original: shes bya dang / nyon rmongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa gsum ni thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad du thams cad spang ngo //
analyzed: shes bya dang / nyon rmongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa gsum ni thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad du thams cad spang ngo //
translated: The three obscurations are the obscuration of the knowable, the afflictive obscuration, and the obscuration of the karma that is to be known. The Omniscient One abandons them all, in every way.

original: de ltar na mig gi ling tog dang bral ba'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba thams cad du 'jug pas thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mig gi ling tog dang bral ba'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba thams cad du 'jug pas thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Thus, the wisdom of the Buddha, free from the cataracts of the eye, is the omniscience of the Omniscient One, because it engages all objects of knowledge.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa na nye bar gyur pa yang mi shes so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa na nye bar gyur pa yang mi shes so //
translated: When one is obscured by the obscurations of attachment and so on, one does not even know what is near.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong bas thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa spong bas thams cad mkhyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one becomes omniscient by abandoning the obscurations of passion and so on.

original: de'i rdzogs pa'i dbang ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa'i mthu dang / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de la mnga'o //üîΩtshigs su bcad pa'i don lhag par bshad par bya ba na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid pha rol gyi bar sgro btags pa ni rang gi sems snang ba nyid du khong du chud pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de'i rdzogs pa'i dbang ni rnal 'byor gyi dbang dang / sems can thams cad la phan pa'i mthu dang / dpag tu med pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa de la mnga'o // tshigs su bcad pa'i don lhag par bshad par bya ba na rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid pha rol gyi bar sgro btags pa ni rang gi sems snang ba nyid du khong du chud pa rnams la stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: The power of its completion is the power of yoga, the power to benefit all sentient beings, and the power of the assembly of immeasurable qualities such as the ten powers and the four forms of fearlessness.üîΩWhen the meaning of the verses is to be explained in detail, the superimposition of the characteristics of self and other is the three doors of liberation: emptiness, signlessness, and

original: smon pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
translated: wishlessness for those who understand that appearances are only one's own mind.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis gong nas gong du yid kyi sku rnam par phye ba dpyad pa dang po'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis gong nas gong du yid kyi sku rnam par phye ba dpyad pa dang po'o /
translated: mental body in terms of the distinctions of the levels and meditative concentrations.

original: // / su zhig @153b gis mtshams med pa zhig byas te /
analyzed: // / su zhig @153b gis mtshams med pa zhig byas te /
translated: Someone who has committed a heinous crimeüîΩand has not performed the three kinds of virtue of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and perfect buddhas, in order to clear away his or her

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba gsum gyi dge ba mi byed pa la de'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi rnam par grol ba gsum gyi dge ba mi byed pa la de'i 'gyod pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: remorse,üîΩhaving emanated in the form of a ≈õrƒÅvaka, and so on, through the

original: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs su sprul pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis mtshams med pa byas pas dge ba spyad de /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa'i gzugs su sprul pa byas nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i byin gyi rlabs kyis mtshams med pa byas pas dge ba spyad de /
translated: blessing of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, having performed virtue,

original: bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog cing cho 'phrul byed do zhes de ltar mthong nas gzhan gyis kyang 'gyod pa spangs te dge ba la 'jug go zhes bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: bsam gtan la mnyam par 'jog cing cho 'phrul byed do zhes de ltar mthong nas gzhan gyis kyang 'gyod pa spangs te dge ba la 'jug go zhes bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: Having seen it thus, others also abandon regret and engage in virtue. This is the summarized meaning.

original: brtson pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa bor ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa med pa'o //
translated: Abandoning striving means being inactive.

original: rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa ni gang zag la bdag med pas 'pho'o //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bdag dang bdag gir mngon par chags pa ni gang zag la bdag med pas 'pho'o //
translated: Attachment to permanence, self, and mine is overcome by the selflessness of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pas 'dzin pa dang gzung ba 'pho'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa khong du chud pas phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pas 'dzin pa dang gzung ba 'pho'o //
translated: Grasping subject and object is overcome by understanding the selflessness of phenomena and not being attached to external objects.

original: kha cig la ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid khong du chud pas theg pa gsum spyi la'o zhes so //
analyzed: kha cig la ni mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid khong du chud pas theg pa gsum spyi la'o zhes so //
translated: For some, it is by understanding the non-dual nature, in the general sense of the three vehicles.

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i chos nyid la sgra mi 'jug pas na de bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi nub mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya nga las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i bar du yi ge gcig kyang maüîΩbshad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i chos nyid la sgra mi 'jug pas na de bcom ldan 'das kyis gang gi nub mo mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas gang gi nub mo yongs su mya nga las 'das par 'gyur bas de'i bar du yi ge gcig kyang ma bshad ces gsungs so //
translated: Since the reality that is the object of individual knowledge is not expressed by words, the Lord said, ‚ÄúBetween the night when I fully awakened to supreme awakening and the night when I will pass into parinirvƒÅ·πáa, not a single syllable has been uttered by me.‚Äù

original: tshig med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig go zhes bya ba ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa tshig gis ston mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig med pa ni sangs rgyas kyi tshig go zhes bya ba ni bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa tshig gis ston mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe absence of words is the word of the Buddha‚Äù means that the ultimate truth, which is the nondual perfect realization that is free of thought and appearance, cannot be taught by words.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la spyir sgro btags pa 'ba' zhig gis chas bstan par 'jug go //üîΩsangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi spyi'i yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la spyir sgro btags pa 'ba' zhig gis chas bstan par 'jug go // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad la sangs rgyas kyi spyi'i yin te /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúonly by the superimposition of a general characteristic onto the particular characteristic‚Äù means that the particular characteristic is not taught by words.

original: des na chos de kho na nyid gcig gis gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos de kho na nyid gcig gis gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The particular characteristic is the object of individual knowledge.üîΩThe general characteristic is the object of knowledge that is common to many.

original: dgongs te gsungs pa ni thams cad la bsdus pa'i don du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs pa ni thams cad la bsdus pa'i don du shes par bya'o //
translated: The teaching with an ulterior purpose should be understood as the interpretable meaning.

original: da ni yod pa dang med pa dpyad pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yod pa dang med pa dpyad pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Now, the analysis of existence and non-existence will be begun.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pa'i phyir byed pa dang byed pa po la mngon par chags pa ni brjod pa dang / brjod pa'i tha snyad la goms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam du khong du ma chud pa'i phyir byed pa dang byed pa po la mngon par chags pa ni brjod pa dang / brjod pa'i tha snyad la goms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of not having understood that it is mere representation of one‚Äôs own mind, one is attached to the agent and action, because of being accustomed to the conventions of expression and the expressed.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad du 'jug gi /üîΩnam @154a * //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la ni yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i tha snyad du 'jug gi / nam @154a * //
translated: In the consciousness that is the discrimination of duality, the conventions of the discrimination of existence and non-existence are engaged.

original: shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig pa ni mi dmigs pas des na dngos po dang dngos po med par kun brtags pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad mi 'jug pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyis dpyad de shes par bya ba sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhig pa ni mi dmigs pas des na dngos po dang dngos po med par kun brtags pa gnyis kyi rnam pa'i tha snyad thams cad mi 'jug pas bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'o //
translated: But when one has analyzed with wisdom, and has understood that the coarse and subtle discriminations are destroyed, one does not perceive them. Therefore, all the conventions of the two aspects of the imagined, entity and non-entity, are not engaged, and so there is no thought and no appearance.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The ultimate truth is the sole object of the knowledge of the perfected being.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang pos sprul pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na sems can
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de mchog tu yongs su dag pa 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi dbang pos sprul pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na sems can
translated: Awakened by the traces of compassion, the Buddha, who is supremely pure, free from desire, and endowed with the organ of the various forms of emanation, resides in the concentration of the pure worldly knowledge.

original: gyi don du gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i tshul mang por chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gyi don du gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i tshul mang por chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: For the benefit of beings, he manifests many times in the manner of the non-dual and the dual and preaches the Dharma.

original: de ltar na grangs can rnams kyis rgyu thams cad yod pas de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'chad do //
analyzed: de ltar na grangs can rnams kyis rgyu thams cad yod pas de dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bu 'chad do //
translated: Thus, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that since all causes exist, they explain the cause and effect of those.

original: gang dag la yang byung nas rnam par 'jig pa de dag la ni yod pa pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag la yang byung nas rnam par 'jig pa de dag la ni yod pa pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: For those who arise and perish, there is the conception of existence and nonexistence.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ni sangs rgyas kho na ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par grol ba ni sangs rgyas kho na ste /
translated: Only the Buddha is naturally liberated.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la mi 'byung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas grub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid la mi 'byung ngo zhes thams cad mkhyen pas grub par mdzad pa /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the omniscient one has established that the conceptual thoughts of attachment and so forth do not occur in the nature of reality, which is completely pure by nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nyon mongs pa rnams gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang / nang dang phyi rol du mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams gcig pa dang tha dad pa dang / nang dang phyi rol du mi dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the afflictions are not observed as the same or different, or as internal or external.

original: blo gros chen po 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug lus med pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol tu mi dmigs so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug lus med pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol tu mi dmigs so //
translated: MahƒÅmati, attachment, aversion, and delusion are not observed as internal or external because they are nonphysical.

original: blo gros chen po 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dngos po rnams khas mi len pa'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi dngos po rnams khas mi len pa'i phyir zhes te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, because the things of attachment, aversion, and delusion are not accepted.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'khrul ba'i rnam pa can so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa rnams kyi 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams 'khrul ba'i rnam pa can so sor snang ngo //
translated: The afflictions of desire, etc., of those who are mistaken about the things that are impermanent, painful, insubstantial, and impure appear in the form of error.

original: de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par yongs su shes pas mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong par yongs su shes pas mi snang ngo //
translated: But when they are known to be impermanent, painful, insubstantial, and empty, they do not appear.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa la 'dod chags kyang med /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa la 'dod chags kyang med /
translated: In the clear light of reality, there is no desire,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang med do //
translated: and no one free from desire.

original: @154b ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: @154b ji lta zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gzugs med pa'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don la mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes par mngon par chags pa yang med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i phyir de ltar phyi rol gyi don la mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes par mngon par chags pa yang med do //
translated: Because there is no form, there is no attachment to beauty or ugliness in external things.

original: yul med par 'dod chags la sogs pa gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i chos des de kun mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: yul med par 'dod chags la sogs pa gang chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang du chags par 'gyur ba dang / gang gis chags par 'gyur ba'i chos des de kun mi mthong ngo //
translated: In the absence of objects, one does not see any of the things that would cause desire, the desire itself, or the one who desires.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / mdzes par mngon par chags pa'i phyi nang gi mtshan ma gcig pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i chos thams cad kyi rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba dang / mdzes par mngon par chags pa'i phyi nang gi mtshan ma gcig pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because all phenomena, such as desire, are not the same in terms of the internal and external signs of attachment to permanence, self, bliss, purity, and beauty, and they are not different.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rab 'byor 'ching bar bcings pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir /üîΩchos thams cad bcings pa'ang med /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'ching bar bcings pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir / chos thams cad bcings pa'ang med /
translated: Subh≈´ti, because there is no cause for bondage or liberation,

original: grol ba 'ang med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: grol ba 'ang med do zhes pa'o //
translated: all phenomena are neither bound nor liberated.

original: 'dir yang ci dgongs she na /
analyzed: 'dir yang ci dgongs she na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: chud pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal la nyon mongs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par mi srid do zhes so /
analyzed: chud pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal la nyon mongs pa rnams dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par mi srid do zhes so /
translated: Since the naturally luminous mind is not an entity, the afflictions are not possible as either different or not different.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: zhen 'dod chags pa ma gtogs par //
analyzed: zhen 'dod chags pa ma gtogs par //
translated: Apart from the desire of attachment,

original: gal te 'dod chags sngar gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags sngar gyur na //
translated: if desire existed prior,

original: de yi rkyen las 'dod 'gyur na //
analyzed: de yi rkyen las 'dod 'gyur na //
translated: and if it arose from the conditions of that,

original: zhen med par ni ji ltar 'dod //
analyzed: zhen med par ni ji ltar 'dod //
translated: How can one desire what one does not desire?

original: 'dod chags yod na zhen par yang //
analyzed: 'dod chags yod na zhen par yang //
translated: If there is attachment, there is also one who is attached.

original: rim pa de ni mtshungs pa ste //
analyzed: rim pa de ni mtshungs pa ste //
translated: This is the same process.

original: 'dod chags bzhin du thams cad chos //
analyzed: 'dod chags bzhin du thams cad chos //
translated: All things are like attachment.

original: 'jug pa gcig min tha dad min //
analyzed: 'jug pa gcig min tha dad min //
translated: They are neither unitary nor different.

original: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
analyzed: mtshon bya mtshan nyid gal te gzhan //
translated: If the characteristic is different from the characterized,

original: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshan la mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the characteristic would be without a basis.

original: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
analyzed: gcig na'ang de gnyis mi 'grub ste //
translated: If they are identical, the two are not established.

original: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
analyzed: tha dad na yang gzhan du med //
translated: If they are different, there is no other.

original: gal te chos dang chos can tha dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / tsha ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir rtag pa mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rtag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos can tha dad pa yin na ni de'i tshe rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa dang / tsha ba la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir rtag pa mi rtag pa dang mi rtag pa rtag par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the property and the possessor of the property are different, then the permanent and the impermanent, the material and the immaterial, and hot and so on would be different, and the permanent would become impermanent and the impermanent would become permanent.

original: gzugs can gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The material would become immaterial.

original: tsha ba tsha ba med pa dang / tsha ba med pa tsha bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tsha ba tsha ba med pa dang / tsha ba med pa tsha bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Hot would become not hot and not hot would become hot.

original: de ltar me la sogs pa la tsha ba la sogs pa'i chos tha dad do zhe na ni me la sogs pa'i tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar me la sogs pa la tsha ba la sogs pa'i chos tha dad do zhe na ni me la sogs pa'i tsha ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin stong pa nyid do //
translated: If you say that heat and so on are different attributes of fire and so on, then the nature of fire and so on is emptiness.

original: de de @155a * //
analyzed: de de @155a * //
translated: That is so

original: ltar me dang tsha ba dang / chos can dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / zhen pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par dpyad pas gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chos su brtags pa de dag stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: ltar me dang tsha ba dang / chos can dang / mtshan mar bya ba dang / mtshan nyid dang / zhen pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med par dpyad pas gnyis kyi rnam pa'i chos su brtags pa de dag stong pa nyid do //
translated: because fire and heat, the possessor of attributes and the attribute, attachment and desire and so on, and difference and nondifference are all empty of duality when analyzed.

original: gang dag yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por gsal bar snang ba de dag kyang don dam par na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang dag yang gzugs la sogs pa 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por gsal bar snang ba de dag kyang don dam par na rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du skye ba med pa'i stong pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, those things that appear clearly as the apprehender and the apprehended, such as form and so on, are also emptiness, unborn in the ultimate, like a dream, a magical display and so on.

original: des na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba grub pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de ;
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba grub pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de ;
translated: Therefore, the establishment of natural luminosity is emptiness, free from duality.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rtag pa'i phyir kun tu rtog pa thams cad kyi snang ba tha dad pa'i tha snyad med do //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa la dngos po dang dngos po med par mi rtag pa'i phyir kun tu rtog pa thams cad kyi snang ba tha dad pa'i tha snyad med do //
translated: In the ultimate truth, which is nondual, nonconceptual, and nonapparent, there is no conventional designation of the various appearances of all conceptual thoughts, because it is not possible to conceive of it as either existent or nonexistent.

original: thugs rje bag chags kyis bskul te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: thugs rje bag chags kyis bskul te snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: When the Omniscient One, urged by the latent impressions of compassion, is in a concentration that is accompanied by appearances, the teaching of the Dharma occurs.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩ'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa dang // bden pa gnyis la brten nas su //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa dang // bden pa gnyis la brten nas su //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩThe teaching of the Dharma by the buddhasüîΩoccurs based on the two truths:üîΩthe conventional truth of the world

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan 'byung //üîΩgang dag dngos po rnams la ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chos bstan 'byung // gang dag dngos po rnams la ni //
translated: and the truth of ultimate reality.üîΩThose of little intelligenceüîΩwho see things as existent

original: yong med mthong ba blo chung rnams //
analyzed: yong med mthong ba blo chung rnams //
translated: do not see

original: zhi ba nyer zhi blta bya ba //üîΩde dag gis ni mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi ba nyer zhi blta bya ba //üîΩde dag gis ni mi mthong ngo //
translated: the peace, the utter peace.

original: gang dag la yod pa nyid la rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ni rgyu med pa las yod par smra ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag la yod pa nyid la rgyu dang rkyen yod pa ni rgyu med pa las yod par smra ba yin te /
translated: Those who maintain that what exists has causes and conditions are propounding existence from a non-cause.

original: rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du smra bar byed do //
analyzed: rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i dngos po'i mtshan nyid du smra bar byed do //
translated: They are propounding the characteristics of things such as permanence and pleasure.

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa'i mtshan ma dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should know that they are devoid of the characteristics of passion, etc.

original: rkyen kyis  yod par ma bsgrubs na //
analyzed: rkyen kyis  yod par ma bsgrubs na //
translated: When existence is not established by conditions,

original: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe na gcig pa med pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med ces so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni gang gi tshe na gcig pa med pa de'i tshe na gnyis po med ces so //
translated: When there is no one, then there is no two.

original: ji tsam du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems pa de tsam du yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog gi //
analyzed: ji tsam du gnyis kyi rnam pa'i sems pa de tsam du yod pa dang / med pa'i rnam par rtog gi //
translated: To the extent that there is a thought with the aspect of two, to that extent there is the discrimination of existence and non-existence.

original: gnyis su med pa la ma yin no //üîΩrtog pa dang yi ge med pa zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su med pa la ma yin no // rtog pa dang yi ge med pa zhes pa ni phung po la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: But not in the non-dual.üîΩThe absence of conceptualization and verbal expression refers to the conceptualization of the intrinsic identity of the aggregates, etc.

original: spyi'i rnam par sgras sgro btags te rnam par rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par sgras sgro btags te rnam par rtog go zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to: one conceptually imagines by superimposing a general aspect with a word.

original: le'u @155b gsum pa las yod pa dang / med pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rnam par grol ba dpyad pa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: le'u @155b gsum pa las yod pa dang / med pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rnam par grol ba dpyad pa gnyis pa'o /
translated: Chapter 3 examines existence and nonexistence and bondage and liberation.

original: // / grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: // / grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rnam pa gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The two modes of tenets are as follows.

original: de la blo gros chen po grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po grub pa'i mtha'i tshul ni 'di lta ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the mode of tenets is as follows:

original: so so rang gis rig pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: so so rang gis rig pa'i bye brag gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: the characteristics of the distinctions of one‚Äôs own awareness,

original: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa dang / yi ge med pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtogs pa thob par byed pa /
analyzed: tshig gi rnam par rtog pa dang / yi ge med pa zag pa med pa'i dbyings rtogs pa thob par byed pa /
translated: free from words, concepts, and letters, is the uncontaminated realm that causes the attainment of realization.üîΩThe characteristics of one‚Äôs own realization are free from all tƒ´rthikas and mƒÅras.

original: so so rang gis rtogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad spang zhes pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi don sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi mthong zhing khang pa dang /
analyzed: so so rang gis rtogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mu stegs can dang bdud thams cad spang zhes pa ni gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de phyi rol gyi don sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na mi mthong zhing khang pa dang /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and distinguishes coarse and subtle external objects, one does not see them, and one realizes that they are like houses,

original: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: armies, and forests.

original: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa ni ma skyes pa'i phyir ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa yin no //
translated: The permanent is non-existent like the horns of an ass, because it is not produced.

original: de lta bur gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa'i mu stegs kyis bdud thams cad la thub par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bur gnyis dang mi gnyis pa'i rtogs pa'i mu stegs kyis bdud thams cad la thub par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the tƒ´rthika demons who are in the extreme views of duality and non-duality should be refuted.

original: sems pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mdzes so //
analyzed: sems pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba mdzes so //
translated: The non-conceptual, non-apparent ultimate truth, non-dual, perfectly realized, naturally luminous, is beautiful.

original: blo gros chen po de ni grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: blo gros chen po de ni grub pa'i mtha'i tshul gyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: MahƒÅmati, that is the definition of the method of tenets.

original: de la bshad pa'i tshul gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bshad pa'i tshul gang zhe na /
translated: What is the method of explanation?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bstan pa yan lag dgu sna tshogs su bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bstan pa yan lag dgu sna tshogs su bshad pa yin te /
translated: The explanation is the various explanations of the nine branches of the teaching.

original: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa thabs mkhas pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas sems can rnams la bshad pa 'jug ste zhes pa ni gang dag la mi gnyis pa zab mo bshad pa mngon du mi 'jug pa de dag la ni phung po dang /
analyzed: gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs spangs pa thabs mkhas pa'i cho ga sngon du 'gro bas sems can rnams la bshad pa 'jug ste zhes pa ni gang dag la mi gnyis pa zab mo bshad pa mngon du mi 'jug pa de dag la ni phung po dang /
translated: He teaches sentient beings by means of the skill in means of abandoning the extremes of identity, difference, existence and non-existence.

original: khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa la gsung rab rnam par gzhag cing bshad par mdzad do //
analyzed: khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa la gsung rab rnam par gzhag cing bshad par mdzad do //
translated: He teaches and explains the scriptures in terms of the aggregates, elements, sense bases and so on to those who are not engaged in the profound non-dual teachings.

original: kha cig la yan lag dgu ste /
analyzed: kha cig la yan lag dgu ste /
translated: To some, he teaches with nine branches.

original: skyes pa'i rabs dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi ni da ltar dang 'das pa'i sder gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi ni da ltar dang 'das pa'i sder gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nine branches are jƒÅtaka, avadƒÅna, nidƒÅna, because they belong to the present and past categories.

original: kha cig la ni yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kha cig la ni yan lag bcu gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: To some, he teaches with twelve branches.

original: mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du @156a * //
analyzed: mdo dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du @156a * //
translated: The twelve branches are s≈´tra, geya, vyƒÅkara·πáa, gƒÅthƒÅ, udƒÅna,

original: brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / da ltar dang / 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang / chos bstan pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa dang / gleng gzhi dang / rtogs pa brjod pa dang / da ltar dang / 'das pa dang / skyes pa'i rabs dang / shin tu rgyas pa dang / rmad du byung ba dang / chos bstan pa'o //
translated: 1. the Sutra, 2. the Exceedingly Extensive, 3. the Tales, 4. the Birth Stories, 5. the Marvels, 6. the Established Regulations, 7. the Allegories, 8. the Discourses, 9. the Narratives, 10. the Parables, 11. the Analyses, 12. the Verses, 13. the Precepts, and 14. the Utterances.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni rab rib dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa las gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i dpyad pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po rnams ni rab rib dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du chud pa las gcig pa dang / tha dad pa'i dpyad pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are like a mirage, a dream, an illusion, a reflection, etc., and are free from the analysis of identity and difference.

original: yongs su grub pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The perfected is emptiness, being devoid of the aspects of subject and object.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is non-conceptual with regard to entity and non-entity,

original: snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis yod pa dang med par brjod du med do //
analyzed: snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma thams cad kyis yod pa dang med par brjod du med do //
translated: it is inexpressible as existent or non-existent by all signs of conceptual appearances.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //üîΩstong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba // stong pa zhes par smra mi bya //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:üîΩOne should not say ‚Äúempty,‚Äù

original: mi stong par yang ma yin te //
analyzed: mi stong par yang ma yin te //
translated: nor should one say ‚Äúnon-empty.‚Äù

original: gnyis dang mi gnyis zhes par yang //
analyzed: gnyis dang mi gnyis zhes par yang //
translated: The two and the non-two are also so.

original: bzhi la rnam bzhi ga la zhig / ces pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi la rnam bzhi ga la zhig / ces pa'o //
translated: How can there be the four in the four?

original: gsung rab kyi yan lag phye ste bshad pa mdo ni mdo'i don gyi phyir te /üîΩji ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo sde bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gsung rab kyi yan lag phye ste bshad pa mdo ni mdo'i don gyi phyir te / ji ltar so sor thar pa'i mdo sde bshad pa ni /
translated: The Sutra is the explanation of the divisions of the scriptures, because it is the meaning of the sutra.üîΩThe Sutra of the Vinaya is the explanation of the Pratimoksha Sutra.

original: rnam par 'byed pa rab tu 'chad pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa rab tu 'chad pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Sutra of the Abhidharma is the explanation of the Vibhanga, the Prakara·πáa, etc.

original: 'dul ba'i mdo sde ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i mdo sde ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The Sutra of the Vinaya is the superior morality.

original: bshad pa'i mdo sde ni lhag pa'i sems ni mngon par dang bar bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i mdo sde ni lhag pa'i sems ni mngon par dang bar bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Sutra of the Explanation is the superior mind, which is the meaning of the clear faith.

original: de ni lung tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de ni lung tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa ste /
translated: That is different because of the different scriptures.

original: ring po'i lung dang / bar ma'i lung dang / ldan pa'i lung dang / gcig yan chad kyi lung gi mdo rnams so //
analyzed: ring po'i lung dang / bar ma'i lung dang / ldan pa'i lung dang / gcig yan chad kyi lung gi mdo rnams so //
translated: The scriptures are long, medium, brief, and the sutras of one or more scriptures.

original: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde rnams ni theg pa chen po la med de /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde rnams ni theg pa chen po la med de /
translated: The Vaipulya Sutras are not of the Mahayana.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lang kar gshegs pa dang / sa bcu pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po dang / sdong po brgyan pa dang / dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / lang kar gshegs pa dang / sa bcu pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po dang / sdong po brgyan pa dang / dam pa'i chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang /
translated: How is it that the noble Perfection of Wisdom, the Descent into Lanka, the Ten Stages, the King of Meditative Absorptions, the Adornment of Trees, the Application of Mindfulness of the True Dharma,

original: lha mo'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha mo'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Sutra of the Goddess, and so forth are all sutras?

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni rgyud ring ba'o /
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni rgyud ring ba'o /
translated: The verse texts are the extensive discourses.

original: la las ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa rnams ni gcig pa kho nar rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: la las ni dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa rnams ni gcig pa kho nar rtogs par byed de /
translated: Some understand that the verse texts, the proclamations, and the eulogies are all the same,

original: rgyud thung ba tsam zhig ni tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: rgyud thung ba tsam zhig ni tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: but the verse texts are merely brief discourses.

original: ched du brjod pa'i gsung ni mdo las spobs pa de lta bur bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ched du brjod pa'i gsung ni mdo las spobs pa de lta bur bskyed pa'o //
translated: The proclamations are the eloquence generated in the sutras.

original: @156b lung bstan pa ni ma 'ongs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: @156b lung bstan pa ni ma 'ongs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The predictions are the statements about the future.

original: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni gdangs kyis sems can mang po mgu bar mdzad de /
analyzed: dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa ni gdangs kyis sems can mang po mgu bar mdzad de /
translated: The eulogies are the many beings delighted by the melody.

original: ji ltar bar ta'i gtsug lag las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar bar ta'i gtsug lag las 'byung ba //
translated: As it appears in the Vartika:

original: gan dha ra ni sha dbyangs dag ni //
analyzed: gan dha ra ni sha dbyangs dag ni //
translated: The Gandharvas are the pure tones.

original: snying rje'i rol blang bar bya //
analyzed: snying rje'i rol blang bar bya //
translated: One should take up the melody of compassion.

original: 'thab mo 'jigs pa dang bcas la //
analyzed: 'thab mo 'jigs pa dang bcas la //
translated: In the midst of fear and conflict,

original: bde bar dbyangs ni blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar dbyangs ni blang bar bya'o //
translated: one should take up the melody of happiness.

original: zhes te / chos bshad pas kun tu skyo bar bya ba'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gsung bar mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes te / chos bshad pas kun tu skyo bar bya ba'i phyir rnam pa de lta bu dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor gsung bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, in order to be weary of explaining the Dharma, one should take up the melody of that kind of circle of sound.

original: rlom pa dang dpa' bo la sogs par gsung bar mi mdzad pa ni rtsed mo rlom par bla ba ni /
analyzed: rlom pa dang dpa' bo la sogs par gsung bar mi mdzad pa ni rtsed mo rlom par bla ba ni /
translated: One should not take up the melody of boasting, heroism, and so forth.

original: lnga pa dbu ma dbyangs dag ste //
analyzed: lnga pa dbu ma dbyangs dag ste //
translated: The fifth is the middle melody.

original: dpa' bo drag po ngo mtshar du //
analyzed: dpa' bo drag po ngo mtshar du //
translated: Heroic, fierce, and wondrous,

original: drug skyes khyu mchog de bzhin no //
analyzed: drug skyes khyu mchog de bzhin no //
translated: the sixth is the supreme bull.

original: zhes pa'o // gleng gzhi ni sngon 'das pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gleng gzhi ni sngon 'das pa ste /
translated: The nidana is the past.

original: la las rgyur yang brjod do //
analyzed: la las rgyur yang brjod do //
translated: Some say it is the cause.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa ni snga ma dang 'brel bar 'grel to //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa ni snga ma dang 'brel bar 'grel to //
translated: The present and past are connected with the former.

original: skyes pa'i rabs ni sngon gyi spyad pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs ni sngon gyi spyad pa'o //
translated: The Jataka is the former conduct.

original: rtogs pa brjod pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi tshe gzhan du spyad pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtogs pa brjod pa ni nyan thos rnams kyi tshe gzhan du spyad pa nyid de /
translated: The avadana is the conduct in another life of the sravakas.

original: la las don gcig par rtog pa ni ji ltar dpal sde'i rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtsug na nor bu'i rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: la las don gcig par rtog pa ni ji ltar dpal sde'i rtogs pa brjod pa dang / gtsug na nor bu'i rtogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: Some think that one topic is the glorious Sutra of the Ten Stages and the Sutra of the Crown of the Head.

original: skyes pa'i rabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa nyid du grags pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs ni byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa nyid du grags pa'o //
translated: The Jataka Tales are known as the Bodhisattva's conduct.

original: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po ste /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po ste /
translated: The Vaipulya is the Great Vehicle.

original: mdo sde 'grel pa'i chos mngon pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab po //
analyzed: mdo sde 'grel pa'i chos mngon pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab po //
translated: The Abhidharma is the commentary on the sutras, and it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: rmad du byung ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul lo //
translated: The Adbhutadharma is the miracle of psychic power.

original: chos bstan pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag ste /
analyzed: chos bstan pa ni bsam gtan gyi man ngag ste /
translated: The Dharma teaching is the instruction in meditation.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gsum du yang rtogs pa ji bzhin par gyur pa dang yan lag bcu gnyis so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gsum du yang rtogs pa ji bzhin par gyur pa dang yan lag bcu gnyis so //
translated: The three Bodhisattvas are the realization of the twelve links of dependent origination.

original: yan lag dgu ni gsung rab bsdu ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yan lag dgu ni gsung rab bsdu ba'i phyir te /
translated: The nine links are for the collection of the scriptures.

original: gal te dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa rnams gcig tu bsdu'o //
analyzed: gal te dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa dang / ched du brjod pa rnams gcig tu bsdu'o //
translated: If the songs, verses, and exclamations are combined into one,

original: yang na skyes pa'i rabs dang / rtogs pa brjod pa ni da ltar dang / 'das pa dang gleng gzhi rnams gcig tu bsdu zhes te /üîΩthams cad mkhyen pa'am /
analyzed: yang na skyes pa'i rabs dang / rtogs pa brjod pa ni da ltar dang / 'das pa dang gleng gzhi rnams gcig tu bsdu zhes te / thams cad mkhyen pa'am /
translated: The Jataka Tales and the Avadanas are the present; the Nidanas are the past.üîΩOr else, the Nidanas are the future, the Jataka Tales and the Avadanas are the present, and the Itivrttakas are the past.üîΩOr else, the Nidanas are the past and the future, the Jataka Tales and the Avadanas are the present.

original: yang dag par bsdu par mdzad pa rnams kyis mdo dang rgya cher dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: yang dag par bsdu par mdzad pa rnams kyis mdo dang rgya cher dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: Or else, the Nidanas are the past, the Jataka Tales and the Avadanas are the present and the future.

original: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po ste /üîΩbtsun gtso'i byang chub sems @157a * //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po ste / btsun gtso'i byang chub sems @157a * //
translated: The Vaipulya is the Great Vehicle.

original: dpa' rnams kyis bro dang / bro'i 'byung gnas dang / mig rtsi dang / gter mi zad pa dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / ral gri dang / gzhal med khang la sogs pa sngags kyis 'grub pa'i 'du byed ni sems can gyi don du byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su bskang ba'i phyir mkho'o //
analyzed: dpa' rnams kyis bro dang / bro'i 'byung gnas dang / mig rtsi dang / gter mi zad pa dang / yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che dang / ral gri dang / gzhal med khang la sogs pa sngags kyis 'grub pa'i 'du byed ni sems can gyi don du byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su bskang ba'i phyir mkho'o //
translated: The Bodhisattvas, the foremost of the twice-born, need the spells which bring about the accomplishment of the magical powers, the eye-salve, the inexhaustible treasure, the wish-fulfilling gem, the sword, the celestial palace, etc., in order to fulfill the accumulations necessary for enlightenment for the benefit of all beings.
