original: nyan thos pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa skyo ba dang 'dod pa chung ba rnams la bro dang bro'i 'byung gnas dang / mig rtsi mi dgos so //
analyzed: nyan thos pa ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bsgom pa skyo ba dang 'dod pa chung ba rnams la bro dang bro'i 'byung gnas dang / mig rtsi mi dgos so //
translated: The listeners cultivate the four noble truths in the aspect of impermanence, suffering, no-self and emptiness, and for those who are disenchanted with samsara and have few desires, this is a source of joy and delight, but it is not necessary for the eye ointment.

original: de dag gis kyang shin tu rgya che ba ni theg pa chen por zur byung ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gis kyang shin tu rgya che ba ni theg pa chen por zur byung ba yin te /
translated: And the listeners' path is very extensive, for it is the source of the Great Vehicle.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa dga' bos yang dag par bsdu ba na smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa dga' bos yang dag par bsdu ba na smras pa /
translated: As it says in the Arya-nandagarbhani-graha,

original: stobs bcu'i gsung ni gzhal du med pa ste //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i gsung ni gzhal du med pa ste //
translated: The speech of the one with ten powers is immeasurable.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i 'jig rten la sogs par gsungs pa'i mdo sde mang po gang dag bdag gis ma thos shing /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis lha'i 'jig rten la sogs par gsungs pa'i mdo sde mang po gang dag bdag gis ma thos shing /
translated: The sutras spoken by the Lord in the world of the gods and so on, I have not heard.

original: dge slong pha kha cig gis thos so zhes te /
analyzed: dge slong pha kha cig gis thos so zhes te /
translated: Some of the bhikshus have heard them.

original: de bas na de ltar gnas brtan bcun gtso'i tshig gis dbang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / rnam par thar ba gsum po thob pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos kyis lho phyogs kyi thog ma'i ri dang / tha ma ri'i gnas su theg pa chen po ni sde snod bdun du yang dag par bsdu par byas so //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar gnas brtan bcun gtso'i tshig gis dbang po la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun dang / rnam par thar ba gsum po thob pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos kyis lho phyogs kyi thog ma'i ri dang / tha ma ri'i gnas su theg pa chen po ni sde snod bdun du yang dag par bsdu par byas so //
translated: Therefore, in this way, the Elder MahƒÅkƒÅ≈õyapa and so on, the Sa·πÖgha of Bodhisattvas headed by the faculties, and the noble ≈örƒÅvakas who have attained the three liberations, in the southern region, from the beginning of the mountain and in the end, in the mountain abode, have perfectly compiled the MahƒÅyƒÅna into the seven collections.

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs dang / 'phags pa dga' bo dang / au p'a li la sogs pas rgyal po'i khab tu sde snod gsum yang dag par bsdus so //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs dang / 'phags pa dga' bo dang / au p'a li la sogs pas rgyal po'i khab tu sde snod gsum yang dag par bsdus so //
translated: The noble KƒÅ≈õyapa, the noble Nanda, UpƒÅli, and so on, in RƒÅjag·πõha, have perfectly compiled the three pi·π≠akas.

original: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po bar /
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa ni theg pa chen po bar /
translated: The extensive is in the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis zung byung ba btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnam par phye ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nyan thos rnams kyis zung byung ba btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnam par phye ba ste /
translated: The noble ≈örƒÅvakas have compiled it, and the Bodhisattvas headed by the two foremost have analyzed it.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du theg pa chen por bsdu ba /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'di nyid du theg pa chen por bsdu ba /
translated: Just as this very s≈´tra is compiled into the MahƒÅyƒÅna.

original: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam bar shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
analyzed: chos lnga rnams dang rang bzhin dang // rnam bar shes pa brgyad rnams dang // bdag med gnyis kyi nang du ni //
translated: The five dharmas, the three natures, the eight consciousnesses, and the two kinds of selflessness.

original: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
analyzed: theg pa chen po thams cad 'dus //
translated: All the Mahayana is included in these.üîΩThe five dharmas are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute, and within the absolute are included the perfected, the perfected as object of knowledge, and the perfected as object of meditation.üîΩThe three natures are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: zhes te de la mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / ming dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dang chos lnga'o //
analyzed: zhes te de la mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / ming dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dang chos lnga'o //
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the store consciousness, the active consciousnesses, and the purified consciousness.üîΩThe two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩThe five dharmas are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute, and within the absolute are included the perfected, the perfected as object of knowledge, and the perfected as object of meditation.

original: de dag ni brtags @157b pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
analyzed: de dag ni brtags @157b pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
translated: The three natures are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.üîΩThe eight consciousnesses are the store consciousness, the active consciousnesses, and the purified consciousness.

original: mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //üîΩming ni brtags par ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang / rnam par rtog pa gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o // ming ni brtags par ro //
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩThe five dharmas are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute, and within the absolute are included the perfected, the perfected as object of knowledge, and the perfected as object of meditation.üîΩThe three natures are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni yongs su grub par ro //üîΩlus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa na mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni yongs su grub par ro // lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa na mtshan ma ste /
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the store consciousness, the active consciousnesses, and the purified consciousness.üîΩThe two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩThe five dharmas are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute, and within the absolute are included the perfected, the perfected as object of knowledge, and the perfected as object of meditation.üîΩThe three natures are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du'o //
translated: The eight consciousnesses are the store consciousness, the active consciousnesses, and the purified consciousness.üîΩThe two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of phenomena.üîΩThe five dharmas are the imagined, the dependent, and the absolute, and within the absolute are included the perfected, the perfected as object of knowledge, and the perfected as object of meditation.üîΩThe three natures are the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.üîΩThe eight consciousnesses are the store consciousness, the active consciousnesses, and the purified consciousness.üîΩThe two kinds of selflessness are the selflessness of persons and the selflessness of

original: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: de la yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The mental consciousness has the nature of conceptualization.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs nyid la rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gsal ba'i gzugs nyid la rnam par rtog go //
translated: It conceptualizes the dependent nature, which is the manifestation of form, etc.

original: ming ni nges pa med do //
analyzed: ming ni nges pa med do //
translated: The name is not fixed.

original: brtags pa las skye bas na de lta bu'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: brtags pa las skye bas na de lta bu'i phyir kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Because it arises from imagination, it is the imagined nature.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni shes rab dpyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni shes rab dpyod pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Correct knowledge has the nature of wisdom and investigation.

original: de ni gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa /
analyzed: de ni gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa /
translated: It is free from the aspect of duality, is the nondual reality, is nonconceptual and nonapparent, is the nondual ultimate truth,

original: yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin dngos po rnam par mi rtog pa'i de bzhin nyid rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin dngos po rnam par mi rtog pa'i de bzhin nyid rtogs par byed do //
translated: and realizes the nonconceptual suchness that is the nature of correct knowledge.

original: bdag med pa gnyis ni /
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis ni /
translated: The two kinds of selflessness are

original: chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa dang / gang zag la bdag med pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons.

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: tshogs su mi gnas pa dang / mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir nang dang phyi'i stong pa nyid ces te /
analyzed: tshogs su mi gnas pa dang / mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir nang dang phyi'i stong pa nyid ces te /
translated: Because it is not a collection and is not a non-fear, it is called the emptiness of the internal and the emptiness of the external.

original: rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi tshogs su gnas pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par gzhigs pa na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi tshogs su gnas pa med do //
translated: When analyzed, like a house, an army, a forest, etc., there is no external collection that endures.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in this Sutra:

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is analyzed into atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: The atom is without parts.

original: zhes so // snang ba 'di ci zhig ces pa la /
analyzed: zhes so // snang ba 'di ci zhig ces pa la /
translated: As for what appears, it is said:

original: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: Even though external things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: the mind appears in two aspects.

original: zhes so // mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa ni rtag pa gang zag la sogs pa med de ma skyes pas na ri bong gi ral sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes so // mi 'jigs pa ma yin pa ni rtag pa gang zag la sogs pa med de ma skyes pas na ri bong gi ral sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med pa kho na'o //
translated: As for not being a non-fear, that which is permanent, such as the person, does not exist, because it is unproduced, like the horn of an ass, it is just a non-thing.

original: de de ltar bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa thams cad kyi thabs su bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de de ltar bdag med pa gnyis ni stong pa thams cad kyi thabs su bshad pa sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, the two kinds of selflessness should be applied as the method for all emptinesses.

original: rang bzhin ni chud pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni chud pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The nature is the realm of reality.

original: chos lnga'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: chos lnga'i gnas yin te /
translated: The five dharmas are the basis.

original: chos nyid la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: chos nyid la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with reality.

original: btsun @158a * //
analyzed: btsun @158a * //
translated: Venerable

original: gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi don du theg pa chen po la thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas theg pa chen po khyad par du phye ba yin no //
analyzed: gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sems can gyi don du theg pa chen po la thams cad mkhyen pa bsgrub pa'i phyir sa dang pha rol tu phyin pas theg pa chen po khyad par du phye ba yin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas, the foremost of the noble ones, in order to benefit sentient beings, in order to attain omniscience in the Great Vehicle, distinguish the Great Vehicle by means of the stages and perfections.üîΩThe Omniscient One taught the emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness of the ≈õrƒÅvakas in order to realize the liberation.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas nyan thos rnams la yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar ba rtogs par mdzad pa'i slad du bstan pa ni ji ltar dge slong dag mig ni stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas nyan thos rnams la yang stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i rnam par thar ba rtogs par mdzad pa'i slad du bstan pa ni ji ltar dge slong dag mig ni stong pa nyid dang /
translated: As it is said, Monks, the eye is seen as empty,

original: gsog dang / gso ba dang / 'du shes tsam pa dang / 'dus byas su mthong ngo //
analyzed: gsog dang / gso ba dang / 'du shes tsam pa dang / 'dus byas su mthong ngo //
translated: as hollow, as worthless, as mere perception, as conditioned.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bur mtshungs //
analyzed: gzugs ni dbu ba'i gong bur mtshungs //
translated: Form is like a mass of foam,

original: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
analyzed: tshor ba chu yi chu bur 'dra //
translated: Feeling is like a water bubble,

original: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
analyzed: 'du shes smig rgyu lta bu ste //
translated: Perception is like a mirage,

original: 'du byed chu shing du ni snang //
analyzed: 'du byed chu shing du ni snang //
translated: Formations appear like a plantain tree,

original: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam shes sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: Consciousness is like an illusion.

original: zhes pa nyi ma'i gnyen gyis gsungs //
analyzed: zhes pa nyi ma'i gnyen gyis gsungs //
translated: Thus it was taught by the Kinsman of the Sun.

original: zhes pa'o // de de ltar gsung rab dang mi 'gal ba la /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // de de ltar gsung rab dang mi 'gal ba la /
translated: Thus, in this way, [the teaching of the Buddha] is not in contradiction with the scriptures.

original: kha cig gis ni 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni 'dod /
translated: Some accept it,

original: kha cig gis ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig gis ni mi 'dod do //
translated: and some do not.

original: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod par zhugs pa rnams mi spong zhing brnyas bas na de dag la yang ngan song ngo //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod par zhugs pa rnams mi spong zhing brnyas bas na de dag la yang ngan song ngo //
translated: Those who are engaged in accepting and rejecting, and who are contemptuous, will also go to the lower realms.

original: mkhas pa rnams ni legs par gsungs pa 'dzin pa yin pas na shes rab can rnams kyis nyan par byed do //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams ni legs par gsungs pa 'dzin pa yin pas na shes rab can rnams kyis nyan par byed do //
translated: The wise, however, uphold the well-spoken [teachings], and so the wise listen.

original: rang gi sems snang ba tsam khong du chud pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don la sogs par rnam par rtog par mi byed cing /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba tsam khong du chud pas rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don la sogs par rnam par rtog par mi byed cing /
translated: By understanding that [appearances] are merely one's own mind, one does not conceive of permanence, a self, external objects, and so forth.

original: theg pa chen po yang dag pa ji lta bu rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang dag pa ji lta bu rtogs par byed do //
translated: One realizes the Great Vehicle just as it is.

original: nyan thos dang mu stegs kyi rtog pa las rnam par grol zhing /
analyzed: nyan thos dang mu stegs kyi rtog pa las rnam par grol zhing /
translated: One is liberated from the thoughts of the ≈õrƒÅvakas and tƒ´rthikas.

original: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba las ma gtogs pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa byed pa por smra ba las ma gtogs pa'i las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa khong du chud par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will understand the connection between action and result, except for the assertions of BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, etc. as the creator.

original: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
analyzed: sems 'di ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba ste /
translated: This mind is naturally luminous.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis sus ji ltar sbyor ba des /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams kyis sus ji ltar sbyor ba des /
translated: It is made to be like this or like that by the formative forces, such as the wholesome and the unwholesome, in accordance with the way in which it is applied.

original: de ltar 'grub par 'gyur bas na sa dang pha rol tu phyin par 'byed pas dbye ba na snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'grub par 'gyur bas na sa dang pha rol tu phyin par 'byed pas dbye ba na snang ba dang bcas pa dang snang ba med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when it is classified according to the stages and perfections, it becomes omniscience, because it attains the meditative concentration with and without conceptualization.

original: des yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad spyod do //
analyzed: des yid bzhin gyi nor bu rin po che ltar sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad spyod do //
translated: It acts for the benefit of all sentient beings like a wish-fulfilling gem.

original: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang @158b bral ba /
analyzed: mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang @158b bral ba /
translated: It is completely pure, free from attachment,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: omniscient,

original: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas ba'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi dbang po gzugs rnam pa sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' yas ba'i sems can gyi rgyud rangs par mdzad pa /
translated: The Lord of Yogins, by the magic display of various forms, delights the mind-streams of infinite sentient beings.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs dpag tu med pa shes bya dang / nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi sgrib pa spangs pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa kho nar ro //
translated: The assembly of his immeasurable qualities is omniscience, which abandons the obscurations of the knowable, afflictions, and karma.

original: de'i bgegs ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i bgegs ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa ste /
translated: The obstacles to that are the obscurations of the afflictions, such as attachment.

original: dngos po yang dag pa nyid nye bar ji ltar gnas pa yang mi shes so //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag pa nyid nye bar ji ltar gnas pa yang mi shes so //
translated: One does not know the nature of things as they are and as they abide.

original: shes pa'i spyod yul so sor nges pa med kyang sgrib pa spangs pa na mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du thams cad shes so //
analyzed: shes pa'i spyod yul so sor nges pa med kyang sgrib pa spangs pa na mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du thams cad shes so //
translated: Although the domain of knowledge is not ascertained individually, when the obscurations are abandoned, one knows everything, like being free from the cataracts of the eyes.

original: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim par dbye ba na ye shes gong ma nas gong mar khyad par gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni sngon thos pa dang / sems pa las tshogs kyi stobs las byung ba ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa'i rim par dbye ba na ye shes gong ma nas gong mar khyad par gang dang gang yod pa de dang de ni sngon thos pa dang / sems pa las tshogs kyi stobs las byung ba ste /
translated: When divided into the stages of hearing, reflection, and meditation, the differences between the higher and higher wisdoms arise from the power of the collection of hearing and reflection.

original: slob ma rnams khyad par du mkhas par 'byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slob ma rnams khyad par du mkhas par 'byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the difference between students who are more and more learned.

original: skyes ma thag pa rnams la yang dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan snang ste /
analyzed: skyes ma thag pa rnams la yang dga' ba dang / 'jigs pa dang / mya ngan snang ste /
translated: Even in those who are born, joy, fear, and sorrow appear.

original: des na sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na sngon gyi goms pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, previous habituation is inferred.

original: tshe gzhan du mchog gi rim par dbye ba na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe gzhan du mchog gi rim par dbye ba na shes rab la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: When divided into the stages of the highest in another life, through the differences of wisdom and so on, it becomes the wisdom of omniscience.

original: lta ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol don du lta ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa la sogs par lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba gnyis zhes bya ba ni phyi rol don du lta ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa la sogs par lta ba'o //
translated: The two views are the view of external objects and the view of action, agent, and so on.

original: rkyen ni mi rtag pa de ma thag pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: rkyen ni mi rtag pa de ma thag pa tsam gyis so //
translated: The condition is merely the impermanent immediately preceding condition.

original: mi spang ba ni spang bar mi bya ba ste blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi spang ba ni spang bar mi bya ba ste blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúNot to be abandoned‚Äù means not to be rejected; the meaning is that it is to be accepted.

original: gang zag med ces pa ni rtag par snang ba rnam par rtag pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang zag med ces pa ni rtag par snang ba rnam par rtag pa ni med do //
translated: ‚ÄúNo person‚Äù means that the appearance of permanence is not real.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni phung po lus gzhan gyi dbang la rmi lam dang 'dra bar rgyu yod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams ni phung po lus gzhan gyi dbang la rmi lam dang 'dra bar rgyu yod do //
translated: ‚ÄúAttachment and so on‚Äù means that attachment and so on have a cause, like a dream, in the body of the aggregates, which is other-powered.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rnam par 'byed par dpyad pa gsum pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las grub pa'i mtha'i tshul rnam par 'byed par dpyad pa gsum pa'o /
translated: This concludes the analysis of the third chapter, called ‚ÄúThe Analysis of Philosophy,‚Äù in the treatise called ‚ÄúAn Analysis of the Way Things Are,‚Äù composed by the master ƒÄryadeva.

original: // / yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos gsol ba'o //
analyzed: // / yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' blo gros chen pos gsol ba'o //
translated: The noble one, the bodhisattva MahƒÅmati, said, ‚ÄúThe imagined is not real,‚Äù and so on.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gsol ba'i lan du gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gsol ba'i lan du gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One, in reply to his request, said,

original: blo gros chen @159a * //
analyzed: blo gros chen @159a * //
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati,

original: po don rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs su yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa la mngon par chags pas mi rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: po don rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs su yang dag pa ma yin par kun tu brtags pa la mngon par chags pas mi rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The various different objects are not real, but are imagined. Because of attachment to them, the thoughts of people arise.

original: don rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs ni snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: don rnam pa tha dad pa sna tshogs ni snang ba rnam pa sna tshogs pa thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs par brtag go //
translated: The various different objects are all the various appearances, which should be understood as the Buddha's intention.

original: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du nang 'khrugs pa'i mthus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du nang 'khrugs pa'i mthus rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as when one is dizzy or faints, various kinds of consciousness arise by the power of an internal disturbance.

original: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don rtog pa'i rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa gang la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yod
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das phyi rol gyi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi don rtog pa'i rdul phra mo'i rdzas la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa gang la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yod
translated: The Blessed One said, External objects, etc. External objects are various substances of subtle particles, etc., which are not real but are imagined. Where there is the characteristic of imagination,

original: pa de de lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa de de lta bu'o //
translated: that is like that.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su lhung ba'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de de lta bu ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs su lhung ba'i mtshan nyid gang la yod pa de de lta bu ste /
translated: That which has the characteristic of falling into the position of existence or non-existence is just that.

original: don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa las bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa las bzlog pa'o //
translated: It is the opposite of the non-dual ultimate reality.üîΩJust as the external object is invalidated by valid cognition, yet the engagement of incorrect imagination occurs, in the same way, the non-dual ultimate reality is also similar to the engagement of incorrect imagination in the sense-cognitions and inferences, which are beyond the cause of parts and example.

original: de ji ltar phyi rol gyi don la tshad mas gnod kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa yang dbang po'i shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pa cha shas kyi rgyu dang dpe las 'das pa der yang yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa mtshungs na bcom ldan 'das der de ji lta bu zhig ces glengs pa'o //
analyzed: de ji ltar phyi rol gyi don la tshad mas gnod kyang yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa 'jug pa de bzhin du don dam pa mi gnyis pa'i chud pa yang dbang po'i shes pa dang / rjes su dpag pa cha shas kyi rgyu dang dpe las 'das pa der yang yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa mtshungs na bcom ldan 'das der de ji lta bu zhig ces glengs pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, How is that?

original: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhes pa ni mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags shing zhes pa ni mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: Attachment to the characteristic of ultimate reality refers to the own-characteristic of non-dual correct knowledge.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa ste /
translated: Imagination is incorrect imagination.

original: don dam pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the opposite of the ultimate.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba la phyi rol gyi rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs su snang ba la phyi rol gyi rtag pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa ni yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa ste /
translated: The false imagination is the superimposition of external things as permanent, beautiful, and so on, in the appearances of various aspects.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi gzung ba'i cha la mngon par chags pa'i don te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi gzung ba'i cha la mngon par chags pa'i don te /
translated: It is the clinging to the objective aspect of the dependent nature.

original: rmi lam ltar snang ba las slu ba dang / slu ba med pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam ltar snang ba las slu ba dang / slu ba med pa'o //
translated: It is like a dream, in that it is both deceptive and nondeceptive.

original: yod pa dang / med par lta ba ni mu stegs byed kyi lta ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med par lta ba ni mu stegs byed kyi lta ba'o //
translated: The views of existence and nonexistence are the views of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: so sor rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang / bdag gir rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rnam par rtog pa ni bdag dang / bdag gir rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The discriminations are the discriminations of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: ji ltar gsungs pa /üîΩyang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: ji ltar gsungs pa / yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: As it has been taught:üîΩThe false imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: Is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: zhes pa'o // 'phags pa blo gros chen pos @159b kyang de ste rgyu las yang dag pa ma yin kun du rtog pa 'di yin na ni don dang sgra'i chos su mthun pas ji ltar na phyi rol gyi don ma mchis /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'phags pa blo gros chen pos @159b kyang de ste rgyu las yang dag pa ma yin kun du rtog pa 'di yin na ni don dang sgra'i chos su mthun pas ji ltar na phyi rol gyi don ma mchis /
translated: The noble one, MahƒÅmati, also said, ‚ÄúIf this imagination of what is unreal is the cause, then, because of the concordance of the object and the word, how is there no external object?üîΩTherefore, it would be the cause of non-equivalence.‚Äù

original: des na mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes glengs pa las thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gleng ba la yongs su spong bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: des na mi mtshungs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro zhes glengs pa las thams cad mkhyen pas kyang gleng ba la yongs su spong bar mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One, having been addressed in this way, completely rejected this:

original: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba 'am ldog pa med do zhes te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po rnam par rtog pa 'byung ba 'am ldog pa med do zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, the arising or cessation of conceptualization does not exist.

original: yang dag pa la des brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa la des brjod du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the real cannot be expressed by that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yod pa dang med pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba dang / phyi rol gyi snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtog pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba dang / phyi rol gyi snang ba'i dngos po med pa dang / rang gi sems snang ba tsam du rtog pa ste /
translated: Conceptualization does not arise from existence or nonexistence, external appearing things do not exist, and one realizes that it is one‚Äôs own mind that appears as everything.

original: blo gros chen po byis pa rnams rang gi sems rnam pa sna tshogs su phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags pas bsam pa skyon can du gyur nas rnam par rtog pas brtags te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po byis pa rnams rang gi sems rnam pa sna tshogs su phyi rol gyi bar sgro btags pas bsam pa skyon can du gyur nas rnam par rtog pas brtags te /
translated: Mahamati, because of their own minds' various external projections, the childish become flawed in their thinking and are conceptualized by conceptualization.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pas lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung bar bshad do zhes te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa sna tshogs kyi dngos po'i mtshan nyid la mngon par chags pas lo rgyus las byung ba sngon du 'gro ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i 'byung bar bshad do zhes te /
translated: They are attached to the characteristics of things that are various unreal conceptualizations, and so I explain that they arise from conceptualization that is preceded by stories.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas bshad pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pas bshad pa ni /
translated: The noble Maitreya, the most venerable one, explained the non-existence of the duality of the imagined and the dependent in the Madhyantavibhaga:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: des na gnyis po yod ma yin //
analyzed: des na gnyis po yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, the duality does not exist.

original: stong pa nyid kyang de na yod //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang de na yod //
translated: Emptiness exists therein.

original: de la yang ni de yod do //
analyzed: de la yang ni de yod do //
translated: And in that, it also exists.

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //üîΩzhes pas te /
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //üîΩzhes pas te /
translated: Is mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba 'dus pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba 'dus pa las rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the combination of mind and mental factors, conceptualization arises.‚Äù

original: ji ltar nang 'khrugs pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nang 'khrugs pas mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa 'byung ste /
translated: Just as, for example, when the internal organs are disturbed, there is dizziness, fainting, and so on.

original: des na yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: des na yang dag pa ma yin par yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a false imagination.

original: de gnyis kyis stong ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyis stong ste /
translated: It is empty of those two.

original: stong pa nyid kyang de na yod do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyang de na yod do //
translated: Emptiness is present there.

original: de na yang de yod de /
analyzed: de na yang de yod de /
translated: And it is present there.

original: byis pa rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la yang dag pa ma yin pas yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a false imagination for the childish.

original: yod pa dang med pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni snang du zin kyang nor ba'i rnam pa la skye ba med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las rnam par rtog pa mi 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni snang du zin kyang nor ba'i rnam pa la skye ba med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConceptualization does not arise from existence or nonexistence‚Äù means that even if it appears, it does not arise in the form of error. This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa med pa nyid pas na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du skye ba med do //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa med pa nyid pas na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib la sogs pa snang ba bzhin du skye ba med do //
translated: Since it is devoid of the aspect of duality, it does not arise like appearances in dreams, illusions, and eye diseases, and so on.

original: thog ma med @160a * //
analyzed: thog ma med @160a * //
translated: Since beginningless time,

original: pa'i sems kyi rgyud gang la yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa kun rtog pa de la yang tha dad pa'i byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bar mi rung bar thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa bzhin gyis bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: pa'i sems kyi rgyud gang la yang skye ba dang gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa kun rtog pa de la yang tha dad pa'i byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel bar mi rung bar thams cad mkhyen pas rigs pa bzhin gyis bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: is not suitable to be related as an action and an agent that are different.

original: yod pa dang med pa las mi skye zhes te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa las mi skye zhes te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt does not arise from the existent or the nonexistent.‚Äù

original: yod pa ni dngos su yod pas grangs can la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i skye ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yod pa ni dngos su yod pas grangs can la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i skye ba mi rung ngo //
translated: The existent is actually existent, so the origination imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on is not suitable.

original: med pa yang dngos po bya mi nus te /
analyzed: med pa yang dngos po bya mi nus te /
translated: The nonexistent also cannot perform an entity.

original: dngos po med ces pa ni cang mi byed pa ni byed pa dgag par gyur pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po med ces pa ni cang mi byed pa ni byed pa dgag par gyur pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: ‚Äú Nonexistent‚Äù means not doing anything; it is called the negation of doing.

original: rnam grangs mang por bshad do //
analyzed: rnam grangs mang por bshad do //
translated: It is explained in many synonyms.

original: 'on te yod pa dang med pa las mi skye na ni ji ltar na 'dis byed do zhes bya /
analyzed: 'on te yod pa dang med pa las mi skye na ni ji ltar na 'dis byed do zhes bya /
translated: But if it does not arise from the existent or the nonexistent, how can it be said, ‚ÄúIt does this‚Äù?

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po yang mi rung ngo zhes pa de thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa'i tha snyad mi rung ba ni don ji bzhin pa'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos po yang mi rung ngo zhes pa de thams cad mkhyen pas bsgrub par mdzad pa byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa'i tha snyad mi rung ba ni don ji bzhin pa'i 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Omniscient One has established that the entities of the apprehender and the apprehended are not tenable, because the conventions of the agent, action, and instrument are not tenable in reality, due to the absence of the apprehension of the apprehender and the apprehended.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Imagination occurs in relation to consciousness that has the aspect of duality.

original: blo gros chen po gzhan du na zhes pa ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por byed pa dang / byed pa pos bskyed do zhes rang gi sems snang ba la kun brtags te /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gzhan du na zhes pa ni 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i dngos por byed pa dang / byed pa pos bskyed do zhes rang gi sems snang ba la kun brtags te /
translated: MahƒÅmati, otherwise, the agent and the action are imagined in relation to the appearances of one‚Äôs own mind, thinking that the entities of the apprehender and the apprehended are produced by the agent.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos po med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos po med do zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o /
translated: The Omniscient One thinks that external things do not exist.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis rnam par dpyad de /
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom

original: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi gnyis pa'i ye shes gnas so //
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par phye ba na phyi rol gyi mi dmigs pa de'i tshe mi gnyis pa'i ye shes gnas so //
translated: and distinguishes the coarse and the subtle, if external things are not observed, at that time the nondual wisdom abides.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba rgyun du 'byung ba yang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba rgyun du 'byung ba yang byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rjod pa dang / brjod pa la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba thams cad dang bral ba'i don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The ultimate truth is free from all the appearances of conceptual thought, such as the agent and the object of action, the speaker and the object of speech, and so on, which are the continuous occurrence of the grasping and the grasped.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes bya bar snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rab tu chud pa la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na sems can thams cad la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rten cing 'brel
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes bya bar snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin dag pa 'jig rten pa'i rab tu chud pa la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na sems can thams cad la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rten cing 'brel
translated: The pure mundane wisdom of the samƒÅdhi that appears as ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be‚Äù arises for the Omniscient One in order to illuminate for all sentient beings the various aspects of dependent origination.

original: te 'byung ba rab tu snang bar mdzad pa'i don du las dang 'bras bur so sor nges par 'brel ba'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: te 'byung ba rab tu snang bar mdzad pa'i don du las dang 'bras bur so sor nges par 'brel ba'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma that is connected with the definite connection between action and result arises.

original: snang ba bzhin du rjes su mthun par khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir phyogs dang / rgyu dang / dpe dang / khyab @160b pa'i tshul dang / chos mthun pa dang / mi mthun par mthun par gsungs so //
analyzed: snang ba bzhin du rjes su mthun par khong du chud par mdzad pa'i phyir phyogs dang / rgyu dang / dpe dang / khyab @160b pa'i tshul dang / chos mthun pa dang / mi mthun par mthun par gsungs so //
translated: In order to make them understand in accordance with the way things appear, he taught in terms of directions, causes, examples, pervasions, similarities, and dissimilarities.

original: gang skyes par rig pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
analyzed: gang skyes par rig pa de ni mi rtag pa ste /
translated: Whatever is known to arise is impermanent.

original: thal mo'i sgra dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / chu zla la sogs pa bzhin du thog ma dang / tha ma'i mthar stong pa'o //
analyzed: thal mo'i sgra dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / chu zla la sogs pa bzhin du thog ma dang / tha ma'i mthar stong pa'o //
translated: Like the sound of a clap, a dream, a magical illusion, blurred vision, or the moon in water, it is empty in the beginning and in the end.

original: skyes pa ni rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshad mas chud pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshad mas chud pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'o //
translated: One who knows that what arises is impermanent is omniscient.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pas bslad de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rnam par rtog pas bslad de /
translated: Those who are deluded by the concepts of existence and nonexistence

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni gzugs yod la rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes gang dag grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa de dag la phyi rol gyi don ni snang ba tsam dang /
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i dus na ni gzugs yod la rmi lam gyi dus na med do zhes gang dag grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa de dag la phyi rol gyi don ni snang ba tsam dang /
translated: Those who are attached to external objects, such as the Samkhyas, the Aul≈´kyas, the Vaisheshikas, the Kashyapaparivarta, the Lokayata, and so on, are refuted by the analogy of the mere appearance of external objects.

original: mtshungs pas na lhag par bsgrub pa med do zhes spyis khyab pa'i tshul du gsungs so //
analyzed: mtshungs pas na lhag par bsgrub pa med do zhes spyis khyab pa'i tshul du gsungs so //
translated: Since there is no need to establish anything further, this is stated in the manner of a general pervasion.

original: gang gis gzugs ni de ltar cung zad cig ni yod /
analyzed: gang gis gzugs ni de ltar cung zad cig ni yod /
translated: If one says that form is partly existent and partly nonexistent, then one would be propounding a contradiction.

original: cung zad cig ni med do zhe na ni mi mtshungs par smra bar yang 'gyur na de 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas yongs su spong ba ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni med do zhe na ni mi mtshungs par smra bar yang 'gyur na de 'phags pa blo gros chen pos glengs pa la thams cad mkhyen pas yongs su spong ba ni phyi rol gyi don med pa'i phyir zhes te /
translated: However, in the sutra the omniscient one refutes this in the context of the discussion of the noble Mahaprajna:

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par brtags pa ni bla 'og tu phyogs kyi char 'byed pas rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par brtags pa ni bla 'og tu phyogs kyi char 'byed pas rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: The external gross and subtle objects are divided into upper and lower parts, and so on, and when they are divided, they become empty like a house, an army, a forest, and so on.

original: rdul phra mo rnams kyang yan lag med pas na bla 'og tu chags shing tshogs su 'du bar mi rung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams kyang yan lag med pas na bla 'og tu chags shing tshogs su 'du bar mi rung ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: The subtle particles also are without parts, and so it is not possible for them to be arranged in a pile, one on top of the other, like mind and mental factors.

original: des na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dbang dang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas rnam pa sna tshogs su bslad pas rnam par shes pa sna tshogs gyi  rnam pa snang ngo //
analyzed: des na bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud dbang dang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pas rnam pa sna tshogs su bslad pas rnam par shes pa sna tshogs gyi  rnam pa snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the various appearances of consciousness are polluted by the various forms of ignorance, which do not rest in the equality of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô mental continua.

original: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad nas shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pas gnas so //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad nas shes par bya ba mi dmigs pa de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pas gnas so //
translated: When one analyzes with wisdom and does not observe anything to be known, then, without thought and without appearance, one rests in the ultimate truth, which is nondual, by means of right knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi don du thugs rjes snang ba dang bcas pa dag gis 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na phyi rol gyi don med par yang chos 'chad pa 'byung @161a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du thugs rjes snang ba dang bcas pa dag gis 'jig rten gyi ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa na phyi rol gyi don med par yang chos 'chad pa 'byung @161a * //
translated: The Buddha, who has compassion for others and who appears in the world, teaches the Dharma even though external objects do not exist.üîΩAll dharmas, whether afflicted or unafflicted, are included in the three natures: imagined, other-dependent, and reality.

original: ngo ; / brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa rnams su nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos thams cad bsdu ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: ngo ; / brtags pa dang gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa rnams su nyon mongs pa dang nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos thams cad bsdu ba ni phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba dang /
translated: The aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: the thirty-seven factors of awakening, the ten powers, the four forms of fearlessness, and so on are included in the other-dependent nature.

original: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gnyis su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang gnyis su bsdu'o //
translated: The truths of suffering and origin, which are afflicted, are included in the imagined and other-dependent natures.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa rnams dang / 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
translated: The unafflicted truths of cessation and path are included in the perfected nature.

original: khams gsum 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes so //
analyzed: khams gsum 'di ni sems tsam mo zhes so //
translated: The three realms are mind only.

original: sa bcu pa dang / lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: sa bcu pa dang / lang kar gshegs pa las gsungs pa ni /
translated: The Ten Stages and the Mission to Lanka state:

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, enjoyments, and the appearance of the abode

original: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun tu 'byung ba ste //
translated: are the universal ground and the universal occurrence.

original: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: The eight and the nine are like

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //
translated: the waves of the ocean.

original: yang lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang lang kar gshegs par gsungs pa /
translated: The Mission to Lanka also states:

original: brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes te /
analyzed: brtags pa dang / rnam par brtags pa dang / chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes te /
translated: The form of the imagined, the form of the discrimination, and the form of reality.üîΩThe imagined is the mere thing,

original: brtags pa dngos po tsam pa dang // khyad par du ni rnam par brtags //
analyzed: brtags pa dngos po tsam pa dang // khyad par du ni rnam par brtags //
translated: and the discrimination is the particular.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is the intrinsic identity

original: chos nyid gzugs ni de yin no //üîΩzhes pa'o // de la brtags pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid gzugs ni de yin no // zhes pa'o // de la brtags pa ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid du brtags pa'o //
translated: is the form of reality.üîΩAmong these, the imagined is the imagined nature.

original: de nyid la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog gi /
analyzed: de nyid la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i chos su rnam par rtog gi /
translated: The discrimination is the discrimination of the imagined as permanent, impermanent, and so on,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i yul ni med do //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa brtags pa'i yul ni med do //
translated: but the object imagined as permanent and so on does not exist.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i 'khrul pa dang bral ba ni grub pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i 'khrul pa dang bral ba ni grub pa ste /
translated: The establishment of the form of the two is the freedom from the error of the two.

original: chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid kyi gzugs zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the form of reality.

original: 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pa'i dgongs pa byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa btsun gtso byams pa'i dgongs pa byed pa yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of the intention of the noble Maitreya, the chief of the venerable, the false imagination, is as follows:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog ni //
translated: The false imagination

original: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
analyzed: sems dang sems byung khams gsum pa //
translated: Is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.

original: de na don mthong rnam par shes //
analyzed: de na don mthong rnam par shes //
translated: There, the seeing of objects is consciousness.

original: de yi khyad par sems las byung //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de yi khyad par sems las byung // zhes pa ste /
translated: Its distinctions are mental factors.

original: khams gsum gyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa thams cad kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa thams cad kyang sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs su bsdu'o //
translated: All the phenomena of the three realms, whether afflicted or unafflicted, are included in the collection of mind and mental factors.

original: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa sems @161b las byung ba rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa yongs su shes pas 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa sems @161b las byung ba rnams yongs su zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By fully understanding the selflessness of phenomena and persons, the mental factors of attachment, aversion, and so on are completely exhausted.

original: kun du 'gro ba /
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba /
translated: The universal

original: tshor ba sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dod pa reg pa blo dran dang // yid la byed pa mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems kun la ste //
analyzed: tshor ba sems pa 'du shes dang // 'dod pa reg pa blo dran dang // yid la byed pa mos pa dang // ting nge 'dzin sems kun la ste //
translated: Attention, resolve, and concentration are in all minds.

original: sems las byung ba dag pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dag pa rnams ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las 'byung ngo //
translated: The pure mental factors arise from the concentration of the pure omniscience that is accompanied by the light of the world.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa der rig pa dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems bdag nyid la yang mi rgyun bag chags kyis dus kyi kun du 'gro ba'i sems las byung ba rnams snang bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos /üîΩ'on kyang thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa der rig pa dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems bdag nyid la yang mi rgyun bag chags kyis dus kyi kun du 'gro ba'i sems las byung ba rnams snang bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos / 'on kyang thugs rje'i bag chags kyis bskul te /
translated: The ultimate truth, which is free from thought and appearance, is the nondual perfect realization. In that, the appearance of the mind as the entity of the knower and the known does not occur, let alone the appearance of the mental factors that are the habitual tendencies of time.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin sems las byung ba dag pa rnams so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin sems las byung ba dag pa rnams so sor snang ngo //
translated: However, the pure mental factors that are the concentration accompanied by light appear individually, since they are impelled by the habitual tendencies of compassion.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par spyir sgra dang don du sgro btags ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / gtsang ba'i dngos por phyin ci log pa'i gnyen por mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par spyir sgra dang don du sgro btags ste /
translated: The antidote to the error of permanence, self, pleasure, and purity is the contemplation of impermanence, suffering, the ugly, and emptiness.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid la yang chos ston pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa dang / rang gi mtshan nyid la yang chos ston pa 'jug ste /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is applied to the general superimposition of sound and meaning and to the individual characteristics of the two kinds of consciousness.

original: de ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa rnams su chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa rnams su chos thams cad kyi mtshan nyid 'byed pa ste /
translated: All phenomena are classified as the imagined, the dependent, and the perfected.

original: de la thams cad mkhyen pas brtags pa la rnam pa bcur sngar bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga ste /
analyzed: de la thams cad mkhyen pas brtags pa la rnam pa bcur sngar bshad pa ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga dang / mig la sogs pa dbang po lnga ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has explained the imagined as tenfold above. These are the five objects such as form and the five sense faculties such as the eye.

original: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du sgro btags te /
translated: They are imagined to be external objects.

original: rdul phra mo'i brtsams pa'i rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs par rtog pas brtags pa kho nar brtag go //
analyzed: rdul phra mo'i brtsams pa'i rdzas dang / yon tan la sogs par rtog pas brtags pa kho nar brtag go //
translated: The imagined is only imagined as substances, qualities, etc.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni /
translated: The dependent is

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: the body, the enjoyments, the abode, and the appearance.

original: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste //üîΩrnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
analyzed: kun gzhi kun du 'byung ba ste // rnam brgyad rnam dgu de bzhin du //
translated: The universal ground is the origin of everything.

original: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o //üîΩzhes par gsal lo //
analyzed: rgya mtsho rlabs rnams bzhin du'o // zhes par gsal lo //
translated: It is like the ocean and its waves.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The universal ground consciousness

original: gzhan gyi dbang du rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du rgyu dang rkyen las skyes pa ste /
translated: is the dependent, arising from causes and conditions.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bshad pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rgyus @162a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bshad pa la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi rgyus @162a * //
translated: It is the cause of the various imprints that are made by the various explanations of the sacred and non-sacred dharmas, etc.

original: btab pa'i 'du byed sna tshogs nyid 'byung ngo //
analyzed: btab pa'i 'du byed sna tshogs nyid 'byung ngo //
translated: The various formations arise from the power of the imprints of the various explanations of the sacred and non-sacred dharmas, etc.

original: gzhan yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni kun gzhi 'di las yang dag pa ma yin pa phyi rol gyi gzhan par yongs su rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa'i sgras brjod par bya ba ni kun gzhi 'di las yang dag pa ma yin pa phyi rol gyi gzhan par yongs su rtog pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the expression ‚Äúthe unreal imagination‚Äù refers to the imagination of the unreal external things from this universal ground.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gnyis kyi rnam pa yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i tshogs gnyis kyi rnam pa yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The two groups of mind and mental functions are unreal.

original: der yang lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / phyi rol gyi la sogs par sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: der yang lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / phyi rol gyi la sogs par sems can rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: In that regard, the conceptualization of sentient beings occurs in regard to the appearance of body, enjoyment, and abode as permanent, impermanent, external, and so on.

original: de nyid du mtshan ma dang / ming dang / rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i chos lnga rnam par gzhag go /
analyzed: de nyid du mtshan ma dang / ming dang / rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba'i chos lnga rnam par gzhag go /
translated: In that regard, the five dharmas are established, called sign source, name, conceptualization, correct knowing, and suchness.

original: de la gnyis kyi khyad par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gnyis kyi khyad par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Among them, the difference between the two should be taught.

original: gzhan gyi dbang sgra dang don du 'byed pa na mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang sgra dang don du 'byed pa na mtshan ma'o //
translated: When the dependent is divided into sound and meaning, it is the sign source.

original: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang de nyid lus dang longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'o //
translated: That very dependent appears as body, enjoyment, and abode.

original: ming ni brtags pa'i dngos por bsdu ste /
analyzed: ming ni brtags pa'i dngos por bsdu ste /
translated: Name is included in the imagined thing.

original: kun tu brtags pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag la sogs pa dngos po'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The imagined is the object of things such as permanence and self.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du bsdu'o //
translated: Conceptualization is included in the dependent.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid dag ni yongs su grub par bsdu ste /
translated: Correct wisdom and suchness are included in the real.

original: de ltar na yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyis de bzhin nyid gnyis kyi rnam par dang bral ba nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar na yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi lam gyis de bzhin nyid gnyis kyi rnam par dang bral ba nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' rtogs par byed de /
translated: Thus, by the path of correct wisdom, one realizes the limit of reality, which is the freedom from the two types of conceptualization of suchness.

original: de ni lan du mar bshad pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni lan du mar bshad pa dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied to the many explanations.

original: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes yongs su rtog pa mdo'i don du dpyad pa bzhin pa'o /
analyzed: 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos bshad pa sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa zhes yongs su rtog pa mdo'i don du dpyad pa bzhin pa'o /
translated: In the third chapter of the glorious wisdom-filled good explanation of the noble Lankavatara, the meaning of the sutra is analyzed in terms of the non-reality of conceptualization.

original: // / rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams kyis //
analyzed: // / rgyu rnams dang rkyen rnams kyis //
translated: The causes and conditions

original: gang rnams 'jig rten 'byung zhes pa //
analyzed: gang rnams 'jig rten 'byung zhes pa //
translated: From which the world arises

original: mtha' bzhi dang ni ldan pa ste //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dang ni ldan pa ste //
translated: Are endowed with the four extremes,

original: de dag nga yi tshul ni shes //
analyzed: de dag nga yi tshul ni shes //
translated: But they know my way.

original: zhes pa ni gnyis med pa'i shes pa la /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gnyis med pa'i shes pa la /
translated: This is about non-dual consciousness.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzung gi / gnyis med pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por gzung gi / gnyis med pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The relation of cause and effect is accepted, but not the relation of non-duality.

original: gang gnyis kyi gzugs yin pa de ni rmi lam dang / skad cig pa snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba yang 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: gang gnyis kyi gzugs yin pa de ni rmi lam dang / skad cig pa snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod pas 'di yod do zhes rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba yang 'dzin gyi /
translated: That which is the form of duality is grasped as the relation of cause and effect, ‚ÄúWhen this exists, that comes to be,‚Äù because it exists after the prior moment of the cause.

original: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel pa ni med do //
analyzed: byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel pa ni med do //
translated: But there is no relation of agent and action.

original: skad cig gi @162b dus ma gtogs par skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: skad cig gi @162b dus ma gtogs par skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because arising, enduring, and ceasing are impossible except in the moment.

original: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po ba rnams klog pa /
analyzed: ji ltar dge 'dun chen po ba rnams klog pa /
translated: As the MahƒÅsƒÅ·πÉghika reciters recite:

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All formations are momentary.üîΩHow can they be unstable and active?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is active.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: It is also called the agent.

original: ces te / de de lta bur lhag pa'i skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos med pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: ces te / de de lta bur lhag pa'i skye ba dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos med pas rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ni skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Thus, since such a dependent origination is devoid of the phenomena of arising, enduring, and ceasing, etc., it has the characteristic of non-arising, non-ceasing, etc.

original: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar dbu ma las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said in the Madhyamaka:

original: 'gog med skya ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // gcig don du ma'i don min dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
analyzed: 'gog med skya ba med pa dang // rtag med chad pa med pa dang // gcig don du ma'i don min dang // 'ong ba med pa 'gro ba med //
translated: Non-cessation, non-arising, non-annihilation, non-permanence, non-identity, non-difference, non-coming, non-going,

original: ces bya ba la sogs par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs par rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The dependent origination explained above is referred to by such terms as ‚Äúnon-cessation‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-arising.‚Äù

original: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
analyzed: gal te skye ba 'dus byas na //
translated: If arising were conditioned,

original: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum ldan der rig ste //
translated: It would have the three characteristics.

original: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba 'dus ma byas //
translated: But if arising were unconditioned,

original: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
analyzed: 'dus byas mtshan nyid ji ltar rung //
translated: How could it be a characteristic of the conditioned?

original: de de ltar yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par 'gyur bas smra ba bdun du phye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de de ltar yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par 'gyur bas smra ba bdun du phye ba las ma gtogs pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba rig par bya'o //
translated: Since it would be both existent and nonexistent, and neither existent nor nonexistent, it should be understood that dependent origination is not included in the seven positions.

original: grangs can rnams ni yod par smra ba ste /
analyzed: grangs can rnams ni yod par smra ba ste /
translated: The Enumerators are proponents of existence.

original: yod pa skye'o zhes pa ni dngos por yod pas na skye bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: yod pa skye'o zhes pa ni dngos por yod pas na skye bar mi rigs so //
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúan existent arises,‚Äù since it already exists as a thing, it is illogical that it arises.

original: med pa skye'o zhes pa na /
analyzed: med pa skye'o zhes pa na /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúa nonexistent arises,‚Äù

original: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can la sogs pa kun rtog pa yang dngos po med par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can la sogs pa kun rtog pa yang dngos po med par byed pa ni /
translated: the imagination of the particular, the universal, and so on are also rendered as nonexistent things.

original: ci yang mi byed pa ste /
analyzed: ci yang mi byed pa ste /
translated: Since it does not do anything at all,

original: byed pa dgag par byed pas gyur pa nyid do zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: byed pa dgag par byed pas gyur pa nyid do zhes lan du mar bshad pa'o //
translated: it is said many times that it is a negation of activity.üîΩIf it is said that ‚Äúboth an existent and a nonexistent arise‚Äù and ‚Äúneither an existent nor a nonexistent arises,‚Äù

original: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa ni yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba dang / smra bar mi bya bar 'gyur ba'o zhes te /
analyzed: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa ni yod par 'gyur ba dang / med par 'gyur ba dang / yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba dang / smra bar mi bya bar 'gyur ba'o zhes te /
translated: it would follow that it both exists and does not exist, and it would be inexpressible.

original: bstan pa la ni rang bzhin gnyis su mi srid de /
analyzed: bstan pa la ni rang bzhin gnyis su mi srid de /
translated: But it is not possible for an existent to have two natures.

original: der gang don byed nus de yod //
analyzed: der gang don byed nus de yod //
translated: That which is able to perform a function exists there.

original: ces lan du mar bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ces lan du mar bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: This has been established many times.

original: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: All things are unproduced.

original: zhes bya ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: This is the reason that is stated:

original: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: gang phyir rkyen las byung bas na // zhes pa ste /
translated: Because they arise from conditions.

original: gang zag rkyen las byung ba de dang de dag ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag rkyen las byung ba de dang de dag ma skyes pa ste /
translated: The person who arises from conditions is unproduced,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: rkyen rnams thams cad 'bras bu ste //üîΩ'bras bu @163a * //
analyzed: rkyen rnams thams cad 'bras bu ste // 'bras bu @163a * //
translated: All conditions are effects.

original: las ni mi srid skye //
analyzed: las ni mi srid skye //
translated: An effect does not arise from an effect.

original: zhes pa ni rmi lam du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rgyun bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa ni rmi lam du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po rgyun bzhin no //
translated: This is like the continuity of the entity of cause and effect in a dream.üîΩIf it were to arise from an effect, what would be the problem?

original: de ste 'bras bu las 'byung na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ste 'bras bu las 'byung na nyes pa cir 'gyur zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One said this:

original: 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur bas na //
analyzed: 'bras bu gnyis su 'gyur bas na //
translated: Because there would be two effects,

original: 'bras bu la ni 'bras mi skye //
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni 'bras mi skye //
translated: An effect does not arise from an effect.

original: rnam pa gnyis su rab 'gyur bas //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su rab 'gyur bas //
translated: Because there would be two aspects,

original: 'bras bu'i dngos por mi dmigs so //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i dngos por mi dmigs so //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: The entity of an effect is not observed.

original: gal te 'bras bu las 'bras bu skye na ni lhan cig pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu las 'bras bu skye na ni lhan cig pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If an effect were to arise from an effect, the error of simultaneity would follow.

original: ma zhig pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: ma zhig pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The meaning of the statement by the Omniscient One that ‚Äúarising occurs from the nondisintegrated‚Äù should be investigated.

original: zhig pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir skyes pa'i mthu med de /
analyzed: zhig pa yang dngos po med pa'i phyir skyes pa'i mthu med de /
translated: Since the disintegrated is a nonentity, it has no power to arise.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes 'ba' zhig go //
translated: It is only said that ‚Äúif this exists, that occurs‚Äù after the prior.

original: khyad par can dang lung ston pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos lhag par byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel pa med par 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dang lung ston pa la sogs pas kun brtags pa'i skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos lhag par byed pa dang / byed pa por 'brel pa med par 'byung ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o //
translated: The arising, enduring, ceasing, etc., that are imagined by the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the NaiyƒÅyikas, etc., and the special qualities, such as the one that is revealed, etc., that are imagined by the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, etc., are not related to the agent and the action.
