original: gang zag la bdag med par skad cig mar 'jig pa la'ang med na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba med pa'i chos la bdag med pa lta ga la zhig /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med par skad cig mar 'jig pa la'ang med na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa lta bur gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba med pa'i chos la bdag med pa lta ga la zhig /
translated: If the selflessness of persons and the momentariness of things do not exist, how could the selflessness of phenomena exist, which is like a dream, an illusion, etc., and is free from the duality of arising?

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gog pa med pa sogs pa de lta bur bdag med pa gnyis la yang rig par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gog pa med pa sogs pa de lta bur bdag med pa gnyis la yang rig par bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The Omniscient One intended that the two kinds of selflessness should be understood in the same way.

original: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di 'chad pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa dang / don dam par dpyad pa na sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di 'chad pa ni yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa dang / don dam par dpyad pa na sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of this verse on the summary is as follows. When one examines the ultimate, as was explained above,

original: dmigs dang dmigs bya med par yang //
analyzed: dmigs dang dmigs bya med par yang //
translated: there is neither objective referent nor reference

original: nam zhig 'dus byas rnams mthong na //
analyzed: nam zhig 'dus byas rnams mthong na //
translated: when one sees the conditioned.

original: sems med pa yi sems tsam ste //
analyzed: sems med pa yi sems tsam ste //
translated: The mind-only without mind

original: sems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: sems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained as mind-only.

original: zhes pa ni nam zhig shes rab kyis dpyad de dmigs pa sbom po dang / phra mo tha dad par rnam par phye ba na phyi rol gyi don med par 'dus byas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar mthong ba de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa
analyzed: zhes pa ni nam zhig shes rab kyis dpyad de dmigs pa sbom po dang / phra mo tha dad par rnam par phye ba na phyi rol gyi don med par 'dus byas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral bar mthong ba de na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa
translated: When one examines with wisdom and distinguishes the gross and subtle objective referents, then one sees the conditioned, free from object and subject, without external referents. At that time, without thought and without appearance, one realizes the ultimate truth, nondual.

original: ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor du gnas pa na sems tsam du ngas bshad do zhes so //
analyzed: ni snang ba dang bcas pa'i dbyangs kyi dkyil 'khor du gnas pa na sems tsam du ngas bshad do zhes so //
translated: I explain that when it abides in the ma·πá·∏çala of sound together with appearance, it is mind only.

original: thams cad mkhyen @163b pas gnyis dang mi gnyis par dam pa'i chos ston pa na sgra dang don du 'byed do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen @163b pas gnyis dang mi gnyis par dam pa'i chos ston pa na sgra dang don du 'byed do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: When the Omniscient One teaches the Dharma, he distinguishes between sound and meaning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni snga ma'i le'ur yang dpyad pa ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni snga ma'i le'ur yang dpyad pa ste /
translated: The nature of cause and effect was also analyzed in the previous chapter.

original: rkyen rnams kyis ni cung zad kyang //
analyzed: rkyen rnams kyis ni cung zad kyang //
translated: By conditions, not even the slightest

original: skye zhing 'gag pa der med de //
analyzed: skye zhing 'gag pa der med de //
translated: arising or ceasing exists.

original: rkyen rnams brtags pa nyid dag ni //
analyzed: rkyen rnams brtags pa nyid dag ni //
translated: The mere examination of conditions

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: is arising and ceasing.

original: ji tsam du nang 'khrugs pa'i rgyu las mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes te /
analyzed: ji tsam du nang 'khrugs pa'i rgyu las mgo 'khor ba dang brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa skyes te /
translated: To the extent that there is internal agitation, like dizziness and fainting, consciousness arises in the aspect of duality from the power of one‚Äôs own continuum and the continuum of another.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs lta bur snang ba de tsam du rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs par tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs lta bur snang ba de tsam du rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs par tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: In the same way, as long as the various aspects appear, the conceptual thoughts that appear as different causes and effects and so on occur.

original: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyis dpyad de rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa mi 'byung bar mthong ba de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang shes rab kyis dpyad de rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa mi 'byung bar mthong ba de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig
translated: But when, through the analysis of wisdom, one sees that, like dreams and illusions, the aspects of duality do not occur, at that time, without thought and without appearance, one should know the ultimate truth, nondual,

original: pa la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems bdag nyid la rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par yang mi rgyu na rkyen du snang ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa der 'gyur ba'i gnas lta zhig ga la yod de /
analyzed: pa la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems bdag nyid la rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam par yang mi rgyu na rkyen du snang ba'i gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par rtog pa der 'gyur ba'i gnas lta zhig ga la yod de /
translated: If the mind does not operate in terms of the two aspects of the cognizer and the cognized, how could there be any basis for the conceptual thought of the two aspects of the appearance of conditions?

original: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa'i dag pa 'jig rten pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sangs rgyas bzhugs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan mang por bshad pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa'i dag pa 'jig rten pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sangs rgyas bzhugs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan mang por bshad pa ste /
translated: However, it is said many times that the Buddhas, abiding in the concentration of the knowledge of all things, teach the Dharma, in all the pure mundane concentrations, which are accompanied by appearances.

original: dam pa'i chos bshad pa thams cad du de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos bshad pa thams cad du de ltar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This should be applied in all explanations of the holy Dharma.

original: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bsdu ba'i thams cad mkhyen pas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa bsdu ba'i thams cad mkhyen pas tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: The Omniscient One has spoken this verse in order to summarize the selflessness of persons and things:

original: de tsam ngo bo nyid kyi dbyibs //
analyzed: de tsam ngo bo nyid kyi dbyibs //
translated: That much is the shape of the essence itself,

original: rkyen dang dngos po spangs pa ste //
analyzed: rkyen dang dngos po spangs pa ste //
translated: Free from conditions and things,üîΩThe ultimate, the best of Brahmas,

original: mthar thug pa ni tshangs pa'i mchog / de ni tsam zhes ngas bshad do //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni tshangs pa'i mchog / de ni tsam zhes ngas bshad do //
translated: That much I have explained.

original: zhes te / yan lag gi rnam pa'i cha de tsam rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pa'i rkyen rnams kyis brtsams pa'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes te / yan lag gi rnam pa'i cha de tsam rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim pa'i rkyen rnams kyis brtsams pa'i dngos po spangs pa ste /
translated: That much is the shape of the essence itself, free from things that are composed of conditions, such as the two atoms and so on, which are parts of the aspects of the branches.

original: shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi dbyibs phyi rol gyi med do //
analyzed: shes par bya ba med pa'i phyir yan lag can gyi dbyibs phyi rol gyi med do //
translated: Since there is no object of cognition, there is no external shape of a whole.

original: mthar thug pa ni dmigs su med pa dang rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa ni dmigs su med pa dang rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The ultimate is the non-apprehension and completion of that.

original: de la tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin mi gnyis pa'i sems su dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshangs pa ni gnyis su med pa'i rang bzhin mi gnyis pa'i sems su dgongs pa'o //
translated: Brahma is the intention of the non-dual mind, the nature of non-duality.

original: bdag ni brtags par yod pa'i phyir /üîΩrdzas yod dngos po ma @164a * //
analyzed: bdag ni brtags par yod pa'i phyir / rdzas yod dngos po ma @164a * //
translated: The self is imputedly existent,

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: not substantially existent, not a thing.

original: de bzhin phung po'i phung po nyid //
analyzed: de bzhin phung po'i phung po nyid //
translated: Likewise, the aggregates are the aggregates themselves,

original: brtags pa yin te rdzas med do //
analyzed: brtags pa yin te rdzas med do //
translated: imputed, not substantially existent.

original: zhes pa ni gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / rtag pa dang / khyab pa'i rang bzhin dang / phra ba'i bdag nyid du kun tu brtags pa'i bdag rnams ni dmigs su med de /
analyzed: zhes pa ni gcig pa dang / tha dad pa dang / rtag pa dang / khyab pa'i rang bzhin dang / phra ba'i bdag nyid du kun tu brtags pa'i bdag rnams ni dmigs su med de /
translated: Thus, the selves that are imputed as identical, different, permanent, pervasive natures, and subtle identities are not apprehended.

original: sems kyi rgyud 'ba' zhig la byis pa so so'i skye bos bdag tu yongs su rtog go //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud 'ba' zhig la byis pa so so'i skye bos bdag tu yongs su rtog go //
translated: Only in the continuum of mind do childish ordinary beings conceive of a self.

original: phung po rnams kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por skye ba med do //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin du gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por skye ba med do //
translated: The aggregates are like a dream, a magical creation, a mirage, an optical illusion, a reflection of the moon in water, etc. They are not produced as subject and object.

original: brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva lta bur rdzas su med do //
analyzed: brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva lta bur rdzas su med do //
translated: Since the imagined is not produced, it does not exist substantially, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo yang rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo yang rnam par phye ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: The gross and subtle external is not a thing, like a house, an army, a forest, etc., when distinguished as separate.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
translated: The omniscient one should be known as the one who accomplishes the one verse on the selflessness of phenomena and the person.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni rnam bzhi ste //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni rnam bzhi ste //
translated: Sameness is fourfold.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma'o //
translated: Here, characteristic means mark.

original: rgyu ni byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa'o //
translated: Cause means action.

original: snod ni 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs so //
analyzed: snod ni 'jig rten rnam pa sna tshogs so //
translated: The world is the various worlds.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mi snang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mi snang ngo //
translated: The yogis do not perceive any aspects.

original: cis na yang dngos po rnams tha dad pa'i rnam par so sor mi snang zhes pa dang / rig pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
analyzed: cis na yang dngos po rnams tha dad pa'i rnam par so sor mi snang zhes pa dang / rig pa'i khyad par gsungs pa /
translated: The special knowledge is stated:

original: lta ba thams cad rnam bzlog cing //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad rnam bzlog cing //
translated: All views are completely rejected.

original: rtog dang brtag pa spangs pa ste //
analyzed: rtog dang brtag pa spangs pa ste //
translated: Imagination and the imagined are abandoned.

original: dmigs med skye ba med pa ni //
analyzed: dmigs med skye ba med pa ni //
translated: Without observation, without arising,

original: sems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: sems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
translated: I have explained as mind only.

original: zhes te / gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brtag pa dang / rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs shing /
analyzed: zhes te / gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la rtag pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / brtag pa dang / rtog pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dmigs shing /
translated: If consciousness has the aspect of duality, there is the observation of permanence, self, external grasping, the grasped, the imagined, imagination, and so on.

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang 'jug na mi gnyis pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyang 'jug na mi gnyis pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: If arising and so on are conventionally engaged, it is not nondual.

original: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: As explained above.

original: cis na yang dmigs pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i chos med ces te /
analyzed: cis na yang dmigs pa dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i chos med ces te /
translated: Why are there no phenomena such as observation and arising?

original: de ltar thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having suspected that, the Omniscient One said:

original: dngos min dngos med ma yin pa //
analyzed: dngos min dngos med ma yin pa //
translated: It is not a thing, nor is it a nonthing.

original: dngos dang dngos med rnam par spangs //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med rnam par spangs //
translated: It is free from the extremes of existence and non-existence.

original: de bzhin sems las grol ba ni //üîΩsems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
analyzed: de bzhin sems las grol ba ni // sems tsam du yang ngas bshad do //
translated: Likewise, the mind is liberated from the mind.

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: I have taught that the mind is only mind.

original: dngos po dang @164b dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ni rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa thams cad mkhyen pas 'dir gsungs pa na smra ba po thams cad kyi the tshom dang rnam par rtog pa dang rgolüîΩba rnam par bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang @164b dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa ni rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbu ma'i ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa thams cad mkhyen pas 'dir gsungs pa na smra ba po thams cad kyi the tshom dang rnam par rtog pa dang rgol ba rnam par bzlog pa'o //
translated: The abandonment of the concepts of existence and non-existence is the middle concentration of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins. When it is taught here, the doubts, concepts, and objections of all the disputants are eliminated.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba 'di ni sa brgyad du ste /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs pa skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos dang bral ba 'di ni sa brgyad du ste /
translated: This abandonment of the concepts of existence and non-existence, free from the dharmas of arising and cessation, is the eighth stage.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyud rgyun du 'byung zhing bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyud rgyun du 'byung zhing bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa'i don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the arising of the continuum of moments, the ultimate truth without intention and without appearance, the nature of non-duality.

original: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa ste /
translated: Suchness is the essence that is naturally luminous.

original: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i rim par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa'i me long gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa'i rim par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa'i me long gi rang bzhin no //
translated: The ground of all is the nature of a mirror that is free from the conceptual thoughts that appear as the stages of mind, thought, and consciousness.

original: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said here:

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: The mind is the ground of all consciousness.

original: rang sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: rang sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: One‚Äôs own mind is thought.

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That which apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //
translated: is called consciousness.

original: zhes sems tsam ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa la dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes sems tsam ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa la dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mere mind is the transference of the ground of all consciousness.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi sa la sogs pa bzhin du me long lta bu'i ye shes so //
translated: That is the mirror-like pristine awareness, like the stage of a buddha, and so forth.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yid 'phos pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yid 'phos pa ni mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes so //
translated: The transference of the defiled mind is the pristine awareness of uniformity.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The transference of the eye consciousness and so forth is the pristine awareness of individual discernment.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nang nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nang nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'phos pa ni bya ba nan tan gyi ye shes so //
translated: The transference of the mental consciousness from among the engaging consciousnesses is the pristine awareness of successful activities.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yid kyi sku chos ston par gzhag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin yid kyi sku chos ston par gzhag go //
translated: The concentration of the pure knowledge of all things, together with the illumination of the world, is the mental body that teaches the Dharma.

original: theg pa chen po legs par gsungs pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas dpag tu med pa la mthar thug pa ga la yod de /
analyzed: theg pa chen po legs par gsungs pa'i rin po che'i 'byung gnas dpag tu med pa la mthar thug pa ga la yod de /
translated: How could there be an end to the infinite source of jewels of the well-spoken Great Vehicle?

original: legs par gsungs pa rin po che zla ba las 'ongs pa rnams kyang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: legs par gsungs pa rin po che zla ba las 'ongs pa rnams kyang bshad pa'o //
translated: The jewels of the well-spoken Moon have also been explained.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin mi shes pa thams cad mkhyen pas thams cad mkhyen pa ston pa /
translated: All that is not known as the nature of suchness is taught by the Omniscient One.

original: de bzhin nyid dang stong pa'i mtha' //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang stong pa'i mtha' //
translated: The limit of suchness and emptiness,

original: mya ngan mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings //
analyzed: mya ngan mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings //
translated: The limit of suffering and the realm of phenomena,

original: sna tshogs yid kyi lus rnams ni //
analyzed: sna tshogs yid kyi lus rnams ni //
translated: The various mental bodies,

original: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do // zhes pa ste /
translated: I have explained as mere mind.

original: sems tsam ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnam par gcad do //
analyzed: sems tsam ni phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnam par gcad do //
translated: Mind only eliminates external objects.

original: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i @165a * //
analyzed: snang ba dang bcas pa dang / snang ba med pa'i @165a * //
translated: With appearance and without appearance,

original: ting nge 'dzin dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /üîΩma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: The concentrations existüîΩwhether a TathƒÅgata appears in the world or not.

original: chos kyi chos nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi chos nyid do //
translated: The concentrations and formless absorptions are the reality of phenomena, whether a tathƒÅgata appears or not.

original: chos gdon mi za ba nyid do //
analyzed: chos gdon mi za ba nyid do //
translated: They are the undeceiving nature of phenomena.

original: de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid yang dag pa'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa /
translated: They are included in suchness, the limit of reality, the expanse of reality, the natural luminosity of reality,üîΩand they are primordially present.

original: ye nas gnas pa'o zhes 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las klog go //
analyzed: ye nas gnas pa'o zhes 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las klog go //
translated: These are read in the noble Perfection of Wisdom and the S≈´tra Unraveling the Intention.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pas nang glongs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis skyes pa rnams ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor la sogs pa bzhin pas na skye ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pas nang glongs pa'i mthus mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa lta bu bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang gis skyes pa rnams ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor la sogs pa bzhin pas na skye ba med pa ste /
translated: Those that arise under the influence of one‚Äôs own or others‚Äô mindstreams, such as the appearances of the two in dreams, illusions, cataracts, and mirages, are unarisen.

original: des na rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i chos nyid ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the reality that is naturally completely pure is suchness.

original: de lta bu nyid du gnas pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gzhan du sus kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid du gnas pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa gzhan du sus kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is so, and because no one can change the nature of the senses and so on.

original: bslad pa rnam par spong ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: bslad pa rnam par spong ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: The elimination of defilement is by wisdom, through analysis.

original: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na nam mi dmigs pa de na /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs pa na nam mi dmigs pa de na /
translated: When the gross and subtle are analyzed and not found,

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i yang dag pa rig pa sems tsam yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i yang dag pa rig pa sems tsam yang dag pa'i mtha' ngo bo nyid rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then there is no thought, no appearance. The ultimate truth, nondual, the perfect knowledge, mind only, the limit of reality, the essence, the natural luminosity, abides.

original: de ltar na yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni sngon med pa las byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin ni sngon med pa las byas pa yin no //
translated: And yet, the nature of the realm of reality is not made from something that did not exist before.

original: de ni dri ma dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de ni dri ma dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from defilement.

original: thog mar zhi zhing ma skyes pa //
analyzed: thog mar zhi zhing ma skyes pa //
translated: From the beginning, it is peace, unborn,

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis mya ngan 'das //
translated: naturally nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba na //
translated: When the wheel of Dharma is turned,

original: chos rnams dngos por khyod kyis bstan //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams dngos por khyod kyis bstan //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: you teach that phenomena are real.

original: thog ma nyid du zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams te /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du zhi ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams te /
translated: The first is the naturally luminous mind, which is obscured by the adventitious defilements.

original: de dag gis bslad pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis gser dang rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du sbyang gi sngon med pa skyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis bslad pa'i dri ma dang bral ba ni shes rab kyis dpyad pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gyis gser dang rin po che la sogs pa bzhin du sbyang gi sngon med pa skyed pa ma yin no //
translated: The noble path, which is the analysis by wisdom, purifies it, like the purification of gold and jewels, etc. It is not a matter of producing something that did not exist before.

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnam byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel par kun brtags pa skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnam byed pa dang / byed pa po dang 'brel par kun brtags pa skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba la gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par yang mi rung ste /
translated: The dependent origination of the conditioned, such as arising, enduring, and ceasing, and the relation of the conditioned to the agent, cannot be either the same or different in the stream of moments.

original: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa @165b gnyis po med do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na skad cig pa gcig yod pa de'i tshe na skad cig pa @165b gnyis po med do //
translated: When one moment exists, the second moment does not exist.

original: gcig po nyid ni su dang yang mi 'brel to //
analyzed: gcig po nyid ni su dang yang mi 'brel to //
translated: The one does not relate to anything else.

original: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is only said that when this exists, that exists after it.

original: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel bar bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bur nges par 'brel bar bstan par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be taught that there is a definite connection between cause and effect.

original: mi gnyis pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa la ni gnyis kyi rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: In nonduality, there is no conceptualization that appears as a different aspect of duality.

original: des na sems bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por yang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: des na sems bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por yang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra rnams lta ci smos te /
translated: Therefore, there is no continuum of mind that is the object of awareness and the entity of the knower, let alone letters and sounds.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rnam grangs de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i rnam grangs de bzhin nyid /
translated: The enumeration of the ultimate truth, which is free from thought and appearance, is thusness, the limit of reality, natural luminosity, and so on.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs lta bu dang / sprul pa'i 'khor los re ba mang po yongs su skong ba'i yid kyi skus chos ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba la sogs pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa'i gzugs lta bu dang / sprul pa'i 'khor los re ba mang po yongs su skong ba'i yid kyi skus chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: While abiding in the wisdom of the omniscient one, who is endowed with the light of samƒÅdhi, he teaches the Dharma with a mental body that is like the form of the elements and the elements derived from them, and with a magical wheel that fulfills many hopes.

original: mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la ji ltar na rnam par 'byung zhes thams cad mkhyen pas thugs dogs nas gsungs pa /üîΩrnam rtog bag chags 'brel pa yi //
analyzed: mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la ji ltar na rnam par 'byung zhes thams cad mkhyen pas thugs dogs nas gsungs pa / rnam rtog bag chags 'brel pa yi //
translated: The Omniscient One, having doubts about how the wisdom of the second person arises, said:üîΩThe various things that arise from the mind

original: sna tshogs sems las byung ba ste //
analyzed: sna tshogs sems las byung ba ste //
translated: Are related to the latent tendencies of conceptuality.

original: mi rnams la ni phyi rol snang //
analyzed: mi rnams la ni phyi rol snang //
translated: They appear as external to humans,

original: 'jig rten pa yi sems tsam mo //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi sems tsam mo // zhes pa ste /
translated: The mere mind of the worldly.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pa sems tsam ga la yod pa sems tsam de ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par rtog pa sems tsam ga la yod pa sems tsam de ni rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: How can the various aspects of conceptuality be the mere mind? That mere mind is conceptuality.

original: de yang 'byung ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthu dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor ba pa rnams la so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: de yang 'byung ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos bstan pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi khyad par gyi mthu dang / mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam par shes pa 'khor ba pa rnams la so sor snang ngo //
translated: Moreover, it arises from the power of the special conditions of the continuum of self and other, the power of nonvirtuous teachings, and so on, and like the various appearances of spinning fire, fainting, and so on, the various consciousnesses appear individually to transmigrating beings.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa'i dge ba mngon par 'du byed pas dag pa 'jig rten gyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams la ni thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad pa dang / bdag dang / gzhan la phan pa'i dge ba mngon par 'du byed pas dag pa 'jig rten gyi mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal pa dang / bdag med pa dang /
translated: For yogins, the concepts of the pure mundane truth appear as impermanent, painful, empty,

original: mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par rtog pa snang ngo //
analyzed: mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par rtog pa snang ngo //
translated: and ugly, due to the latent tendencies of compassion and the formation of virtue for the benefit of self and others.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes thog mar byas te /üîΩrtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes @166a * //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes thog mar byas te / rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bde ba dang / mdzes @166a * //
translated: However, beginning with the authentic wisdom,üîΩthe mind that is afflicted by the suffering of samsara and the errors of permanence,

original: pa'i phyin ci log gi 'khor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs pa'i yid spong ngo //
analyzed: pa'i phyin ci log gi 'khor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs pa'i yid spong ngo //
translated: self, bliss, and beauty is abandoned.

original: dge bar mngon par 'du byed pa yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin par 'byed pas dbye ba na /
analyzed: dge bar mngon par 'du byed pa yang sa dang pha rol tu phyin par 'byed pas dbye ba na /
translated: Moreover, when the formation of virtue is divided by means of the levels and the perfections,

original: gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis don dam pa'i rnam par sangs rgyas kho na'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis don dam pa'i rnam par sangs rgyas kho na'i rgyu yin te /
translated: the concepts that appear as the two accumulations are the cause of buddhahood alone, the ultimate.

original: de la spang ba'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: de la spang ba'i rgyu med de /
translated: There is no cause for its abandonment.

original: 'khor ba yod kyi bar du gnas so //
analyzed: 'khor ba yod kyi bar du gnas so //
translated: It remains as long as cyclic existence exists.

original: snying rjes gnyer ba'i bdag gi lus chen po gzhan gyi don du gnyer ba dang / mnyen des che zhing skyes bu dam pa rnams so //
analyzed: snying rjes gnyer ba'i bdag gi lus chen po gzhan gyi don du gnyer ba dang / mnyen des che zhing skyes bu dam pa rnams so //
translated: The great body of the one who is concerned with others‚Äô welfare through compassion, the great flexibility, and the holy beings.üîΩHow is it that there is only mind?

original: ji ltar na yang sems tsam lags zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar na yang sems tsam lags zhes de skad du thugs dogs nas thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa /
translated: The Omniscient One, having doubts about this, said:

original: phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
analyzed: phyi rol snang ba yod med de //
translated: There is no external reality.

original: sems ni sna tshogs rnams su snang //
analyzed: sems ni sna tshogs rnams su snang //
translated: The mind appears as various things.

original: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod gnas snang ba //
translated: The body, the enjoyments, and the world

original: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: sems tsam du ni ngas bshad do //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: I explain that they are only mind.

original: phyi rol gyi don sun dbyung ba ni 'dir thams cad la gsal bas na ji ltar grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa la sogs pa smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol par kun brtags pa de ltar med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don sun dbyung ba ni 'dir thams cad la gsal bas na ji ltar grangs can dang / ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pa na pa la sogs pa smra ba rnams kyis phyi rol par kun brtags pa de ltar med do //
translated: Since the refutation of external objects is clear to everyone here, it is not as it is imagined by non-Buddhists, such as the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the NyƒÅya, the Vai≈õe·π£ika, the KƒÅ≈õmƒ´ri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas, the Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsaka, and so on.

original: rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis yan lag gi rdzas brtsams pa ni rdzas kyis rdzas kyi khyad par rtsom pa dang / yon tan gyis kyang yon tan gyi khyad par rtsom mo zhes khyad par can gyi mdo'o //
analyzed: rdul gnyis la sogs pa'i rim gyis yan lag gi rdzas brtsams pa ni rdzas kyis rdzas kyi khyad par rtsom pa dang / yon tan gyis kyang yon tan gyi khyad par rtsom mo zhes khyad par can gyi mdo'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika S≈´tra says, ‚ÄúThe substance of the parts is composed of two atoms and so on, and the substance of the qualities is composed of the substance of the qualities.‚Äù

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba rnams la ni mngon sum tshad ma ste /
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba rnams la ni mngon sum tshad ma ste /
translated: Direct perception is a valid means of knowledge for the manifest and the unmanifest.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / snang ba dang / ris mthun pa'i yo byad dang / blo can gyi skyes bus rlabs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi yan lag med pa dang / grangs du ma dang ldan pa'i rgyu spun tshad chung ba rnams las tshad che ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzes skye'o zhes na yi ya yi ka'i mdo'i lo rgyus so //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa dang / snang ba dang / ris mthun pa'i yo byad dang / blo can gyi skyes bus rlabs pa dang / rang bzhin gyi yan lag med pa dang / grangs du ma dang ldan pa'i rgyu spun tshad chung ba rnams las tshad che ba gzugs la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i snam bu la sogs pa'i rdzes skye'o zhes na yi ya yi ka'i mdo'i lo rgyus so //
translated: The cloth and so on, which are the effects, are produced from the causes, the small threads, which have the qualities of form and so on, are illuminated, are the material of the same class, are woven by a conscious person, are naturally without parts, and have many numbers.

original: grangs can rnams kyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug yon tan rnams phyi rol gyi sems pa med pa dag gis gnas kyi dkyil 'khor rtsom mo //
analyzed: grangs can rnams kyis bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug yon tan rnams phyi rol gyi sems pa med pa dag gis gnas kyi dkyil 'khor rtsom mo //
translated: The CƒÅrvƒÅkas say that pleasure, pain, and delusion are the qualities of the self, and that the self is the inner experiencer of the body, which is the abode of the qualities.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that pleasure, pain, and delusion are the qualities, and that the self is the experiencer of the qualities.

original: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can te /
translated: The self is the experiencer of the qualities.

original: ji ltar ba'i 'o ma tshor ba med @166b pa be'u tshor ba can la phan pa'i phyir 'byung ba de ltar tshor ba med pa'i gtso bo skyes bu la phan pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar ba'i 'o ma tshor ba med @166b pa be'u tshor ba can la phan pa'i phyir 'byung ba de ltar tshor ba med pa'i gtso bo skyes bu la phan pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //
translated: Just as milk, which is without feeling, arises for the benefit of the calf, which has feeling, so the insentient pradhƒÅna arises for the benefit of the sentient puru·π£a.

original: gsal ba 'di ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pas na de'i rgyu yang mi gsal zhing bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa yod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: gsal ba 'di ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pas na de'i rgyu yang mi gsal zhing bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa yod pa'i rigs so //
translated: Since this manifestation is endowed with pleasure, pain, and delusion, it is reasonable that its cause, the pradhƒÅna, would also exist as endowed with pleasure, pain, and delusion.

original: sa'i 'bras bu bum pa dang / phru ba la sogs pa dang mthun par mthong ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i 'bras bu bum pa dang / phru ba la sogs pa dang mthun par mthong ba'o //
translated: The result of earth, such as a pot, a saucer, and so on, is seen to be in conformity with its cause.

original: thog ma'i rgyu'i yon tan gyis 'bras bu'i yon tan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: thog ma'i rgyu'i yon tan gyis 'bras bu'i yon tan du 'gyur te /
translated: The qualities of the result arise from the qualities of the initial cause.

original: des na phyi rol gyi longs spyod tshor ba can ma yin la /
analyzed: des na phyi rol gyi longs spyod tshor ba can ma yin la /
translated: Therefore external objects are not endowed with feeling.

original: longs spyod pa'i skyes bu ni tshor ba can yin no zhes grangs can gyi lo rgyus so //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i skyes bu ni tshor ba can yin no zhes grangs can gyi lo rgyus so //
translated: The person who experiences them is endowed with feeling. This is the story of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya.

original: ksha pa na ka rnams kyang yongs su rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi yul spyi dang khyad par du ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka rnams kyang yongs su rtog pa ni phyi rol gyi yul spyi dang khyad par du ldan pa yin te /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhasikas also imagine that external objects are general and particular.

original: bdag gi shes pas yul rnams 'dzin to zhes pa /
analyzed: bdag gi shes pas yul rnams 'dzin to zhes pa /
translated: They say that the objects are apprehended by our consciousnesses.üîΩThe Samkhyas say:üîΩThe world is a combination of the three gu·πáas,

original: 'du ba dang ni gyes pa dang // srog gi lus kyi tshad can te //
analyzed: 'du ba dang ni gyes pa dang // srog gi lus kyi tshad can te //
translated: and it is the measure of the body of the soul.

original: de ni rigs pa rnams kyis smras //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa rnams kyis smras //
translated: The wise say that it is

original: nams kyang phra ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: nams kyang phra ba yod ma yin //
translated: never subtle.

original: zhes te / des na longs spyod par bya ba dang / longs spyod pa'i bye brag yod do zhes so //
analyzed: zhes te / des na longs spyod par bya ba dang / longs spyod pa'i bye brag yod do zhes so //
translated: Therefore, they say that there is a distinction between the object of enjoyment and the enjoyer.

original: dpyod pa can rnams kyang kun du rtog pa ni kun du dmigs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul dus gzhan pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: dpyod pa can rnams kyang kun du rtog pa ni kun du dmigs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul dus gzhan pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: The Vaisesikas imagine that external objects are perceived by the mind, which is of a different nature from the object.üîΩThey say:

original: yul de dang ni gzhan yang rung //
analyzed: yul de dang ni gzhan yang rung //
translated: The object may be the same or different,

original: rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul lo //
analyzed: rmi lam shes pa'i spyod yul lo //
translated: but it is the domain of the consciousness of dreams.

original: myur du 'khor ba'i 'du byed kyis //
analyzed: myur du 'khor ba'i 'du byed kyis //
translated: The rapid movement of the world is due to

original: 'gal ba 'khor lor 'khor lo yod //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khor lor 'khor lo yod //
translated: the wheel of the wheel of the conflict of the gu·πáas.üîΩThe clouds in the city of the gandharvas

original: dri za'i grong du sprin rnams dang // yang na sngon mthong khang pa rnams //
analyzed: dri za'i grong du sprin rnams dang // yang na sngon mthong khang pa rnams //
translated: or the houses seen before

original: smig rgyu chu yi rnam shes la //
analyzed: smig rgyu chu yi rnam shes la //
translated: The mirage is the consciousness of water.

original: de bzhin pa tsha 'od zer spros //üîΩde ltar rab rib stsogs shes la //üîΩnyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin pa tsha 'od zer spros // de ltar rab rib stsogs shes la // nyi ma'i 'od la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the sun is the emission of hot rays.üîΩIn the same way, the sun‚Äôs rays, etc.

original: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa rnams smra ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten rgyang phan pa rnams smra ba ni /
translated: are the cause of the consciousness of the person with cataracts, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mngon sum nyid du snang bas na mthong pa mi 'thad do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams ni yang dag pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams mngon sum nyid du snang bas na mthong pa mi 'thad do zhes byar mi rung ba'i phyir sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung rnams ni yang dag pa'o //
translated: The LokƒÅyatas say: It is not correct to say that the appearance of objects such as form is not tenable because they are perceived. Therefore, earth, water, fire, and wind are real.

original: de dag la tshor ba skye bas na rnam par shes pa chang gi mthu bzhin no //
analyzed: de dag la tshor ba skye bas na rnam par shes pa chang gi mthu bzhin no //
translated: Consciousness is like the power of alcohol, because feeling arises from them.

original: srog rnams ni chu'i chu bur lta bu ste /
analyzed: srog rnams ni chu'i chu bur lta bu ste /
translated: Life is like a water bubble.

original: skyes bu'i lus ni tshor bas snang bar byas nas de 'dus pa las /
analyzed: skyes bu'i lus ni tshor bas snang bar byas nas de 'dus pa las /
translated: The body of a person is illuminated by feeling. From the collection of those,üîΩthe body and the sense faculties are designated.

original: lus dang dbang po gdags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo rnams so //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po gdags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo rnams so //
translated: The s≈´tras say this and more.

original: de lta bur @167a * //
analyzed: de lta bur @167a * //
translated: In this way,

original: der rgol ba mtha' dag thub pa dbang phyug gi mchog thams cad mkhyen pa tshig gi dbang po bla mas phyi rol gyi don lta bur sun 'byin pa de ltar mdo sde 'dir bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: der rgol ba mtha' dag thub pa dbang phyug gi mchog thams cad mkhyen pa tshig gi dbang po bla mas phyi rol gyi don lta bur sun 'byin pa de ltar mdo sde 'dir bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The omniscient lord of speech, my lama, who is the supreme lord of all conquerors, refutes external objects in the same way that this sutra establishes that they do not exist.

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: Form is the analysis of atoms.

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: Atoms are partless.

original: zhes so // 'o na snang ba 'di ci zhig ces pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
analyzed: zhes so // 'o na snang ba 'di ci zhig ces pa dang / phyi yi dngos po med par yang //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhat is this appearance?‚Äù and ‚ÄúExternal things do not exist,

original: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
analyzed: sems ni rnam pa gnyis su snang //
translated: but the mind appears in two aspects.‚Äù

original: zhes pa'o // gang sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu kun rtog pa de rnam par gzhigs pa na gcig par mi rung ba ni bcos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gang sbom po yan lag can gyi rdzas gcig tu kun rtog pa de rnam par gzhigs pa na gcig par mi rung ba ni bcos pa dang / ma btsos pa dang / bsgul ba dang / ma bsgul ba dang / bsgribs pa dang /
translated: When you analyze what is imagined to be a single substance, such as a coarse object, it is not suitable to be a single thing. It is not suitable to be a single thing because it is cooked and uncooked, moved and unmoved, covered and uncovered, and so on.

original: ma bsgribs pa dang / phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na til dang 'bras la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bsgribs pa dang / phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na til dang 'bras la sogs pa'i tshogs dang / khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: houses, armies, forests, etc.

original: rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na gcig par mi rigs pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
analyzed: rdul phra mo rnams kyang phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na gcig par mi rigs pa ni snga ma bzhin te /
translated: Moreover, when the subtle particles are divided into different directional parts, it is not reasonable that they are singular, as was previously explained.

original: 'gal ba'i rdzas du ma spungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i rdzas du ma spungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: They are like a heap of many contradictory substances.

original: gang dag yan lag med pa de dag kyang bla 'og tu chags pa'i tshogs su mi rung ste /
analyzed: gang dag yan lag med pa de dag kyang bla 'og tu chags pa'i tshogs su mi rung ste /
translated: Those that are partless are also not reasonable as a collection that is attached above and below,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: like mind and mental factors.

original: yan lag gi yul du rnam pa'i char brten pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par yang mi rung ste //
analyzed: yan lag gi yul du rnam pa'i char brten pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin par yang mi rung ste //
translated: It is also not reasonable that they are things or non-things that are supported in the aspect of the object of the parts,

original: dbus kyi rdul phra mo de 'og ma'i phyogs kyi mthar gang gnas pa de nyid gong ma'i phyogs su cis na gnas par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dbus kyi rdul phra mo de 'og ma'i phyogs kyi mthar gang gnas pa de nyid gong ma'i phyogs su cis na gnas par mi 'gyur /
translated: because that subtle particle in the middle is located at the end of the lower direction. Why is it not located in the upper direction?

original: des na nang glongs pa'i mthus lus dang / longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa du ma'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo //
analyzed: des na nang glongs pa'i mthus lus dang / longs spyod dang gnas su snang ba'i rnam par shes pa mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs rnam pa du ma'i rnam par shes pa so sor snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, by the power of internal reflection, consciousness appears in various ways, in many different ways, like the body, enjoyments, and appearances of place, as in a dizzy spell or a faint.

original: ji ltar rmi lam na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por snang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar rmi lam na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul med par kun gzhi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por snang ngo //
translated: Just as in a dream, without the consciousnesses of the sense faculties such as the eyes, and without objects such as forms, the consciousness of the ground of all appears as the entities of objects and subjects.

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, through analysis with wisdom,

original: sbom po dang / phra mo'i phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo'i phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ba na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: the gross and subtle aspects are distinguished and not observed,

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
translated: then, without thought and without appearance, the ultimate truth, nondual perfect awareness itself, abides.

original: dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge @167b 'dzin la bzhugs pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo //üîΩ'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa dpyad pa las bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbu ma gtan
analyzed: dag pa'i 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge @167b 'dzin la bzhugs pa na thams cad mkhyen pa'i chos ston pa 'byung ngo // 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i bshad pa slob dpon ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las yang dag pa ma yin pa yongs su rtog pa dpyad pa las bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bshad pa rnam par shes par smra ba'i dbu ma gtan
translated: When one abides in the meditative stabilization that is accompanied by the appearances of the pure world, the teaching of the Dharma of omniscience will occur.

original: la phab pa lnga pa'o /
analyzed: la phab pa lnga pa'o /
translated: This concludes the fifth chapter of the commentary on the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka, called ‚ÄúAn Examination of the Non-Real Constructive Ideation,‚Äù which is the section on the middle way of the Vijfiaptimatra.

original: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: // / de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po blo gros chen pos bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then again the bodhisattva mahasattva Mahamati said this to the bhagavat:

original: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgra ji bzhin gyi don du gzung bar mi bya'o zhes de skad du gsungs na zhes bya ba la sgra ji bzhin du gzung ba la nongs pa cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das kyis sgra ji bzhin gyi don du gzung bar mi bya'o zhes de skad du gsungs na zhes bya ba la sgra ji bzhin du gzung ba la nongs pa cir 'gyur /
translated: The bhagavat has said, 'Do not take it literally.' What is the error in taking it literally?

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:üîΩSon of noble family, the three types of lack of nature are as follows.

original: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa gsum po zhes bya ba'i dbang du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa zhes te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu rang bzhin med pa gsum po zhes bya ba'i dbang du chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin med pa zhes te /
translated: All phenomena lack a nature in the sense of lacking an imputed nature.

original: brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dngos po med do //üîΩgzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs su skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po med do //
analyzed: brtags pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir dngos po med do // gzhan gyi dbang sna tshogs su skye ba med pa'i phyir dngos po med do //
translated: They lack a nature in the sense of lacking a dependent nature.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The ultimate lacks a nature in the sense of lacking a nature that is a combination of the two.

original: de de lta bur dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de de lta bur dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is how it is intended.

original: gang yang brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang / gzhan gyi dbang lta bur grub pa'i rang bzhin med do zhes rtog pa de ni chos kyi gnod pa 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed /
analyzed: gang yang brtags pa'i rang bzhin dang / gzhan gyi dbang lta bur grub pa'i rang bzhin med do zhes rtog pa de ni chos kyi gnod pa 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed /
translated: Those who think, ‚ÄúThe imputed nature and the dependent nature do not exist,‚Äù are engaging in a form of deprecation that harms the Dharma.

original: de ltar na 'phags pa ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las tshig gi dbang pos gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na 'phags pa ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bdun brgya pa las tshig gi dbang pos gsungs pa /
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Seven Hundred Lines, the Lord of Secrets says:

original: dngos po med pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa blta'o zhes so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rnam par de bzhin gshegs pa blta'o zhes so //
translated: The Tathagata should be seen as the absence of entities.

original: der ni sgra ji bzhin par mo gsham gyi bu dngos po med pa lta bur de bzhin gshegs par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni sgra ji bzhin par mo gsham gyi bu dngos po med pa lta bur de bzhin gshegs par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Here, the Tathagata is not to be seen as an entity, like the son of a barren woman.

original: dad pa'i dge slong gis ni dad pas sbyin pa la longs spyod par mi rigs so //
analyzed: dad pa'i dge slong gis ni dad pas sbyin pa la longs spyod par mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right for a faithful monk to enjoy the gifts of the faithful.

original: ma dad pas ni rigs so zhes so //
analyzed: ma dad pas ni rigs so zhes so //
translated: It is right for the faithless.

original: der don khyad par du bshad par bya'i /
analyzed: der don khyad par du bshad par bya'i /
translated: Here, the meaning should be explained as distinctive,

original: sgra ji bzhin du gzung bar bya ba ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du dgongs pa ni du ma yod de shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems can gyi don du 'byed par rjes su mthun pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang mthun par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin du gzung bar bya ba ma yin no // de bzhin du dgongs pa ni du ma yod de shes rab dang thabs la mkhas pas sems can gyi don du 'byed par rjes su mthun pa dang / chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa dang mthun par bshad par bya'o //
translated: but it should not be taken literally.

original: theg @168a * //
analyzed: theg @168a * //
translated: In the same way, there are many intentions, and the meaning should be explained in accordance with the benefit for sentient beings by means of skill in wisdom and means, and in accordance with the selflessness of phenomena and persons.

original: pa chen po la de las khyad par te /
analyzed: pa chen po la de las khyad par te /
translated: The Mahayana is distinguished from that.

original: gzhan gyi don du snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la zhugs kyang ltung ba med la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi don du snying rje'i sems nye bar gzhag ste mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la zhugs kyang ltung ba med la /
translated: For the sake of others, with a mind of compassion, even if one engages in the paths of the ten nonvirtues, there is no downfall.

original: bsod nams mang po rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams mang po rab tu 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And one‚Äôs merit will increase greatly.

original: byang chub kyi spyad pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi spyad pa rnam pa sna tshogs dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs te /
translated: There are various kinds of bodhisattva conduct and various ways of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: des na thams cad du gnang na bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brang zhing /
analyzed: des na thams cad du gnang na bdag dang gzhan gyi don du 'gyur ba chos nyid kyi rjes su 'brang zhing /
translated: So if it is permitted in all cases, then in accordance with reality, for the sake of oneself and others,

original: de de lta bur bya ba shes par bya'i sgra ji bzhin pa'i don du gzung bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de de lta bur bya ba shes par bya'i sgra ji bzhin pa'i don du gzung bas ni ma yin no //
translated: one should understand that it is to be done in that way, but not by taking the meaning literally.

original: de la blo gros chen po sgra gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po sgra gang zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúMahƒÅmati, what is sound?

original: 'di lta ste tshig dang ; yi ger 'phrad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshig dang ; yi ger 'phrad pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: It is the conceptualization of the contact of words and syllables.

original: so dang / 'gram pa dang / rkan dang / lce dang / mchu sbyar ba las byung pa phan tshun smra bar rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni sgra zhes bya'o zhes pa la yi ge brjod pa ni sngon gyi goms pa'i mthu las kyang de ltar byis pa rnams la yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: so dang / 'gram pa dang / rkan dang / lce dang / mchu sbyar ba las byung pa phan tshun smra bar rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi rgyu las skyes pa ni sgra zhes bya'o zhes pa la yi ge brjod pa ni sngon gyi goms pa'i mthu las kyang de ltar byis pa rnams la yang 'byung ngo //
translated: The expression of letters arises in that way even in children through the power of previous habituation.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa pa rnams smra ba /
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa pa rnams smra ba /
translated: As the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say,

original: thog mar nan tan shom pas ni //
analyzed: thog mar nan tan shom pas ni //
translated: First, through the power of previous habituation,

original: sgra ni gong du rgyu ba ste //
analyzed: sgra ni gong du rgyu ba ste //
translated: The sound moves upward.

original: sgra yi goms pa med par yang //
analyzed: sgra yi goms pa med par yang //
translated: Even without the habituation to sound,

original: gnas rnams su ni thogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas rnams su ni thogs pa'o //
translated: It is obstructed in the places.

original: byis pa rnams la yang sngon goms pa'i mthu nyid las sgra dang don tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: byis pa rnams la yang sngon goms pa'i mthu nyid las sgra dang don tha dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Even in children, the discursive thought of the difference between sound and meaning arises through the power of previous habituation.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dharma k'irtis bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: As ƒÄcƒÅrya Dharmikƒ´rti establishes,

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags las //
translated: From beginningless latent impressions,

original: rnam rtog byung la yod gnas pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog byung la yod gnas pa //
translated: Discursive thought arises and exists.

original: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
analyzed: sgra don chos ni rnam pa gsum //
translated: The three types of phenomena of sound and meaning,

original: dngos dang dngos med gnyis ka'i gnas //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med gnyis ka'i gnas //
translated: The abode of both entity and non-entity.

original: zhes te / de'i phyir sgra pa rnams 'di skad ces 'dzer te ;üîΩsgra rnams rnam par rtog las 'byung //
analyzed: zhes te / de'i phyir sgra pa rnams 'di skad ces 'dzer te ; sgra rnams rnam par rtog las 'byung //
translated: Therefore, the grammarians say this:üîΩSounds arise from conceptualization.

original: rnam rtog rnams kyang sgra las 'byung //
analyzed: rnam rtog rnams kyang sgra las 'byung //
translated: Conceptualizations arise from sounds.

original: zhes te / des na de dag gi phyi rol gyi don la bag tsam yang reg pa med do //
analyzed: zhes te / des na de dag gi phyi rol gyi don la bag tsam yang reg pa med do //
translated: Therefore, they do not touch external objects in the least.

original: rang gi blo la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa don gyi rjes su mthun par brjod par bya ba'i don chung par byed do zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi blo la yod pa'i rnam par rtog pa don gyi rjes su mthun par brjod par bya ba'i don chung par byed do zhes pa ste /
translated: They make the object of expression, which is a conceptualization existing in one's own mind, conform to the object.

original: blo yis sngar ni rnam brtags te //
analyzed: blo yis sngar ni rnam brtags te //
translated: The mind first conceptualizes,

original: kha cig don du gzung bar byas //
analyzed: kha cig don du gzung bar byas //
translated: and some hold it to be the object.üîΩThey are mistaken about the practice,

original: nan tan rnams ni log pa dang // tshig gis de ni rjes su 'dzin //
analyzed: nan tan rnams ni log pa dang // tshig gis de ni rjes su 'dzin //
translated: but they hold it to be so with words.

original: zhes so // sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i don gcig tu byas te /
analyzed: zhes so // sangs rgyas pa rnams kyi khyad par ni snang ba dang rnam par rtog pa'i don gcig tu byas te /
translated: The Buddhists make the distinction that appearances and conceptualizations are one.

original: rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis su nor ba'i @168b tshul du de la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i phyir des na don dam par sgra dang don gnyis sgra tshangs par smra ba lta bur tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba gnyis su nor ba'i @168b tshul du de la gdon mi za bar 'jug pa'i phyir des na don dam par sgra dang don gnyis sgra tshangs par smra ba lta bur tha dad pa med de /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, words and their referents are not different, like the speech of BrahmƒÅ.

original: sgra don tha dad pa ma yin kyang tha snyad du byed pa tha dad do //
analyzed: sgra don tha dad pa ma yin kyang tha snyad du byed pa tha dad do //
translated: Although words and referents are not different, they are made to be different conventionally.

original: gang na sgra dang don dag de kho na nyid gnyis pa der mnyam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang na sgra dang don dag de kho na nyid gnyis pa der mnyam par gnas pa'o //
translated: Where words and referents abide in equality, that is reality.

original: bar ti ka byed pas kyang sgrub par byed pa /
analyzed: bar ti ka byed pas kyang sgrub par byed pa /
translated: The suffix -tva is used to indicate establishment.

original: sbyor zhing tha dad med pa ni //
analyzed: sbyor zhing tha dad med pa ni //
translated: The connection is the absence of difference.

original: don dam don ni bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: don dam don ni bdag nyid kyis //
translated: The ultimate is the referent itself.

original: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma par //
analyzed: gzugs ni gcig dang du ma par //
translated: Form is neither one nor many.

original: de ni blo yis 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de ni blo yis 'khrul pa'o //
translated: That is the error of the intellect.

original: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir sgra dang don tha dad par ston pa /
analyzed: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir sgra dang don tha dad par ston pa /
translated: The Omniscient One teaches that words and referents are different because of the difference in their appearances.

original: de la blo gros chen po don gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la blo gros chen po don gang zhe na /
translated: In this regard, MahƒÅmati, what is a referent?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gcig pu dben par song nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam rang gi blos bag chags kyi gnas rab tu gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba so so rang gis rig pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gcig pu dben par song nas thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i shes rab kyis mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam rang gi blos bag chags kyi gnas rab tu gyur pa sngon du 'gro ba so so rang gis rig pa /
translated: A bodhisattva-mahƒÅsattva, having gone alone to a secluded place, with the wisdom of hearing, reflection, and meditation, transforms the basis of habitual tendencies of his own mind, which is the path going to the city of nirvƒÅ·πáa, and attains the wisdom that is individually cognized,

original: 'phags pa'i spyod yul las dang / sa'i gnas gzhan gyi bye brag dang don gyi mtshan nyid 'jug par tu 'thob na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i spyod yul las dang / sa'i gnas gzhan gyi bye brag dang don gyi mtshan nyid 'jug par tu 'thob na /
translated: the domain of the noble ones, the distinctions of the different stages, and the characteristics of the meaning.

original: don la mkhas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba tshig gi dbang po'i dbyangs thob pa'i shes rab kyis don thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang ; mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: don la mkhas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba tshig gi dbang po'i dbyangs thob pa'i shes rab kyis don thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa dang ; mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam par 'jug par byed do //
translated: If he does not attain that, he is not skilled in the meaning. Thus, with the wisdom that attains the power of words and tones, he engages all meanings with the aspects of impermanence, selflessness, ugliness, and emptiness.

original: sems pa yang gang yod pa de skad cig pa dang / thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: sems pa yang gang yod pa de skad cig pa dang / thams cad stong pa dang / bdag med pa ste /
translated: Also, whatever exists is momentary, empty, and selfless.

original: thal mo'i sgra dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: thal mo'i sgra dang / rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / rab rib dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: like the sound of clapping, a dream, an illusion, blurred vision, a mirage, a reflection, and so on.

original: phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang gi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid thams cad kyi bye brag rtogs par byed do //
analyzed: phung por gnas pa med pa dang / rnam par mi 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang gi stong pa nyid la sogs pa stong pa nyid thams cad kyi bye brag rtogs par byed do //
translated: Because they do not endure as a collection and because they do not perish, one should understand the distinctions of all the forms of emptiness, such as the emptiness of the inner, the emptiness of the outer, and the emptiness of the inner and outer.

original: rnam par gzhigs pa na phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: rnam par gzhigs pa na phyi rol gyi phung por gnas pa gang yang med de /
translated: When analyzed, there is nothing at all that endures as an outer collection.

original: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa nyid do //
translated: Like a house, an army, a forest, and so on, it is empty.

original: brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med de /
analyzed: brtags pa ni ma skyes pas na ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med de /
translated: Since the imputed does not arise, it is like the horn of a rabbit and so on, and is not a thing.

original: des na gang rnam par mi 'jig par kun brtags pa stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na gang rnam par mi 'jig par kun brtags pa stong pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the imputed is emptiness, which does not perish.

original: @169a * // de de ltar shes rab kyis dpyad pa na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don mi dmigs so //
analyzed: @169a * // de de ltar shes rab kyis dpyad pa na rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol gyi don mi dmigs so //
translated: a self, or external objects.üîΩWhen one goes to a solitary place and does not see even the slightestüîΩentity imagined as a subject or object, at that time, without thought andüîΩwithout appearance, one realizes the ultimate truth, which is nondual. The

original: gang gi tshe gcig pu dben par song nas 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar kun brtags pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig cing myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro
analyzed: gang gi tshe gcig pu dben par song nas 'dzin pa dang / gzung bar kun brtags pa'i dngos po cung zad kyang mi mthong ba de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig cing myong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi lam mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro
translated: path, which is characterized by experience, leads to the city of nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: ba mngon sum gyi don du ting nge 'dzin gyi yul lo //
analyzed: ba mngon sum gyi don du ting nge 'dzin gyi yul lo //
translated: The object of direct perception is the object of samƒÅdhi.üîΩ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own mind‚Äù means that one attains it by oneself and not through

original: rang gi blos zhes pa ni bdag nyid kyis thob kyi dbang pos rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi blos zhes pa ni bdag nyid kyis thob kyi dbang pos rab tu sbyin pa la sogs pas ni ma yin te /
translated: the generosity of others.

original: de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa myong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa dang / dbugs thub pa myong ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the direct perception of the other sense faculties and the experience of the breath.

original: sa tha dad par phye ba na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu'i rim pa'i bye brag rnams te /
analyzed: sa tha dad par phye ba na 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par gyis btsun gtso byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi mngon par shes pa'i 'bras bu'i rim pa'i bye brag rnams te /
translated: When divided into different levels, there are the various stages of the results of the higher perceptions of the bodhisattvas, the most venerable ones, due to the distinction between mundane and supramundane samadhis.

original: gong nas gong du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bdag dang gzhan gyi don du byung ba'i khyad par gyis thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: gong nas gong du bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bdag dang gzhan gyi don du byung ba'i khyad par gyis thams cad mkhyen pa rnal 'byor gyi dbang po mchog tu yongs su dag pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: Due to the distinction of the accumulations of merit and wisdom for the benefit of self and others that arise higher and higher, the omniscient lords of yoga, who are utterly pure and free from attachment,

original: gzugs sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud kyi bsam pa mchog tu rangs par byed pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don rgya cher 'khor ba yod kyi bar du 'jug go //
analyzed: gzugs sna tshogs kyi cho 'phrul gyis mtha' med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud kyi bsam pa mchog tu rangs par byed pa rnams kyis sems can gyi don rgya cher 'khor ba yod kyi bar du 'jug go //
translated: with the magical display of various forms, satisfy the wishes of the infinite mindstreams of sentient beings to the highest degree. They engage in the benefit of sentient beings on a vast scale for as long as samsara exists.

original: sa dang po la 'jug pa nyid kyis sems can la phan pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la dga' ba'i sbyin pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa dang po la 'jug pa nyid kyis sems can la phan pa'i phyir sems can thams cad la dga' ba'i sbyin pa rnams kyis rab tu dga' ba'i ting nge 'dzin gyi khyad par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By entering the first level, they attain the special meditative absorption of perfect joy, through the generosity of joy for all sentient beings in order to benefit them.

original: dri ma med par ni dri ma gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad las grol zhing sems can rnams la mi gnod pa'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims can rnams so //
analyzed: dri ma med par ni dri ma gnyis kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad las grol zhing sems can rnams la mi gnod pa'i phyir mi gnyis pa'i tshul khrims can rnams so //
translated: On the second level, they are disciplined in non-dualism, because they are free from all concepts of the two kinds of impurity and do not harm sentient beings.

original: gsum por ni mchog tu zab mo'i chos la bzod cing sems can rnams kyis ngan du smras pa'i sdug bsngal yid la 'jog pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: gsum por ni mchog tu zab mo'i chos la bzod cing sems can rnams kyis ngan du smras pa'i sdug bsngal yid la 'jog pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: On the third level, they have the patience of the profound Dharma and are free of the concepts of being upset by the suffering of sentient beings‚Äô verbal abuse.

original: de bzhin du sa bzhi por gong nas gong du ye shes sgro ba yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus can rnams sems can mtha' dag gdon pa'i mthu chen po can rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa bzhi por gong nas gong du ye shes sgro ba yongs su dag pa'i brtson 'grus can rnams sems can mtha' dag gdon pa'i mthu chen po can rnams so //
translated: Similarly, on the fourth level and above, they have the diligence of completely purifying the armor of gnosis, and they have the great power to save all sentient beings.

original: sa lngar ni sems rtse gcig par btul ba'i bsam gtan las g-yo ba med pa'i blo can rnams so //
analyzed: sa lngar ni sems rtse gcig par btul ba'i bsam gtan las g-yo ba med pa'i blo can rnams so //
