translated: On the fifth, they are those whose minds are disciplined in one-pointed concentration, and who are unshakable in their intelligence.

original: drug por ni rten cing 'brel bar @169b 'byung ba mnyam par bsgrubs pas gnyis dang tha dad pa chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa zab mo'i chos rnams la 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: drug por ni rten cing 'brel bar @169b 'byung ba mnyam par bsgrubs pas gnyis dang tha dad pa chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa zab mo'i chos rnams la 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: On the sixth, they are those who have accomplished the equality of dependent origination, who are free from the duality of subject and object, who are engaged in the profound Dharma of the no-self of phenomena and of persons, and who are free from the two hindrances.

original: bdun por ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mchog tu rdzogs shing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin can khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: bdun por ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun mchog tu rdzogs shing nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ting nge 'dzin can khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: On the seventh, they are those who have perfectly completed the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, who have the concentration that is not shared by the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, and who are free from attachment to the three worlds.

original: sa brgyad por ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel cing dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: sa brgyad por ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'i chos la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin par byed pa dang byed pa por 'brel cing dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: In the eight grounds, the phenomena of dependent origination are free from the concepts of thing and non-thing, and free from the connection of production, abiding, cessation, etc. as other or not other, and of agent and action.

original: ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde 'dir gsungs pa //
translated: As it is said in this sutra:

original: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
analyzed: sa bdun dag ni sems yin te //
translated: The seven grounds are mind,

original: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: snang ba med pa brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is non-appearance.

original: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te //üîΩsa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: sa gnyis dag ni gnas yin te // sa gzhan nga yi rang bzhin no //
translated: The two grounds are abodes,

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /
translated: The other grounds are my nature.

original: gang nas bdun du phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang nas bdun du phyin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / nyan thos dang ; rang sangs rgyas dang / mu stegs can rnams kyi spyod yul yang ma yin no //
translated: The seven grounds are the domain of the bodhisattvas, but not of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and tƒ´rthikas.

original: mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbu ma'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i mtshan nyid de ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i dbu ma'i ye shes so //
translated: The characteristic of non-production is the middle pristine consciousness free from the concepts of thing and non-thing.

original: mi g-yo ba der yang sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba der yang sangs rgyas su lung bstan pa'o //
translated: And there, in the Immovable, he is prophesied to Buddhahood.

original: dgur ni bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba shes shing so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa rnams so //
analyzed: dgur ni bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba shes shing so so yang dag par rig pa thob pa rnams so //
translated: In the ninth, he is one who knows the thoughts and latent tendencies of others, and who has attained the analytical knowledges.

original: bcur ni gzhan thams cad la phan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa kho na'i go 'phang thob pa'i don du chos kyi dbang bskur ba ste /
analyzed: bcur ni gzhan thams cad la phan pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa kho na'i go 'phang thob pa'i don du chos kyi dbang bskur ba ste /
translated: In the tenth, he is consecrated to the state of omniscience for the sake of attaining the state of omniscience for the benefit of all others.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur bar mdzad do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis dbang bskur bar mdzad do //
translated: And he is consecrated by the Buddhas dwelling in the world-realms of the ten directions.

original: der yang nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa de'i 'og tu spang ngo //
analyzed: der yang nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa de'i 'og tu spang ngo //
translated: And there, in the Immovable, he abandons the ignorance that is not a passion.

original: dar srab mos g-yogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad sa bcur snang ngo //
analyzed: dar srab mos g-yogs pa bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad sa bcur snang ngo //
translated: And the whole mandala of knowables appears to him as the ten stages, as if covered with a fine gauze.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams la ni sgrib pa med pas na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i khyad par te des na sa bcur song ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa mnyam par 'jog pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bag chags dang ldan pa shes
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa rnams la ni sgrib pa med pas na sangs rgyas kyi sa'i khyad par te des na sa bcur song ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa mnyam par 'jog pa med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can bag chags dang ldan pa shes
translated: Thus, the obstructions to omniscience, which are associated with the imprints of the ignorance that is the absence of the knowledge of the afflictions that have gone to the ten grounds, are abandoned.

original: bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa nis dang por mthong ba'i lam thob nas /
analyzed: bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa nis dang por mthong ba'i lam thob nas /
translated: Having attained the path of seeing for the first time,

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyis sbom po dang / bar ma dang / @170a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyis sbom po dang / bar ma dang / @170a * //
translated: the path of meditation gradually divides the coarse, medium,

original: phra mo dang / de las phra ba dang / yang phrar gse ste rim par phye zhing bag chags de sangs rgyas kyi sa la spang ngo //
analyzed: phra mo dang / de las phra ba dang / yang phrar gse ste rim par phye zhing bag chags de sangs rgyas kyi sa la spang ngo //
translated: and subtle imprints, and the subtlest of the subtle, and abandons them on the Buddha ground.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bur thob pa ni sa bcur rgya cher ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bur thob pa ni sa bcur rgya cher ro //
translated: The attainment of the result of omniscience is explained extensively in the ten grounds.

original: sa'i phyogs mdo sde 'dir zur tsam zhig bsnyad pa'i zla la 'ongs pa ni bshad do //
analyzed: sa'i phyogs mdo sde 'dir zur tsam zhig bsnyad pa'i zla la 'ongs pa ni bshad do //
translated: The explanation of the mere fraction of the grounds that is mentioned in this sutra is finished.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' don la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' don la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is said that bodhisattvas are skilled in the meaning.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po sgra'i don la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po /üîΩsgra dang don tam /üîΩdon dang sgrar yang gcig pa ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po sgra'i don la mkhas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po / sgra dang don tam / don dang sgrar yang gcig pa ma yin /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the bodhisattva mahasattva who is skilled in the meaning of soundüîΩshould correctly see that sound and meaning are not the same,

original: tha dad pa yang ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa yang ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ste /
translated: nor are they different.

original: zhes pa ni kha cig sgra dang / don gzhan pa'i don du zhugs pa rnams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni kha cig sgra dang / don gzhan pa'i don du zhugs pa rnams te /
translated: This refers to those who engage in the meaning of sound as being different from the meaning.

original: ji ltar ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / grangs can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar ne yi ya yi ka dang / khyad par can dang / grangs can dang / 'jig rten rgyang pan pa rnams so //
translated: They are the Naiyayikas, Vaisheshikas, Samkhyas, and Lokayatas.

original: kha cig ni gzhan pa ma yin pa kho nar te /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan pa ma yin pa kho nar te /
translated: Some consider them to be not different at all.

original: ji ltar lung ston pa dang / sgra tshangs par smra ba po rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar lung ston pa dang / sgra tshangs par smra ba po rnams te /
translated: They are the Vaibhashikas and the Grammarians.

original: sgra dang don tha dad pa ma yin par yang tha snyad du tha dad par byed kyang sgra dang don dag gi de kho na nyid gcig ste /
analyzed: sgra dang don tha dad pa ma yin par yang tha snyad du tha dad par byed kyang sgra dang don dag gi de kho na nyid gcig ste /
translated: Although they make the conventional distinction that sound and meaning are not different, the reality of sound and meaning is the same.

original: de dag mnyam par gnas so //
analyzed: de dag mnyam par gnas so //
translated: They abide in equality.

original: ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can rnams ni /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka dang / dpyod pa can rnams ni /
translated: The Kashmiri Vaibhashikas and the Mimamsakas

original: gnyis kar smra ba po rnams so //
analyzed: gnyis kar smra ba po rnams so //
translated: the two-fold, and the many-fold.

original: ksha pa na ka'i rnam 'gyur bar smra ba la gzhan par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka'i rnam 'gyur bar smra ba la gzhan par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that the transformation of the k·π£a·πáas is four-fold: transformation into something else, transformation into something not else, transformation into something else and not else, and transformation into something neither else nor not else.üîΩTransformation into something else is a particular that becomes something else; transformation into something not else is a universal that does not become something else; transformation into something else and not else is a universal and particular that becomes something else and does not become something else; and transformation into something neither else nor not else is a non-entity that does not become something else and does not become something not else.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gzhan par 'gyur ba dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / cig car smra bar mi bya ba dang /üîΩbdun du 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gzhan par 'gyur ba dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / cig car smra bar mi bya ba dang / bdun du 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is not to be spoken of all at once.

original: dpyod pa can gyi kun rtog ni //üîΩdngos po gzugs ni du ma la //
analyzed: dpyod pa can gyi kun rtog ni // dngos po gzugs ni du ma la //
translated: The NaiyƒÅyikas say that the transformation of the k·π£a·πáas is seven-fold:üîΩThe transformation of the many forms of entities

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs su brtag pa ni //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs su brtag pa ni //
translated: into the form of the desired object

original: cig car rim gyis 'jug pa yis //
analyzed: cig car rim gyis 'jug pa yis //
translated: is by way of simultaneous or gradual engagement.

original: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: tshig gi rnam pa gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other way of speaking.

original: ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
translated: Just as in a mixture of colors,

original: dngos po rnams ni sna tshogs phyir //
analyzed: dngos po rnams ni sna tshogs phyir //
translated: because entities are various,

original: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
translated: they take on the color as desired.

original: de bzhin tha dad mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin tha dad mi dmigs so //
translated: and the difference is not perceived.

original: rang byung 'dod chen khyi rnams kyang //
analyzed: rang byung 'dod chen khyi rnams kyang //
translated: The dogs of the great desire for self-originate

original: bud med lus ni gcig pu la //üîΩmi gtsang mdzes pa bza'o zhes //
analyzed: bud med lus ni gcig pu la // mi gtsang mdzes pa bza'o zhes //
translated: from a single body of a womanüîΩthe thought of the three:

original: rnam par rtog pa gsum rnams so //üîΩ@170b zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gsum rnams so // @170b zhes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúI will eat the impure beauty.‚Äù

original: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la ni don dang gcig par rig ste /
analyzed: mi gnyis par smra ba rnams la ni don dang gcig par rig ste /
translated: The non-dualists know that the meaning is the same as the word.

original: bslad pa rnams sna tshogs snang ba tha dad pa las sgra dang / don yang tha dad par rung ba ni tha dad rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba sna tshogs su nor ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bslad pa rnams sna tshogs snang ba tha dad pa las sgra dang / don yang tha dad par rung ba ni tha dad rab rib can gnyis kyis zla ba sna tshogs su nor ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The adulterated, who have the appearance of variety, are suitable for the difference of word and meaning, like the two with eye disease who err in the variety of the moon.

original: rnam par shes pa smra ba rnams la yang sgra dang don gyi snang ba tha dad par rung ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa smra ba rnams la yang sgra dang don gyi snang ba tha dad par rung ste /
translated: The Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins are also suitable for the difference of the appearance of word and meaning.

original: brtags pas de dag las gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad rigs te /
analyzed: brtags pas de dag las gzhan pa dang / gzhan pa ma yin pa'i tha snyad rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to designate them as different or not different from those,

original: snang ba tshogs kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tshogs kyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the collection of appearances.

original: gang dag yang phyi rol gyi don du smra ba de dag gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni smrar med de /
analyzed: gang dag yang phyi rol gyi don du smra ba de dag gi rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid ni smrar med de /
translated: The nature of the external objects of the proponents of external objects cannot be spoken of.

original: gzhan du me dang 'brel bas ni //
analyzed: gzhan du me dang 'brel bas ni //
translated: In another way, by the connection with fire,

original: bdag tshig ces ni tshor ba ste //
analyzed: bdag tshig ces ni tshor ba ste //
translated: the word ‚Äúhot‚Äù is a feeling.

original: gzhan du tshig pa'i sgra yis ni //
analyzed: gzhan du tshig pa'i sgra yis ni //
translated: In another way, by the sound of the word ‚Äúhot,‚Äù

original: sgra yi don ni shes par byed //üîΩdbang po'i don ni gzhan du la //
analyzed: sgra yi don ni shes par byed // dbang po'i don ni gzhan du la //
translated: the meaning of the word is known.üîΩThe object of the sense faculty is one thing,

original: sgra yi spyod yul gzhan pa ste //
analyzed: sgra yi spyod yul gzhan pa ste //
translated: the domain of the word is another.

original: sgra las mig med mthong yang ni //
analyzed: sgra las mig med mthong yang ni //
translated: Even though the eye is not in the word,

original: mngon sum du ni 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: mngon sum du ni 'gyur ba med //
translated: it is not directly perceived.

original: ces so // brjod pa thams cad ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyis brjod kyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ces so // brjod pa thams cad ni 'jug pa'i mtshan ma rnams kyis brjod kyi rang bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: All expressions are expressions by means of the signs of engagement, not by means of the nature.

original: ji ltar 'grel pa byed pas sgrub pa sgra rnams ni gsum gyi phyir 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'grel pa byed pas sgrub pa sgra rnams ni gsum gyi phyir 'jug ste /
translated: As the commentary says, ‚ÄúThe grammarians say that words engage because of three things:

original: rigs dang / yon tan dang / byed pa'i sgra rnams yod do zhes te /
analyzed: rigs dang / yon tan dang / byed pa'i sgra rnams yod do zhes te /
translated: the words of class, quality, and action exist.‚Äù

original: ba dkar mo 'gro ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ba dkar mo 'gro ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúthe white cow goes.‚Äù

original: sgra rnams 'jug pa'i mtshan ma bzhi pa ni /
analyzed: sgra rnams 'jug pa'i mtshan ma bzhi pa ni /
translated: The fourth sign of the engagement of words is

original: ming gi sgra rnams yod pa ni ji ltar 'di the dang / da wid thar ming du btags pa'i sgra rnams te /
analyzed: ming gi sgra rnams yod pa ni ji ltar 'di the dang / da wid thar ming du btags pa'i sgra rnams te /
translated: The sounds of names exist.üîΩ

original: nye bar brtags pa'i ris su 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtags pa'i ris su 'jug pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The sound of names exists as the cause of engagement in the class of nominal designations, such as ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúhorse.‚Äù

original: la las ni thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dus dang / yul gyi rjes su song ba'i lha sbyin la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyur rtog go //
analyzed: la las ni thog ma dang / tha ma dang / dus dang / yul gyi rjes su song ba'i lha sbyin la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyur rtog go //
translated: Some imagine that the cause of engagement is the name that is related to the beginning, end, time, and place of the object, such as Devadatta.

original: gang dag la yang nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la spyi gcig pa med pa de dag ni rang bzhin la 'jug pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gang dag la yang nyi ma dang / zla ba dang / nam mkha' la sogs pa rnams la spyi gcig pa med pa de dag ni rang bzhin la 'jug pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: But in the case of the sun, moon, sky, and so on, there is no single universal, and so they are the cause of engagement in the intrinsic nature.

original: de ltar 'grel pa las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar 'grel pa las 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is how it appears in the commentary.

original: gang na dngos po thams cad rang gi dngos por 'byung bas na de de dag gi dngos po ste /
analyzed: gang na dngos po thams cad rang gi dngos por 'byung bas na de de dag gi dngos po ste /
translated: Since all things arise in their own nature, that is their nature.

original: de brjod pa ni kho na dang rang nyid du'o //
analyzed: de brjod pa ni kho na dang rang nyid du'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse means ‚Äúitself.‚Äù

original: zla ba'i zla ba kho na ni gang tshim par byed pa dang / ku mu da rnams rgyas par byed pa de'o //
analyzed: zla ba'i zla ba kho na ni gang tshim par byed pa dang / ku mu da rnams rgyas par byed pa de'o //
translated: The moon that is only the moon is the one that satisfies and causes the water lilies to bloom.

original: nyi ma'i nyi ma kho na ni gang snang bar byed pa dang / padmo rgyas par byed pa de'o //
analyzed: nyi ma'i nyi ma kho na ni gang snang bar byed pa dang / padmo rgyas par byed pa de'o //
translated: The sun is the sun itself, which illuminates and causes the lotus to open.

original: ba lang kho na ni gang rtsva za ba dang / shing rta 'dren pa de'o //üîΩnam mkha'i @171a * //
analyzed: ba lang kho na ni gang rtsva za ba dang / shing rta 'dren pa de'o // nam mkha'i @171a * //
translated: The ox is the ox itself, which eats grass and pulls a cart.üîΩSpace is space itself, which is the absence of form.

original: de kho na ni nam mkha' kho na tshig 'khor ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na ni nam mkha' kho na tshig 'khor ba ste /
translated: Space is the only term that refers to the absence of form.

original: der shing rta la sogs pa 'phrad pa dang bral ba tha dad par kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: der shing rta la sogs pa 'phrad pa dang bral ba tha dad par kun brtags pa ste /
translated: In it, a chariot and so on are imagined to be different from the parts that are in contact with it.

original: yul mang po la gnas pas nam mkha' rjes su song bar kun rtog go //
analyzed: yul mang po la gnas pas nam mkha' rjes su song bar kun rtog go //
translated: Since it is present in many places, space is imagined to be all-pervading.

original: de bzhin du stong ba nyid la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dngos po dang / dngos po med par spyir sgro 'dogs par 'jug go //
analyzed: de bzhin du stong ba nyid la sogs pa'i sgra rnams dngos po dang / dngos po med par spyir sgro 'dogs par 'jug go //
translated: In the same way, the terms ‚Äúemptiness‚Äù and so on are applied in a general way to things and nonthings.

original: dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / mi dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams kyi kha dog kho na ni gcig dang du ma dang / gzugs dang / gzugs ma yin pa yid ches par mi byed do //
analyzed: dkar po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / mi dkar po la sogs pa'i kha dog rnams kyi kha dog kho na ni gcig dang du ma dang / gzugs dang / gzugs ma yin pa yid ches par mi byed do //
translated: The color of white, yellow, red, and so on is not accepted as being either one or many, as being form or not being form.

original: des na spyir bkra ba la bkra ba kho na ni gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na spyir bkra ba la bkra ba kho na ni gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, in general, a diversity is not a diversity of another, nor is it not a diversity of another.

original: sgro 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig gis kun brtags pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa 'ba' zhig gis kun brtags pa'o //
translated: It is imagined by mere superimposition.

original: de bzhin du grang ba dang / dro ba dang / brlan pa dang / sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi grang ba kho na dang / dro ba kho na dang / brlan pa kho na dang / sra ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du grang ba dang / dro ba dang / brlan pa dang / sra ba la sogs pa rnams kyi grang ba kho na dang / dro ba kho na dang / brlan pa kho na dang / sra ba kho na'o //
translated: Similarly, cold, hot, wet, hard, etc. are only cold, only hot, only wet, only hard, etc.

original: gal te gzhan pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe grang ba dang grang ba ma yin pa dang / dro ba dang dro ba ma yin pa dang / brlan pa dang / sra ba dag kyang de las bzlog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan pa ma yin na ni de'i tshe grang ba dang grang ba ma yin pa dang / dro ba dang dro ba ma yin pa dang / brlan pa dang / sra ba dag kyang de las bzlog par 'gyur na /
translated: If they are not a diversity of another, then at that time cold and not cold, hot and not hot, wet and dry, etc. would be the opposite of that.

original: gang gcig gi gzugs yin pa de gnyis por mi rigs so //
analyzed: gang gcig gi gzugs yin pa de gnyis por mi rigs so //
translated: But it is not tenable that what is one form is two.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la gcig po la gzugs du ma kho nar ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba la gcig po la gzugs du ma kho nar ji ltar na rung /
translated: How could it be tenable that a single thing is a diversity of forms for the proponents of external objects?

original: gzugs gcig pa ni gcig pa kho na'o zhes dbang pos smras pa ma yin no zhes de skad ce na ni gang gi tshe na de ltar gzugs du ma yang gcig par ji ltar rigs te /
analyzed: gzugs gcig pa ni gcig pa kho na'o zhes dbang pos smras pa ma yin no zhes de skad ce na ni gang gi tshe na de ltar gzugs du ma yang gcig par ji ltar rigs te /
translated: If that is so, then how can it be correct that many forms are one?

original: de ltar na 'gro ba thams cad kyang gzugs gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gro ba thams cad kyang gzugs gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, all the world would be one form.

original: phyug dbul dang / grol ba dang / ma grol ba la sogs pa'i rim pa dmigs su med la ;
analyzed: phyug dbul dang / grol ba dang / ma grol ba la sogs pa'i rim pa dmigs su med la ;
translated: The distinctions of rich and poor, free and unfree, and so on, would not be perceived.

original: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba byed pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa rnams kyis don gyi bya ba byed pa gcig pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And the error would arise that cold, warm, blue, yellow, and so on, would perform the same function.

original: des na ji ltar grangs can la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don dkar po dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin du mar mi rigs so //
analyzed: des na ji ltar grangs can la sogs pa phyi rol gyi don dkar po dang / sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin du mar mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, just as for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on, the nature of external objects such as white and blue is not tenable as a nature,

original: nor pa la ltos te /
analyzed: nor pa la ltos te /
translated: in dependence on error,

original: de'i bdag dang / bdag gir dang / bdag gi ba gang yin pa dang / nor pa'i gzugs kyang ji lta bu de yin pa de mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i bdag dang / bdag gir dang / bdag gi ba gang yin pa dang / nor pa'i gzugs kyang ji lta bu de yin pa de mi rung ngo //
translated: the self, what is mine, what is mine, and the form of error are not tenable.

original: de ste nor pa sna tshogs kyi phyir du ma'i rnam par shes pa la med na ni de'i tshe rab rib la sogs pa'i nor pa ltos pas /
analyzed: de ste nor pa sna tshogs kyi phyir du ma'i rnam par shes pa la med na ni de'i tshe rab rib la sogs pa'i nor pa ltos pas /
translated: If it does not exist for the consciousness that is the basis of error, then at that time, like the error of cataracts, etc., it is dependent.

original: tshig gi don @171b rnams kyi bdag nyid mtha' med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don @171b rnams kyi bdag nyid mtha' med par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If, on the other hand, the various forms of consciousness do not exist in the form of the various errors, then in that case, the objects of words would arise without end, depending on errors such as cataracts.

original: bar ti ka las dpyad pa ltar /
analyzed: bar ti ka las dpyad pa ltar /
translated: As analyzed in the Varttika:üîΩ‚ÄúThe analysis of the external object is as follows:

original: dmigs pa kun phyi rol gyi yin no zhes dpyod pa can gang gis kun du rtog pa ni /üîΩmar me la sogs sngon dmar du //
analyzed: dmigs pa kun phyi rol gyi yin no zhes dpyod pa can gang gis kun du rtog pa ni / mar me la sogs sngon dmar du //
translated: The imagination of what is unrealüîΩArises in the form of an object, a representation, and an image.

original: rma bya'i mdongs ni snang ba ltar //
analyzed: rma bya'i mdongs ni snang ba ltar //
translated: Like a double moon,üîΩLike a mirage,üîΩLike a dream,üîΩLike a magical illusion,

original: mig 'phrul rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du //
analyzed: mig 'phrul rnams kyi dkyil 'khor du //
translated: Like a reflection,üîΩLike an echo,üîΩLike a cloud,üîΩLike lightning,

original: kun du mthong bar byed pa'o //üîΩgang gi tshe shes par bya ba gcig la gzugs du ma mi rung ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: kun du mthong bar byed pa'o // gang gi tshe shes par bya ba gcig la gzugs du ma mi rung ba de'i tshe /
translated: All things should be understood to be impermanent.‚Äù

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa kho na'o //
translated: When it is not possible for a single object of consciousness to be many forms, then consciousness must have aspects.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus, it says:

original: blo ni sngo sogs gzugs kyi phyir //
analyzed: blo ni sngo sogs gzugs kyi phyir //
translated: Because the mind is blue and so on,

original: phyi rol don la cis na 'brel //
analyzed: phyi rol don la cis na 'brel //
translated: Why is it related to external objects?

original: blo la sngo sogs gzugs med na //
analyzed: blo la sngo sogs gzugs med na //
translated: If the mind does not have the form of blue and so on,

original: de yi de myong ji lta bu //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de yi de myong ji lta bu //üîΩzhes pa ste /
translated: How can it experience that?

original: nam rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa de na de ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi don gang yin /
analyzed: nam rnam pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa de na de ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi don gang yin /
translated: If consciousness has aspects, what is the external object that is different from it?

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa la rnam pa med pa 'di ni sngon po'i myong ba yin gyi ser po'i ma yin no zhes rnam pa med pa'i shes pas myong ba'i rnam pa med pas ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa la rnam pa med pa 'di ni sngon po'i myong ba yin gyi ser po'i ma yin no zhes rnam pa med pa'i shes pas myong ba'i rnam pa med pas ji ltar na rung /
translated: If consciousness is devoid of aspects, how can it be experienced by a consciousness that is devoid of aspects? For example, one cannot say, ‚ÄúThis is the experience of blue, not yellow.‚Äù

original: bag chags blo la rnam pa med //
analyzed: bag chags blo la rnam pa med //
translated: The logicians say: ‚ÄúThe latent potentialities are not aspects of the mind.

original: don ni rnam pa bcas pa ste //
analyzed: don ni rnam pa bcas pa ste //
translated: The object is endowed with aspects.üîΩ‚Äù

original: zhes dpyod pa can rnams de skad ces smras pa de la rab rib can gyi rnam pa mang po snang na /
analyzed: zhes dpyod pa can rnams de skad ces smras pa de la rab rib can gyi rnam pa mang po snang na /
translated: When many aspects of floaters appear to someone with an eye disease,

original: ci'i phyir don de snyed de ltar yod dam /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don de snyed de ltar yod dam /
translated: why do they not exist in the same way as they appear?

original: de ltar na gzhan gyis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhan gyis ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
translated: Why do not all people apprehend them?

original: des na nor pa'i mthus rnam par shes par smra ba la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ste /
analyzed: des na nor pa'i mthus rnam par shes par smra ba la rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ste /
translated: Therefore, due to the power of error, consciousness appears to the proponents of consciousness to have various aspects.

original: snang ba tha dad pas /
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pas /
translated: Since the appearances are different,

original: tshad ma dang gzhal ba'i tha snyad dang / sgra dang don tha dad par de la gleng ba ci yang med do //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal ba'i tha snyad dang / sgra dang don tha dad par de la gleng ba ci yang med do //
translated: There is no discussion of valid cognition and the object of comprehension, or of the difference between words and their referents.

original: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: nam shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, through analysis with wisdom,

original: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de la bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: sbom po dang / phra mo rnam par gzhigs te mi dmigs pa de la bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par rig pa dngos po dang / dngos po med pa rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gnas so //
translated: the coarse and subtle [aspects of the object] are dissected and not observed, that is the ultimate truth, nondual awareness free from thought and appearance.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dang don gyi tha snyad 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad de dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgra dang don gyi tha snyad 'byung ba ni /
translated: Awakened by the latent tendencies of compassion, the conventions of words and referents of omniscience arise from the samƒÅdhi that is accompanied by the appearances of the pure world.

original: rtog dang mos pa dag gis ni //
analyzed: rtog dang mos pa dag gis ni //
translated: Through imagination and aspiration,

original: 'jig rten lam du gnas pa na //
analyzed: 'jig rten lam du gnas pa na //
translated: those abiding on the worldly path

original: shes dang so sor brjod pa yang //
analyzed: shes dang so sor brjod pa yang //
translated: have knowledge and verbal expression

original: byis pa dang ni mkhas pa 'dra //
analyzed: byis pa dang ni mkhas pa 'dra //
translated: that is similar to that of the childish and the wise.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sgra'i don gyi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sgra'i don gyi dbang du byas te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, from the perspective of the meaning of words,

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: he said:

original: gang phyir sgra ni brjod pa yin //
analyzed: gang phyir sgra ni brjod pa yin //
translated: Because sound is the expression.

original: gang tshe don @172a * //üîΩgang yid ches byed //
analyzed: gang tshe don @172a * // gang yid ches byed //
translated: When the meaning is understood,

original: de ni sgra yi don du smras //
analyzed: de ni sgra yi don du smras //
translated: That is said to be the meaning of sound.

original: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med do //
analyzed: don gyi mtshan nyid gzhan med do //
translated: There is no other characteristic of meaning.

original: blo gros chen po gal te sgra dang don du tha dad na ni don gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu sgra ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: blo gros chen po gal te sgra dang don du tha dad na ni don gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu sgra ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: Mahatma, if sound and meaning were different, sound would not be the cause of clarifying meaning.

original: nor rdzas la mar me bzhin du don de la sgras rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: nor rdzas la mar me bzhin du don de la sgras rjes su 'jug go //
translated: Like a lamp for wealth, sound engages in that meaning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: blo gros chen po skyes bu la la zhig mar me thogs nas phyogs 'di nang gi nor 'di lta bu 'di yod do zhes nor la lta ba zhes pa ni rtag pa la ltos te sgra ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: blo gros chen po skyes bu la la zhig mar me thogs nas phyogs 'di nang gi nor 'di lta bu 'di yod do zhes nor la lta ba zhes pa ni rtag pa la ltos te sgra ni gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Mahatma, if a person holds a lamp and says, The wealth in this direction is like this, and looks at the wealth, sound is the cause of clarifying the meaning in relation to permanence.

original: byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ni ba dan la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa ni ba dan la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not the cause of production, like a flag and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra brjod pa las don gang yid ches par 'gyur pa de nyid sgra'i don yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra brjod pa las don gang yid ches par 'gyur pa de nyid sgra'i don yin gyi gzhan ma yin no zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of a word is that which is believed to be the referent of the word, not anything else. This is the intention of the Omniscient One.

original: de bzhin du blo gros chen po tshig tu rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i mar mes byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams tshig gi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba so so rang gis rig pa'i don gyi yul la rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni dngos po
analyzed: de bzhin du blo gros chen po tshig tu rnam par rtog pa'i sgra'i mar mes byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams tshig gi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba so so rang gis rig pa'i don gyi yul la rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni dngos po
translated: In the same way, Mahamati, the lamp of the word that is conceptualized as a word causes the great bodhisattvas to enter into the object that is the domain of the individually realized wisdom, which is free from conceptualized words.

original: dang dngos po med pa dang / gnyis ka la gnas pa'i sgra thams cad ni mngon sum dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul la spyir sgra'i don du sgro btags te gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu bsnyad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dang dngos po med pa dang / gnyis ka la gnas pa'i sgra thams cad ni mngon sum dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i yul la spyir sgra'i don du sgro btags te gsal bar byed pa'i rgyu bsnyad pa yin gyi /
translated: All words that abide in things, non-things, and both are generally imputed as the meaning of words in relation to the domain of direct perception and non-direct perception, and are explained as the cause of manifestation.

original: byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu ni ma yin te /
translated: But they are not the causal agent.

original: spyir brtags pa'i don nyid la sgra rnams 'jug pa na rang gi mtshan nyid bsnyad par byed do //
analyzed: spyir brtags pa'i don nyid la sgra rnams 'jug pa na rang gi mtshan nyid bsnyad par byed do //
translated: When words engage with the meaning that is generally imputed, they express the specific characteristics.

original: de ltar na de dag brtags pa'i tha snyad kyis gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na de dag brtags pa'i tha snyad kyis gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: Thus, they are clarified by the convention of their examination.

original: rang bzhin gyi sgra dang don du 'brel pa med cing /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi sgra dang don du 'brel pa med cing /
translated: There is no connection between the word ‚Äúnature‚Äù and its meaning.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur ma yin pa ni de dag mi 'bral ba'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur ma yin pa ni de dag mi 'bral ba'i dngos po ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not a cause and effect because it is not a thing that is inseparable from them.

original: ji ltar smras pa /
analyzed: ji ltar smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: sgra ni brjod par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: sgra ni brjod par gyur pa ni //
translated: The word, having been uttered,

original: don la the tshom rab tu 'byung //
analyzed: don la the tshom rab tu 'byung //
translated: Gives rise to doubt about the meaning.üîΩThus, one is certain from seeing the direct perception

original: de ltar mngon sum mthong ba dang // mtshan ma las ni nges par 'gyur //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum mthong ba dang // mtshan ma las ni nges par 'gyur // zhes pa ste /
translated: And from the sign.

original: ji ltar sgra'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa las rjes su dpags te /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i don gyi rnam par rtog pa las rjes su dpags te /
translated: Just as the meaning of a word is inferred from the conception of its meaning,

original: spyi las khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du sgra'i don spyi las kyang sgra dang bral bar rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gro ba /
analyzed: spyi las khyad par gyi mtshan nyid gsal bar byed pa de bzhin du sgra'i don spyi las kyang sgra dang bral bar rang gi mtshan nyid du 'gro ba /
translated: and the definition of a particular is clarified from the universal, in the same way, even from the universal meaning of a word, one goes to its own definition, free from the word.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid la btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jug go zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid la btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' 'jug go zhes bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who is a master of the ultimate truth, which is non-dual and free from thought and appearance, enters into the reality that is known.

original: @172b thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par mdzad pa /
analyzed: @172b thams cad mkhyen pas sgra'i don mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas bsgrub par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has established the meaning of the words by means of direct perception and inference.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / theg pa gsum ni theg pa gcig pa dang / chos lnga dang / sems dang / rang bzhin la sogs pa la sgra ji bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dang / theg pa gsum ni theg pa gcig pa dang / chos lnga dang / sems dang / rang bzhin la sogs pa la sgra ji bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the unborn, the unceasing, natural nirvana, the one vehicle of the three vehicles, the five dharmas, mind, nature, and so forth, should not be taken literally.

original: mngon par chags pa la brten nas mngon par chags pa zhes te /
analyzed: mngon par chags pa la brten nas mngon par chags pa zhes te /
translated: One should not say, I am attached to the literal meaning, based on attachment.

original: sgra ji bzhin par gsung bar mi bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsung ngo //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin par gsung bar mi bya'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsung ngo //
translated: The Omniscient One says that one should not speak literally.

original: sgra dang don spyir 'jug pa la yang /
analyzed: sgra dang don spyir 'jug pa la yang /
translated: Even in the case of engaging in the general meaning of words,

original: rigs pa dang / lung gis 'gal ba med par 'ga' zhig dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang / lung gis 'gal ba med par 'ga' zhig dpyad par bya'o //
translated: Some of these should be analyzed without contradiction by reasoning and scripture.

original: de ste ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnams ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bur chos rnams 'dzin na ni de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar na 'gyur /
analyzed: de ste ma skyes pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnams ni mo gsham gyi bu lta bur chos rnams 'dzin na ni de'i tshe kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar na 'gyur /
translated: If those that are unarisen and naturally in a state of nirvƒÅ·πáa were to apprehend phenomena like the son of a barren woman, then how could the presentation of affliction and purification occur?

original: des na bkri ba'i don rnams kyis nges pa'i don nyid shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na bkri ba'i don rnams kyis nges pa'i don nyid shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the provisional should be understood to be definitive meaning.

original: de ste yang ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa de lta bu rnams la don gyi bye brag med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can rnams la 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med de /
analyzed: de ste yang ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / rang bzhin gyis mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa de lta bu rnams la don gyi bye brag med par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe sems can rnams la 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa med de /
translated: If those that are unarisen and unceasing and naturally in a state of nirvƒÅ·πáa were to be without any distinction in meaning, then at that time sentient beings would not have sa·πÉsƒÅra and nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: chos ni gang /
analyzed: chos ni gang /
translated: What is the Dharma?

original: gang gis su la /
analyzed: gang gis su la /
translated: By whom is it taught?üîΩTo whom is it taught?

original: ci'i phyir na ston /
analyzed: ci'i phyir na ston /
translated: For what purpose is it taught?

original: theg pa gsum ni /
analyzed: theg pa gsum ni /
translated: The three vehicles are:

original: theg pa gcig ces pa der yang dgongs pa'i khyad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa gcig ces pa der yang dgongs pa'i khyad par shes par bya ste /
translated: The one vehicle should also be understood as having a special intention.

original: mna' ba'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nga smra zhes dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las so //
analyzed: mna' ba'i rgyu ni mya ngan las 'da' bar nga smra zhes dam pa'i chos punda r'i ka las so //
translated: The cause of the vehicle is stated in the Subahupariprccha: I declare nirvana to be the vehicle.

original: 'dir yang / de dag ting 'dzin myos pa rnams //
analyzed: 'dir yang / de dag ting 'dzin myos pa rnams //
translated: And here: Those intoxicated with samadhi

original: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i dbyings na gnas //
translated: dwell in the uncontaminated realm.

original: zhes pa'o // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ni gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni sangs rgyas su bya bar nus so //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las ni gang dag la snying rje'i sa bon yod pa de dag ni sangs rgyas su bya bar nus so //
translated: In the Samdhinirmocana, it says: Those who have the seed of compassion are able to become buddhas.

original: gang dag yang zhi ba phyogs gcig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni zhi ba nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: gang dag yang zhi ba phyogs gcig gi 'dod chags dang bral ba ni zhi ba nyid du gnas so //
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the one-sided peace remain in peace.

original: de de ltar na dam pa'i chos kyis bkri ba dang / nges pa'i don gyi bye brag yongs su shes pa'i phyir mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: de de ltar na dam pa'i chos kyis bkri ba dang / nges pa'i don gyi bye brag yongs su shes pa'i phyir mkhas par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should be wise in the distinction between the provisional and definitive meanings of the Dharma.

original: chos lnga ni de dag ming la sogs pa rnams brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i nang du gtogs so //
analyzed: chos lnga ni de dag ming la sogs pa rnams brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i nang du gtogs so //
translated: The five dharmas are included in the imagined, dependent, and perfected.

original: de la ming dang / mtshan ma dang / @173a * //
analyzed: de la ming dang / mtshan ma dang / @173a * //
translated: Name, sign,

original: brtags pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid du 'byed pa ni chos lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtags pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid du 'byed pa ni chos lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: conceptualization, correct knowing, and suchness are called the five dharmas.

original: de la ming ni kun brtags par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de la ming ni kun brtags par bsdu'o //
translated: Name is included in the imagined.

original: mtshan ma ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: Sign is the store consciousness.

original: lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su gsal bar snang ba gzhan gyi dbang ngo //üîΩde nyid rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su gsal bar snang ba gzhan gyi dbang ngo // de nyid rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: The appearance as body, resources, and abode is the other-dependent.üîΩIt is conceptualization.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa der bsdu'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa der bsdu'o //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization is included in that.

original: khyad par du ni kun brtags pa ste /
analyzed: khyad par du ni kun brtags pa ste /
translated: In particular, the imagined is the object of conceptualization.

original: yang brtags pa la sogs pa'i yul med pas na yul med pa'o //
analyzed: yang brtags pa la sogs pa'i yul med pas na yul med pa'o //
translated: Since there is no object of conceptualization, etc. , there is no object.

original: dam pa'i chos kyi lugs kyis brtags pa dang / kun brtags pa'i khyad par de'o //üîΩdbung  mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyi lugs kyis brtags pa dang / kun brtags pa'i khyad par de'o // dbung  mtha' rnam par 'byed pa las //
translated: The difference between the imagined and the conceptualized is the system of the true Dharma.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du byams pas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i mtshan nyid du byams pas gsungs pa'o //
translated: Maitreya has stated that correct knowing and suchness are the characteristic of the perfected in the MadhyƒÅntavibhƒÅga.

original: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid yongs su grub par bsdu'o //
translated: Therefore, correct knowledge and reality are included in the perfected.

original: 'phags pa'i bden par chos lnga bsdu ba ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden par chos lnga bsdu ba ni /
translated: The inclusion of the five subjects in the four noble truths is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung du'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams ni sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung du'o //
translated: The defiled are included in suffering and the origin.

original: dag pa ni 'gog pa dad lam du'o //
analyzed: dag pa ni 'gog pa dad lam du'o //
translated: The pure are included in cessation and the path.

original: de de ltar sgra ji bzhin pa tsam du dam pa'i chos kyi don du bye brag mi shes so //
analyzed: de de ltar sgra ji bzhin pa tsam du dam pa'i chos kyi don du bye brag mi shes so //
translated: Thus, he does not understand the meaning of the holy Dharma as it really is, merely according to the letter.

original: des na sgra ji bzhin pa'i don gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na sgra ji bzhin pa'i don gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not grasp the meaning according to the letter.

original: rigs pa dang lung gi dam pa'i chos kyi don ji ltar rung ba de ltar dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung gi dam pa'i chos kyi don ji ltar rung ba de ltar dpyad par bya'o //
translated: One should investigate the meaning of the holy Dharma according to what is reasonable and according to the scriptures.

original: klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi bsod nams 'thob po zhes zung gi mdo la sogs pa'i mdo sde las byung ba de rkyang don shes par bya'o //
analyzed: klung gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi bsod nams 'thob po zhes zung gi mdo la sogs pa'i mdo sde las byung ba de rkyang don shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the meaning of the sutras such as the Samgƒ´ti S≈´tra, which says, ‚ÄúOne obtains the merit of as many Buddhas as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River,‚Äù according to the reasonable meaning.

original: sems can thams cad la byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos la mngon par dad cing mnyam pa la sogs pas ngas sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir bsod nams 'thob po zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa mnyam pa nyid dang / chos la mngon par dad cing mnyam pa la sogs pas ngas sangs rgyas dang mnyam pa nyid 'thob pa'i phyir bsod nams 'thob po zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The equality of generating the Thought of Enlightenment in all sentient beings, and the equality of faith in the Dharma, etc., are to be understood as the meaning of the statement by the Omniscient One, ‚ÄúI obtain merit for the sake of attaining equality with the Buddhas.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams gang //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bsod nams gang //
translated: The merit of the Bodhisattva

original: bskal pa bye bar bsags pa ni //üîΩgzungs sngags 'di ni 'chang ba na //
analyzed: bskal pa bye bar bsags pa ni // gzungs sngags 'di ni 'chang ba na //
translated: which is accumulated for ten million eonsüîΩis all surpassed

original: zla gcig gis ni thams cad gnon //
analyzed: zla gcig gis ni thams cad gnon //
translated: in one month by the one who bears this dh√¢ra·πá√Æ.

original: zhes pa yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam pa'i bsod nams ni bsgom pa'i bsod nams kyis zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: zhes pa yang sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bsam pa'i bsod nams ni bsgom pa'i bsod nams kyis zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Also, the merit of giving, morality, and thought is surpassed by the merit of meditation.üîΩThe merit of giving is not even a hundredth part of the merit of meditation.

original: sbyin pa'i bsod nams snga ma de ni bsgom pa'i brgya'i char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje gcod pa la sogs par dam pa'i chos su klog pa @173b dgongs par gsungs par brtag go //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bsod nams snga ma de ni bsgom pa'i brgya'i char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rdo rje gcod pa la sogs par dam pa'i chos su klog pa @173b dgongs par gsungs par brtag go //
translated: This is stated in the Vajracchedik√¢, etc., as the holy Dharma.

original: 'dir dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang kar gshags par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi dgongs pa rab tu bstan pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir nga yang sangs rgyas de nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir dam pa'i chos kyi 'grel pa lang kar gshags par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis rang gi dgongs pa rab tu bstan pa ni sangs rgyas thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir nga yang sangs rgyas de nyid do //
translated: I am that Buddha, because of the sameness of all Buddhas.

original: rang gis yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa /
analyzed: rang gis yang dag par rig pa'i chos nyid kyi dbang du mdzad de gsungs pa /
translated: He speaks from the perspective of the reality that he himself has realized.

original: mngon par sangs rgyas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du chos ma bshad ces so //
analyzed: mngon par sangs rgyas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyi bar du chos ma bshad ces so //
translated: He says, From the time of manifest enlightenment until the time of complete nirvana, I have not taught any Dharma.

original: de bzhin du bdun brgya pa las /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdun brgya pa las /
translated: In the same way, the Sapta-satika-prajnaparamita-sutra says:

original: dngos po med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dngos po med pa'i de bzhin nyid ces te /
translated: The Tathagata is not a thing, and suchness is not a thing.

original: der ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa la glo bur gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po med pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: der ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa la glo bur gyis gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i phyir dngos po med pa'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: There, the thought is that the natural luminosity of the mind is not a thing, because it is free from the adventitious twofold appearance.

original: rang bzhin ni chos lnga'i gnas te chos kyi dbyings so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni chos lnga'i gnas te chos kyi dbyings so //
translated: The nature is the basis of the five dharmas, the dharmadhatu.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni thog ma nas zhi ba'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni thog ma nas zhi ba'o //
translated: The nature of complete nirvana is peace from the beginning.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig pa la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs par 'brel bar kun brtags pa ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ni chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa'i skad cig pa la skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa byed pa dang / byed pa po la sogs par 'brel bar kun brtags pa ni tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: The unborn and unceasing are not related to the non-existence of a self of phenomena and persons, to the momentary, to arising, abiding, and ceasing, and to the agent and action, and so on, because they are not suitable as different or not different.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam par skye ba med de /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam par skye ba med de /
translated: Also, in the selflessness of phenomena, there is no arising as the apprehender and apprehended.

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi dngos por so sor snang ba 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa la yang tha dad pa mi rtog go //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi dngos por so sor snang ba 'byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir gnyis su med pa la yang tha dad pa mi rtog go //
translated: Since there is no conception that distinguishes the appearance of the individual entities of self and other, nonduality is also not conceived as different.

original: brjod du med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyud la rang gi bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra rnams lta ci smos te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i skad cig pa'i rgyud la rang gi bdag nyid la rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por sems kyang mi rgyun yi ge dang sgra rnams lta ci smos te /
translated: In the continuum of the inexpressible instant, the mind does not even occur as the entity of that which is to be known and the knower, let alone as letters and sounds.

original: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas bzhengs te /
analyzed: thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas bzhengs te /
translated: Having awakened from the latent tendencies of compassion,

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la thams cad mkhyen pa bzhugs pa rnams kyis chos ston pa 'byung ngo zhes lan du mar bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is explained many times that the teaching of the dharma arises from the abodes of the omniscient ones in the pure mundane samadhi with appearances.

original: sgyu ma sna tshogs mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa lta bur sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba'i lta bar ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma sna tshogs mthong ba'i rnam par rtog pa lta bur sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba'i lta bar ltung ba yin no //
translated: Like the conceptualization of seeing various illusions, there is the view of superimposition and the view of denial.

original: rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan du so sor rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni yod do zhes sgro 'dogs pa dang / med do zhes skur pa ste /üîΩji ltar @174a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du gnas pa la rnam pa gzhan du so sor rnam par rtog pa zhes pa ni yod do zhes sgro 'dogs pa dang / med do zhes skur pa ste /üîΩji ltar @174a * //
translated: The statement conceptualizing something different in the different aspects is superimposition, saying it exists, and denial, saying it does not exist.

original: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa las mtha' gnyis rnam par dpyad pa ni dbu ma'i nan tan zhes so //
analyzed: 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dkon mchog brtsegs pa la sogs pa las mtha' gnyis rnam par dpyad pa ni dbu ma'i nan tan zhes so //
translated: The noble Perfection of Wisdom, the Heap of Jewels, and so on, analyze the two extremes, and this is called the practice of the Middle Way.

original: ji ltar 'di nyid du thams cad ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di nyid du thams cad ni rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa ma yin /
translated: Here, in the same way, everything is neither permanent nor impermanent, neither created nor uncreated,

original: thams cad ni ther zug pa dang / ther zug pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad ni ther zug pa dang / ther zug pa ma yin pa'ang ma yin /
translated: everything is neither eternal nor not eternal,

original: thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad ni 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas ma yin /
translated: everything is neither compounded nor uncompounded,

original: thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu ma yin /
translated: everything is neither cause nor effect,

original: yod pa dang med pa ma yin /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ma yin /
translated: everything is neither existent nor nonexistent,üîΩand neither both nor neither.

original: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par bram ze 'jig rten rgyang pan pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir gsungs pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam khong du ma chud pa'i phyir srin bal gyi srin bu rnams bdag nyid kyis
analyzed: gnyis ka dang gnyis ka ma yin pa'ang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs par bram ze 'jig rten rgyang pan pa sun dbyung ba'i phyir gsungs pa rang gi sems snang ba tsam khong du ma chud pa'i phyir srin bal gyi srin bu rnams bdag nyid kyis
translated: In order to refute the brahmin LokƒÅyata, this was taught. However, because they do not understand that all these are mere appearances of their own minds, like silkworms in a cocoon,

original: bdag nyid 'ching bar byas pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi rnam par rtog par lta ba'i mu stegs byed rnams gnyis kyi rnam par lhung ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid 'ching bar byas pa bzhin du phyi rol gyi rnam par rtog par lta ba'i mu stegs byed rnams gnyis kyi rnam par lhung ba yin no //
translated: The tƒ´rthikas, who view external conceptualization, fall into the duality of bondage and liberation.

original: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste //
analyzed: sems ni sgyu ma lta bu ste //
translated: The mind is like an illusion.

original: snang ba tsam pa la phyi rol gyi med pa la sgro btags te /
analyzed: snang ba tsam pa la phyi rol gyi med pa la sgro btags te /
translated: It is merely an appearance, but the external is superimposed.

original: snang ba ji bzhin pa la byis pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ltar ni med do //
analyzed: snang ba ji bzhin pa la byis pa rnams rnam par rtog pa ltar ni med do //
translated: It is not as it appears, as conceptualized by the childish.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: blo gros chen po sgyu ma sna tshogs ni rnam pa gzhan du lta ba yin na byis pa rnams rnam pa gzhan dang so sor rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: blo gros chen po sgyu ma sna tshogs ni rnam pa gzhan du lta ba yin na byis pa rnams rnam pa gzhan dang so sor rnam par rtog ste /
translated: MahƒÅmati, the various illusions are seen in another way, but the childish conceive them separately.

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes pa ni rtag pa dang / bdag dang / 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / bskyed pa dang / skyed pa po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu dang /
translated: The noble ones do not. This refers to permanence, self, grasping, grasped, action, agent, production, producer, cause and effect,

original: byas pa dang ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka la sogs par smra ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la byis pa rnams kyis kun rtog gi /
analyzed: byas pa dang ma byas pa dang / rtag pa dang chad pa dang yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka la sogs par smra ba gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa la byis pa rnams kyis kun rtog gi /
translated: The childish conceptualize the consciousness that has the aspect of the two, such as the produced and the unproduced, the permanent and the impermanent, existence and nonexistence, and so on.

original: brjod du med pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni 'phags pa rnams kyis mi rtog go //
analyzed: brjod du med pa bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa yang dag par rig pa la ni 'phags pa rnams kyis mi rtog go //
translated: The noble ones do not conceptualize the ultimate truth, which is inexpressible, inconceivable, and nonappearing, in terms of the correct awareness of the two, such as the produced and the unproduced, the permanent and the impermanent, existence and nonexistence, and so on.

original: der bdag dang gzhan gyi dngos por tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir de la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs par 'byed pa'am /
analyzed: der bdag dang gzhan gyi dngos por tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par shes pa med pa'i phyir de la rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / byas pa dang / ma byas pa dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu la sogs par 'byed pa'am /
translated: Because the consciousness that appears as the different entities of self and other does not exist there, there is no conceptualization that distinguishes it in terms of the permanent and the impermanent, the produced and the unproduced, the agent and the action, cause and effect, and so on.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog @174b pa med do //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rtog @174b pa med do //
translated: There is no conceptualization that appears as existence, nonexistence, both, and so on.

original: 'on kyang thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thams cad mkhyen pas rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis pa mdzub btsugs bzhin du spyi'i rnam par bsnyad par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang thugs rje'i bag chags kyis sad nas dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi thams cad mkhyen pas rang gi mtshan nyid mi gnyis pa mdzub btsugs bzhin du spyi'i rnam par bsnyad par mdzad do //
translated: However, having awakened through the habitual tendencies of compassion, the omniscience of meditative concentration, together with the appearances of the pure world, has described the non-duality of intrinsic characteristics like pointing with a finger.

original: de bzhin du yang shes rab can rnams kyis shes rab kyis dpyad cing chos dang gang zag la bdag med par mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ni rmi lam dang sprin las glog 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang shes rab can rnams kyis shes rab kyis dpyad cing chos dang gang zag la bdag med par mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / mi mdzes pa dang / stong pa'i rnam pas 'jug pa ni rmi lam dang sprin las glog 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, the wise, having analyzed with wisdom, engage with impermanence, suffering, ugliness, and emptiness in the selflessness of phenomena and individuals, like a dream or a flash of lightning in the clouds.

original: spyi'i rnam par bsnyad pa la yang gnyis kyi cha stong pa dang / 'gro ba skad cig pa'o zhes shes rab kyis khyad par gyi rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam par bsnyad pa la yang gnyis kyi cha stong pa dang / 'gro ba skad cig pa'o zhes shes rab kyis khyad par gyi rjes su 'jug go //
translated: In the description of the general aspect, the wise also engage with the specific aspects of the emptiness of the two parts and the momentariness of beings.

original: dge slong khyod med par 'gyur ba lta bur de kho na nyid sgoms shig ces nas des kyang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnam par phye ste /
analyzed: dge slong khyod med par 'gyur ba lta bur de kho na nyid sgoms shig ces nas des kyang phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa rnam par phye ste /
translated: He analyzed the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on,

original: gang gi lus kyi rdul phra mo 'dus pa skad cig pa la de bzhin du byas nas de ltar bdag tu chags pa nye bar zhi ste /
analyzed: gang gi lus kyi rdul phra mo 'dus pa skad cig pa la de bzhin du byas nas de ltar bdag tu chags pa nye bar zhi ste /
translated: and when he had done so, he pacified attachment to a self that is an aggregation of the subtle particles of the body.

original: des rtogs par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: des rtogs par 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: He thought, I have realized it!

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba rmi lam la sogs pa bzhin du stong pa ste /
translated: In the same way, he thought, The world is empty like a dream,üîΩand in the absence of a self, I have realized the selflessness of phenomena.

original: skyes pa'am / skyes pa med par chos la bdag med par rtogs shing phyi rol gyi phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ba na stong par mthong ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'am / skyes pa med par chos la bdag med par rtogs shing phyi rol gyi phyogs kyi cha tha dad pas phye ba na stong par mthong ste /
translated: When I analyze the external world into different directions, I see that it is empty.

original: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi la sogs par chags pa ldog go //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gi la sogs par chags pa ldog go //
translated: I have stopped attachment to permanence, a self, mine, and so on.

original: ji bzhin sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas phyi rol gyi bar kun rtag pa dang / la las rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir sgro 'dogs so //
analyzed: ji bzhin sgra zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i sgra thos nas phyi rol gyi bar kun rtag pa dang / la las rtag pa dang / bdag dang / bdag gir sgro 'dogs so //
translated: The words just as sound and so on refer to the superimposition of permanence, self, and mine on external objects, having heard the words form and so on.

original: de ltar na yang log pa'i shes pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na yang log pa'i shes pa las 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the suffering of cyclic existence is connected to mistaken cognition.

original: phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du phung po rnams la rtag pa'i bdag sgro 'dogs pa de bzhin dud ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: phung po rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du phung po rnams la rtag pa'i bdag sgro 'dogs pa de bzhin dud ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: The words in the aggregates and so on mean that just as a permanent self is superimposed on the aggregates, in the same way, it does not exist, like the son of a barren woman and so on.

original: phung po rnams gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni nang glongs pa'i mthu las rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba'i rnam pa lta bur gsal ba der brtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sgro 'dogs so //
analyzed: phung po rnams gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pa ni nang glongs pa'i mthu las rab rib dang / mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba'i rnam pa lta bur gsal ba der brtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas sgro 'dogs so //
translated: The aggregates, which are under the influence of others, are superimposed by the conceptualization of investigation and so on, like the appearance of floaters, dizziness, and fainting due to the power of internal disturbances.

original: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar rnam par sgro btags @175a * //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa'i rtag pa dang / bdag dang / phyi rol dang / bde ba dang / gtsang bar rnam par sgro btags @175a * //
translated: All things and so on are the superimpositions of permanence, self, external, pleasure, and purity.

original: te ; ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags bzhin //
analyzed: te ; ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags bzhin //
translated: As it is said: The world is imagined by the childish, but not by the noble ones.

original: de ste dngos po dang dngos po med pa de bzhin na ni thams cad kyis yang dag par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de ste dngos po dang dngos po med pa de bzhin na ni thams cad kyis yang dag par mthong ba yin no //
translated: If things and non-things were like that, then everyone would see reality.

original: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa la chos thams cad ni gzugs la sogs pa ste /
translated: As for all phenomena and so on, all phenomena are form and so on.

original: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang gzung ba'i rnam pas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not exist in the form of apprehender and apprehended.

original: de lta bas na de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / dag pa med de 'khrul pa'i rnam pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag la nyon mongs pa dang / dag pa med de 'khrul pa'i rnam pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, they are neither defiled nor purified, because they are the aspect of error.

original: rmi lam du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du kun nas nyon mongs pa dang dag pa bzhin no //
translated: Like defilement and purification in a dream.

original: so sor snang ba tsam du de dag ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin te /
analyzed: so sor snang ba tsam du de dag ni gzugs brnyan la sogs pa bzhin te /
translated: They are mere individual appearances, like reflections and so on.

original: mthong ba dang mi mthong ba las dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang mi mthong ba las dngos po dang dngos po med pa'o //
translated: From the point of view of being seen or not being seen, there are entities and non-entities.üîΩAs it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bcings pa yang med /üîΩdgrol ba yang med pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags ma shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las 'byung ba rab 'byor chos thams cad ni bcings pa yang med / dgrol ba yang med pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, all phenomena are neither bound nor liberated.

original: brtags pa'i bdag dang / bdag gi pa rnams kyi dngos po med pas na 'ching ba dang bkrol pa med de /
analyzed: brtags pa'i bdag dang / bdag gi pa rnams kyi dngos po med pas na 'ching ba dang bkrol pa med de /
translated: Because of the non-existence of the self and what belongs to the self, which are imputed, there is neither bondage nor liberation.

original: ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva dang mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the horns of a rabbit, the son of a barren woman, and so on.

original: gzhan gyi dbang rnams ni skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang rnams ni skye ba'i rang bzhin med de /
translated: The dependent nature is not of the nature of arising.

original: rang bzhin gyis rmi lam gyi thar pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rmi lam gyi thar pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a dream, which is naturally liberated.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam par stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa rnams glo bur gyi gnyis kyi rnam par stong pa nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is empty of the duality of the adventitious two.

original: de dag rin po che dang gser la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyi dri ma dang 'brel pa las rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rin po che dang gser la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyi dri ma dang 'brel pa las rnam par dag par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that they become pure by being free from stains by nature, like jewels, gold, and so on.

original: des na chos thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par dag pa med do zhes dgongs nas /
analyzed: des na chos thams cad la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang / rnam par dag pa med do zhes dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, with the thought that all phenomena are neither defiled nor purified,

original: rab 'byor chos thams cad bcings pa med pa dang / bkrol ba med pa'o zhes so ;üîΩ/'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sgra ji bzhin pa'i don la dgongs pa dpyad pa drug pa'o /
analyzed: rab 'byor chos thams cad bcings pa med pa dang / bkrol ba med pa'o zhes so ; /'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa ye shes dpal bzang pos sbyar ba'i le'u gsum pa las sgra ji bzhin pa'i don la dgongs pa dpyad pa drug pa'o /
translated: Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are neither bound nor liberated.

original: // / gzhan yang blo gros chen po ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid khyod la bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la blo gros chen po ye shes rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: // / gzhan yang blo gros chen po ye shes dang rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid khyod la bshad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la blo gros chen po ye shes rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Furthermore, MahƒÅmati, I will explain to you the characteristics of wisdom and consciousness.üîΩTherein, MahƒÅmati, there are three kinds of wisdom:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mchog go zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: mundane, supramundane, and the highest supramundane.

original: de la skyes nas 'jig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas @175b tha dad pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la skyes nas 'jig pa ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi gnas @175b tha dad pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The line What is born and perishes is consciousness means that it is devoid of a difference in location at the beginning and end.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa lta bu ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes su brtag go //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog la sogs pa lta bu ni 'jig rten pa'i ye shes su brtag go //
translated: The line What is like a finger snap or lightning is to be considered mundane wisdom means that it is devoid of a difference in time.

original: ma skyes mi 'jig pa ni ye shes so zhes pa ni gang skye ba dang 'jig pa rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa med cing skad cig pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
