analyzed: ma skyes mi 'jig pa ni ye shes so zhes pa ni gang skye ba dang 'jig pa rnam pa tha dad par snang ba'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa med cing skad cig pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The line What is unborn and imperishable is wisdom means that it is devoid of a difference in the appearance of the aspects of birth and destruction. The absence of conceptualization of phenomena and their momentariness is supramundane.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be free from the aspects of duality.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos ni 'jig rten pas rnam par rtog go //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa la sogs pa'i chos ni 'jig rten pas rnam par rtog go //
translated: Mundane people conceptualize phenomena as having birth and destruction, etc.

original: yang na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par lung ston pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: yang na tha dad pa dang tha dad pa ma yin par lung ston pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Or, it is the proponents of the statements of difference and non-difference.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa med pa'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba ste /
translated: The Buddhists, however, maintain that dependent origination is the non-existence of the agent and the object of action.

original: ji ltar / 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: ji ltar / 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: As it is said: All that is compounded is momentary.üîΩHow can the unstable be an agent?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //
translated: That which arises is the very agent.

original: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: It is also called the object of action.

original: ces te / des na lhag pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa med pas na ma skyes pa mi 'jig par dang chos dang gang zag la bdag med par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: ces te / des na lhag pa'i skye ba dang / 'jig pa med pas na ma skyes pa mi 'jig par dang chos dang gang zag la bdag med par dgongs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since there is no arising or destruction of anything else, the intended meaning is that the unarisen does not cease and that there is selflessness in phenomena and in persons.

original: mu stegs byed rnams kyi ma skyes pa nyid mi 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs byed rnams kyi ma skyes pa nyid mi 'jig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The non-Buddhist‚Äôs unarisen does not not cease.

original: ye shes ni bdag la sogs pa bzhin du brtags pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni bdag la sogs pa bzhin du brtags pa ste /
translated: Wisdom is imagined to be like a self, etc.

original: ji ltar skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can no zhes grangs can rnams so //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu'i rang bzhin ni tshor ba can no zhes grangs can rnams so //
translated: The Samkhyas say that the nature of a person is to feel.

original: 'o na snang ba ci zhig ces pa dang / 'di bdag ste rang snang ngo zhes te /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba ci zhig ces pa dang / 'di bdag ste rang snang ngo zhes te /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is this appearance?‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is a self, it is a self-appearance.‚Äù

original: rang nyid yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rig sngags 'dzin pas bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid yang dag par rig pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rig sngags 'dzin pas bsam pa'o //
translated: The mantra-holder should think, ‚ÄúI am the nature of perfect knowledge.‚Äù

original: der ni sgra dang don la bslab pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mthar smra ba rnams kyi rtsod pa che zhing mang ngo //
analyzed: der ni sgra dang don la bslab pa'i bdag dang gzhan gyi grub pa'i mthar smra ba rnams kyi rtsod pa che zhing mang ngo //
translated: There is much debate among those who propound the tenets of our own and other schools about the training in words and meanings.

original: ma skyes pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i ye shes la ji ltar kha cig smra ba /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang 'jig pa med pa'i ye shes la ji ltar kha cig smra ba /
translated: How is it that some say that the wisdom of non-arising and non-ceasingüîΩis not real?

original: yang dag par ni 'dus byas stong //
analyzed: yang dag par ni 'dus byas stong //
translated: ‚Äú The conditioned is empty.

original: rgyu bzhin rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu bzhin rkyen las 'byung ba'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises from conditions like a cause,

original: 'dus ma byas kyang yang dag min //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang yang dag min //
translated: the unconditioned is also not real.

original: yang dag min pa mkhas min bzhin //
analyzed: yang dag min pa mkhas min bzhin //
translated: The wise do not consider what is not real to be real.‚Äù

original: zhes te / gang skye ba dang 'gag pa de ni kun rdzob bden pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: zhes te / gang skye ba dang 'gag pa de ni kun rdzob bden pa'i ye shes te /
translated: That which arises and ceases is the wisdom of conventional truth,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like dreams, illusions, and so forth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Ultimate truth is without nature,

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa bzhin du ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa ste /
translated: unborn and unceasing, like the horn of a rabbit and so forth.

original: des na sangs rgyas kho na ye shes kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: des na sangs rgyas kho na ye shes kyang kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Therefore, only the Buddha has the intuition of the ultimate truth.

original: @176a * // don dam pa'i bden pa ci yin zhes pa la ci'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: @176a * // don dam pa'i bden pa ci yin zhes pa la ci'ang ma yin te /
translated: What is the ultimate truth? It is nothing at all.

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes so //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin zhes so //
translated: It is the nature of non-existence.

original: la la yang rang gi rnam par rtog pas bslad de /
analyzed: la la yang rang gi rnam par rtog pas bslad de /
translated: Some, however, are confused by their own ideas.

original: ma skyes pa dang mi 'jig pa ni sgra'i don brtags pa tsam gyis de dag rtsod de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chud pa la 'khor bar sdug bsngal tshor ba dang / grol ba'i dus na sdug bsngal med par 'gyur bar dgongs na dam pa'i chos mi shes so //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang mi 'jig pa ni sgra'i don brtags pa tsam gyis de dag rtsod de kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i chud pa la 'khor bar sdug bsngal tshor ba dang / grol ba'i dus na sdug bsngal med par 'gyur bar dgongs na dam pa'i chos mi shes so //
translated: They argue about non-production and non-cessation as if they were mere verbal objects. They do not understand the holy teaching that the end of defilement and purification is the time of liberation, when there is no feeling of suffering in cyclic existence.

original: de ltar na yang gnas kyi rim par dbye ba na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gnas kyi rim par dbye ba na /
translated: Now, in the analysis of the stages of the abode,

original: ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
translated: how is it permanent?

original: ma skyes pa dang mi 'jig pa gsungs su zin kyang /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang mi 'jig pa gsungs su zin kyang /
translated: Although it is said to be non-produced and non-ceasing,

original: skye ba dang byed pa dang byed pa por 'grel par mngon par chags pa gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par gsal ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye ba dang byed pa dang byed pa por 'grel par mngon par chags pa gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par gsal ba'i phyir te /
translated: because the Commentary makes it clear that the otherness and non-otherness of arising, action, and agent are attachments.

original: de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la yang brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zag la bdag med pa la yang brjod do //
translated: And so it is with the selflessness of persons.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las gsungs pa /
translated: And as for the selflessness of things, it is as stated in the Sa·π≠pƒÅramitƒÅ-samgraha:

original: don rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa gzhan gyi dbang la skye ba'i rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: The nature of the dependent origination of the various aspects of objects is essencelessness.

original: rnam pa de lta bur mi skye ba ni rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur mi skye ba ni rab rib la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Non-arising in that way is like the consciousness of one with cataracts, etc.

original: don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i rang bzhin med pa ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pas stong pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate essencelessness is the emptiness of the apprehended and apprehender of the naturally luminous mind.

original: de yang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa kho nar brtags pas srid pa dang thar pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rim par dbye ba na skad cig pa nyid do //üîΩdbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas des na 'dus ma byas pa kho na'i rgyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas pa kho nar brtags pas srid pa dang thar pa'i rgyun du 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rim par dbye ba na skad cig pa nyid do // dbang po la sogs pa sus kyang ma byas pas des na 'dus ma byas pa kho na'i rgyu ni de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: occur in the continuum of cyclic existence and liberation, they are momentary.

original: chos nyid yongs kyis gnas so //
analyzed: chos nyid yongs kyis gnas so //
translated: Since it is not created by anyone, such as a creator god, the cause of only the unconditioned is the reality that completely abides whether a tathƒÅgata appears or not.

original: des na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ston pas btags pa'o //
analyzed: des na 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni ston pas btags pa'o //
translated: Therefore the terms conditioned and unconditioned are imputations of the Teacher.

original: 'dus byas kho na'am 'dus ma byas pa kho na bar tha snyad du bya ba de de ltar bkri ba'i don du dgongs pa'i khyad par gang dag gis mi shes pa de dag ma skyes pa dang / mi 'jig pa rtag par rtog go //
analyzed: 'dus byas kho na'am 'dus ma byas pa kho na bar tha snyad du bya ba de de ltar bkri ba'i don du dgongs pa'i khyad par gang dag gis mi shes pa de dag ma skyes pa dang / mi 'jig pa rtag par rtog go //
translated: Those who do not understand the special intention of the statement that the conditioned and the unconditioned are to be conventionally designated as only the conditioned or only the unconditioned, respectively, imagine that the unarisen and the unceased are permanent.

original: kha cig gis ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig gis ni rang bzhin med pa ste /
translated: Some say that it is essenceless.

original: skad cig pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na dang / dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa kho na zhe'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa kho na dang / dngos po med pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa kho na zhe'o //
translated: The momentary is only the conventional truth, and the non-entity is only the ultimate truth.

original: gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi dngos por yang stong par klog go //
analyzed: gang zhig sangs rgyas kyi dngos por yang stong par klog go //
translated: One should read the emptiness of the Buddha-entity.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gzhan gyi @176b dbang gi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po gzhan gyi @176b dbang gi rnam pa gnyis kyi rnam pas stong pa nyid de /
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are empty in the aspect of the other-dependent, in the manner of the two.

original: de bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa med do //
analyzed: de bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa yang dag par rig pa la gnod pa med pa'i phyir don dam pa'i bden pa med do //
translated: Since the ultimate truth is not negated in the absence of thought and appearance, it is not non-existent.

original: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar rdo rje gcod pa las 'byung ba /
translated: As it is said in the Vajracchedika:

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de tsam du brdzun no //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de tsam du brdzun no //
translated: To the extent that there is perfection of the major marks, to that extent there is falsehood.

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa de tsam du mi brdzun no //
translated: To the extent that there is no perfection of the major marks, to that extent there is no falsehood.

original: bcom ldan 'das ma las mtshan med ces pa ni gnyis su med par yang dag par rig cing brjod du med pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma las mtshan med ces pa ni gnyis su med par yang dag par rig cing brjod du med pa'o //
translated: In the Bhagavati, the signless is said to be the non-dual, perfect knowledge and inexpressibility.

original: chos dang chos can du 'byed pa ji tsam du mtshan nyid du kun rtog pa de tsam du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos dang chos can du 'byed pa ji tsam du mtshan nyid du kun rtog pa de tsam du gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: As long as there is the conceptual differentiation of the dharmin and dharma, there is the inappropriateness of sameness and difference.

original: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa lnga mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i yon tan la sogs pa'i chos lta bur kun brtags pa /
analyzed: grang ba dang / dro ba dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med pa lnga mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnams kyi spyi'i yon tan la sogs pa'i chos lta bur kun brtags pa /
translated: The conceptual differentiation of the general characteristics of impermanence, etc., in regard to the five aggregates, beginning with form, is like the conceptual differentiation of the general characteristics of the qualities, etc., of the dharmin, fire, such as heat.

original: gal te chos can de dag las tha dad par gyur du zin na ni grang ba la dro ba dang / gzugs can la gzugs med pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du phyin ci log par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te chos can de dag las tha dad par gyur du zin na ni grang ba la dro ba dang / gzugs can la gzugs med pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du phyin ci log par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they were different from those dharmins, then heat would be the nature of cold, the formless would be the nature of the corporeal, the permanent would be the nature of the impermanent, etc.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir phyogs su ni chos dang / chos can dang / mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir phyogs su ni chos dang / chos can dang / mtshan ma'i gzhi dang / mtshan ma tha mi dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: But because they are not different, the dharmin, the dharma, the basis of the sign, and the sign would not be different.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa ste /
translated: All conditioned things are the conventional truth,

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a dream, an illusion, etc.

original: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste /üîΩde yang 'dus byas sam /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni don dam pa ste / de yang 'dus byas sam /
translated: The opposite of that is the ultimate.

original: 'dus ma byas pa dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be analyzed as either conditioned or unconditioned.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob ces pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ni kun rdzob ces pa'o //
translated: The dependent nature that has the aspect of duality is the conventional.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa ni nges par 'jug pa'i dbang po'i shes pa yang dag par rig pa bzhin no //
translated: The opposite of that is the nature of the perfected, which is like the cognition of a sense consciousness that is engaged in a real object.

original: ci gnyis su med par grub pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci gnyis su med par grub pa'i ye shes ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin nam /
translated: Is the nondual cognition that is established the ultimate truth?

original: yang na ci gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi mthun pa mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pa yin /
analyzed: yang na ci gnyis pa dang mi gnyis pa'i 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid dang / mi mthun pa mo gsham gyi bu dang / ri bong gi rva med pa'i rang bzhin don dam pa'i bden pa yin /
translated: Or is the ultimate truth the nature of the nonexistence of the son of a barren woman and the horn of a rabbit, which is the opposite of the characteristic of a conditioned thing that is either dual or nondual?

original: ma skyes pa dang / mi 'jig pa ni dgongs par bshad pa dang bral te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / mi 'jig pa ni dgongs par bshad pa dang bral te /
translated: Nonarising and noncessation are free from being explained as having an intended meaning.

original: sgra ji bzhin pa ni de'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin pa ni de'i tshe yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang bar mi rung ngo //
translated: At that time, the literal reading is not suitable for either the afflictive or the purified.

original: brtags pa lta bu dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du grub pa yang med do zhes gang smras pa de ni dam pa'i chos las sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: brtags pa lta bu dang / gzhan gyi dbang bzhin du grub pa yang med do zhes gang smras pa de ni dam pa'i chos las sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i las sgrub par byed de /
translated: What was said, that it does not exist as imagined, nor as dependent, is the practice of the action that produces suffering in the good dharma.

original: @177a * // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa'i don de nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong zhing dbus su gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: @177a * // dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las thams cad mkhyen pa'i dgongs pa'i don de nyid sgyu ma lta bu'i rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba thog ma dang tha ma'i mthar stong zhing dbus su gnyis kyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid do //
translated: In the Samdhinirmocana, the meaning of the intention of the Omniscient One is that the illusion-like dependent origination is empty of a beginning and end, and in the middle it is empty of the nature of duality.

original: skad cig pa gcig ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i mtha'i skad cig pa dang 'brel pa med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa gcig ni thog ma dang / tha ma'i mtha'i skad cig pa dang 'brel pa med do //
translated: One moment is not connected with the beginning and end moments.

original: des na byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa dang bral ba snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na byed pa dang / byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel pa dang bral ba snga ma'i 'og tu 'di yod na 'di yod do zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the action and the agent are connected and disconnected. After the former, if this exists, that exists.

original: de ltar yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa gcig la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig pa gcig la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the phenomena of arising, enduring, ceasing, and so on do not exist in a single moment.

original: des na skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
analyzed: des na skye ba dang / 'gag pa med pa ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba'o zhes thams cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the absence of arising and ceasing is dependent origination. This is the intended meaning of the Omniscient One.

original: de ltar yang pa yang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de ltar yang pa yang chos dang gang zag la bdag med pa chos nyid dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Thus, the selflessness of phenomena and the selflessness of persons do not contradict reality.

original: chos la bdag med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pas ma skyes pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa ni gnyis kyi rnam pas ma skyes pa rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The selflessness of phenomena is non-arising in terms of duality, like a dream, an illusion, and so on.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gang yod pa thams cad skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa yang gang yod pa thams cad skad cig pa ste /
translated: The selflessness of persons is that all that exists is momentary.

original: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra dang / glog dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like the sound of a finger snap, lightning, a waterfall, and so on.

original: rtag pa ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
analyzed: rtag pa ma skyes pas na mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa bzhin du dngos po med do //
translated: Since it is permanent and non-arisen, like the son of a barren woman and so on, it is not a thing.

original: gang yang skad cig pa mngon sum pa'o zhes brjod pa ji ltar na rung /
analyzed: gang yang skad cig pa mngon sum pa'o zhes brjod pa ji ltar na rung /
translated: Also, how could it be that what is momentary is directly perceived?

original: la las skad cig pa drug tu gnas zhes der gtogs pa ni se gol gyi sgra'i dus na skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhi 'da' ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: la las skad cig pa drug tu gnas zhes der gtogs pa ni se gol gyi sgra'i dus na skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhi 'da' ba lta bu'o //
translated: Some say that it lasts for six moments, and that which belongs to that is the passing of sixty-four moments in the time of the sound of a finger-snap.

original: kha cig smra ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig smra ba ni /
translated: Some say:

original: rmi lam gyi dus yun thung du der yang lo brgya la sogs par tshor ba myong ba ste /
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus yun thung du der yang lo brgya la sogs par tshor ba myong ba ste /
translated: Even in the short time of a dream, one experiences the feeling of a hundred years, and so on.

original: de de bzhin du skad cig pa'i dus la chud pa so sor nges pa med cing 'khor bar snang ba'i tshad la dus gsum gyi rtog pa med do //
analyzed: de de bzhin du skad cig pa'i dus la chud pa so sor nges pa med cing 'khor bar snang ba'i tshad la dus gsum gyi rtog pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the time of a moment is not definitely included in the time of a moment, and there is no conception of the three times in the measure of the appearance of cyclic existence.

original: de bas na 'khor ba med pa'i phyir thar par rnam par rtog pa gang yid ches par byed pa ga la zhig ces pa ni rgyu thams cad dang 'gal bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'khor ba med pa'i phyir thar par rnam par rtog pa gang yid ches par byed pa ga la zhig ces pa ni rgyu thams cad dang 'gal bar smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since cyclic existence does not exist, how can one believe in the conception of liberation? This is the statement of the contradiction with all causes.

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bar gzhag pa ni snang ba ji bzhin pa dang rjes su mthun par gnyis dang mi gnyis par smra ba la sogs pas de khas lan to //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bar gzhag pa ni snang ba ji bzhin pa dang rjes su mthun par gnyis dang mi gnyis par smra ba la sogs pas de khas lan to //
translated: The establishment of valid cognition and the object of comprehension is accepted by the proponents of two and non-two in accordance with the way things appear.

original: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang glog la sogs pa rnams kyis skad cig pa thog ma dang tha ma'i dus dang bral ba shin tu myur bar 'jig pa mngon sum pa de nyid skad cig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar se gol gyi sgra dang glog la sogs pa rnams kyis skad cig pa thog ma dang tha ma'i dus dang bral ba shin tu myur bar 'jig pa mngon sum pa de nyid skad cig pa kho na'o //
translated: Just as the sound of a finger snap and lightning, etc., are directly perceived to be momentary, and to be destroyed very quickly, without a beginning or end.

original: gang yang grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka @177b dang ; khyad par can rnams kyis skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun rtog pa de ni rim gyis 'byung gi cig car ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang grangs can dang ne yi ya yi ka @177b dang ; khyad par can rnams kyis skad cig pa drug tu gnas par kun rtog pa de ni rim gyis 'byung gi cig car ni ma yin no //
translated: And the six moments of the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, the NyƒÅya, the Vai≈õe·π£ika, and the Vai≈õe·π£ika are conceived to endure, but they occur gradually, not instantaneously.

original: ji ltar grangs can rnams kyi skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / zad par 'gyur pa dang / rnam par 'jig ces pa ni dngos po'i 'gyur pa rnam pa drug cig car mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: ji ltar grangs can rnams kyi skye ba dang / yod pa dang / 'gyur ba dang / rnam par 'phel ba dang / zad par 'gyur pa dang / rnam par 'jig ces pa ni dngos po'i 'gyur pa rnam pa drug cig car mi 'byung ste /
translated: Just as the six transformations of entities of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas‚Äîarising, existence, change, increase, destruction, and disintegration‚Äîdo not occur simultaneously,

original: rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not conceived to be so.

original: ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa'i skad cig pa rnams kyang skad cig pa'i dus la de las phyi ma'i skad cig la gzhan gyi dngos po rtog par mi 'gyur ba ni ji ltar yod pa dang 'brel pa dang / gnas pa'i dus dang /
analyzed: ne yi ya yi ka la sogs pa'i skad cig pa rnams kyang skad cig pa'i dus la de las phyi ma'i skad cig la gzhan gyi dngos po rtog par mi 'gyur ba ni ji ltar yod pa dang 'brel pa dang / gnas pa'i dus dang /
translated: The instants of a nyƒÅya, etc., are not conceived to be different in the subsequent instant from the previous instant, and so on.

original: yon tan gzhan 'byung ba'i dus dang / dmigs pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu bsnyen dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan 'byung ba'i dus dang / dmigs pa'i dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'i rgyu bsnyen dus dang / rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: The time of existence, the time of the origin of another quality, the time of the object, the time of the cause of destruction approaching, and the time of destruction.

original: de de ltar rim gyis 'byung ba'i skad cig pa rnams dus gcig tu 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de de ltar rim gyis 'byung ba'i skad cig pa rnams dus gcig tu 'byung ba med do //
translated: Thus, the instants arise in sequence, not simultaneously.

original: ji ltar na shin tu myur du 'jig pa'i rnam pas skad cig pa drug gi bar du gnas par rung /
analyzed: ji ltar na shin tu myur du 'jig pa'i rnam pas skad cig pa drug gi bar du gnas par rung /
translated: How can they endure for six instants due to the mode of destruction being very quick?

original: skad cig pa rnams kyis ji ltar se gol gyi sgra'i dus la skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhi 'byung zhes te /
analyzed: skad cig pa rnams kyis ji ltar se gol gyi sgra'i dus la skad cig pa drug cu rtsa bzhi 'byung zhes te /
translated: How can the instants arise in the time of the sound of a finger snap, which is said to have sixty-four instants?

original: de bzhin du mthe bong dang / sor mo'i yan lag rim gyis reg nas phrad pa'i 'og tu skyes pa'i sgra la skad cig par thos so zhes pa de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la skad cig par rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthe bong dang / sor mo'i yan lag rim gyis reg nas phrad pa'i 'og tu skyes pa'i sgra la skad cig par thos so zhes pa de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la skad cig par rab tu grub pa'o //
translated: In the same way, when the fingers and toes are gradually touched and the contact is felt, the sound of birth is heard in an instant. In the same way, all philosophical tenets are well established in an instant.

original: rmi lam gyi dus ltar rab tu bslad pas 'khrugs pa'i chud pa la dus yun thung du dang ring por nges pa med do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi dus ltar rab tu bslad pas 'khrugs pa'i chud pa la dus yun thung du dang ring por nges pa med do //
translated: Like in a dream, the time is not determined as short or long, as it is disturbed by strong delusion.

original: gang yang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa yang dag par rig pa de la bdag tha dad par 'dzin pa med do //
analyzed: gang yang don dam pa'i bden pa gnyis su med pa'i skad cig pa yang dag par rig pa de la bdag tha dad par 'dzin pa med do //
translated: In the ultimate truth, which is nondual and momentary, there is no grasping at a separate self.

original: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten gyi ye shes kyis skad cig re rer myong ba lta bur thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pa dang / bral ba'i skad cig pa rtogs pas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba dang bcas pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i dag pa 'jig rten gyi ye shes kyis skad cig re rer myong ba lta bur thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim pa tha dad pa dang / bral ba'i skad cig pa rtogs pas na /
translated: However, all appearances are experienced in each moment by the pure worldly wisdom of omniscience, as if they were separate in the beginning and end, due to the realization of the momentary.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dus gsum gyi don gang yin pa don de dben par snang ba ni mig gi ling tog med pa lta bu'i ye shes pa la'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes la dus gsum gyi don gang yin pa don de dben par snang ba ni mig gi ling tog med pa lta bu'i ye shes pa la'o //
translated: The meaning of the three times appears to the pristine wisdom of omniscience, which is free from the obscurations of attachment and so forth, as if it were an object, just as the eye sees forms when the eye disease is cured.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'khrul pa la ni nye bar gyur kyang ye shes mi 'jug go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pas 'khrul pa la ni nye bar gyur kyang ye shes mi 'jug go //
translated: Pristine wisdom does not engage in the confusion of attachment and so forth.

original: gang gi tshe na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe na nyon @178a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang bral bar gyur pa de'i tshe na nyon @178a * //
translated: When one is free from attachment and so forth,

original: mongs pa kun dang bral ba'i ye shes kun tu 'jug go //
analyzed: mongs pa kun dang bral ba'i ye shes kun tu 'jug go //
translated: pristine wisdom, which is free from all afflictions, engages.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par lhung ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan mar ltung ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med par lhung ba'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs par snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan mar ltung ba ste /
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the consciousness that falls into signs and signlessness is the falling into signs by the characteristics of the appearance of form and so forth.

original: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med par yang nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med par yang nang 'khrugs pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Without an external object, there is a variety of aspects, like the whirling of the head and fainting, etc., due to the power of internal disturbance.

original: mtshan ma med par lhung ba ni gang gi tshe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med par lhung ba ni gang gi tshe na /
translated: Falling into the signless is when,

original: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
analyzed: gzugs ni rdul phran gzhigs pa na //
translated: having analyzed with wisdom that form is the analysis of atoms,

original: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
analyzed: rdul phran cha ni med pa ste //
translated: the atom has no parts,

original: zhes par shes rab kyis dpyad de mtshan ma mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: zhes par shes rab kyis dpyad de mtshan ma mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa nyid gnas so //
translated: at that time, without thought, without appearance, the ultimate truth, non-dual perfect knowledge itself, abides.

original: yod pa dang med par lhung ba dang zhes bya ba la yod pa dang med ces bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod kyi /
analyzed: yod pa dang med par lhung ba dang zhes bya ba la yod pa dang med ces bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis gnyis kyi rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa la tha dad pa'i tha snyad yod kyi /
translated: Falling into existence and non-existence means that for the childish, the consciousness of the two aspects has the convention of difference.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa so sor tha dad par snang ba ni med do //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes la ni dngos po dang / dngos po med pa'i rnam par rtog pa so sor tha dad par snang ba ni med do //
translated: In the nondual wisdom of ultimate truth, there is no appearance of the conceptual differentiation of things and nonthings.

original: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa de yang gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam pa'i shes pa de yang gzhan gyi dbang ngo //
translated: That consciousness with the aspect of duality is the other-dependent.

original: mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi rgyu las skyes pa zhes pa ni bslad pa ni sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid mtshan ma rgyu gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid sna tshogs kyi rgyu las skyes pa zhes pa ni bslad pa ni sna tshogs kyi mtshan nyid mtshan ma rgyu gang la yod pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from a cause of various characteristics‚Äù means that the adulterated is that which has a cause of various characteristics, of various signs.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs de lta bu'i gzugs gang na yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs de lta bu'i gzugs gang na yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has various aspects, various forms, is so called.

original: gang sna tshogs pa de rgyu sna tshogs las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gang sna tshogs pa de rgyu sna tshogs las skyes pa ste /
translated: That which is various is arisen from a cause of various things.

original: de tshon du mas ri mo bris pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de tshon du mas ri mo bris pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a painting with many colors.

original: 'khor bar yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tha dad par dbye ba na rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor bar yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa tha dad par dbye ba na rnam par shes pa sna tshogs pa yin te /
translated: In cyclic existence, there is a differentiation of various things, such as pleasure and pain, and so consciousness is various.

original: des na skye bo rnams kyi las du ma'i rgyus skyes par shes pa'o //
analyzed: des na skye bo rnams kyi las du ma'i rgyus skyes par shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is understood that it arises from the cause of the many actions of beings.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ye shes te /üîΩbsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pas na der yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan ma med pa las shin tu 'das pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can ni ye shes te / bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig pa ni mtshan ma thams cad las 'das pas na der yod pa dang / med pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang /
translated: The characteristic of the transcendence of both signs and signlessness is intuition. The characteristic of the transcendence of the signs of conceptual discrimination such as entity and nonentity is intuition.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi @178b mdzes pa la sogs par tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag dang / bdag med pa dang / mdzes pa dang / mi @178b mdzes pa la sogs par tha dad par snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nonconceptual, nonapparent, nondual, ultimate reality, which is the perfect knowledge, is beyond all signs, because it is devoid of the signs of conceptual discrimination that appear as different, such as existent and nonexistent, permanent and impermanent, blissful and painful, self and nonself, beautiful and ugly, etc.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa las de lta bu rnam pa thams cad so sor snang ngo zhes so //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dag pa 'jig rten gyi snang ba dang bcas pa las de lta bu rnam pa thams cad so sor snang ngo zhes so //
translated: From the pure gnosis of omniscience, together with the appearances of the world, all of this appears in all its aspects.

original: stsogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the collection is consciousness, which has the aspect of various kinds.

original: gang gi tshe na mtshan ma shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe na mtshan ma shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When the characteristics are analyzed with wisdom,

original: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo rnam par gzhigs te /
translated: the coarse and subtle are dissected.

original: rnam par mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bri ba'i mtshan nyid bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
analyzed: rnam par mi dmigs pa de'i tshe na bri ba'i mtshan nyid bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa yang dag par rig pa gnas so //
translated: When they are not observed, then the characteristic of dissolution is the absence of thought and appearance, the abode of the ultimate truth, nondual perfect knowledge.

original: de la ye shes ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes pa gang yang dag par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la ye shes ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes pa gang yang dag par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa ste /
translated: With regard to that, there are three kinds of gnosis: that which causes the realization of the specific and general characteristics of things.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni thun mong ma yin pa'o //
translated: The specific characteristic is the uncommon.

original: spyi'i ni spyir rjes su song zhing rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i ni spyir rjes su song zhing rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The general is the general, which is to be expressed as a conceptual thought.

original: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa de ni tha snyad kyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid rtogs par byed pa de ni tha snyad kyi shes pa ste /
translated: The understanding of the characteristics of the general and the particular is the conventional consciousness.

original: sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin pa gzhan gsal ba rgya cher shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyi rang bzhin pa gzhan gsal ba rgya cher shes par bya'o //
translated: The understanding of the nature of the word and the meaning is to be understood as the extensive clarification of the other.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa rtogs par byed pa ni skad cig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa rtogs par byed pa ni skad cig gi rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: The understanding of arising and ceasing is the consciousness of the moment,

original: se gol gyi sgra'i rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
analyzed: se gol gyi sgra'i rnam par shes pa bzhin te /
translated: like the consciousness of the sound of a finger snap.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim pa dang bral ba skad cig par rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i dus kyi rim pa dang bral ba skad cig par rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is to be understood as momentary, free from the sequence of beginning and end.

original: skye ba med pa dang 'gog pa med par rtogs par byed pa ni khyad par can rnams dang lung ston pa la sogs pas skad cig pa la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma'i dus su skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun tu brtags pa ni byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel ba lhag par dmigs su med do /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang 'gog pa med par rtogs par byed pa ni khyad par can rnams dang lung ston pa la sogs pas skad cig pa la thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma'i dus su skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams kun tu brtags pa ni byed pa dang byed pa po dang mngon par 'brel ba lhag par dmigs su med do /
translated: The instant is not perceived as a thing that arises, abides, or ceases, nor is it perceived as a thing that is related to an agent or an action.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig pa //
translated: All conditioned things are momentary.üîΩHow can the unstable be an agent?

original: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de //üîΩbyed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
analyzed: mi brtan byed pa ga la zhig / gang byung byed pa de nyid de // byed pa por yang de nyid brjod //
translated: That which arises is the agent.

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: That itself is called the agent.

original: de de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa la skye ba dang 'gog pa med par rtogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: de de ltar gang zag la bdag med pa la skye ba dang 'gog pa med par rtogs pa skad cig mar 'jig pa'o //
translated: Thus, the person is understood to be without self, without arising, and without cessation.

original: chos la bdag med pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: chos la bdag med pa la yang gnyis kyi rnam par skye ba dang 'gag pa med de /
translated: The Dharma is understood to be without self, without the duality of arising and cessation,

original: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dang mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a dream, a magical illusion, and so on.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni gang zhe na /üîΩyod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa mu stegs byed pa dang @179a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ye shes ni gang zhe na / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs la mngon par chags pa mu stegs byed pa dang @179a * //
translated: What is mundane knowledge?üîΩIt is the attachment to the positions of existence and non-existence of the tirthikas and all foolish ordinary beings.

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi'o zhes pa ni rtag pa'i bdag ni yod la gzugs ni med pa ste /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi'o zhes pa ni rtag pa'i bdag ni yod la gzugs ni med pa ste /
translated: The self is permanent and exists, but form does not exist.üîΩWhen the self experiences the momentary, it exists as pleasure, pain, etc.

original: bdag gis skad cig pa yang myong ba na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yod ces pa de yang dag par tshor bar dbye ba na bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gis skad cig pa yang myong ba na bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa yod ces pa de yang dag par tshor bar dbye ba na bdag dang / tshangs pa dang / dbang po la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: When that is correctly felt, the self, Brahma, Indra, etc. are impermanent.

original: rmi lam du ni gzugs med la gnyid kyis ma log pa na yod ces pa phyogs su mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: rmi lam du ni gzugs med la gnyid kyis ma log pa na yod ces pa phyogs su mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: In a dream, form does not exist, but when not asleep, it exists. This is attachment to a position.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'i bsam pa la mngon par chags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa rnams kyi ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du lhung ba'i bsam pa la mngon par chags pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad kyi'o zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don la mngon par chags pa rnams kyi ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid du mngon par chags pa'o //
translated: The supramundane wisdom is that of all the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas, who are attached to the idea that falls into the characteristics of the individual and the general.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / dro ba dang / g-yo ba'o //
translated: The individual characteristics are the elements such as earth, which are solid, liquid, hot, and moving.

original: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / mi mdzes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their general characteristics are impermanence, suffering, selflessness, ugliness, and so on.

original: phyi'i gzugs med pas na sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: phyi'i gzugs med pas na sra ba la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / mdzes pa dang mi mdzes pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang med de /
translated: Since there is no external form, there are no individual characteristics such as solidity, and there are no general characteristics such as beauty and ugliness.

original: 'dod chags dang bral bas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig de dag la med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral bas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig de dag la med do //
translated: And because they are free from attachment, they do not have the suffering of samsara.üîΩThe highest supramundane wisdom is the wisdom of the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis snang ba med pa'i chos la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten las 'das pa mchog gi ye shes ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis snang ba med pa'i chos la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: When, through the analysis of wisdom,

original: sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste /
analyzed: sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par phye ste /
translated: the coarse and subtle parts of the directions are differentiated,

original: dmigs su med cing stong nas de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par gnas so //
analyzed: dmigs su med cing stong nas de'i tshe bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis par yang dag par rig par gnas so //
translated: and when they are not observed and are empty, at that time, without thought and without appearance, one abides in the realization of ultimate truth, which is nondual.

original: skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par mthong ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzhan gyi dbang gis skad cig pa yang mi snang na gnyis med pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: skye ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par mthong ba dang / yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba zhes pa ni skye ba dang 'gog pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams gzhan gyi dbang gis skad cig pa yang mi snang na gnyis med pa lta ci smos /
translated: The vision of non-production and non-cessation, and the freedom from the positions of existence and non-existence, is the non-dual, inexpressible, which arises from the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ni brjod du med pa'i mi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i phyogs dang bral ba ni brjod du med pa'i mi gnyis pa ste /
translated: The freedom from the positions of existence and non-existence is the non-dual, inexpressible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i spyod yul can ni chos la bdag med pa thugs su chud pa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa'i spyod yul can ni chos la bdag med pa thugs su chud pa las 'byung ngo //
translated: The domain of the stage of the Tathagata arises from the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi gnyis pa sngon gyi de ma @179b thag pa'i skad cig pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i mi gnyis pa sngon gyi de ma @179b thag pa'i skad cig pa ni dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la snang ngo //
translated: The non-duality of the Omniscient One appears in the samadhi of the pure worldly vision of the preceding moment.

original: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tha snyad lta bur rmi lam dang / sprul pa la sogs par slu ba med pa des kyang rgyud gzhan du brtags pa'i rgyu las skyes par rigs so //
analyzed: gnyid kyis ma log pa'i tha snyad lta bur rmi lam dang / sprul pa la sogs par slu ba med pa des kyang rgyud gzhan du brtags pa'i rgyu las skyes par rigs so //
translated: Just as in the expression not yet gone to sleep, the dream and the emanation are not deceived by the non-existence of the other mind-stream, and it is reasonable that they arise from a cause that is examined in another mind-stream.

original: gzhan du ni dgongs pa med par rig sngags 'dzin pa lta bur de skad su zhig gis ston par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ni dgongs pa med par rig sngags 'dzin pa lta bur de skad su zhig gis ston par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, without any intention, who would teach that the mantra-holder is like that?

original: gsol ba dang lan du dgongs pa rgyud gzhan ma gtogs par ni sprul pa bsam pa med cing /
analyzed: gsol ba dang lan du dgongs pa rgyud gzhan ma gtogs par ni sprul pa bsam pa med cing /
translated: The answer is: Except for the other mind-stream, the intention is that the emanation has no thought.

original: sems can ma yin pas dris pa'i lan ji ltar na glon //
analyzed: sems can ma yin pas dris pa'i lan ji ltar na glon //
translated: Since it is not a sentient being, how can it answer a question?

original: gsol pa'i lan nor pa med pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyis rgyud kyi brtags pa bzung nas lan bka' stsal te /
analyzed: gsol pa'i lan nor pa med pa de ni bdag dang gzhan gyis rgyud kyi brtags pa bzung nas lan bka' stsal te /
translated: The answer to the question is given by grasping the examination of the mind-stream by oneself and others.

original: des na bzhengs pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na bzhengs pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, the arising is inferred.

original: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: In the Sutra Unraveling the Intention,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bzhengs pa gsal par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bzhengs pa gsal par gsungs pa'o //
translated: the arising of the Buddha Bhagavans is clearly taught.

original: 'on te yang rgyud gzhan gyi dgongs pa med par gsol ba'i lan ma nor bar 'gyur ba na ni de'i tshe rgyud gzhan med par gsol ba'i lan ma nor bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te yang rgyud gzhan gyi dgongs pa med par gsol ba'i lan ma nor bar 'gyur ba na ni de'i tshe rgyud gzhan med par gsol ba'i lan ma nor bar gyur te /
translated: But if, on the other hand, the reply is correct without the intention of another continuum, then at that time the reply is correct without another continuum.

original: des kyang rgyud gzhan du grub pa mi 'grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na der sprul pa la 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: des kyang rgyud gzhan du grub pa mi 'grub pa'i skyon du 'gyur bas na der sprul pa la 'gag pa med do //
translated: And since that does not establish the existence of another continuum, there is no cessation of emanations.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni gang yul rnams su chags pa med pa de ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gnyis pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni gang yul rnams su chags pa med pa de ni chags pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyis mi gnyis pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the characteristic of nonattachment is wisdom. That which is not attached to objects is nondual wisdom by the characteristic of nonattachment.

original: yang na dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dag pa 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes ni shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor mtha' dag la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: Or else, the wisdom of omniscience abiding in the pure worldly samadhi is unobstructed with regard to the entire sphere of knowledge.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa ni /
translated: Obstructed by the obscurations of attachment and so forth,

original: spyod yul la so sor chad pa med kyang nye bar gyur pa la yang yongs su gsal bar mi 'jug go //
analyzed: spyod yul la so sor chad pa med kyang nye bar gyur pa la yang yongs su gsal bar mi 'jug go //
translated: Although the field is not divided, it is not fully engaged in the proximate.

original: yul dang dus la sogs pa'i bye brag gis la la dpag tshad gcig dang / la la dpag tshad gnyis la sogs par kha cig la cung zad cig ste /
analyzed: yul dang dus la sogs pa'i bye brag gis la la dpag tshad gcig dang / la la dpag tshad gnyis la sogs par kha cig la cung zad cig ste /
translated: By the distinctions of place, time, etc., some [objects] are seen at a distance of one kro≈õa, some at two kro≈õas, etc., and some are seen only a little.

original: de ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mngon sum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, they are perceived.

original: dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med de /
translated: There is nothing at all that is beyond the senses.

original: sngags dang mig rtsi grub pa rnams kyis re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pas bar bcad kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: sngags dang mig rtsi grub pa rnams kyis re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pas bar bcad kyang mthong ngo //
translated: Those who have accomplished mantras and eye-salve see through walls, fences, and so on.

original: pra se na byas pas dus gsum gyi tshig gi don thams cad snang ngo //
analyzed: pra se na byas pas dus gsum gyi tshig gi don thams cad snang ngo //
translated: By the power of prasena, all objects of the three times appear.

original: @180a * // des na bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: @180a * // des na bag chags dang bcas pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: Therefore, the obscuration of affliction, along with its imprints, is abandoned.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du chags pa med par 'jug go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes mig gi ling tog dang bral ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i dkyil 'khor thams cad du chags pa med par 'jug go //
translated: Just like the removal of the cataract from the eye of omniscient pristine awareness, one enters all ma·πá·∏çalas without attachment.üîΩConsciousness is characterized by attachment to various objects.

original: yul sna tshogs la chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs la chags pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the dependent nature.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is also twofold:

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thugs rje'i bag chags sad nas rdzogs longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa snang ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis ni thugs rje'i bag chags sad nas rdzogs longs spyod pa dang / sprul pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs pa snang ngo //
translated: For yogins, the various characteristics of the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya and nirmƒÅ·πáakƒÅya appear after the latent tendencies of compassion are awakened.

original: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis ni ma rig pa dang las rnam pa sna tshogs smin pa'i mthu las lha dang mi la sogs par snang ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba pa rnams kyis ni ma rig pa dang las rnam pa sna tshogs smin pa'i mthu las lha dang mi la sogs par snang ngo //
translated: For those in sa·πÉsƒÅra, various appearances of gods, humans, and so on appear through the power of ripening ignorance and karma.

original: gzhan yang blo gros chen po gsum 'dus pa'i bya ba skye ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa gsum 'dus te bya ba skye ba ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang blo gros chen po gsum 'dus pa'i bya ba skye ba dang ldan pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes pa'o zhes pa ni ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang / len pa gsum 'dus te bya ba skye ba ni 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Moreover, Mahamati, the characteristic of consciousness is the arising of the activity of the union of the three, which is the characteristic of birth and possession. This is ignorance, craving, and grasping. The arising of activity is the characteristic of samsaric consciousness.

original: mi ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni grol ba gnyis su med par dgongs par brtag go //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni ye shes so zhes pa ni grol ba gnyis su med par dgongs par brtag go //
translated: The characteristic of the nature of non-possession is wisdom. This should be understood as the intention of non-dual liberation.

original: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes te zhes pa ni /
analyzed: thob pa med pa'i mtshan nyid ni ye shes te zhes pa ni /
translated: The characteristic of non-attainment is wisdom.

original: gang gis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i rang bzhin la lhag par cung zad kyang 'thob par byed pa med de /
analyzed: gang gis rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i chud pa'i rang bzhin la lhag par cung zad kyang 'thob par byed pa med de /
translated: By this, there is nothing whatsoever to attain in the nature of the naturally luminous mind.

original: gang shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig go zhes de ltar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang shes par bya ba 'ba' zhig go zhes de ltar dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is only to be known. This is the intention.

original: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rang gis yang dag par rig pa tsam ste /
analyzed: bdag gi so so rang gi 'phags pa'i ye shes kyis rtogs pa'i spyod yul zhes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi rang gis yang dag par rig pa tsam ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe domain of activity that is realized by the transcendent wisdom that is one‚Äôs own‚Äù refers to the transcendent wisdom that is the self-realization of the noble ones.

original: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa med cing snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa dngos po dang dngos po med par rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is free of thought, free of appearance, ultimate truth, nondual, and free of the concepts of things and nonthings.üîΩBecause it does not engage and does not arise, it is like the reflection of the moon in water.

original: mi 'jug mi 'byung ba'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin no zhes pa ni byed pa dang byed pa po 'brel pa med cing /
analyzed: mi 'jug mi 'byung ba'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin no zhes pa ni byed pa dang byed pa po 'brel pa med cing /
translated: This is the absence of a relationship between an action and an agent.

original: dngos po thams cad byed pa med pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad byed pa med pa ste /
translated: All things are devoid of action.

original: de bas na 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes 'byung bas na /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa rnams kyi ye shes 'byung bas na /
translated: Therefore, since the wisdom of the noble ones arises,üîΩit does not come from anywhere.

original: gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba la 'gag pa na yang tshogs su mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang nas kyang mi 'ong ba la 'gag pa na yang tshogs su mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: When it ceases, it does not go anywhere.

original: des na mi 'jug mi 'byung ste //
analyzed: des na mi 'jug mi 'byung ste //
translated: Therefore, it does not engage and does not arise.

original: byed pa med pa'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin te /
analyzed: byed pa med pa'i phyir chu la chu zla bzhin te /
translated: Because it is devoid of action, it is like the reflection of the moon in water.

original: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong zhing bar du rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: thog ma dang tha ma'i mtha' stong zhing bar du rang bzhin gnyis kyis stong pa mi gnyis pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The wisdom of non-duality is the emptiness of the beginning and end, and the emptiness of the two natures in between.

original: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i sngon gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes thams @180b cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
analyzed: gzugs brnyan dang 'dra ba'i sngon gyi ye shes kyi rang bzhin no zhes thams @180b cad mkhyen pas dgongs pa'i don du brtag go //
translated: The nature of the wisdom of the past is like a reflection.

original: sgra'i don la don rnam pa du ma yod pas na khyad par du dgongs pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
analyzed: sgra'i don la don rnam pa du ma yod pas na khyad par du dgongs pa'i don du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid tshad ma'o //
translated: The meaning of the word is considered to be the meaning of the intention of the Omniscient One, because there are many meanings of the word.

original: khong du chud pa dang gzung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis chud par mdzad pa /
analyzed: khong du chud pa dang gzung ba'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa rnams kyis chud par mdzad pa /
translated: The Omniscient One has summarized the verses of the collection for the sake of understanding and grasping.

original: sems kyis su ni las rnams sogs //üîΩye shes kyis ni sogs dang bral //
analyzed: sems kyis su ni las rnams sogs // ye shes kyis ni sogs dang bral //
translated: By the mind, one thinks of actions, etc.üîΩBy wisdom, one is free from, etc.

original: shes rab kyis kyang snang med pa //
analyzed: shes rab kyis kyang snang med pa //
translated: By insight, one is free from appearances, etc.

original: zhes pa ni sems kyis bsams te /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sems kyis bsams te /
translated: This is thought by the mind.

original: las gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba byed pa de'i 'bras bu yod do //
analyzed: las gang dge ba dang / mi dge ba byed pa de'i 'bras bu yod do //
translated: Whatever virtuous or non-virtuous actions one performs, there is a result of those actions.

original: dus phyi nas 'byung ba'i ye shes kyis rnam pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang bral bas de'i 'bras bu yongs su mi rdzogs so //
analyzed: dus phyi nas 'byung ba'i ye shes kyis rnam pa tha dad pa'i rnam pa sna tshogs pa dang bral bas de'i 'bras bu yongs su mi rdzogs so //
translated: The wisdom that arises later is free from the various different aspects, so its result is not fully complete.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las glong zhing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbang las glong zhing mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i ma rig pa dang / las rnam par smin pa'i mthu las mgo 'khor ba dang / brgyal ba la sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs rnam par shes pa la so sor snang ba gang gi tshe na shes rab kyis dpyad de /
translated: From the power of the ripening of karma, the various appearances manifest individually to consciousness, like a spinning firebrand, or a dream, or a swoon, and so on.

original: shes par bya ba gzhigs pa ni mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa nyid gnas so //
analyzed: shes par bya ba gzhigs pa ni mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa nyid gnas so //
translated: When that is analyzed by wisdom, and the object of knowledge is dissected, and not observed, then the non-appearance, the ultimate truth, the non-dual itself, abides.

original: des ni thugs rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te /
analyzed: des ni thugs rje'i bag chags kyis glengs te /
translated: By that, the latent tendencies of compassion are aroused.

original: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'thob pa ni gzhan gyi don du rdzogs longs spyod pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid snang ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi rnam pa'i ye shes rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis 'thob pa ni gzhan gyi don du rdzogs longs spyod pa dang sprul pa la sogs pa'i sku'i mtshan nyid snang ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of the yogis in the various aspects is the appearance of the characteristics of the bodies of enjoyment and emanation for the sake of others.

original: dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
analyzed: dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs te /
translated: Abiding in the pure worldly samadhi,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa ni phan pa mdzad par spyod par brtag go //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa snang ba dang bcas pa ni phan pa mdzad par spyod par brtag go //
translated: the omniscience with appearance is to be considered as the performance of benefit.

original: sems ni yul dang 'brel pa ste //
analyzed: sems ni yul dang 'brel pa ste //
translated: The mind is connected with the object.üîΩKnowledge enters into the thought.

original: rtog pa la ni ye shes 'jug / snang ba med pa'i bye brag la //
analyzed: rtog pa la ni ye shes 'jug / snang ba med pa'i bye brag la //
translated: In the absence of appearance,

original: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug / ces pa la /
analyzed: shes rab yang dag rab tu 'jug / ces pa la /
translated: wisdom enters perfectly.

original: sems ni lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'di nyid du gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: sems ni lus dang / longs spyod dang / gnas su snang ba'i kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'o zhes 'di nyid du gsungs pa ste /
translated: The mind is the consciousness of the ground-of-all appearing as the body, enjoyments, and abode, as is taught in this very text.

original: des na yul dang 'brel to //üîΩrtog pa la ni shes pa 'jug / ces pa ni /
analyzed: des na yul dang 'brel to // rtog pa la ni shes pa 'jug / ces pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is connected with the object.üîΩKnowledge enters into the thought.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nang nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i nang nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: Among the consciousnesses of engagement, it is the mental consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe na yang dpyad cing yul mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med cing bsam pa med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i bye brag la @181a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe na yang dpyad cing yul mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba med cing bsam pa med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i bye brag la @181a * //
translated: When one does not find an object by investigating, then, without appearance and without thought, one enters into the ultimate truth, the nondual sphere.

original: shes rab rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: shes rab rab tu 'jug go //
translated: One enters into the wisdom of the ultimate.

original: yul med pas na bsam pa med pa'i phyir gnas kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i yang dag par rig pa la gnas so //
analyzed: yul med pas na bsam pa med pa'i phyir gnas kyi rnam pa dang bral ba'i yang dag par rig pa la gnas so //
translated: Because there is no object, there is no thought. Therefore, one abides in the correct knowledge that is free from the aspect of a basis.

original: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang // zhes pa ni /
analyzed: sems dang yid dang rnam shes dang // zhes pa ni /
translated: Mind, thought, and consciousnessüîΩ.

original: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
analyzed: sems ni kun gzhi rnam shes te //
translated: Mind is the storehouse consciousness.

original: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems nyid ni yid yin no //
translated: Thought is the very thinking of ‚ÄúI. ‚Äù

original: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
analyzed: gang gis yul rnams 'dzin pa ni //
translated: That by which one apprehends objects

original: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya //üîΩzhes pa ste /üîΩgzhan gyi dbang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam par shes zhes bya // zhes pa ste / gzhan gyi dbang yul dang / yul can gyi dngos por gsal ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: is called consciousness.üîΩThe dependent is the consciousness that manifests as the entities of objects and subjects.

original: rtog pa ni rtog pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes tsam pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa ni rtog pa dang / bdag dang phyi rol gyi rdzas la sogs pa'i yul gyi 'du shes tsam pa ste /
translated: Imagination is the mere perception of objects such as the self and external substances.

original: brtags pa la ni yul med de //
analyzed: brtags pa la ni yul med de //
translated: Imagined objects do not exist

original: gzhan gyi dbang la'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la'o //
translated: in the dependent.

original: nyan thos rnams las khyad par du ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos nyid thob pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams las khyad par du ni btsun gtso'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis chos nyid thob pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas, who are the most venerable of all beings, attain the reality that is superior to that of the sravakas.

original: grub pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid thob pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: grub pa mi gnyis pa'i chos nyid thob pa'i bar du'o //
translated: They attain the reality that is not dual, that is, the reality that is not the object of the two kinds of nescience.

original: zhi dang bzod pa'i khyad par la //
analyzed: zhi dang bzod pa'i khyad par la //
translated: The special qualities of peace and patienceüîΩare the virtues of the Tathagata's intuition,

original: de bzhin gshegs kyi ye shes dge / bye brag don du de skye ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kyi ye shes dge / bye brag don du de skye ste //
translated: which is born for the sake of the special object.

original: kun tu rgyu ba rnam par spangs //üîΩzhes pa la /
analyzed: kun tu rgyu ba rnam par spangs // zhes pa la /
translated: It is free from all discursiveness.

original: zhi ba dang bzod pa'i khyad par ni sa gong nas gong du rtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: zhi ba dang bzod pa'i khyad par ni sa gong nas gong du rtogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The special qualities of peace and patience are the special realizations on the higher stages.

original: de bzhin gshegs kyi zhes pa ni ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs kyi zhes pa ni ye shes te /
translated: The Tathagata's intuition is the intuition of the tenth stage bodhisattva.

original: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa spang bar bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bcu'i dbang po rnams kyi nyon mongs pa med pa'i mi shes pa spang bar bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyis nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the intuition of the Tathagata because it abandons the nescience that is the passion of the faculties of the ten stages, since it abandons the passions together with their instincts.

original: de yang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: de yang mnyam par mi 'jog pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: Moreover, it is characterized by non-equipoise.

original: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la kun tu rgyu'o //üîΩnyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni khyad par te /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la kun tu rgyu'o // nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni khyad par te /
translated: It is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.

original: der yang skyon kun tu rgyu ba med pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnga yi shes rab rnam gsum ste //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: der yang skyon kun tu rgyu ba med pa ni yon tan thams cad kyi tshogs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // nga yi shes rab rnam gsum ste // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni thos pa dang / sems pa dang bsgom pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.

original: des chos kyi de kho na nyid yang dag par 'grel pa ste 'thob pa'o //üîΩtheg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing //
analyzed: des chos kyi de kho na nyid yang dag par 'grel pa ste 'thob pa'o // theg pa gnyis dang mi ldan zhing //
translated: It is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang mi ldan pa rnams so //üîΩshes rab snang ba rnam par spangs //
analyzed: zhes pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa dang mi ldan pa rnams so // shes rab snang ba rnam par spangs //
translated: It is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.

original: zhes pa ni btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni btsun gtso'i sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ste /
translated: It is the universal vehicle because it is the cause of the omniscience of the buddhas.üîΩIt is the universal vehicle because it is

original: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad cing phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas phyogs kyi cha tha @181b dad par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba dang bcas pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes rab kyis dpyad cing phyi rol gyi rdul phra mo dang / yan lag can gyi rdzas phyogs kyi cha tha @181b dad par phye ste mi dmigs pa de'i tshe snang ba dang bcas pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
