translated: When, through analysis with wisdom, one does not observe external subtle particles and wholes, which are divided into directional parts, then one abandons appearances.

original: dngos po yod par chags pas ni zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don mngon par chags pas nyan thos rnams kyi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod par chags pas ni zhes pa ni phyi rol gyi don mngon par chags pas nyan thos rnams kyi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúDue to attachment to the existence of things‚Äù means that due to attachment to external objects, the ≈õrƒÅvakas will arise.

original: sems tsam la ni 'jug pas na //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni 'jug pas na //
translated: ‚ÄúBy engaging in mind only,

original: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
analyzed: bde gshegs shes rab dri ma med //
translated: the sugatas‚Äô stainless wisdom‚Äù

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: is stated.

original: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo dang / rdul phra mo las kun brtags par dpyad cing phyogs kyi char 'byed pas phye ba na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / mgo 'khor ba dang /
analyzed: gang gi tshe phyi rol gyi sbom po dang / phra mo dang / rdul phra mo las kun brtags par dpyad cing phyogs kyi char 'byed pas phye ba na mi dmigs pa de'i tshe rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / mgo 'khor ba dang /
translated: When, through analysis of the coarse, subtle, and subtle particles of external objects, one does not observe them when they are divided into directional parts, then, like forms in a dream, an illusion, a mirage,

original: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bur 'gro ba sems tsam du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brgyal ba la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bur 'gro ba sems tsam du rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: or a hallucination, one realizes that beings are mind only.

original: de yang shes rab kyis mi dmigs shing thos pa dang / sems pa ni bsgom pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa nas brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dri ma med pa'i bar du chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pas ting nge 'dzin thob ste /üîΩmchog gi yang mchog tu byed par phye bas khyad par thob po //üîΩ'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i le'u gsum gyi bshad pa las ye shes kyi khyad par dpyad pa bdun pa'o /
analyzed: de yang shes rab kyis mi dmigs shing thos pa dang / sems pa ni bsgom pas rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa nas brtsams nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa dri ma med pa'i bar du chos dang gang zag la bdag med par rab tu rtogs pas ting nge 'dzin thob ste / mchog gi yang mchog tu byed par phye bas khyad par thob po // 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i le'u gsum gyi bshad pa las ye shes kyi khyad par dpyad pa bdun pa'o /
translated: Moreover, by wisdom one does not objectify anything, and by hearing and reflection one begins with the stages of joy, etc., and by thoroughly realizing the selflessness of persons and phenomena, one attains meditative concentration up to the stainless stage of a tathƒÅgata.üîΩThus, one attains distinction by becoming the supreme of the supreme.üîΩüîΩThis concludes the seventh chapter of the commentary on the Entry into Lanka, called ‚ÄúThe Analysis of the Distinctions of Wisdom.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: // / gzhan yang blo gros chen po mu stegs 'gyur bar bya ba rnams kyi 'gyur bar lta ba rnam pa dgu yod de /üîΩ'di lta ste /üîΩdbyibs 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgrangs can rnams ni gnas las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: // / gzhan yang blo gros chen po mu stegs 'gyur bar bya ba rnams kyi 'gyur bar lta ba rnam pa dgu yod de / 'di lta ste / dbyibs 'gyur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / grangs can rnams ni gnas las gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Moreover, by wisdom one does not objectify anything, and by hearing and reflection one begins with the stages of joy, etc., and by fully understanding the selflessness of persons and phenomena, one attains meditative concentration up to the stainless stage of a tathagata.

original: dpyod pa can rnams kyi ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa can rnams kyi ni tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Thus, one attains distinction by being classified as the best of the best.

original: ksha pa na ka rnams kyi ni bdun du 'byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ksha pa na ka rnams kyi ni bdun du 'byed par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The Kasyapa-parivarta Sutra says,

original: de de ltar na grangs kyis 'byung ba rnam pa dgu'o //
analyzed: de de ltar na grangs kyis 'byung ba rnam pa dgu'o //
translated: Thus, there are nine types of elements according to their number.

original: dpe ser ni 'gyur bar smra ba thams cad la mtshungs so //
analyzed: dpe ser ni 'gyur bar smra ba thams cad la mtshungs so //
translated: The example of gold is the same for all who maintain that there is transformation.

original: gser ni rtag pa zhes te /
analyzed: gser ni rtag pa zhes te /
translated: Gold is permanent,

original: gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / spen tog dang / g-yung drung dang / mgul 'khor la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rgyan du tha dad par dbye ba na yang de nyid rgyun du 'byung ngo zhes te /
analyzed: gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / spen tog dang / g-yung drung dang / mgul 'khor la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi rgyan du tha dad par dbye ba na yang de nyid rgyun du 'byung ngo zhes te /
translated: but when it is divided into different ornaments, such as bracelets, armlets, earrings, lockets, and necklaces, it is said to be continuous.

original: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de bzhin du snga ma'i phyogs su gsungs pa la skad cig tu 'jig pa ni phyi ma'i phyogs te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pas kyang de bzhin du snga ma'i phyogs su gsungs pa la skad cig tu 'jig pa ni phyi ma'i phyogs te /
translated: The Omniscient One has also said the same in the Kasyapa-parivarta Sutra:

original: gang yod pa de thams cad se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig pa'o //üîΩrtag pa ni ma skyes pas ni mo gsham gyi bu la @182a * //
analyzed: gang yod pa de thams cad se gol gyi sgra dang / 'bab chu la sogs pa bzhin du skad cig pa'o // rtag pa ni ma skyes pas ni mo gsham gyi bu la @182a * //
translated: Whatever exists is momentary, like the sound of a finger snap or a waterfall.

original: sogs pa bzhin du med do //
analyzed: sogs pa bzhin du med do //
translated: What is permanent does not exist, like the son of a barren woman.

original: 'on te gdu bu'i rang bzhin gyi gser dngos po gcig pa'i phyir rtag pa po zhen ni spen tog la sogs pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'on te gdu bu'i rang bzhin gyi gser dngos po gcig pa'i phyir rtag pa po zhen ni spen tog la sogs pa'i dngos por mi rung ngo //
translated: But if it is gold by nature, it is not proper to say that it is a bracelet, etc., because of the identity of the substance.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin zhig la de bzhin du phyi ma'i dngos por 'byung na gser zhes bya ba ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin zhig la de bzhin du phyi ma'i dngos por 'byung na gser zhes bya ba ji ltar na rtag pa yin /
translated: If the former nature is destroyed and the latter substance arises, how can gold be permanent?

original: gang yang ser po'i rnam par rgyun du 'byung ba ni der 'dra ba'i skad cig gcig pa gzhan 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang yang ser po'i rnam par rgyun du 'byung ba ni der 'dra ba'i skad cig gcig pa gzhan 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, a continuum of moments of yellow color arises, and a different moment of similar yellow color arises.

original: 'bab chu lta bu skra dang sa la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa lta bur so sor shes pa yang 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'bab chu lta bu skra dang sa la sogs pa bcad nas yang skyes pa lta bur so sor shes pa yang 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: It is understood that the continuum is cut off, like a river, and that it arises again, like hair and nails, etc., that have been cut.

original: rtag pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtag pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not permanent.

original: dbyibs 'gyur pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis gdu bu dang spen tog la sogs pa'i dpes bshad do //
analyzed: dbyibs 'gyur pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa bdag nyid kyis gdu bu dang spen tog la sogs pa'i dpes bshad do //
translated: The transformation of shape is explained by the Buddha himself with the example of a bracelet, etc.

original: lhag pa ni 'o ma dang / chang la sogs pa'i dpes de nyid kyi nang du gtogs par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa ni 'o ma dang / chang la sogs pa'i dpes de nyid kyi nang du gtogs par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The remainder is included in that, with the examples of milk, beer, etc.

original: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi mu stegs pa rnams 'dir ji lta bur 'jug pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la da ltar gyi dus kyi mu stegs pa rnams 'dir ji lta bur 'jug pa de ltar bshad par bya'o //
translated: The present-day tƒ´rthikas should be explained in the same way as they are here.

original: gang dag gis blo yang nub par gyur pa de dag gi yang brtag cing bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis blo yang nub par gyur pa de dag gi yang brtag cing bshad par bya ste /
translated: Even those whose intelligence has declined should be examined and explained.

original: sgra'i don ni don du ma yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid der mkhyen to //
analyzed: sgra'i don ni don du ma yin pas na thams cad mkhyen pa nyid der mkhyen to //
translated: Since the meaning of the word is not multiple, omniscience knows it.

original: kha cig ni rgyu la rtog ces pa ni tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams las sa dang chu la sogs pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba ni gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu la rtog ces pa ni tshangs pa dang dbang po la sogs pa rnams las sa dang chu la sogs pa'i gzugs 'gyur ba ni gzhan pa dang gzhan pa ma yin par rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Some imagine a cause, such as BrahmƒÅ, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, and that the forms of earth, water, and so on transform from them, abandoning being other and not being other.

original: mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste de bzhin du 'gyur pas na 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan nyid ni mtshan ma ste de bzhin du 'gyur pas na 'gyur ro //
translated: A characteristic is a mark, and it transforms in that way.

original: rgyu ni byed pa ste 'bras bu 'byung ba'i tshe de gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu ni byed pa ste 'bras bu 'byung ba'i tshe de gzhan du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A cause is an agent, and when an effect arises, it transforms into something else.

original: sbyor bas na sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: sbyor bas na sbyor ba ste /
translated: By connection, it is a connection.

original: mang po 'dus pa ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mang po 'dus pa ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: A multiplicity of collections is a connection.

original: de lta bur gyur pas dri dang sbyor ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pas dri dang sbyor ba bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It transforms in that way, like a connection with smell.

original: lta ba ni mthong ba ste rgyu'i tshogs la de bzhin du chud pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lta ba ni mthong ba ste rgyu'i tshogs la de bzhin du chud pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The view is seeing, the arising of the penetration of the cause.

original: grangs can dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: grangs can dang / rig sngags 'dzin pa'i mthar smra ba la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, the VedƒÅntins, and so on.

original: yul sna tshogs bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa lta bar byed pa'i chud pa la skyes bus mthong ba tsam ni lta bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yul sna tshogs bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa lta bar byed pa'i chud pa la skyes bus mthong ba tsam ni lta bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The mere seeing of the person who views the various objects, such as pleasure and pain, is seeing.

original: skye bar 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang mi snang bar 'byed pas yod pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes grangs can rnams so //
analyzed: skye bar 'gyur ba ni snang ba dang mi snang bar 'byed pas yod pa skye bar 'gyur ro zhes grangs can rnams so //
translated: Arising is the appearance of existence, because it is divided into appearance and non-appearance. This is the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.

original: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par snang ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur zhes pa ni ksha pa na ka rnams so //
analyzed: yod pa dang / med pa dang / gnyis ka dang / gnyis ka ma yin par snang ba dang / mi snang bar 'gyur zhes pa ni ksha pa na ka rnams so //
translated: The appearance and non-appearance of existence, non-existence, both, and neither is the Ka≈õmƒ´rans.

original: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma @182b yin par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni dpyod pa can rnams so //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa ma @182b yin par skye bar 'gyur zhes pa ni dpyod pa can rnams so //
translated: Arising as different and non-different is the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: de la grangs can rnams kyi ni med pa ni mi skye med pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la grangs can rnams kyi ni med pa ni mi skye med pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say: The nonexistent does not arise, and the nonexistent does not cease.

original: gnas pa'i chos chos gzhan du ldog pa dang / chos gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes pa ni 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i chos chos gzhan du ldog pa dang / chos gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes pa ni 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The transformation of a thing that abides into another thing is the transformation of one thing into another.

original: ksha pa na ka rnams kyi ni spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba na khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ksha pa na ka rnams kyi ni spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba na khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba ni spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba dang / spyi'i bdag nyid du yod par 'gyur ba yang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: The Ka≈õmƒ´rans say: When it exists as a universal, it does not exist as a particular. When it exists as a particular, it does not exist as a universal. One should not say that it exists as a universal and does not exist as a particular.

original: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi bdag nyid du med par 'gyur ba yang spyi'i bdag nyid du smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not say that it exists as a particular and does not exist as a universal.

original: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang / med par 'gyur ba yang yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang rnam pa la ltos te cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par gyi bdag nyid du yod pa dang / med par 'gyur ba yang yul dang / dus dang / rim pa dang rnam pa la ltos te cig car smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not say that it exists as a universal and does not exist as a particular, or that it exists as a particular and does not exist as a universal, all at once, in dependence on place, time, and order.

original: dpyod pa can rnams kyi ni /üîΩji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
analyzed: dpyod pa can rnams kyi ni / ji ltar kha dog 'dres pa la //
translated: The Analysts say:üîΩJust as a color is mixed,

original: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dod pa bzhin du kha dog 'dzin //
translated: so it takes on a color as desired.

original: de bzhin dngos po sna tshogs phyir //
analyzed: de bzhin dngos po sna tshogs phyir //
translated: In the same way, because of the variety of things,

original: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: it is not perceived as either different or non-different.

original: zhes pa ni sna tshogs gcig par mi rung ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ni sna tshogs gcig par mi rung ste /
translated: This is not suitable as a unity of the variety.

original: de bzhin du yang bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs su dben pa med pa'i phyir gcig pa dang du mar yid ches par mi srid do zhes rtsod pa 'di ni lan du mar sun phyung ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang bdag gi gzugs dang / gzhan gyi gzugs su dben pa med pa'i phyir gcig pa dang du mar yid ches par mi srid do zhes rtsod pa 'di ni lan du mar sun phyung ba'o //
translated: In the same way, because there is no isolation of one's own form and another's form, it is impossible to believe in one or many. This dispute has been refuted many times.

original: dngos por 'gyur ba zhes pa la dngos po ni yod de /
analyzed: dngos por 'gyur ba zhes pa la dngos po ni yod de /
translated: As for it would be a thing, a thing exists.

original: de'i 'gyur ba la lung ston pa rnams kyis rtog pa ni de'i dngos po kho na dang nyid ces te /
analyzed: de'i 'gyur ba la lung ston pa rnams kyis rtog pa ni de'i dngos po kho na dang nyid ces te /
translated: The logicians declare that its transformation is just that thing itself.

original: de yang so so'i tshig gi don dang / khams kyi don du smra ba ste //
analyzed: de yang so so'i tshig gi don dang / khams kyi don du smra ba ste //
translated: That is also said to be the meaning of individual words and the meaning of the elements.

original: ji ltar / ha ri 'thor ba las 'byung ba //
analyzed: ji ltar / ha ri 'thor ba las 'byung ba //
translated: As it is said: From the scattering of the ha,

original: de yod de ni che ba dang // bdag nyid kho na nyid sogs smras //
analyzed: de yod de ni che ba dang // bdag nyid kho na nyid sogs smras //
translated: it exists, that is great, and it is said to be just itself and so on.

original: zhes pa'o // rkyen snang bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar shing gtsubs pa las med dang / til rnams las mar dang / khron pa las chu'o bya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sprul gyis zos pa dang / 'dus pas nyams pa la sngags dang /üîΩsman la sogs pas srog snang bar byed cing /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // rkyen snang bar byed par 'gyur ba ni ji ltar shing gtsubs pa las med dang / til rnams las mar dang / khron pa las chu'o bya ba snang bar byed pa'i 'gyur ba ni ji ltar sprul gyis zos pa dang / 'dus pas nyams pa la sngags dang / sman la sogs pas srog snang bar byed cing /
translated: The appearance of conditions is like the appearance of fire from the rubbing of sticks, of oil from sesame seeds, and of water from a well.

original: dbugs 'byin pa la sogs par byed par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩde dag de ltar thog ma dang tha ma'i rim par tha dad par phye ba'i skad cig pa rnams rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'byung bas shing dang thal ba la @183a * //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa la sogs par byed par 'gyur ba'o // de dag de ltar thog ma dang tha ma'i rim par tha dad par phye ba'i skad cig pa rnams rgyu rnam pa sna tshogs kyis 'byung bas shing dang thal ba la @183a * //
translated: The appearance of the life of the dead is like the appearance of life, breath, and so on, through mantras, medicines, and so on.üîΩSince those are different in terms of the order of beginning and end, the moments are various causes.

original: sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa tha dad pa rnams la bslad pa rnams kyis gcig par kun rtog go //
analyzed: sogs pa bzhin du rnam pa tha dad pa rnams la bslad pa rnams kyis gcig par kun rtog go //
translated: Therefore, like wood, ashes, and so on, those that are different are imagined to be one by the confused.

original: mu stegs byed dag gis zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa'i sgra'i don du mar sbyor ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mu stegs byed dag gis zhes pa ni rnam pa sna tshogs su sprul pa'i sgra'i don du mar sbyor ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The tƒ´rthikas say, The meaning of the various emanations is like the application of butter and so on.

original: ji ltar gnyen des rnam par dag pa'i tshig 'di ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyen des rnam par dag pa'i tshig 'di ste /
translated: The pure words of the friend.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words of the bodhisattva, etc.

original: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes pa la kha cig gis ni mi rtag par khong du chud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad stong pa'o zhes pa la kha cig gis ni mi rtag par khong du chud par byed pa'o //
translated: All dharmas are empty - some understand this as impermanence.

original: gzhan gyis ni gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral bar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ni gnyis kyi rnam pa dang bral bar ro //
translated: Others understand it as the absence of the aspect of duality.

original: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
analyzed: de bas na 'di skad du gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: 'jig rten phan par dbyangs gcig khyod kyi las //
analyzed: 'jig rten phan par dbyangs gcig khyod kyi las //
translated: Your one voice for the benefit of the world

original: mos pa sna tshogs las ni dbyangs 'byung ste //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs las ni dbyangs 'byung ste //
translated: Arises from various aspirations.

original: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ston par mdzad pa /
analyzed: zhes so // thams cad mkhyen pas bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pas don dam pa'i de kho na nyid ston par mdzad pa /
translated: The omniscient one teaches the ultimate reality with a verse of collection:üîΩElement, substance, sense faculty,

original: 'byung dang dngos dang dbang po dang // dus dang dbyibs dang 'gyur ba dang // srid pa bar ma bsdu bar yang //
analyzed: 'byung dang dngos dang dbang po dang // dus dang dbyibs dang 'gyur ba dang // srid pa bar ma bsdu bar yang //
translated: Time, shape, change, and intermediate existence -

original: gang rtog de dag mi mkhas so ;
analyzed: gang rtog de dag mi mkhas so ;
translated: Those who imagine these are unwise.

original: /'jig rten rten cing 'brel 'byung dang // rgyal ba rnam par mi rtog ste //
analyzed: /'jig rten rten cing 'brel 'byung dang // rgyal ba rnam par mi rtog ste //
translated: Dependent origination in the world and the non-conceptuality of the Victorious Ones,

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di dag ni //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten 'di dag ni //
translated: however, these worldsüîΩare like a city of gandharvas,

original: rkyen nyid dri za'i grong khyer bzhin //üîΩzhes pa ste /
analyzed: rkyen nyid dri za'i grong khyer bzhin // zhes pa ste /
translated: only due to conditions.

original: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
analyzed: ji ltar dgongs pa nges par 'grel pa las /
translated: As the S≈´tra Unravelling the Intended Meaning says:

original: ji bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa 'byung bar mi rung ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pas so sor snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ji bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi rang bzhin med pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / gzung ba'i rnam pa 'byung bar mi rung ba ni rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pas so sor snang ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the nature of the dependent is non-existent, in the same way, the appearance of the apprehended and the apprehender is not possible, like the appearance of dreams, illusions, and so on.

original: yang dag par rig pa so sor snang ba tsam gyi phyir de la phyi rol gyi rnam par 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: yang dag par rig pa so sor snang ba tsam gyi phyir de la phyi rol gyi rnam par 'byung ba med do //
translated: Because it is the mere appearance of the correct cognition, external objects do not arise.

original: gal te gnyis kyi rnam pa gzhon nu'i bu skyes pa dang / 'chi ba bzhin du ma skyes na ni de'i tshe sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bur snang zhing gong nas gong du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tshogs yongs su bskor zhing ji ltar na 'tshang rgya zhes pa de ni rtog pa gzhan
analyzed: gal te gnyis kyi rnam pa gzhon nu'i bu skyes pa dang / 'chi ba bzhin du ma skyes na ni de'i tshe sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bur snang zhing gong nas gong du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos tshogs yongs su bskor zhing ji ltar na 'tshang rgya zhes pa de ni rtog pa gzhan
translated: So how could there be buddhahood?

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is another point to consider.

original: skyes bu chen po'i sku la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba sangs rgyas kho na yin kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du de yang ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i sku la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du snang ba sangs rgyas kho na yin kyang rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du de yang ma skyes pa ste /
translated: Although the appearance of the characteristics of the great being's body and so forth is only the Buddha, like a dream or an illusion and so on, that is also unarisen.

original: de ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas na skye ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig gang la yang tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel te 'byung bas na skye ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams skad cig gang la yang tha dad pa med de /
translated: Because they are dependently originated, the phenomena of arising and so on are not different in any instant.

original: snga ma'i gong du 'ba' zhig pa ni rang bzhin brjod du med cing rnam par @183b rtog pa med pa la snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa yang dag par rig pa rgyun tu 'byung yang /
analyzed: snga ma'i gong du 'ba' zhig pa ni rang bzhin brjod du med cing rnam par @183b rtog pa med pa la snang ba med pa don dam pa'i bden pa mi gnyis pa'i skad cig pa yang dag par rig pa rgyun tu 'byung yang /
translated: The previous verse says that the sole reality, which is inexpressible by nature and nonconceptual, is the ultimate truth, which is not dual, and is the moment of non-differentiation, the correct awareness that occurs continuously.

original: rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por gnyis kyi rnam par myong ba med do //
analyzed: rig par bya ba dang / rig pa po'i dngos por gnyis kyi rnam par myong ba med do //
translated: However, there is no experience of duality, of the object of awareness and the experiencer.

original: sems rang bdag la don dam pa'i bden par rgyu ba med na yi ge dang sgra rnams su yang ci smos te dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems rang bdag la don dam pa'i bden par rgyu ba med na yi ge dang sgra rnams su yang ci smos te dag pa 'jig rten pa'i snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin la bzhugs pa na chos ston pa 'byung ngo //
translated: If the mind does not move towards the ultimate truth with regard to itself, how much less so towards letters and sounds? When one abides in the samƒÅdhi that is the pure worldly appearance, the teaching of the Dharma occurs.

original: rang gi rnam par rtog pa goms pa 'jug ces bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa la goms pas 'jug go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa la tshig sbyor bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par rtog pa goms pa 'jug ces bya ba ni rang gi rnam par rtog pa la goms pas 'jug go zhes thams cad mkhyen pas gsungs pa la tshig sbyor bar bya ste /
translated: The phrase one enters through the cultivation of one's own concepts should be connected to the statement by the Omniscient One that one enters through the cultivation of one's own concepts.

original: lan du mar bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: lan du mar bshad par bya'o //
translated: This should be explained many times.

original: mu stegs byed dag gi 'gyur ba re rer rnam par brtags te yod pa dang med pa ni gang yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa 'gyur bar mi rigs te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs byed dag gi 'gyur ba re rer rnam par brtags te yod pa dang med pa ni gang yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni yod pa 'gyur bar mi rigs te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-Buddhists imagine that existence and non-existence are not transformed in any way by the transformations of the elements.üîΩExistence is not reasonable as a transformation because it exists.

original: med pa dang dngos po mi nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa dang dngos po mi nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Non-existence is not reasonable as a transformation because it is not a thing.

original: snga ma'i bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: snga ma'i bzhin du bshad do //
translated: This is explained as before.

original: rang gi sems snang ba ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams rmi lam bzhin te /
analyzed: rang gi sems snang ba ma gtogs par phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams rmi lam bzhin te /
translated: Except for the appearances of one‚Äôs own mind, external things are like dreams.

original: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bya ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi sbom po dang phra mo phyogs kyi cha tha dad par bya ba na khang pa dang / sde dang / nags tshal la sogs pa bzhin du stong par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the gross and subtle external things are divided into directional parts, like houses, armies, forests, and so on, they become empty.

original: gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yongs su rtog na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ma skyes pas 'dzin pa dang /
analyzed: gnyis kyi rnam par shes pa la rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yongs su rtog na rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs pa bzhin du gnyis kyi rnam pa rnams ma skyes pas 'dzin pa dang /
translated: When the cause and effect, the permanent and impermanent, and so on, of the consciousness of the two are imagined, like dreams, illusions, and so on, the aspects of the two are not produced. Therefore, the apprehender and

original: gzung ba'i dngos po rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa der mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gzung ba'i dngos po rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i rnam par rtog pa der mi rung ngo //
translated: The conceptualization of the apprehended thing as permanent or impermanent is not tenable there.

original: gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med pa yang ye shes yang dag par rig pa tsam gyi phyir der skad cig pa re rer rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa'i skad cig ma'i rgyun brjod du med pa yang ye shes yang dag par rig pa tsam gyi phyir der skad cig pa re rer rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: Since the continuum of the inexpressible momentariness is nondual, there is no conceptualization of momentariness in each moment, because it is mere cognition of perfect wisdom.

original: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs bshad pa 'byung ngo zhes de skad du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa 'jig rten pa snang ba dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin las dbyings kyi dkyil 'khor gyi tshogs bshad pa 'byung ngo zhes de skad du bshad pa'o //
translated: It is explained that the assembly of the ma·πá·∏çala of the dhƒÅtu arises from the pure worldly samƒÅdhi with appearance.

original: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la sogs pa gang dag smra ba rnams kyis 'byung ba dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyur bar rtog pa de dag la yang srid pa bar mar 'gro ba'i chos gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med de /
analyzed: des na 'jig rten rgyang pan pa la sogs pa gang dag smra ba rnams kyis 'byung ba dang / dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi 'gyur bar rtog pa de dag la yang srid pa bar mar 'gro ba'i chos gang yang 'jug pa'am ldog pa med de /
translated: Therefore, for those who conceive of the transformation of the elements, sense faculties, and so on, as taught by the LokƒÅyatas and others, there is no engagement or disengagement of any phenomena that go to the intermediate state.

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs par snang ba bzhin du yang dag par @184a * //
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul la sogs par snang ba bzhin du yang dag par @184a * //
translated: Like appearances in a dream, magical display, and so on, they are not tenable.

original: rig pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of mere awareness.

original: rnam pa de lta bur 'gro bar snang ba ni su yang 'gro ba med la /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur 'gro bar snang ba ni su yang 'gro ba med la /
translated: In this way, although it appears that beings go, no one goes,

original: 'ong ba yang med de /
analyzed: 'ong ba yang med de /
translated: and no one comes.

original: chud pa stong pa'i phyir rmi lam ltar 'khor ba'i rim pa snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: chud pa stong pa'i phyir rmi lam ltar 'khor ba'i rim pa snang ba 'ba' zhig go //
translated: Because of the emptiness of what is grasped, the stages of cyclic existence appear only as a dream.

original: phyi rol gyi don med pas na 'gro ba yang med de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don med pas na 'gro ba yang med de /
translated: Since external objects do not exist, there is no going.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las 'byung ba /
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po las 'byung ba /
translated: As the SamaÃÑdhiraÃÑja-suÃÑtra says,

original: srid pa'i 'gro kun rmi lam mtshungs //
analyzed: srid pa'i 'gro kun rmi lam mtshungs //
translated: All beings in cyclic existence are like a dream.
